title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

Participate on special projects as required.

title: Domo Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.

**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**

Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

**Requirements:**

* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

**Benefits:**  


* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/ year**

*Everlight Solar is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all types and are excited to work with talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds. Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Global Power Components is interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, at this time we are unable to sponsor Visas.**   
   
**Global Power Components** is a privately held, growing manufacturer of UL heavy gauge steel fuel tanks, trailers, large generator enclosures and modular metal enclosures for housing fully-equipped electrical distribution and control equipment.   
   
In 2018 we moved operations into a newly renovated 300,000 sq. foot facility that will foster our continued growth as we continue to be recognized as the undisputed leaders in our industry.   
  
As a result of continued growth, we are looking for a **Financial Analyst** to join our Accounting team  
  
**Core Responsibilities:** * Maintain, examine, and analyze financial records and transactions.
* Integral role in analysis of monthly performance metrics.
* Collect and compile necessary financial and economic data to perform meaningful. analysis for strategic business decisions.
* Get deep down in the weeds of our data to find meaningful and actionable insights about our business.
* Provide analytical support for design changes and capex decisions.
* Complete misc. projects and ad-hoc reporting as requested.

  
**Requirements for success:*** Passion for your work and a strong desire for continuous improvement. Your team will have this quality, if you don’t, it will show.
* Strong analytical ability and an eye for the details. If you are unsure if this is you, this role may be a struggle.
* Confidence in your ability and the strength of your analysis. You will need to communicate your conclusions which will often represent a problem that needs fixing.
* 1-3+ years of experience with evidence of increasing responsibilities.
* Bachelor’s degree required, CPA a plus.
* Advanced user of MS Excel, PowerBI experience a plus
* Experience working with an ERP system.

   
   
 **Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled**  
Global Power Components is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Global Power Components is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

title: Financial Analyst 2
description:
Code 6676

Location Milwaukee, WI

 

Job Description

**Financial Analyst 2**

Exciting opportunity to join an iconic American manufacturer! Our client is seeking a dynamic and experienced individual to join their team on a contract basis. This role offers the chance to lead strategic initiatives, manage supplier relationships, and drive performance within the Finance department.

As the **Financial Analyst 2**, you will provide financial guidance, direction, and analytical support for appropriate functional areas and all corresponding departments within the organization. You will coordinate the development of revenue, cost of sales, expense, capital and headcount, budgets, and forecasts for assigned areas.

**Responsibilities**:

* Generate monthly performance reports, financial analysis, revenue.
* Collaborate cross-functionally and influence decision-making.
* Present financial information clearly and concisely to stakeholders at all levels.
* Interpret complex financial data and draw actionable insights.
* Conduct margin and expense variance review.
* Provide recommendations for corrective actions.
* Participate on special projects.

**Qualifications**:

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, or related field.
* Three (3) or more years of experience in financial analysis, planning, or related roles.
* Prior experience in manufacturing, automotive, or related industries is highly desirable.
* Experience in managing supplier relationships and negotiating contracts preferred.
* Demonstrated experience in leading strategic initiatives and driving performance improvements.
* Experience with ERP systems and financial modeling software.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including financial modeling and data analysis.
* Knowledge of GAAP and financial reporting requirements.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills; Strong attention to detail and problem-solving, and analytical skills.

If you are interested in this position, please send resumes to info@division10personnel.com. All inquiries are handled in a confidential manner.

title: Financial Analyst II, Hybrid
description:
**FINANCIAL ANALYST II OPPORTUNITY IN OUR MILWAUKEE CORPORATE OFFICE**

**HYBRID**

 

**WWW.ELKAYINTERIORSYSTEMS.COM**

 

**We are thinkers, innovators, and builders crafting extraordinary interior environments. Are you ready to join us?** 

 

At Elkay Interior Systems (EIS), we work side by side, dare to reimagine the future of design and manufacturing, innovate nonstop, and put our people first. Recognized globally for their creativity, craftsmanship, and talent, our people enrich every project and partnership they serve. 

We provide a relaxed and flexible workspace inspired by our creative people. You'll play an essential role in keeping us at the forefront of global innovation and customer satisfaction. Join our thriving creative community where your ideas make a difference. 

 

As a key member of our Corporate Finance team, the **Financial Analyst** in our dynamic environmentwill get exposure to a wide variety of enterprise projects, and will provide project and analytical support for brand, regional, customer, and national account groups within the sales channels for our business. This role will interface with all internal EIS departments and external customers and reps. This is a great chance to work in an entrepreneurial environment with a nimble organization that values new ideas - bring creative solutions and innovative thinking to the table! Will also have regular senior executive exposure!

 

 

**Specific duties include:**

 

* Monitor financial performance on a regular basis, analyze variances, understand business drivers, and identify opportunities to impact results.
* Monitor and track operating expense trends and meaningfully impact cost control/reductions.
* Assist with product cost analysis and burden rate calculations.
* Perform financial forecasting and budgeting.
* Provide reporting and analysis to support business partner needs.
* Assist with Quarterly Business Review and BOD preparation.
* Support cross functional projects.
* Support ad hoc channel specific initiatives as needed.

 

 

**Qualifications:**

 

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related required.
* 3+ years’ experience in a financial analysis role required.
* Advanced Excel and database skills and MS Office skills essential; Epicor or equivalent ERP preferred.
* Must be proficient with data gathering and analysis tools to create meaningful reports with ability to draw conclusions and problem solve.
* Must be able to handle multiple projects at once and prioritize.
* Must be process driven with the ability to think critically required.
* Ability to work independently and take initiative while collaborating with on-site and remote business partners essential.
* Excellent analytical, communication and collaboration skills a must.

  


Benefit Overview: 

* 
Competitive Medical, Dental & Vision Plans 

* 
Company Paid Long and Short-Term Disability Plans 

* 
Paid Company Life Insurance Policy 

* 
Attractive Paid Time Off (PTO) Policies 

* 
401K Program with Company Match 

* 
2 Volunteer Days each year (16 hours) 

* 
11 Paid Holidays per year 

* 
Flex work schedule (3 days a week in office required) 

* 
Tuition Reimbursement Program 

* 
Wellness Program 

 

It is the policy of Elkay Interior Systems to comply with all state and federal equal employment opportunity laws and regulations. EIS is committed to giving fair and equal treatment to all individuals. This policy applies to all matters relating to employment including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, recruitment, advertising or soliciting employment, training, compensation, selection for training, layoff or termination, and social or recreational programs. Equal opportunity, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, familial status, or veteran status, is company policy.

title: Insurance Agent
description:
Description Were looking for ambitious, entrepreneurial professionals who want to own their business and help clients prepare for lifes planned and unexpected moments with the right insurance products.  
COUNTRY Financial Insurance Agents have the opportunity and the autonomy to build a rewarding, financially stable career while enriching lives in the communities we serve.  
**The Career**Our Insurance Agents take a consultative approach to grow business with existing and prospective clients. As independent contractors, they are in business for themselves but not by themselves, and they:* **Diversify their income through our portfolio of property and casualty, life and health lines.**
* Have the flexibility to manage their schedules to balance their careers and personal interests.
* Educate clients and prospects about our products and services.
* Collaborate with COUNTRY Trust Bank Financial Advisors to inform clients of our financial products and services.
* Establish an office and build a staff.
**We Offer**COUNTRY Insurance Agents have**uncapped earning potential**without a required buy-in and:* Opportunities to earn performance-based global trips and financial rewards.
* Access to continued learning and marketing resources.
* Affiliation with our 95+ year brand heritage and family-focused culture that values authenticity, integrity, and inclusivity.
 Qualifications Successful COUNTRY Insurance Agents are from different paths, but they are all:

* Entrepreneurial, self-motivated, and goal driven.
* Strong communicators with excellent business acumen.
* Committed to building and maintaining solid connections between their efforts and their rewards.
* Focused on achieving professional success through securing clients trust.
* Passionate about making positive impacts in their communities.

**Required Qualifications**

* Property/Casualty State Insurance License\*
* Life/Health State Insurance License\*

**Preferred Experience**

* Series 6/63 licenses
* Accredited Asset Management Specialist (AAMS)
* Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA)
* Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
* Certified Financial Planner (CFP)
* Chartered Financial Consultant (ChFC)
* Bachelors Degree
* 2+ years of experience in the insurance and or financial services industry
* 5+ years of business ownership or managerial experience

\*These licenses are not required to apply; however, the candidates ability to obtain these licenses is essential when a contract decision is made. About Us COUNTRY Financial is the trade name for a collective of affiliated insurance and financial services companies. This means we have an extended family of support and a large backing.  
For nearly 100 years, COUNTRY Financial has been dedicated to helping others plan for their future while also protecting what matters most to them. What started long ago as a simple commitment on Midwest farmlands has expanded to become a FORTUNE 1000 insurance and financial services organization proudly serving 19 states.  
Our insurance agents, financial advisors, and employees remain dedicated to serving nearly one million households with our diverse range of personal and business insurance products as and financial services products. And our consistent AM Best A+ rating means we have the financial strength to keep the promises we make to our clients.  
  
COUNTRY Financial is the marketing name for the COUNTRY Financial family of affiliated companies (collectively, COUNTRY), which include COUNTRY Life Insurance Company, COUNTRY Mutual Insurance Company, and their respective subsidiaries, located in Bloomington, Illinois.  
Investment management, retirement, trust, and planning services provided by COUNTRY Trust Bank. The investment objectives, risks,charges, and expenses of an investment company should be carefully considered before investing.#CB

  
  
 This is a 1099 position. Commissions, bonuses, and incentives only. The position does not have a salary

title: Technology Operations Analyst
description:
Thanks for your interest in Children's Mercy!:

Do you envision finding a meaningful role with an inclusive and compassionate team? At Children’s Mercy, we believe in making a difference in the lives of all children and shining a light of hope to the patients and families we serve. Our employees make the difference, which is why we have been recognized by U.S. News & World Report as a top pediatric hospital, for eleven consecutive years.  

Children’s Mercy is in the heart of Kansas City – a metro abounding in cultural experiences, vibrant communities and thriving businesses. This is where our patients and families live, work and play. This is a community that has embraced our hospital and we strive to say thanks by giving back. As a leader in children’s health, we engage in meaningful programs and partnerships throughout the region so that we can improve the lives of children beyond the walls of our hospital.
Overview:
**Note: This candidate needs to be local to the Kansas City area.**  

**The IT** **Technology Operations (TechOps) Analyst** **is part of a highly technical staff that is responsible for incidents and requests escalated from the Service Desk or Operations teams for Core Infrastructure, End User Compute, Network, and Telecommunication technologies.** **A Technology Operations Analyst is the front-line support for all Tier 3 IT support at Childrens Mercy. This includes system monitoring and troubleshooting of IT Incidents/Requests. Analysts are responsible for following established processes and procedures in the form of training plans, knowledge base articles and organizational documentation. Provides Customer Service to CM staff on IT related issues, communicates in an accurate and effective manner, and escalates major incidents to Sr Analysts or Engineers for help or guidance as needed.**  

**Tech Op’s Analysts are IT generalists and problem solvers no matter the technology. They learn quickly and relentlessly seek/apply knowledge to eliminate single threaded support gaps in an ever-evolving technology landscape. This includes (but not limited to) support/analysis of local area networks (LAN), software, hardware, phone systems, faxing systems, paging systems, user training/support, knowledge article creation, and new technology project deployments** **Telecommunication background and support experience highly preferred****.**  

At Children’s Mercy, we are committed to ensuring that everyone feels welcomed within our walls. A successful candidate for this position will join us as we strive to create a workplace that reflects the community we serve, as well as our core values of kindness, curiosity, inclusion, team and integrity. *Additionally, it’s important to us that we remain transparent with all potential job candidates. Because we value the safety of the patients and families we serve, as well as the Children’s Mercy staff, we want to let you know that the* ***seasonal influenza*** *and* ***COVID-19*** *vaccines are a condition of employment for all employees in our organization. New employees must be willing to be vaccinated if found non-immune to measles, mumps, rubella (MMR) and chicken pox (varicella) and/or without evidence of tetanus, diphtheria, acellular pertussis (Tdap) vaccination since 2005. If you become a finalist for this position, and have any concerns about receiving these vaccines, medical and/or religious exemptions can be further discussed with Human Resources.*
Responsibilities:
* **Incident Management and Problem Management**
* **Request Management**
* **Event Management**
* **Access Management and Documentation**
* **Maintains Technical Competency**


Qualifications:
* **Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related field of study, and 3-5 years' experience OR**
* **High School diploma, or equivalent, and 7 or more years' experience in lieu of a degree**
* **Windows Server 2008 Active Directory, Configuring Preferred**
* **Microsoft Certified Professional in a non-developer area (MCP) Preferred**
* **Citrix certification in Virtualization or Networking Preferred**
* **VMware certification in End User Computing or Data Center Virtualization Preferred**
* **Network+ or CCNA certification Preferred**

  


Starting Pay:

Our pay ranges are market competitive. The pay range for this job begins at $30.73/hr, but your salaried offer will be determined based upon your education and experience.  


Remote Work/Work from Home:

This position is entirely remote or work-from-home. The person hired must live in the Kansas City metro area and may attend on-site meetings, as scheduled.  


EEO Employer/Disabled/Vet:

Children’s Mercy hires individuals based on their job skills, expertise and ability to maintain professional relationships with fellow employees, patients, parents and visitors. A personal interview, formal education and training, previous work experience, references and a criminal background investigation all are factors used to select the best candidates. The hospital does not discriminate against prospective or current employees based on the race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, creed, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ancestry or veteran status. A drug screen will be performed upon hire. Children’s Mercy is smoke and tobacco free.  


Our commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

CM is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. Our patients and families come from all walks of life, and so do we. We know that our greatest strengths come from the people who make up our team so we hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our hospital stronger and our patient care more compassionate.
If you share our values and our enthusiasm for service, you will find a home at CM. In recruiting for our team, we welcome the unique contributions that you can bring, including education, ideas, culture, ethnicity, race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, age, languages spoken, veteran status, color, religion, disability and beliefs.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Working at Lockton
At Lockton, we’re passionate about helping our people achieve their ultimate potential. Our people are curious, action-oriented and always striving to make ourselves and those around us better. We’re active listeners working to ensure understanding and problem solvers developing innovative solutions. If you can see yourself delivering excellent service to clients, giving back to our communities and being a part of our caring culture, **you belong here.**

Business unit
Lockton Affinity, LLC
Schedule
Full-time
Job type
Standard
Workplace
Hybrid
Your Responsibilities
SUMMARY


Lockton Affinity, in Overland Park, KS is searching for a Business Analyst to join our IT team. At Lockton, information technology is seen as a major contributor to delivering exceptional business results. The Business Analyst position is a key contributor to enable our business vision. Lockton desires associates who want to be part of something bigger than themselves, who possess a positive attitude and who are tenacious about overcoming obstacles encountered.


You’re expected to challenge the status quo and help steer the team towards innovative solutions. Our team is driven, passionate, creative, energetic, and fun. We love to challenge each other and ask hard questions, then figure out the answer and solve the problem together.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following.


* Ability to understand desired future state in context of current business environment.
* Defines incremental steps to achieve desired business results.
* Can create innovative approaches to problems, is comfortable challenging the status quo.
* Experienced with Agile approaches and can decompose complex problems into workable team assignments.
* Ability to learn new systems and concepts quickly, building a strong repertoire of business and technical knowledge.
* Ensure that project team has clear understanding of functional requirements and business expectations.
* Collaborate with creative team and ensure that user experience and visual design align with functional requirements.
* Work with QA to develop testing strategy, identify test cases and participate in UAT.
* Serve as a subject matter expert on the ecommerce solution and platform both for client and for the project team.
* Create training materials for train-the-trainer and end-user training sessions.
* Interacts with project team and management to identify and document benefits, costs, and risks associated with solution alternatives.
* Works to ensure the technical/business design matches the detailed user requirements and system needs.
* Define a process for change management and proactively manage requirement changes.
* Proactively identify risks around requirements and communicate to team leads and PMs.
* Helps to ensure proper communication, process flow, data quality, reliability, integrity and security for automated systems as needed.
* Documents procedures, policies and guidelines to support daily operational processes as needed.
Qualifications
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
  

* BS/BA degree preferred
* 3-5 years relevant work experience required.
* Familiar with agile development methodology, including use case scenarios and user stories.
* Strong project management, time management, initiative and interpersonal skills.
* Experience in articulating and documenting user requirements.
* Experience in planning and performing functional testing.
* Experience with Microsoft Suite including Advanced Excel and Visio.
* Experience with project and collaborations tools such as MS Teams, SharePoint, and Workfront.
* Ability to express complex technical concepts effectively, both verbally and written.
* Some off-shift support and travel may be required
* Experience within the insurance and brokerage industry is a plus.
OTHER SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS:


* Provides exceptional customer service and adheres to departmental expectations.
* Promotes teamwork and communication between departments and work groups.
* Makes decisions in compliance with established corporate and department standards.
* Maintains awareness of new system procedures, processes, software capabilities and other technological advances with potential impact to Lockton.
* Attends staff meetings, department meetings and educational workshops.
* Organizes formal presentations to Lockton decision-makers.
* Understands when circumstances require persuasion, conciliation, assertiveness, or other approaches and reacts appropriately.

  

The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by Associates within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted, as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of Associates assigned to this job. Other duties may be assigned to meet business needs.


Equal Opportunity Statement
Lockton Companies is proud to provide everyone an equal opportunity to grow and advance. We are committed to an inclusive culture and environment where our people, clients and communities are treated with respect and dignity.


At Lockton, supporting diversity, equity and inclusion is ingrained in our values, and we believe that we are at our best when we fully embrace everyone. We strive to cultivate a caring culture that learns from, celebrates and thrives because of our breadth of differences. As such, we recognize that recruiting, developing and retaining people with diverse backgrounds and experiences is vital and enabling our people to thrive personally and professionally is critical to our long-term success.


About Lockton
Lockton is the largest privately held independent insurance brokerage in the world. Since 1966, our independence has allowed us to serve our clients, take care of our people and give back to our communities. As such, our 10,000+ Associates doing business in over 100 countries are empowered to do what’s right every day.


At Lockton, we believe in the power of all people. You belong at Lockton.


How We Will Support You
At Lockton, we empower you to be true to yourself in all that you do. Your success is our success, and we provide opportunities to help you grow and create a rewarding career path, however you envision it.


We are ready to meet you where you are today, and as your needs change over time. In addition to industry-leading health insurance, we offer additional options to support your overall health and wellbeing.

  



No Agencies Please
Any Employment Agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume to this site does so with the understanding that the applicant's resume will become the property of Lockton Companies, Inc. Lockton Companies will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion and without any fee owed to the submitting Employment Agency, person or entity. Employment Agencies, who have fee Agreements with Lockton Companies must submit applicants to the designated Lockton Companies Employment Coordinator to be eligible for placement fees.

title: EDI Business Analyst
description:
BUSINESS ANALYST


**PURPOSE OF THE POSITION:**


The EDI Business Analyst is focused on applications and processes related to the customer experience and is responsible for gathering requirements, user acceptance testing of EDI systems, producing complex reporting, and driving resolution to business production issues to improve our EDI systems and technology. In this role, you will engage and collaborate with the


EDI teams across 3 countries, Business Stakeholders, and IS teams to identify opportunities to utilize technology related to our internal processes. You will also identify the best solution to streamline processes by acknowledging and understanding people, processes, and technology. The role supports various EDI teams in Canada, the US, and Mexico. This position will require providing service, building and maintaining positive relationships with the business, and functioning as a team player.


**Job Responsibilities:**


* Support of all EDI systems including ITX, TMDS, EAI, SAPTM, Customer Portals, and other EDI focused applications.
* Gather requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, design thinking, task and workflow analysis
* Reviews and analyzes system problems to identify solutions or recommendations
* Work with EDI, IS, and business teams to understand and document business process requirements, analyzing and validating for automation feasibility; assisting the core automation team in creating the business case
* Perform testing, identify issues concerning solution performance, communicate required changes to the development team, and track resolution
* System requirement identification and documentation analysis
* Plan and facilitate workshops to identify and validate requirements with IS and business stakeholders in support of projects and opportunities
* Build knowledge of the organization, processes, and customers
* Solve a range of straightforward problems; analyze possible solutions using standard procedures
* Receive a moderate level of guidance and direction
* Leads process mapping/modeling and translates requirements into design
* May be required to work irregular hours (weekends, after business hours)
* May be required to perform on-call duties
* Ability to adjust to changing priorities and manage customer/stakeholder expectations
* Ability to manage change
* Leverages best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve products or services; Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective using existing solutions


**REQUIREMENTS:**


* Experience gathering requirements, capturing working flows, and user acceptance testing of EDI systems
* Excellent communication skills
* EDI experience – transportation industry or railroad industry (highly preferred)
* Experience with X12 EDI Standards
* Knowledge of customer-facing EDI transactions and acknowledgments
* Business analyst or project management, or equivalent experience
* Process mapping and project management methodology
* Ability to communicate effectively, strong written and oral skills to respond to internal and external requests for information
* Strong problem-solving, organizational, and planning skills
* Working with business stakeholders regarding process, procedure, and policy development or creation


**NICE TO HAVE****:**


* Experience with Salesforce
* Bi-Lingual (English and Spanish)


**Additional Details :**

Projected Start Date : 2024-04-08T04:00:00


Projected End Date : 2025-10-31T13:00:00


Client Company : KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN - KC Southern Railway


Vendor Pay Rate : 60

Background Check : No

title: Senior Operations Analyst
description:
**Company Description** **We believe that some of the greatest ideas and innovations are yet to come to life. Will they come from you?**

**Welcome to AbbVie!**


At AbbVie, we offer you the resources and a global reach to empower your innovative mindset. From day one, we’ve known it takes teamwork and collaboration to develop the scientific breakthroughs, innovative pipelines, and therapies that change millions of patients’ lives around the world. In short, we know it takes “you” to make those ground-breaking advancements happen. We take pride in serving and supporting our communities and protecting the environment, making a lasting impact that's felt within healthcare and beyond.

 **Job Description**  

We are excited to invite experienced and driven candidates to apply to our **Senior Operations Analyst** position here at **AbbVie Westport.**


Reporting to the Central Services Lead in Eyecare, in your new role as Senior Operations Analyst you will support the core operations of the Eyecare Business unit, ensuring that high quality Eyecare products are being delivered to meet patient & market demands. You will be part of a specialised/focused team that will ensure that the product, once manufactured, advances through the quality system by maintaining a robust "product flow" system with ongoing continuous improvement.

**So, are you ready to join to make the move and become our Senior Operations Analyst?**

**Then read on and apply today!**

**Key Responsibilities will include but not be limited to;**

* Active involvement and management of Global Trackwise (GTW) records as they arise in the business unit, responsible for tracking associated metrics and ensuring records do not adversely impact site Perfect Index. This will involve liaising closely with the relevant shift Manager/Supervisor and QA Lead to ensure thorough timely progression and closure through the system.
* SME for analyzing of Quality related data and metrics.
* Point person for coordinating Eyecare Risk Register and updating of actions.
* Point person for coordinating LMR/QMT presentations.
* Lead for Microbial & Contamination related issues.
* Reporting of QA metrics at Tier 3 and weekly performance review meeting.
* Point person for Environmental Trends monthly meetings and related presentations.
* Prepare awareness notifications for Environmental excursions.
* Work close with Depts on corrective actions arising form Environmental excursions.

  

**Qualifications** **Education and Experience:**

* 3rd level qualification in Science/Engineering or related discipline
* 2-3 Years working in a manufacturing environment, preferably Aseptic/Sterile Manufacturing.
* Knowledge of Eyecare BU an advantage
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability to use sound judgment to make effective decisions within appropriate timeframes
* Proven to be self-directed, self-motivated and ability to prioritise competing priorities
* Quality system management experience

 **So if all this sounds like the opportunity you have been looking for, apply today!**  

The closing date for applications is Friday 22nd March 2023.


AbbVie is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we value bringing together individuals from diverse backgrounds to develop innovative solutions for patients and being part of an inclusive work environment.

 **Additional Information**  

AbbVie is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Position Title: Business Analyst**

PAR Electrical Contractors, LLC is a premier outside electrical infrastructure construction company based in Kansas City, Missouri. A subsidiary of Quanta Services, Inc. (NYSE:PWR), PAR is one of the founding members of Quanta Services and among the largest union contractors in the U.S. PAR’s employees are the reason for the success of our company. Our reputation attracts the highest quality personnel, people who are committed to producing projects that set a standard for excellence. At PAR, we take on the most challenging and complex projects we can find, and we hire people who thrive on hard work and demanding opportunities.

**POSITION OVERVIEW:**

The Business Analyst will function as a bridge between IT and Business sectors, with a focus on comprehending and transforming business processes into system/software requirements and designs that align with the needs of the Operations teams.

**ESSENTIAL JOB SKILLS/DUTIES:** 

* Facilitate requirement elicitation and gathering sessions.
* Create standardized documentation for software/system requirements.
* Define business objectives and problem statements.
* Document current (As-is) and future (To-be) processes.
* Develop product roadmaps and strategies.
* Rationalize systems to align with long and short-term business goals.
* Effective stakeholder management.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate and present effectively to all organizational levels.
* Manage multiple projects simultaneously, and demonstrate strong organizational aptitude.
* Develop project schedules, emphasizing task-resource and financial goal balance.
* Implement and maintain project execution, planning, and management.
* Ensure completion of assigned projects and realization of all associated benefits.
* Demonstrated progressive skills in job knowledge, communication, planning, collaboration, decision-making, judgment, and problem-solving.
* Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, self-motivated, results-driven, and detail-focused.
* Ability to facilitate teams and drive change.
* Familiarity with change management models and techniques.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS:** 

* Minimum of 3 years of experience in software implementation, with a focus on business analysis, requirement and design documentation, project management, and product management.
* Bachelor's degree or higher in a related field is preferred.
* Preferred certifications: PMP, CBAP, and/or PSCO.
* Experience with the HCSS product suite including HeavyJob, HeavyBid, HCSS Credentials, and E360 preferred
* Proficient in data analysis and correlations
* Proficiency with Microsoft VBA programming a plus
* Willingness to travel as needed to support multiple business units nationwide, up to 25%.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including MS Excel, MS Visio, and MS Project.
* Ability to pass a Pre-Employment drug screen and criminal background check.
* Drug free workplace: New employees must submit and successfully pass post-offer drug screening

PAR offers a comprehensive benefits package including 100% employer-paid benefits and generous 401(k) matching contribution.

PAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Women, veterans and minorities are encouraged to apply.

All full-time job offers are contingent upon passing a pre-employment drug screening and background check.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Payroll & HR Operations Analyst-Hybrid to Kansas City Metro
description:
Join the movement transforming the financial system and changing how businesses access the capital they need to thrive. At C2FO, you’ll work with colleagues from around the globe and help companies to meet their unique goals while applying your expertise and finding solutions. We believe individual voices lead to the best ideas. That’s why we seek, encourage and welcome people of all backgrounds.
  
About C2FO
  
Headquartered in Kansas City, USA, C2FO has more than 600+ employees worldwide, with operations throughout North America, Europe, India, Asia Pacific, and Australia. C2FO is the world’s largest on-demand working capital platform. Our mission is to ensure every business has the capital needed to thrive and we have delivered more than $275 billion in funding to businesses since our founding. How do we do this? By providing fast, flexible, and equitable access to low-cost capital through our easy-to-use platform.
  
We provide technology with a human touch, giving our customers the direct support, they need and ensuring our team members have the tools, resources and work environment they need to deliver on our promise to customers. With the C2FO platform, businesses worldwide have more working capital to fuel their growth, create jobs and develop new products.
  
Benefits
  
At C2FO, we take care of our customers and our people – the vital human capital that helps our customers thrive. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package, flexible work options for work/life balance, volunteer time off, and more. Learn more about our benefits here. https://www.c2fo.com/amer/us/en-us/about-us/careers
  
  

**About the Payroll & HR Operations Analyst:**  

This role reports into the People Operations Department and reports directly to the HR Global Operations Director.
  
  

**Essential Duties:**  

* Support calculating and processing employee wages, salaries, bonuses, and other forms of compensation.
* Ensure accurate and timely payment of employees, taking into consideration factors like hours worked, overtime, deductions, and taxes.
* Maintain accurate payroll records and documentation.
* Must be familiar with various pay types; hourly, salaried, salaried non-exempt, salaried commissioned, and processing payment for interns.


Compensation
  
* Assist with organizing data around applicable pay components related to time and attendance, reimbursement programs, gifts cards, anniversary bonus and equity and commission payments.
* Assist with reporting and payroll data to analyze compensation trend and or notable variance/ discrepancies.


Benefits Administration
  
* Calculate and assist with benefit changes as it related to payroll deductions and reconciliation to monthly vendor statements and billing.
* Collaborate with HR team to support and ensure accurate benefit enrollment and processing as it impacts the pay statement.
* Knowledgeable in areas multi-faceted reporting respective to 401(k) compliance, leave administration and administration around sick pay and leave calculation.
* Ability to calculate and process payments related to short-term disability leave, as well as any other mandatory payroll garnishment; child support and/tax levy.


Compliance and Regulations
  
* Staying up to date with local, state, and federal labor laws and regulations related to payroll and compensation across a multi-state organization. Familiarity with CA payroll compliance and standards is a bonus.
* Ensuring compliance with tax regulations and reporting requirements. Assist with state tax inquiries and paperwork and supporting documentation.
* Processing payroll in accordance with legal and regulatory guidelines.


**Data Analysis and Reporting:**  

* Analyzing payroll data to identify trends, discrepancies, and areas for improvement. Ability to generate and query system databases to support HR-reporting needs with minimal guidance and direction is necessary.
* Reconciliation of monthly billing and vendor billing pertaining to payroll.
* Assist payroll team with reinforcing and establishing payroll guidelines by writing and updating policies and procedures.


Problem Resolution
  
* Addressing employee inquiries and concerns related to payroll, taxes, deductions, and compensation.
* Investigating and resolving discrepancies or errors in payroll processing.


Collaboration and Communication
  
* Collaborating with HR, finance, and other departments to ensure accurate and consistent information flow.


**System and Process Improvement:**  

* Identifying opportunities to streamline payroll processes and improve efficiency.
* Implementing and utilizing payroll software and systems to manage data and automate processes.
* Maintain a strong understanding of payroll regulations, compensation principles, and data analysis. Additionally, attention to detail, accuracy, strong organizational skills, and the ability to work with sensitive and confidential information are essential.


**Basic Qualifications:**  

* Business Administration, Accounting degree, or equivalent work experience.
* Minimum of 5+ years business related experience
* Must have related payroll HRIS systems experience (Ceridian/Dayforce—preferred, UKG, ADP, Oracle,Workday).
* Proficiency in Excel, creating pivot tables, building, and comparing data files. The ability to generate and create reporting, as well as verifying accuracy of content is imperative to success in this role.


**Preferred Qualifications:**  

Any relevant license or certification applicable to human resources applied profession: Certified Payroll Professional (CPP), SHRM- CP, Certified Compensation Professional (CCP)
  
C2FO’s global HQ is located in Kansas City. This role is hybrid for someone within the KC Metro. or fully remote. Salary range is $70,000 - $80,000. Compensation offered will be determined by factors such as job level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
  
Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
  
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we not only value diversity and equality, but we also empower our team members to bring their authentic selves to work every day. Our goal is to create a workplace that reflects the communities we serve and our global, multicultural clients. We recognize the power of inclusion, emphasizing that each team member was chosen for their unique ability to contribute to the overall success of our mission.
  
We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.

title: Business Transformation Partner
description:
Canadian Pacific (CP) and Kansas City Southern (KCS) are now CPKC. As the only truly North American railway, we are making big moves! Drawing on our strong foundations and heritage, CPKC moves essential goods across our 20,000-mile network to support economic growth throughout Canada, the U.S. and Mexico. Be a part of history as we connect a continent and create exciting career opportunities across our new transnational network. Visit cpkcr.com to learn about the CPKC advantage, our purpose and culture.

  


**PURPOSE OF THE POSITION:**


Located in Winnipeg, reporting to the Director of Business Transformation the L2C Business Transformation Partner works with the sales & marketing (S&M), Finance and Network Service Center (NCS) to drive value through enabling new transformation capabilities. Our mission is to collaborate with the S&M, Finance and NSC teams along with IS Delivery to drive value through enabling new transformation capabilities. The L2C Business Transformation Partner will enable the business in successful delivery of IS projects by helping to define requirements, designing business processes, and aligning stakeholder expectations.

  


**POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES:**


* Demand Management - manage intake and prioritization of business requests to ensure roadmap alignment and optimization
* Process Mapping – develop an integrated business architecture through process flow mapping, key measures, and process optimization opportunities
* Realize process improvements through simplification, standardization, and automation processes/solutions
* Roadmap development – work with senior business leaders and Enterprise/Solution Architects to identify, elaborate and plan future transformation programs and initiatives. Fit these plans into our corporate transformation roadmap
* Roadmap program delivery – lead innovation and manage change to ensure that strategic programs, solution enhancements realize their value
* Build and maintain partnerships within the business, earn trust, build credibility and thereby forming strong relationships with the business stakeholders
* Lead and facilitate discussions across the organization to identify opportunities, optimize/influence decision making, and drive value
* Apply a variety of techniques to elicit and gather business and user requirements from stakeholders. Understand business issues and opportunities. Analyze and define both the “As Is” and “To Be” business processes and perform a gap analysis
* Coordinate diverse groups who contribute to business requirements and build consensus for requirements across the various user groups
* Capture and document non-functional requirements that are important to the user community (i.e. usability, learnability, reliability). Liaise with architecture to ensure other non-functional requirements are considered (i.e. security, compatibility, maintainability)
* Translating requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems to technical teams designing and implementing the solution
* Develop diagrams and models (use case, activity diagram, business process models, etc.) and clearly document functional requirements and business rules to describe what the system, process, or product/service must do in order to fulfill the business and user requirements
* Demonstrate CPKC s leadership competencies

  




**POSITION REQUIREMENTS:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business or related field required
* Strong experience in Business Transformation, focused on process optimization
* Experience and understanding of railway and transportation processes as it applies to customers, price development, order management, invoice to collections and financial reporting
* Experience developing strategic plans and roadmaps
* High business IQ and ability to articulate the value of different strategies & programs
* Highly analytical with experience in process mapping and business analysis
* Skilled in facilitation, negotiation, gaining consensus and managing conflict of diverse stakeholder groups
* Experience and ability to work with Senior Leadership levels in the organization
* Ability to manage client expectations and negotiate win-win solutions
* Highly effective communicator, confident, passionate, clear, respectfully assertive and inspiring
* Displays emotional intelligence; demonstrates self-awareness and remains calm under pressure, expresses confidences in ability to succeed and keeps an optimistic attitude even when things are not going well

  




**WHAT CPKC HAS TO OFFER**:


* Flexible and competitive benefits package
* Competitive company pension plan
* Employee Share Purchase Plan
* Performance Incentive Program
* Annual Fitness Subsidy
* Part-time Studies Program
  


**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:**


As an employer with North American presence, the possibility does exist that the location of your position may be changed based on organizational requirements.

  

**Background Investigation:**


The successful candidate will need to successfully complete the following clearances:


* Criminal history check
* Reference check
  


**Management Conductor Program:**


Becoming a qualified conductor or locomotive engineer is the single best way for a management employee to learn the business at CPKC. You may be required to obtain a certification or to maintain your current certification/qualification as a conductor or locomotive engineer.

  

CPKC is an employment equity employer committed to the principles of employment equity and inclusion. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply including women, Black, Indigenous, People of Colour (BIPOC), members of the LGBTQ+ community, and people with disabilities. Accommodations for the job application process can be provided, as appropriate, upon request. All applicant information will be managed in accordance with the federal Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA).

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Business Analyst**


Join Orange EV, a fast-growing manufacturer of electric vehicles that are better for the earth, people and the bottom line. Make a difference for the world as part of a company leading the electric vehicle revolution.

**Position Summary**


Assist in accelerating our sales and the adoption of our EV trucks by providing insightful analysis, reporting, planning, and forecasting for our business – and be able to communicate the insights effectively with internal leadership and with external customers. Be a leader in improving our worksheets and internal understanding of performance and improving customer-facing materials and reports.

**Position Responsibilities**

* Implement improvements to take us to the next level versus current reporting and worksheets
* Leverage available CRM and Sales data to provide actionable insights to guide the sales and marketing teams
* Evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns and sales activities to determine the most effective approaches
* Assist with planning and scheduling of production based on customer demand
* Prepare analytical reviews of truck usage/performance from telematics systems to review with customers
* Join customer calls to support the sales team by explaining more complex analytical reports
* Identify knowledge gaps and help us fill them

  

Position Qualifications

* Proven work experience as a Business Analyst, Sales Analyst, or similar role
* Power BI experience
* Outstanding Microsoft Excel skills
* Communicates clearly, confidently, and effectively with high-profile external customers
* Pays close attention to detail
* Confidence and poise to thrive in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to prioritize and multitask
* Diligent follow-up skills
* Experience with Microsoft Office products

  

Ideal Candidates Will Also Have

* Experience with Salesforce or other CRM programs

 *Orange EV is an Equal Opportunity Employers and seek diversity in candidates for employment.*

title: AVP, Technology Product Owner - Gen AI
description:
Job Description:

**Role Summary/Purpose:**


As a Generative AI Product Owner, you will be responsible for the launch and ongoing development of the generative AI products for Synchrony Financial using the Agile methodology. You will work cross functionally to design and implement innovative solutions using generative AI techniques. You will be responsible for researching, identifying epics, prioritizing the backlog, developing, verifying and delivering generative AI models and applications.


We’re proud to offer you choice and flexibility. You have the option to be remote, and work from home, or come into one of our offices. You may be occasionally requested to commute to our nearest office for in person engagement activities such as team meetings, training and culture events.

**Essential Responsibilities:**


As the Generative AI Product Owner, we’ll rely on you to exercise your excellent project management expertise and solid business knowledge of various generative AI techniques and applications used across the enterprise to define business objectives, identify epics and priorities, plan sprints, develop, validate and deliver launch plans related to growth initiatives, while ensuring a superior customer experience.


You will do this by:

* Being the point person on the product development team, using their high-level perspective to define goals and create a vision for generative AI projects.
* Being responsible for communicating with stakeholders across the board, including customers, business managers, ART partners and the development team to make sure the goals are clear, and the vision is aligned with generative AI objectives.
* Helping the agile team maintain the vision by creating a product roadmap.
* Creating the list of backlog items and prioritizing them based on the overall strategy and generative AI objectives. Additionally, mapping out project dependencies to inform the necessary sequence of development.
* Spending a significant amount of time overseeing the actual development of the generative AI products; being a key player throughout each event, including planning, refinement, review, and sprint.
* Being accountable for cross function integration and approval including Compliance, Legal, Brand (Marketing) Reporting, Planning, Forecasting, Training, and Communication.
* Performing other duties and/or special projects as assigned

**Required Skills/Knowledge:**

* Bachelor’s degree and 4+ years’ of Team/Process lead experience in Financial Services Industry or experience in AI Technology, including Data Science methods, Data Analytics, or similar (or in lieu of a degree 8+ years)
* Minimum of 5 years of experience participating in projects using Agile methodology (SAFe/Non SAFe).
* SAFe POPM trained or certified
* Strong business acumen and knowledge of applications used across different functions.
* Superior decision-making skills.
* Expert verbal & written communicator. Should be able to modulate content based on audience.
* Ability to break down complex operational/systemic procedures & create/convert them into simplified process maps/documents.
* Action oriented – create an environment to leverage agile methodology and deliver continuous benefit to the business teams during a project
* Proven experience in problem solving and negotiated solutions
* Working with cross-functional teams (not limited to - architects, application engineers, UX designers, and outsourced vendors) to create a holistic roadmap and planning for product delivery
* Ability to build & maintain relationships & partnerships with key stakeholder

**Desired Skills/Knowledge:**

* Prior PMP, Scrum, SAFe trained or certified
* Prior Product Owner or Business Analyst experience
* Solid Project Management skills
* Experience as a data scientist, data analyst, or similar
* Technical Aptitude / background
* Self-Starter with a strong work ethic
* Ability to make decisions where applicable and escalate when necessary
* Solid prioritization and organizational skills

**Grade/Level: 11**

The salary range for this position is **90,000.00 - 155,000.00** USD Annual and is eligible for an annual bonus based on individual and company performance.

  

Actual compensation offered within the posted salary range will be based upon work experience, skill level or knowledge.


Salaries are adjusted according to market in CA, NY Metro and Seattle.

**Eligibility Requirements:**

* You must be 18 years or older
* You must have a high school diploma or equivalent
* You must be willing to take a drug test, submit to a background investigation and submit fingerprints as part of the onboarding process
* You must be able to satisfy the requirements of Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.
* New hires (Level 4-7) must have 9 months of continuous service with the company before they are eligible to post on other roles. Once this new hire time in position requirement is met, the associate will have a minimum 6 months’ time in position before they can post for future non-exempt roles. Employees, level 8 or greater, must have at least 18 months’ time in position before they can post. All internal employees must consistently meet performance expectations and have approval from your manager to post (or the approval of your manager and HR if you don’t meet the time in position or performance expectations).


Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

**Our Commitment:**


When you join us, you’ll be part of a diverse, inclusive culture where your skills, experience, and voice are not only heard—but valued. We celebrate the differences in all of us and believe that our individual, unique perspectives is what makes Synchrony truly a great place to work. Together, we’re building a future where we can all belong, connect and turn ideals into action. Through the power of our 8 Diversity Networks+, with more than 60% of our workforce engaged, you’ll find community to connect with an opportunity to go beyond your passions.


This starts when you choose to apply for a role at Synchrony. We ensure all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

**Reasonable Accommodation Notice:**

* Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.
* If you need special accommodations, please call our Career Support Line so that we can discuss your specific situation. We can be reached at 1-866-301-5627. Representatives are available from 8am – 5pm Monday to Friday, Central Standard Time

**Job Family Group:**


Information Technology

title: Restaurant Manager, Casual Dining, Commitment to Quality of Life
description:
We strive to be more than operational managers; we are looking for innovators and leaders who are committed to their team's success but also want to maintain an exceptional quality of life for their own personal growth. We put an uncommon value on mentoring and coaching, personal accountability and side-by-side leadership, while committing to a work schedule for our leaders that does not run longer than 45 to 48 hours each week. Our teams are composed of tremendous individuals who work with fun and remarkable efficiency; we work with them and for them to provide every possible opportunity for financial growth and professional development possible. Our leaders thrive on developing the dishwasher into the next great manager on our team and we walk every step alongside them, doing the same work with them. We are Peer-mentors and leaders, we are the epitome of the Player-coach.

JOB SUMMARY

As a partner in a 3-4 member store management team, you will be responsible for the daily operations of the entire restaurant, including adherence to all recipes, quality and control standards, cleanliness, customer experience, and providing professional leadership and growth to our team members.

EXPECTATIONS

* 45 - 48 hour work week with two days off each week. **We take work-life balance very seriously**.
* We pay for every hour of work, there is never a time when our managers are used in response to labor reporting opportunities.
* Shared Individual and Family Medical Insurance Premiums
* Available Dental Insurance
* Available Vision Insurance
* Paid time off that increases with tenure benchmarks
* Employee Discounts in both concepts
* 9 - 10 hour shifts; our restaurant opens at 9am and closes at 8pm, Sundays are 9am to 4pm
* Support to overcome opportunities and demonstrated appreciation for committed effort.
* Achievable $1000 Quarterly bonus
* A very high degree of accountability within our culture.
* P&L analysis and development of operational plans to overcome opportunities.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

* Ensures that the operational standards and best practices are adhered to with complete commitment and an overwhelming desire to provide guidance, growth and opportunity to our team members.
* Develops and maintains expert knowledge of our menus and company food and beverage standards.
* Operates in total compliance with federal/state/local laws, and ordinances.
* Effectively uses daily communication channels to identify opportunities, track progress and provide growth and genuine care to team members, peers and leadership.
* Maintains accurate and timely administrative documents including but not limited to policy updates, menu and product changes, and most importantly our scheduled individual performance reviews, cross-training trackers and team member wage increases.
* Responsible for daily goal tracking and evaluation with regards to restaurant performance.
* Unyielding enforcement of all safety and sanitary standards and practices to ensure the health and safety of our internal and external Guests.
* Responsible for continuously providing our teams with the tools, time, guidance and growth-oriented leadership that establishes the most efficient path for shared success, to include small wares purchasing, scheduling immediate equipment repairs, accurate and timely schedule posting and providing an environment that encourages respectful feedback and insight..

QUALIFICATIONS

* 3+ years of prior restaurant management experience with tenures longer than 18 months at each location preferred, but culture is more important than experience.
* An innate commitment to exemplary service to your Guests, to your vendors and business partners, and most importantly to your team.
* Experience in Product Ordering and Inventory Systems.
* Experience in P&L reporting
* Demonstrated awareness of local Health and Safety Legislation and NRA best practices.
* Basic computer literacy with excel and template-based scheduling and communications software.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken.
* Must be flexible and able to see multiple opportunities and responsibilities through to growth and completion at the same time.
* Must have a strong attention to detail.
* Must have full availability to include days beginning at 7:00am and evenings ending no later than 10:00pm. Must have weekend availability.

Salary: $68,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

* Paid training
* Vision insurance

* Day shift
* Evening shift

title: Financial/Business Analyst
description:
**Why Should You Apply?**

* Competitive Wages
* Paid Bi-Weekly
* Full Benefits Offered Including: Health Insurance, Dental, 401k and Life Insurance
* 2 Weeks Paid Time Off Accruing Weekly
* Seven Paid Holidays

**Summary****:** Looking for a dynamic finance professional adept at overseeing financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting processes. Proven expertise in creating insightful variance analysis reports and financial models, tracking key performance indicators (KPIs), and collaborating with management and accounting team.

 

**Essential Duties****:**

* Manages financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting.
* Creates variance analysis reports and financial models.
* Escalates any financial issues to management.
* Sets and tracks key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives.

* Prepares reports and projections based on analyses.

* Identifies financial status by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts.
* Improves financial status by analyzing results, monitoring variances, identifying trends, and recommending improvements to management.
* Recommends actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses.

 

**Experience:** 

* 3-5 years in consumer products, retail sales or manufacturing preferred.
* Bachelor's degree in finance, Accounting, or a related field.
* Knowledge of accounting principles and financial statement analysis.
* Strong financial modeling and analytical skills.

* Learns quickly and has strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
* Strong understanding of business finance and analytics
* Excellent organizational and project management skills

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Paid time off

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

LHH Recruitment is hiring a Senior Compensation Analyst for Client in Overland Park, KS. In this role you will work with the supervisor to review and approve offers, conduct internal and external analysis and more. · Responsible for championing the annual merit and bonus planning process to include schedules, communications, budgeting, systems/tools configuration.

title: EDI Business Analyst
description:
BUSINESS ANALYST

**PURPOSE OF THE POSITION:**

The EDI Business Analyst is focused on applications and processes related to the customer experience and is responsible for gathering requirements, user acceptance testing of EDI systems, producing complex reporting, and driving resolution to business production issues to improve our EDI systems and technology. In this role, you will engage and collaborate with the

EDI teams across 3 countries, Business Stakeholders, and IS teams to identify opportunities to utilize technology related to our internal processes. You will also identify the best solution to streamline processes by acknowledging and understanding people, processes, and technology. The role supports various EDI teams in Canada, the US, and Mexico. This position will require providing service, building and maintaining positive relationships with the business, and functioning as a team player.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Support of all EDI systems including ITX, TMDS, EAI, SAPTM, Customer Portals, and other EDI focused applications.
* Gather requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, design thinking, task and workflow analysis
* Reviews and analyzes system problems to identify solutions or recommendations
* Work with EDI, IS, and business teams to understand and document business process requirements, analyzing and validating for automation feasibility; assisting the core automation team in creating the business case
* Perform testing, identify issues concerning solution performance, communicate required changes to the development team, and track resolution
* System requirement identification and documentation analysis
* Plan and facilitate workshops to identify and validate requirements with IS and business stakeholders in support of projects and opportunities
* Build knowledge of the organization, processes, and customers
* Solve a range of straightforward problems; analyze possible solutions using standard procedures
* Receive a moderate level of guidance and direction
* Leads process mapping/modeling and translates requirements into design
* May be required to work irregular hours (weekends, after business hours)
* May be required to perform on-call duties
* Ability to adjust to changing priorities and manage customer/stakeholder expectations
* Ability to manage change
* Leverages best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve products or services; Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective using existing solutions

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* Experience gathering requirements, capturing working flows, and user acceptance testing of EDI systems
* Excellent communication skills
* EDI experience transportation industry or railroad industry (highly preferred)
* Experience with X12 EDI Standards
* Knowledge of customer-facing EDI transactions and acknowledgments
* Business analyst or project management, or equivalent experience
* Process mapping and project management methodology
* Ability to communicate effectively, strong written and oral skills to respond to internal and external requests for information
* Strong problem-solving, organizational, and planning skills
* Working with business stakeholders regarding process, procedure, and policy development or creation

**NICE TO HAVE****:**

* Experience with Salesforce
* Bi-Lingual (English and Spanish)

  
Required Skills : Business Analysis  
**Additional Skills :** Business Analyst
