title: Business Analyst
description:
**Business Analyst**


 - (3281783) **The Opportunity**



As a not-for-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Mass General Brigham supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care, and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.



We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Mass General Brigham is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.



Our employees use the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions, and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.



The Clinical Business Analyst I will contribute to the successful training, support, and optimization of Epic applications implemented at Mass General Brigham. Work assignments include analyzing and troubleshooting systems issues, providing workflow guidance, and relationship management of supported departments. In-person, remote, and ticket-based support with strict adherence to documented service level agreements is a primary responsibility for the position.


**Responsibilities**


* Support and educate end users with Epic clinical and complementary applications
* Answer end user “how-to” questions


* Document and analyze business processes and help drive business process improvement workflows


* Produces Specification documentation with the guidance of senior staff


* Help identify and resolve issues, and facilitate appropriate escalation for timely resolution


* Conduct formal presentations and prepare presentation for project level work


* Prepare end user training materials


* Assist with developing and executing user acceptance testing plans including creation of test cases


* Participate in regular team meetings to discuss team and project/program related activities, issues, changes, and communications as needed


* Provide service to users, according to the defined service level agreements
* Adhere to recognized project management tools and methodologies


* Assist in identifying and recommending best practices for business analysis, training and end user support functions
* Analyze business processes to ensure accurate system configuration


* Create and run reports as needed using tools such as Epic Reporting Workbench


* Uses the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration


* Other duties as assigned
 **Qualifications**


* Bachelor’s Degree in Business, IT, Healthcare, or related required
* Must have 3 years of healthcare IT experience with a knowledge of clinical systems
* A combination of education and experience may be substituted for requirements
* Epic Certification desired or must obtain Epic training as outlined by program requirement



**Skills and Abilities**


* Experience in end user management, preferably in a healthcare setting
* Ability to learn and understand clinical workflows
* Ability to effectively translate business requirements to functional requirements
* Possess strong interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with cross functional teams including staff at all levels of the organization including both technical and non-technical personnel
* Strong problem solving skills
* Ability to effectively conduct small meetings, both formal and informal
* Requires minimal direction from leadership and possesses the ability to learn quickly
* Ability to successfully collaborate with others of different skill sets, backgrounds and levels within and external to the organization
* Strong PC skills required with knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Word, Excel, Teams, and Visio preferred.



**Hybrid Working Model**


* Requires local travel to IS and hospital sites, including patient care areas with limited patient contact, located on and off all BWH/BWF campuses.
* Other travel may be required to attend meetings, training, and professional development sessions.
* Must be able to provide adequate transportation between work locations.
* Off-site pager coverage for user support as assigned.
* As projects and priorities dictate, must be available to work non-standard business hours, such as evenings, nights, weekends and holidays when necessary.
* Telecommuting policies as permitted under team and Mass General Brigham policies for Connected Work may be considered under a mutual agreement between the incumbent and his/her manager.

  

**EEO Statement**  

Mass General Brigham is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives, and ideas, we choose to lead. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, sex, age, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, military service, genetic information, and/or other status protected under the law. We will ensure that all individuals with a disability are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

  

**Primary Location** MA-Somerville-BWH Assembly Row**Other Locations** MA-Boston-BWFH Brigham and Women's Faulkner Hospital Main, MA-Boston-BWH Boston Main Campus**Work Locations** BWH Assembly Row 399 Revolution Drive Somerville 02145**Job** Business and Systems Analyst**Organization** Mass General Brigham**Schedule** Full-time**Standard Hours** 40**Shift** Day Job**Posted Shift Description** Hybrid role requires onsite and remote. Requires travel to IS and hospital sites MGB local hospitals**Employee Status** Regular**Recruiting Department** MGB Digital**Job Posting** Mar 27, 2024

title: Business Operations Analyst
description:
**Company Description**  

Dynatrace exists to make software work perfectly. Our platform combines broad and deep observability and continuous runtime application security with advanced AIOps to provide answers and intelligent automation from data. This enables innovators to modernize and automate cloud operations, deliver software faster and more securely, and ensure flawless digital experiences.

 **Job Description**  

* Provide day-to-day analytical support to the team, gathering and analyzing business requirements especially in ambiguous situations, assisting in data gathering, analysis, and interpretation to address immediate business needs and challenges in a timely manner.
* Guide and mentor stakeholders in cultivating an analytical mindset, emphasizing the importance of leveraging data-driven insights to inform decision-making processes.
* Utilize data exploration techniques to uncover trends, patterns, and areas for improvement within the organization's datasets.
* Develop actionable business recommendations based on data insights to drive strategic initiatives and operational efficiencies.
* Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and data visualizations using tools, such as Excel, SQL, and Power BI.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive process improvements and optimize business performance.

**This position will require candidates to work hybrid out of our Waltham, MA office.**

 **Qualifications**  

Minimum Requirements:

* 2+ years of experience in business analysis, data analytics, or related field.
* Bachelor’s degree


Preferred Requirements:

* Master's degree preferred.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think critically and analytically with strong curiosity to explore data trends and uncover insights.
* Proven excellent verbal and written communication skills to clarify requirements and translate vague inputs into actionable tasks, and effectively communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
* Ability to work effectively in a collaborative cross-functional team environment and communicate complex ideas clearly.
* Demonstrate knowledge of database structure.
* Proficient in Excel, including advanced functions and Power Query, and SQL for reporting automation and data ETL. Experience with Power BI, including DAX, to create interactive dashboards and visualizations.
* Apply accounting and financial analysis knowledge to interpret financial data and provide valuable insights.
* Apply quote to cash operation knowledge to identify process improvement opportunities and enhance operational efficiency.
* Strong time management skills and the ability to deliver high-quality results and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Demonstrate a self-starter mentality and fast learner mindset to thrive in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
* Experience of working with Salesforce CPQ data is preferred.
* Familiarity with Snowflake for cloud-based data warehousing and analytics is preferred.
* Python for data manipulation and analysis tasks is a plus.

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


We offer competitive compensation, company-sponsored premium benefits, medical, dental, vacation/holidays, company matching 401(k) Plan, etc. Dynatrace is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities, age, sexual orientation, creed, disability status, veteran status, pregnancy, genetic status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If your disability makes it difficult for you to use this site, please contact careers@dynatrace.com. Dynatrace participates in E-Verify, participant information in English and Spanish. title: Business Analyst
description:
The Advanced Imager Technology Group performs research and development of imager array and subsystem-level technology for the DoD and scientific community. The imager efforts include advanced silicon and compound semiconductor based focal-plane technologies for applications such as ground- and space-based surveillance, adaptive optics, and astronomy. These focal planes address special requirements, for example, large-format gigapixel arrays, very high-speed imagers, time-of-arrival detectors (LADAR receiver), and low-light-level imaging applications. World-class charge-coupled device (CCD) imagers, fabricated by this Group, have been used in a variety of high-end scientific applications, for example, focal planes for the Chandra X-ray telescope, NASA’s Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS), and other preeminent astronomical observatories. The Group's efforts span the range of device development, integrated circuit design and fabrication, custom packaging, and the development of control and readout electronics for system-level demonstrations.  



Job Description  

The Advanced Imager Technology Group seeks a Business Analyst to join our operations team in supporting 70+ researchers who are managing and executing a wide variety of technical programs for government and industry. The Business Analyst will learn about our business environment, organization, research and operations; and will develop expertise in business applications and processes. Working under the guidance of a Business Manager, analysts perform a variety of finance and operational tasks to support project teams, research labs, and group management. Candidates should have a background in finance and business administration, familiarity with project management, and proficiency in Excel and other business automation tools. An ability to effectively communicate and work with individuals from varied backgrounds is essential. The Lab offers a dynamic, high-learning environment with advancement opportunities on the business track.  

This position is non-exempt and typical business hours are 8:30AM-5:00PM.  

Responsibilities include:  

  

Financial Analysis and Reporting  

Use Excel, SAP and Business Objects to execute project reporting and other financial metrics Research variances and perform various ad-hoc analysis requests  

Develop a fundamental understanding of the various factors that contribute to costs  

Procurements  

Project-manage the Group’s purchasing queue including a range of unique procurements that impact research-project deliverables  

Collaborate with others to ensure quick and accurate processing in SRM/SAP; monitor through goods receipt and invoicing  

Apply knowledge of the purchase-to-pay cycle to resolve processing and posting issues  

Personnel Management  

Monitor weekly employee and contingent workforce timesheets in SAP and Field Glass  

Respond to questions or concerns, either by research or referral  

Facilities Management & Other Logistics  

Monitor the movement and tracking of property according to standard lab procedures; support property audit requests and research variances  

Assist with special events and support group coordination as requested  

May participate in process improvement and other lab-wide initiatives  

Requirements  

AS degree and 2+ years of related experience, or Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or related field.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)  

Ability to read and understand financial results/reports  

Effective written and oral communication skills, interpersonal skills, and organizational skills  

Ability to obtain and maintain a government security clearance is required  

  

Preferred Skills and Experience:  

  

Experience working in technology, science, government, or project-driven environment  

SAP HANA, Business Objects, FieldGlass, Concur  

Exposure to government contracting, acquisitions, and project management  

Written and verbal communication skills  

Self-motivation, independence, and critical thinking  


At MIT Lincoln Laboratory, our exceptional career opportunities include many outstanding benefits to help you stay healthy, feel supported, and enjoy a fulfilling work-life balance. Benefits offered to employees include:
* Comprehensive health, dental, and vision plans
* MIT-funded pension
* Matching 401K
* Paid leave (including vacation, sick, parental, military, etc.)
* Tuition reimbursement and continuing education programs
* Mentorship programs
* A range of work-life balance options
* ... and much more!


Please visit our Benefits page for more information. As an employee of MIT, you can also take advantage of other voluntary benefits, discounts and perks.
Selected candidate will be subject to a pre-employment background investigation and must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret level DoD security clearance.
MIT Lincoln Laboratory is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, or genetic information; U.S. citizenship is required.

title: Enterprise Mobility Technician
description:
We are seeking an **Enterprise Mobility Technician** to join the company, a premier supplier, in **Boston, MA 02114.** While working in this clean, and not climate-controlled facility you will have the opportunity to be directly involved in the evolution of the industry. Come work for a company that has been consistently recognized among the Best & Brightest Companies to Work For. Immediate interviews are available, apply today!

**Job Title: Enterprise Mobility Technician** 

**Duration: 3 Months (With possibility of extension)** 

**Location: Boston, MA 02114.** 

**Pay range: $30 to $35 Per hour on W2**

 

**DETAILED STATEMENT OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Provide modern smartphone and tablet technology.
* Provide support for new and ongoing Mobility related projects.
* Provide support for mobile device migration efforts.
* Respond to requests from internal and authorized external business units in a timely manner for Tier II support: telephone, e-mail, remote control, and occasional on-site problem diagnosis and resolution for mobile device issues.
* Enforce mobile device policies and procedures in the MDM environment.
* Integrate commercial off-the-shelf and in-house mobile applications into the MDM catalog and ensure deployment of those applications.
* Cooperate with consultants for installations, deployments, and troubleshooting of new releases as needed.
* Manage service vendor(s) to ensure quality and provide feedback on ways the vendor(s) can improve services.
* Maintain system integrity and security by resolving issues from compliance scans.
* Maintain system configuration design documentation and MDM continuity documentation.
* Participate in team meetings and provide routine status updates.
* Evaluate current and next-generation mobile hardware, software, and services; recommend purchases.
* Collaborate and strategize with business units to formulate secretariat application reference manuals for mobile applications.
* Lend experience and insight into next-generation Mobile Device Management (MDM) services for a large enterprise.

**QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED AT HIRE** (List knowledges, skills, abilities)

* At least 3 years of hands-on experience in IT Asset Management, IT Customer Support, IT Service Delivery, IT Application Development, IT Business Analysis, or other IT related fields in a large enterprise organization. Experience working in state government is preferred but not necessary.
* 1-3 years of relevant work experience and basic knowledge with Mobile Device Management (MDM), Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM), or Unified Endpoint Management (UEM) and tools such as Workspace One (AirWatch), Verizon MDM, Apple Business Manager, and Microsoft Intune is a plus.
* Knowledge of industry trends and insight into mobility device use cases.
* Knowledgeable with both iOS devices
* Must be able to be on site at least 3 days per week.
* Must be able to travel between all locations and a have a valid driver’s license.

 

**Education and Certifications:**

* 
Associates Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience desirable.

* 
Mobility Platform Certifications (Workspace One (AirWatch), Intune, MobileIron, etc.) optional but preferred


 

The Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to creating an equitable and inclusive environment for all.

title: Warehouse Management System (WMS) Business Analyst
description:
JOB TITLE: Warehouse Management System (WMS) Business Analyst

CONTRACT to FULL-TIME

GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION:

Habitat Clothes Inc. is looking to add a superstar full-time Business Analyst to join our team. The Business Analyst contributes in a lead role to the Executive Management team in the evaluation, design, development and implementation of standardized reporting, business processes and information system solutions. The Business Analyst will seek, develop, and help implement strategic initiatives for improved efficiency and productivity while collaborating with Executive Management to identify business needs, analyze data, and recommend effective solutions to enhance overall business performance.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES for Business Analyst:

· Evaluate, analyze, and communicate systems requirements on a continuing basis, and maintain systems processes, including the delivery of status reports to all appropriate parties.

· Propose and implement solutions to enhance efficiency, productivity, and overall business performance.

· Analyze and interpret data to identify trends, patterns and insights that can inform business decisions.

· Conduct interviews, workshops, and surveys to understand current business processes and future needs.

· Conduct daily systems analytics to maximize effectiveness and troubleshoot problems.

· Work closely with cross-functional teams to design and document effective and scalable solutions.

· Participate in project planning, tracking, and reporting.

· Take initiative to create reports using various software applications, gathering and managing data on progress and issues. These reports will be communicated to both development teams and Executive Management

· Ability to independently identify root cause of software program issues and use analysis and testing techniques to solve low to complex issues and to suggest solutions in a logical manner.

· Collaborate with development teams to ensure successful project delivery.

· Develop and execute test plans to ensure that solutions meet business requirements.

· Ensuring ongoing maintenance and upgrades to the software post-development

· Supervising and directing the analysis, writing, building and deployment phases of software development

· Making modifications and conducting testing for changes to previously developed programs

· Perform other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS:

· Bachelor’s degree in business, operations, supply chain, logistics, computer science or a related field.

· 3+ years of experience directly managing the key responsibilities listed above.

· Experience with the apparel industry a plus.

· Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and a high level of understanding of Warehouse Management System WMS (preferably Deposco), WES (KPI/Autostore) ERP (RLM), Website (Kentico) and CRM (Zoho).

· Experience with Power Bi, Tableau, SQL, APIs, Java

· Ability to understand and implement lean methodology and continuous improvement initiatives.

· Ability to lead and maintain a safe work environment.

· Ability to work independently and as part of a small, very focused leadership team.

· Experience a plus in creating and updating various KPI reports for the leadership team.

· Excellent written and verbal communications skills.

· Strong Analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Experience a plus in assisting as a program developer

**KEY COMPETENCIES:**

 

Working within Team Environments

Dependable

Time Management

Strong organization and problem-solving skills

Excellent analytical mindset and understanding of business processes

Flexibility to seasonality of the business

 

 

Contract to Full-Time

title: Temporary Program Analyst, Black in Business
description:
Salary: $25 per hour  
**Overview** 

The Initiative for a Competitive Inner City (ICIC) is a national not-for-profit organization founded in 1994 by Harvard Business School Professor Michael Porter to promote economic development in America’s under-resourced areas through private sector engagement that leads to job, income and wealth creation for local residents. Informed by our research, ICIC has developed and supported highly effective initiatives for underserved urban businesses to meet entrepreneurs’ most pressing needs. At ICIC, you will work with talented, creative, and committed professionals in a collaborative culture dedicated to excellence and innovation.

  


**Program Overview**

ICIC is the national outreach and recruitment partner for Goldman Sachs' *One Million Black Women*: *Black in Business* (BiB), a business education program designed to help Black women sole-proprietors learn how to price their products or services, hire their first employee, assess business finances, and so much more.

  


**Position Summary**

The Temporary Program Analyst will support the execution of outreach, recruitment, application, and selection processes of the Goldman Sachs One Million Black Women*:* *Black in Business* program. The Analyst will focus on this program, working closely with a small program team to support key deliverables, but may also support the Goldman Sachs *10,000 Small Businesses* (10KSB) program in the same capacity as necessary. The Analyst will report to the Manager of BiB on work deliverables and project planning matters.

  


Core responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  


* Support the BiB and 10KSB teams in coordinating partnership-based outreach, recruitment, application, and selection with various program partners and internal team members
* Maintain BiB program systems and applicant trackers to track the application progress for hundreds of applicants throughout the recruitment process
* Assist the BiB team in preparation for business owner interviews, which includes creating interview schedules and application packages for each interview day
* Directly communicate with program applicants via phone, email, and text as necessary to follow up on incomplete applications, interview scheduling, and managing interview re-schedules
* Assist in the evaluation and selection process for program applicants as a supporting member of the National Selection Committee, which includes managing Zoom technology for interview days and entering interview notes and outcomes into final program reports and trackers

  
**Qualifications Required:**The successful candidate is a highly organized self-starter with solid potential for growth and has up to two years of work experience. The newest addition to our team is inspired by the work that we do at ICIC and passionate about supporting small businesses in need of educational resources to help them grow. The ideal candidate will have:

  


* A Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in any relevant field or discipline OR up to two years of relevant work experience
* Finely-tuned analytical, written, and communication skills with an ability to problem solve and mitigate challenges
* Experience managing multiple tasks to completion simultaneously
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
* A team player inclination: collaborative, solutions-oriented, and excited to work with other team members and departments
* Flexibility with changing priorities and deadlines
* Experience building and maintaining relationships

  


We are looking for a good-humored and socially conscious individual who feels passionate about supporting the mission and work of our organization and is prepared to be a leader in their daily work. Individuals are encouraged to work both autonomously and collaboratively to contribute to the professional development of the team. You should be motivated by assisting in providing solutions. We work in a fast-paced environment. At ICIC, we believe in providing all the tools and resources needed to be high performers.

  


This position is a temporary full-time role, planned to start in mid to late April, with a duration of 12 weeks. It is a remote work opportunity, but please note that ICIC is currently only able to employ individuals in the following states: AR, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, KY, MA, MD, MI, NJ, NY, OR, PA, TX, and VA.

  


ICIC is dedicated to the goal of building a culturally diverse and inclusive organization. We are an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, are based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

**Preferred*** 2-3+ years project management experience, agile and lean certifications a plus
* Experience with Salesforce and related systems; Workday, Degreed, and ADP

title: Lending/Retail Business Analyst
description:
Salary:   
**POSITION SUMMARY**

The Business Analyst will be the representative of business units in driving and defining system and process needs of assigned business units. Reporting to the AVP, Data Analytics and Program Support and with guidance from Senior Management Team, the role will leverage a team-based approach methodology with the business unit, IT, project management, and management colleagues; ensure the finished product provides a simple, intuitive, and effective user experience that achieves business aims and draw upon leadership’s key insights to offer responsive solutions to address business challenges. Key tasks include performing ongoing analysis to determine requirements for the design, testing, and implementation of business unit systems; playing a key role in conducting business and data analysis for these systems and implementing new business policies/procedures; performing application testing and developing training curriculum/documentation and providing high-level support. 

 

This role will also support assigned business units.

 

The position is ideal for a versatile, problem-solving business analyst who thrives when developing user-centered designed solutions and enjoys eliciting stakeholder needs and providing solutions.

 

**PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

 

* Solicit, understand, and document stakeholder business requirements, processes, and workflows; document requirements and process flows; and document reporting needs and work with the business to document test cases and outcomes of test functionality.
* Responsibilities include working with content experts in business units to understand business processes and needs; work with all resources to designing, re-engineering, and maintaining business unit resources and solutions to meet those needs; document and help prioritize automation needs.
* Work with business units to improve business results and operational effectiveness; identifying issues, analyzing data/information, and recommending changes; collaborating with the IT, Project Management, and other impacted business units to prioritize and address needs.
* Assist project teams to identify the solution that meets the defined requirements.
* Create documentation: functional requirements; process analysis; gap analysis; status reports; meeting notes; design specifications; and test plans.
* Track and monitor the progress of project activities; meeting notes, report status, risks, issues; coordinates next steps and track project deliverables.
* Work in partnerships with users to develop practitioner’s knowledge of the applications, working with Learning and Development in creating and updating system documentation.
* Maintain technical proficiency in project management software, enterprise systems and financials technology solutions.
* Research and present ideas/tools to users/stakeholders; maintaining up to-date knowledge of application best practices, methods, and techniques; and other duties as needed.
* Work with the business units to complete annual Vendor Management Assessments, Business Continuity Plan Reviews, business unit procedure reviews, and Business Continuity Training.
* May perform other duties as assigned.

  


**SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS**

  


* Experience and proven track record with managing projects, understanding business/system requirements
* Experience in working with and leading teams
* Must have effective problem solving, reasoning, and requirement writing skills.
* Excellent knowledge of multiple business units’ roles and needs in the Credit Union sector,
* Proficient computer skills (Microsoft Word, Excel, and Power Point).
* Professional demeanor and interaction with all customers (internal and external).
* Effective interpersonal and communications (written and verbal) skills.
* Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment as well as independently.
* Ability to pay attention to detail while handling a high volume of work with multiple interruptions.
* Effective project management skills and the ability to proactively problem solve.
* Any equivalent combination of education, experience, and training that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
* Professional appearance, proper attendance, and punctuality.

  


 

**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE** REQUIREMENTS

 

* Bachelor’s degree in a related field required; Minimum 5 years relevant experience required.
* 3+ yrs experience with Project and Program Management and Analysis; 5+ preferred
* 3+ years database management and marketing research experience required; 5+ preferred
* 5+ year in financial industry (working with MCIF) strongly preferred

title: Treasury and Payment Solutions Sales Analyst I
description:
HTLF is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.
HTLF is a diversified financial services company headquartered in Denver, Colorado. We deliver community banking at scale by powering our geographically diverse group of banks with technology, efficiency and strength — giving local decision-making the opportunity and insights to focus on customers and growth. Relationships have been the core of our company since its founding in 1981. We're deeply invested in the communities we serve, and that's why our clients choose us as their banking partners.
What's different about a career at HTLF? We believe our employees and their diverse backgrounds, perspectives and skills are our greatest assets. We wouldn't be HTLF without the people with whom we surround ourselves and empower to enrich the lives of our customers, employees and communities. We're dedicated to making HTLF the best place to work – where your opinions are valued, your feedback and ideas are heard, and your opportunities for personal growth and professional development are endless.
The Treasury and Payment Solutions (TPS) Sales Analyst I is responsible for supporting Commercial Bankers, Treasury Management Officers (TMOs) and Sales Analysts (SAs) to create and analyze proposals, RFPs and sales presentations for Treasury products. This position assists in gathering and verifying correct documentation for new TM sales. Additionally, this role focuses on identifying referral opportunities for TMOs while providing a high level of sales support to the TM sales team.  

Primary Responsibilities* Treasury and Payment Solutions Sales Support:
* Develops proformas, proposals and customer profitability analysis for Treasury. Coordinates proposal responses and works across business lines to gather response information (if needed)
* Understands and communicates the sales culture and vision within each member bank
* Creates comprehensive Relationship Reviews including account structure, industry updates, and product/service recommendations for existing TM clients.
* Prepares pre-call planning prep and materials for TPS client and prospect meetings.
* Serves as the designated backup to the SA team
* Sales Management Support:
* Identifies referral opportunities in SalesForce
* Coordinates and prepares materials for internal meetings
* Maintains a thorough knowledge of all applicable compliance laws and regulations including but not limited to BSA/AML/OFAC/CRA, consumer compliance, etc.
* Completes annual E-Learning Plan and Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) training as assigned and keeps up-to-date knowledge of BSA as it relates to the job function.

  

Secondary Responsibilities* Performs other duties as assigned.


Management Responsibilities* This job has no management responsibilities.

  

Qualifications* Bachelors Business Administration/Management, Finance- Preferred
* 1-3 years related experience, preferably with related experience in sales, sales support and commercial banking
* Basic knowledge of cash management products, commercial card products, principles and practices
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite to include: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
* Interpersonal and customer service skills
* Proficiency in organizing and prioritizing work to meet deadlines, with the ability to adapt within a changing environment
* Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness


Scheduled Weekly Hours:
40

Full time
The targeted salary for this role is:
$62,127.00 - $80,765.00*You may also be offered incentive compensation, and benefits. Benefits may include Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), Health Savings Account, Paid Time Off. title: Chief CQI and Compliance Officer
description:
*Chief Continuous Quality Improvement and Compliance Officer*

Full Time| Days  
Onsite hybrid

Pay begins at $129,000  
*\**Eligible for*Bilingual Pay Differential*

**All Faiths Children’s Advocacy Center (AFCAC)** is currently seeking a **Chief Continuous Quality and Improvement (CQI) and Compliance Officer** to join our team and help children and families thrive! **AFCAC** is the only Children’s Advocacy Center in Albuquerque, working as trusted advocates for children and families affected by trauma.

The ideal candidate will share **Our Mission**: *We are the trusted advocates for children and families affected by trauma.*

As we look ahead to 2024, we are on a transformative journey. Our center is taking immense pride in integrating the **Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinic (CCBHC)** model. This transition underscores our commitment to pioneering care within our community.

The **CCBHC model** extends beyond a framework—it embodies opportunity. It propels centers like ours to expand our care, identify and cater to individuals who frequently go unnoticed. Through innovative, evidence-based therapy and community partnerships, our mission is not only to bridge service gaps but to challenge and reduce health disparities.

By joining our team during this pivotal moment, you will:

* Be at the heart of a community-centric approach to mental health.
* Engage in evidence-based interventions, advocating for holistic care and collaboration.
* Play a crucial role in a team that is dedicated to reshaping care and ensuring a lasting, positive imprint on our community’s well-being.

The Chief CQI Officer will carry a pivotal role in this transformation, ensuring state-of-the art data collection, evaluation, and outcomes measures. The position is a member of the agency’s leadership team and as such, helps craft initiatives at the strategic level.

**Are you ready to be part of a transformative movement?**

**Application Process:**

To be considered for this position, please complete the application questions, upload a cover letter along with your resume.

**Required:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Public Health, Science, Business Administration or related field.
* Seven (7) years of related experience.
* Five (5) years supervisory experience in a quality/internal audit department.

**Preferred:**

* Master’s Degree in related field preferred.
* Lean and/or Six Sigma certification/experience preferred.
* CQI experience in behavioral healthcare environment preferred.
* Experience leading a CQI Team.
* Experience understanding IT as it pertains to EHR systems and data collection
* Able to speak on data validation and data outcomes.
* Able to model professionalism and leadership as a member of C-Level Leadership.

**What will I do as the Chief CQI/Compliance Officer with All Faith’s?**

**A job summary:**

The Chief Continuous Quality Improvement and Compliance (CQI) Officer is responsible for **creating, directing**, and **evaluating** projects and programs that advance All Faiths’ mission and vision, and CQI initiatives throughout the agency with special focus on clinical care, clinical quality and performance measures, and client satisfaction.

The Chief CQI Officer **leads** the CQI team. Under the Chief CQI’s leadership, the CQI team drives and influences the agency’s **quality, client safety and risk management** programs with an emphasis on client safety, harm reduction, and quality and process improvement.

The Chief CQI Officer **oversees** and **coordinates** all agency efforts to monitor and maintain compliance with all regulatory, state, federal government, and accreditation standards.

The Chief CQI Officer fulfills the role of the **HIPAA Privacy and Security Officer** for the agency. In collaboration with the CEO and the Leadership Team, the Chief CQI develops and implements the CQI strategy.

The Chief CQI Officer provides **leadership, direction**, and **administration** of the agency’s compliance, client safety and quality program, risk management, and regulatory oversight. **Advises** and **works collaboratively** with the Leadership Team, department directors, supervisors, and staff to enhance client care through continuous quality improvement methods with a focus on to overall client safety and systemic level outcomes.

The Chief CQI Officer **utilizes** health information technology, reporting tools, and data systems to support the activities of the clinical care team throughout the care of the client.

The Chief CQI Officer **drives** the implementation of the agency’s evidence-based strategy to improve service outcomes by leading measurement-based care (MBC) initiatives and routine data collection.

The Chief CQI Officer **ensures timely and accurate reporting of data** using a defined data collection tool.

The Chief CQI Officer ensures agency’s high performance in **regulatory compliance**.

The Chief CQI Officer **participates** and/or leads various CQI committees and ensures that organization wide CQI initiatives are current, focused and aligned with external regulations, and around improving operational and program efficiencies and effectiveness through audits and best practices.

The Chief CQI Officer **assists** in communicating the progress of quality improvement initiatives to All Faiths’ staff, Leadership Team, and Board.

The Chief CQI Officer ensuresthe **implementation and maintenance** of the established standards placed on the agency by governing bodies, which may include organizations such as NCA, and laws such as HIPAA.

The Chief CQI Officer **ensures** established standards are current, and processes are in place to monitor/audit these standards and collected data.

The Chief CQI Officer **provides leadership**for CQI related policy development; provides leadership and drives continuous process improvement pertaining to the organization’s core functions, evaluates, and makes recommendations regarding the impact that systems improvements have on the agency and the community served; researches and develops Program Management,

**What makes All Faith’s unique?**

At **All Faith’s Children’s Advocacy Center,** we work in a variety of mediums for the treatment of families, children and their caregivers who are struggling due to issues of divorce, homelessness, child abuse/neglect, family violence or other crises.

**The Children’s Safehouse** provides age-appropriate, legally defensible forensic interviews for children 2-18 years of age and developmentally disabled adults who have been the alleged victim of sexual or physical abuse, or who have witnessed a violent crime. *Family advocates* work closely with the alleged victim’s guardian to ensure that they are provided resources and follow-up care, such as medical attention, and therapy.

Our **Family Wellness** refers to a variety of services offered to children and their families to help them navigate the complex system of supports needed on the journey to healing and recovery.

**All Faiths Adoption Services** works to help children find permanent, loving, and safe homes within a family. We work with birth families to provide comprehensive pregnancy options counseling and with prospective adoptive families for adoptions within New Mexico and between states.

**The New Mexico FIESTA Project** focuses on creating a support system for adoptive families through networking events, trainings, and connections to resources.

The **Home Visiting Program** contracts with the **New Mexico Children, Youth & Families Department (CYFD**) to provide detailed assessments and recommendations for licensure for both prospective foster families and CYFD adoptive families throughout the state of New Mexico.

**Job Description Essential Functions:**

1. In collaboration with the CEO and the Leadership Team, builds, directs, manages, and ensures implementation and effectiveness of the agency’s CQI plan.  
2. Champions agency’s continuous quality improvement efforts and deficit-reduction initiatives to establish an effective health care system with responsibility for:  
3. Continuous Quality Improvement planning and implementation. Development and execution of the annual Quality Plan.  
4. Population health initiatives to support clinical care teams.  
5. Performance on various third-party (e.g., MCOs, grantors) and internal clinical quality metrics in collaboration with Leadership Team members, Department Directors as well as other managers, supervisors, and staff.  
6. Risk Management initiatives including strategic oversight of incident and client grievance report and response activities using root cause analysis, failure mode effects analysis, and facilitation of process, planning, implementation, and evaluation of effectiveness of process changes, among other techniques.  
7. Training of CQI plans and processes to agency staff.  
8. Development and implementation of Lean/Six Sigma trainings for new and existing staff.  
9. Supervision of Continuous Quality Improvement and Compliance Department staff.  
10. Understanding of CCBHC requirements and implementation of supporting projects.  
11. Collaborates with and guides clinical team and non-clinical team to establish CQI processes throughout the agency.  
12. Drives the development, implementation and maintenance of timely outcome tracking, program evaluation activities and systemic procedures.  
13. Participates in development and maintenance of client file management and clinical documentation by all service providers.  
14. Drives the development, implementation, and maintenance of all data systems throughout agency operations to standardize the tracking of client and outcome data that will aid in compliance, performance-based budgeting strategies and fiscal matters, such as accounts receivable and grant reporting.  
15. Employs Plan-Do-Study-Act cycle (PDSAs) and other tests of change to design and disseminate optimal workflows, in collaboration with associated teams.  
16. Ensures agency’s HIPAA compliance and updates to appropriate internal procedures regarding HIPAA and confidentiality are current. The Director, in conjunction with the HR department, investigates all potential HIPAA breaches and reports them to the appropriate parties timely.  
17. Ensures agency’s cyber security compliance and manages relationship with external vendor for cyber security.  
18. Responsible for ensuring the completion of the annual HIPAA risk assessment.  
19. Provides agency oversight of data tracking and compliance programs and well as tracking sheets (e.g. The Grid) and communicates upcoming deadlines to leadership minimally on a monthly basis.  
20. Responsible to lend administrative support and provide recommendations to the agency’s Audit and Compliance Committee and reports outcome data to this committee as well as the Board.  
21. Monitors the agency’s Grievance reporting lines and ensures timely investigation, follow-up and reports of these matters.  
22. Completes special projects as requested by the CEO and the Leadership Team.  
23. Ensures that CQI remains current and in compliance with NCA and any other regulatory or credentialing body. Spearheads the project management of the NCA reaccreditation project and other accreditation and compliance tasks.  
24. Trains, mentors, and guides staff identified in implementing CQI processes. Initiates updates to the agency CQI plan as deemed appropriate by accreditation, licensing, policy or best practices.  
25. Ensures all new hire are training in CQI process, policies, and workflows.  
26. Prepares and presents regular reports to CEO and other committees as needed.  
27. Provides consistent data validation and data outcomes to C-Level leadership.  
28. Able to model professionalism and leadership as a member of C-Level Leadership.  
29. Other duties as assigned

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities preferred to perform:**

1) The position requires a high degree of autonomy and expertise in analyzing, interpreting, and investigating causes for and variation in process improvement and workflows that result in error or critical events facilitating improvements at the agency.  
2) Excellent communication skills with ability to interact effectively with all stakeholders.  
3) Ability to systematically gather information from a variety of sources, analyze information, identify implications of data, draw appropriate conclusions, generate viable alternative solutions to a question or problem and evaluate the consequences of choosing each alternative.  
4) Knowledge of standards of behavioral health care and professional care established by accrediting and federal, state agencies.  
5) Working knowledge of behavioral health operations, Medicaid, and state requirements.  
6) Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail and accuracy with report writing functions to summarize various data and coordination of continuous quality improvement across all programs and among all stakeholders.  
7) Demonstrates knowledge of applicable clinical principles and practices.  
8) Demonstrates knowledge and use of clinical policies and procedures and applicable federal and state regulations.  
9) Applies technical procedure skills efficiently and effectively.  
10) Demonstrates ability to effectively use Electronic Health Records (EHR).  
11) Demonstrates ownership, initiative, attention to detail and follow-through.  
12) Verbal and written communication is clear, concise, accurate, timely, and respectful.  
13) Skilled communicator and adept at business analysis and project implementation.  
14) Uses critical thinking to analyze situations, make timely decisions, and take appropriate actions.  
15) Demonstrates good judgement in making decisions.  
16) Resolves issues timely and seeks assistance as needed.  
17) Must have proven knowledge and experience with the latest quality methodologies.  
18) Ability to persist with a problem area or concern and seek an effective solution by reviewing the issue with other staff to achieve an integrated systems solution.  
19) Proficiency or mastery with a variety of computer software, including Microsoft products such as Windows, Excel and Access.  
20) Awareness of, and sensitivity to, cultural and socio-economic characteristics of individuals and families.

**All Faith’s Children’s Advocacy Center cares for our Staff by offering many competitive and generous benefits and perks including:**

* Health, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance
* Flexible Spending (FSA)
* 401(k) retirement plan with employer matched savings
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* PTO, 9 Paid Holidays and 2 Paid Wellness Holidays
* Opportunity to make a positive impact on individuals & the community.

*All Faiths Children’s Advocacy Center (AFCAC) is committed to providing an equal opportunity in our employment practices to all qualified applicants and employees, without regard to race, age, national origin, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, ancestry, familial status, citizenship, national origin, physical/mental disability (or perceived disability), serious medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in accordance with applicable state and federal law. All Faiths Children’s Advocacy Center (AFCAC) conforms to the spirit as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations.*

**Learn more about us at: www.allfaiths.org**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $129,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you able to utilize health information technology, reporting tools, and data systems to support the activities of the clinical care team throughout the care of the client?
* How would you describe your leadership style?
* Tell us about a time where you implemented evidence based strategies?
* Tell us about how you have worked with leaders across the organization?
* Explain how you have ensured the implementation and maintenance of established standards placed on past agencies by governing bodies, such as HIPAA and NCA? What processes did you put in place?
* This application form is intended for use in evaluating your qualifications for employment. This is not an employment contract.

Answer all questions completely & accurately. False or misleading statements during the application, interview or pre-employment process whether  
contained on this form or not will be grounds for terminating the application process or, if discovered after employment, terminating employment.   
Do you attest that all information on this application, to your knowledge, is to be true?

Experience:

* Supervisory: 5 years (Required)
* leading a CQI team: 7 years (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Albuquerque, NM 87112

title: Sr Clinical Quality Analyst - Remote in New Mexico
description:
At UnitedHealthcare, we’re simplifying the health care experience, creating healthier communities and removing barriers to quality care. The work you do here impacts the lives of millions of people for the better. Come build the health care system of tomorrow, making it more responsive, affordable and equitable. Ready to make a difference? Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**



Engagement with providers and community resources will be very important. Key metrics and measures will be developed to assess member health in aggregate. In partnership with other members of the clinical team, a component of the role will include provider education and monitoring of quality improvement programs. This includes analysis and review of health outcomes at the provider and aggregated patient-level monitoring, measuring and reporting on key metrics meeting quality standards, state contractual requirements, , and pay for performance initiatives. This position will focus on planning and implementing initiatives that are needed and do so in accordance with State, CMS, NCQA, and/or other requirements as applicable.

  



This position is full - time (40 hours / week) Monday - Friday. Employees are required to have flexibility to work any of our 8 - hour shift schedules during our normal business hours of 8am to 5pm. It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime. This position is a remote - based position with a home - based office.


If you are located within New Mexico, you will have the flexibility to work remotely\* as you take on some tough challenges.



**Primary Responsibilities:**

  

* Assesses trends in population/quality measures and identifying opportunities for quality improvement.
* Support accurate and timely issue resolution and data reporting and provide overall Prospective customer support
* Support the monitoring and tracking of custom measure / deliverable development with our external vendor and internal partners
* Collaborate with applicable internal stakeholders to obtain in-depth information / data about internal / external customer requirements for technology supporting Quality Optimization and Insights
* Support research to help establish current and emerging customer / market needs and trends (e.g., competitor technology analysis)
* Gather and document requirements from the client / business while focused on process improvement, workflow, benchmarking and/or evaluation of business processes and/or configuration
* Gather / analyze / validate applicable data from internal and external sources (e.g., clients, prospects, potential customers) to identify customer / market characteristics, needs, and problems (e.g., market opportunities, financials, technology trends, user preferences industry / regulatory / legal standards, internal product trends)
* Develop an understanding of the competitive quality metrics technology landscape (e.g., strengths, weaknesses, gaps, product portfolios, win / loss analysis)
* Document / communicate market characteristics and needs to applicable stakeholders (e.g., product management)
* Serves as a team support resource on complex and / or critical issues
* Reviews work performed by others to ensure data accuracy
* May support functional or segment teams or projects
* Provides explanations and information to others on complex issues
* Motivates and inspires other team members
* Works with minimal guidance; seeks guidance on only the most complex tasks
* Support the development of ad-hoc reports

  

  

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**

  

* 3+ years clinical or healthcare experience
* Intermediate software applications skills that include, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint
* A dedicated work area established that is separated from other living areas and provides information privacy
* Must currently reside in New Mexico
* Ability to travel locally up to 25% of the time
* Ability to review data and make clinical interventions and consult others
  


**Preferred Qualifications:**

  

* Current unrestricted Registered Nurse (RN) licensure in the state of NM or Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW)
* CPHQ Certification
* Systems Analyst or Business Analyst experience
* Experience working in Medicaid and/or Medicare
* Knowledge of one or more of: clinical standards of care, preventive health standards, HEDIS, NCQA, governing and regulatory agency requirements, and the managed care industry
* Background in Managed Care


* All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy

  

*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*  

  

*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*  

  

*UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*

title: Safety Subject Matter Expert and Business Analyst
description:
Safety Subject Matter Expert and Business Analyst**The Opportunity:**  

You know that true progress is made at the intersection of business and tech, and as an IT business analyst, you’re highly skilled in both. Here, you’ll have the chance to work with an agile team as they develop digital products to support your clients’ most pressing missions. We’re looking for someone like you to propel business analytics and processes forward, as well as delve into technology trends to deliver user-friendly client experiences.


As an expert in defense missions, your unique background inspires you to think bigger, push further, and ask questions others don’t. We need your extensive industry knowledge and advisory skills to solve some of our clients’ most complex problems—and find solutions that keep our nation safe.


As an IT business analyst, you’ll develop leading-edge application products. Partnering with your team of developers, testers, business analysts and leading safety professionals, you’ll identify clients’ business needs, gather user requirements, and develop user stories and prototypes. You’ll understand the overall direction and nuanced user needs clearly, and you’ll lead your team as they fulfill these needs by creating deployable features. Together, you’ll deliver high value safety products to military professionals and personnel.


Work with us to make an impact by keeping the warfighter safe and protect military readiness.  

  

Join us. The world can’t wait

**You Have:**

* 4+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst or a Software Requirements Analyst in the software industry
* 3+ years of experience in working with DOD safety initiatives and regulations
* Experience with the at least one of the DoD services, including Air Force, Navy, and Army
* Knowledge of the process of software requirements gathering and documentation
* Knowledge of the process of software requirements gathering and documentation
* Ability to show technical expertise and comprehension of software and web application products
* Ability to obtain a security clearance
* Bachelor's degree

**Nice If You Have:**

* Experience as an aviator or aviation support crew
* Knowledge of the Defense Safety Program Management
* Ability to work remotely
* Secret clearance

**Clearance:**  

Applicants selected may be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

**Create Your Career:**

 **Grow With Us**  

Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

**A Place Where You Belong**  

Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.

**Support Your Well-Being**  

Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.

**Your Candidate Journey**  

At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

**Compensation**


At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.


Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $81,800.00 to $186,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.**Work Model**  

Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

* If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
* If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

**EEO Commitment**


We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

title: Asset Protection Analyst - Operations Center (M
description:
**About Gap Inc.**
------------------


Our brands bridge the gaps we see in the world. Old Navy democratizes style to ensure everyone has access to quality fashion at every price point. Athleta unleashes the potential of every woman, regardless of body size, age or ethnicity. Banana Republic believes in sustainable luxury for all. And Gap inspires the world to bring individuality to modern, responsibly made essentials.


This simple idea—that we all deserve to belong, and on our own terms—is core to who we are as a company and how we make decisions. Our teamis made up of thousands of people across the globe who take risks, think big, and do good for our customers, communities, and the planet. Ready to learn fast, create with audacity and lead boldly? Join our team.

**About the Role**
------------------


The Associate Analyst, Asset Protection Service Center (APSC) plays a critical role to Gap Inc.’s Asset Protection strategy, “We enable purpose-led, billion-dollar businesses by protecting People, Assets, and Brands”. You will contribute to the Global Security & AP Services “Center of Excellence” by providing capabilities with a “Try Fast, Learn Fast, Think Big mentality”. You will perform as a subject matter expert by leveraging optimized resources targeted to identify risk and deploy efforts to increase speed and efficiency. The APSC Associate Analysts will participate in a data-lead operation that enables the APSC to deploy better data management to provide forecasting, intelligence and enhanced visibility to crucial data that show potential risk or impact to Gap Inc. assets.
  

  

The Asset Protection Service Center (APSC), located at the Corporate Shared Services Center (CSSC) in Albuquerque, NM, serves as the focal point for the monitoring, risk analysis and business continuity reporting intake for Gap Inc. Under the direction of the Manager, Asset Protection Service Center and the Associate Manager, Asset Protection Service Center, APSC Associate Analyst executes the various core functions of the APSC that includes, but not limited to; Risk Event Identification/Escalation, Risk  

Intelligence Analysis, Emergency & Crisis Response, Supply Chain Security, and Physical Security. APSC Associate Analysts act as business partners who work closely with teams across the Asset Protection organization and the wider business, serving as a key business partner that enables our  

businesses.

**What You'll Do**
------------------

* Perform daily functions of the APSC, including, but are not limited to: risk intelligence, incident/crisis response, emergency notification, supply chain resiliency, travel security, and physical security
* Participate in the intelligence function by preparing and disseminating global risk intelligence products aimed at identifying and mitigating business risks
* Conduct regular monitoring of open-source intelligence, social media platforms, and internal specific intelligence gathering tools for known and potential threats to employees, company assets and reputation
* Monitor geopolitical events that may impact executive travel, company events, and/or operations, and provide periodic and timely reporting
* Manage and handle situations of a sensitive nature and maintain company’s confidentiality and information security practices (medical record, personnel issues, investigations, public relations incidents, emergency personnel contact information, etc.)
* Manage and lead response efforts to life safety incidents (medical, safety, natural disasters, etc.) and coordinate response of security officers, ERT, facilities, police, fire and EMS personnel as required
* Responsible for answering routine and emergency calls, monitoring alarms and video equipment including fire alarms, door alarms, and duress alarms and provides general assistance to employees, vendors and guests
* Maintain various records of communications and events, including operational logs, daily shift checklists, handover reports, monthly safety and security audits checklists and incident reports

**COMPETECIES:**

* Must be competent and literate with computers and technology systems and platforms
* Must have ability to communicate both written and orally, through superior communication skills
* Ability to multitask in a fast paced, high-pressure work environment and make sound decisions
* Ability to analyze and think critically, sometimes under ambiguous circumstances
* Strong understanding and experience with video surveillance and physical access control systems
* Strong decision-making ability during both crisis and non-crisis situations
* Ability to think through problems for logical solutions, and remain calm and professional under stress
* Ability to analyze problems, identify causes, and implement results oriented solutions
* Excellent organizational and time management ability
* A professional demeanor, along with excellent customer service skills
* Ability to work independently while also being a team player

**Who You Are**
---------------

* Must successfully complete and pass the “CritiCall” computer-based testing module. CritiCall is used to measure skills that are vital as a APSC Associate Analyst, including, but not limted to: multitasking, prioritization, map-reading, memory recall, comprehension, data-entry and decision making
* Experience in working with risk intelligence monitoring and mass notification tools and platofrms (Everbridge, Dataminr, ISOS experience a plus)
* 1-3 years of Security Operations Center or similar customer call center experience preferred.
* Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite and Windows OS
* Have a strong knowledge of physical security, information security and emergency operations, preferably in a corporate environment
* Access Control/Alarm Monitoring systems experience (C-CURE experience a plus)
* Flexibility to work various shifts if needed, including weekends and holidays
* Experience in working with video surveillance, physical access control, incident management and risk intelligence monitoring tools and systems
* Possess a solid employment history demonstrating reliability and dependability
* Must pass a pre-employment background check and drug screening

**Benefits at Gap Inc.**
------------------------


* Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.
* One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.\*
* Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.\*
* Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.\*
* Employee stock purchase plan.\*
* Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.\*
* See more of the benefits we offer.
* *For eligible employees*


Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. In 2022, we were recognized by Forbes as one of the World's Best Employers and one of the Best Employers for Diversity.
