title: Business Systems Analyst (Epicor 10)
description:
Applied Composites (AC) is seeking an **Business Systems** **Analyst,** with manufacturing backgroundthat provides expertise in planning and designing business Information Systems to improve the workflow, production, and efficiency of the company’s functional systems. Acts as a liaison between the development group and business units in the development and implementation of new systems and enhancement of existing ones.**About AC:** Come and join the Applied Composites team. We are a leading provider of complex composite components, assemblies, engineering, and tooling to the aerospace, defense, and space system markets. Our employees are treated with respect and given the support, knowledge, and resources they need to thrive. If you are looking for a company that values and develops its employees while offering engaging work, Applied Composites may be the place for you.

**Job Accountabilities:**

* Conducts technical business analysis to identify initiatives that will allow the business to meet its objectives
* Develop and perform maintenance of new and existing test plans in the various application systems that the IT department maintains, such as Epicor ERP and intranet reports (using SSRS)
* Interprets business needs and translates them into application and operational requirements.
* Documents, coordinates, and plans the modifications or enhancements to software products
* Acts as the liaison between the business units, technology teams, and support teams
* Collaborates with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs
* Proactively communicates and collaborates to analyze information needs and functional requirements
* Plans, promotes, and organizes internal training activities related to new product modifications or enhancements
* Other responsibilities as assigned

**Job Specifications:  
  
Education:** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field. Or a High a School Diploma/GED, plus four (4) years of relevant experience and appropriate certifications may be substituted for meeting the educational requirements only.

**Years’ Experience:** Requires three (3) years of relevant experience and previous experience in developing and maintaining various analysis and reporting tools. Significant work experience in the configuration and or customization of ERP systems. Administration of Windows 10+ workstations and Windows 2012+ Servers, **Epicor 10 experience highly preferred**.

**Skills:**

* Possesses advanced analytical skills and strong mathematical aptitude to proactively identify and solve problems
* Strong understanding and working knowledge of the principles and practices associated with SQL databases, and queries and reports developed from those databases.
* Ability to apply creative thinking in the use of management systems and development of business processes
* Possesses project management and leadership skills, including the ability to gather clear business requirements
* Excellent interpersonal, written, oral communication, presentation, and facilitator skills with the ability to negotiate, influence and interact effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization exercising sensitivity to the audience
* Possesses a positive professional image and a high level of ethical behavior in exercising consistent judgment, discretion, and confidentiality in all interactions and matters of significance
* Possesses excellent judgment, critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills with the ability to identify and resolve complex issues in a timely manner
* Ability to work independently and negotiate and set priorities required
* Ability to work efficiently under conditions of multiple and/or completing projects/deadlines prioritizing/reprioritizing as needed to meet departmental and/or business commitments and objectives
* Possesses a high degree of personal accountability

**Benefits:**  
At Applied Composites, we recognize how important your career and benefits are to you and your family. We offer a full suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability coverage, accident insurance, critical illness insurance, basic and supplemental life insurance, employee assistance plan, retirement savings and matching, tuition reimbursement and other developmental opportunities. We are committed to supporting the way you live and work.

*AC is an Equal Opportunity Employer Veterans/Disabled - Affirmative Action Employer.*

*This position requires the use of information which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee.*

title: Retail Operations Analyst, Reality Labs
description:
Meta is looking for a Reality Labs (RL) Retail Operations Analyst. This person will be responsible for planning, budgeting, communicating, building, maintaining, and reporting on all aspects as it relates to Channel Experiences Operations programs across all of our existing and future partners. There will be a required financial focus that this role will require. This role plays an instrumental part in contributing to the RL vision for our global customers to find, learn and experience RL products through physical retail. It is beneficial to have experience with retail and marketing operations, data architecture and analysis, dashboarding/visualization of data, and budget management.The candidate must be able to plan, execute, and evaluate complex projects where analysis of situations and decision making requires an evaluation of unclear and unknown factors. Building relationships to influence leadership to align on direction for broad projects spanning across several organizations is a critical capability. The primary role of the RL Retail Operations Analyst is to ensure that everything data, budget and records related is maintained, housed, and managed with accuracy, accessibility and visualization (dashboards) in mind. In addition, mastery and maintenance of the budget is critical to the operations. Being able to proactively identify problems and assess problems when presented to create and implement a solution. The role is impact, accuracy and organization oriented with the goal of defining functional strategy and setting goals across orgs. The RL Retail Operations Analyst must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment with constant change executing multiple projects, while working collaboratively and communicating clearly across teams such as channel marketing, finance, operations, sales, analytics, and external vendors.  

  

  

### **Retail Operations Analyst, Reality Labs Responsibilities:**

* Build processes for the org based on business needs and requirements presented from the org.
* Manage/Maintain/Visualize large volumes of data from multiple sources globally.
* Partner closely with Channel Marketing Managers, Strategic Account Managers, 3rd party labor partners, Analytics and Channel Services team members on a regular basis to run the business with the utmost efficiency and accuracy.
* Act as liaison between global 3rd party labor partners, channel marketing managers and channel services for data management.
* Assess and make calculated decisions to maximize ROI and efficiency by leveraging partnerships with the internal analytics team.
* Build highly detailed analysis recommendations for a variety of RL initiatives across all product lines.
* Create, maintain, and enforce processes for all operations globally in store and with 3rd party labor partners.
* Review instructions and execution for multiple projects simultaneously with a keen eye for detail.
* Manage the reporting of the results of the field execution to internal stakeholders via internal dashboards.
* Process all invoices and work closely with the Global Field Merchandising Manager to ensure all 3rd party labor projects are on budget and tracked accordingly.
* Develop and launch KPI management tools and dashboard by managing engineering resources.
* Partner with Finance and the Center of Excellence on budget forecast and management.

  

  

  

### **Minimum Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of professional experience in retail, finance, channel marketing analytics or relevant experience.
* Budget and fiscal management experience.
* Experience understanding the unique operating conditions within retailers domestically and globally and how that impacts the planning and executing of the initiatives for all product lines.
* Experience sharing program/project updates across broad teams and organizations - transparency is key within the Meta culture.
* Experience Creating/Managing Data Visualization
* Extremely high level of accuracy and attention to detail with the experience to track and articulate the intricacies of reporting results for project execution.
* Experience managing relationships with cross-functional stakeholders and external vendors.

  

  

  

### **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Consumer Electronics experience.
* Experience with Tableau, PowerBi, Alteryx, Hive and other data visualization and customization tools.
* Tableau Certified Data Analyst preferred
* Microsoft and Google Suite expert proficiency
* Familiarity with retail partners and their guidelines / processes.
* Experience within a brand managing analysis and budgets.
* Experience in reporting on large-scale launches and programs.
* Experience in working in a highly cross-functional setting.
* Experience translating complex engineering and data related items to make them understandable by the lowest common denominator.
* Data Modeling and Analysis
* Familiarity working with SAP or Oracle financial systems datasets
* Understanding of SQL subqueries, statements, join types, window functions, common table expressions

  

  

  

### **About Meta:**


Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.  

  

  

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.
  

  

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

title: TikTok Shop - Moderation Business Analyst
description:
Responsibilities
  
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.
  
  

Why Join Us
  
  

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
  
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
  
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
  
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
  
  

Join us.
  
  

Global E-commerce's Governance and Experience (GNE) is a global team striving to achieve full satisfaction from customers, promoting a sustainable and risk-free sales environment, and providing the perfect purchase experience. Service and Moderation Team (SMT) is part of the GNE organization. Our mission is to deliver trustworthy and excellent service experiences for every user of TikTok Shop. SMT is looking for a Moderation Business Analyst to be responsible for building the metrics reporting system and help to drive business reviews and decision making. This position will provide key analytical, reporting, forecasting support for the group and will be responsible for developing reporting and variance analysis regarding weekly/monthly/bi-monthly statistics, provide support & recommendations regarding performance.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Support in overall data requirements of e-commerce moderation, especially for quality control.
* Structure and design core index; build and maintain data dashboard; monitor core index data abnormalities.
* Identify potential operational requirements and opportunities for quality improvement through data analysis.
* Adapt business analysis to the specific operational research questions and/or build up certain models by using a range of data sources and research methodologies.
* Co-operate with QA leaders closely, take any kind of Data-analysis requests and complete within deadlines.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams to build up insights and provide data analysis & business review reports or any other reports as required.
* Follow up with Quality Assurance operations, supporting data analysis and providing optimization suggestions.
* Participate from a BA's perspective to provide input on different projects.


Qualifications
  
  

**Minimum Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree in a business field with a focus on quantitative or research methods.
* Fluency in Spanish is required for this role.
* 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
* Proficient in Python and SQL to conduct statistical modeling or data analysis.
* Strong multitasking and time management skills.


**Preferred Qualifications:**  

* Graduate degrees in science, mathematics, computer, digital marketing or survey-based research methods.
* Global business experience or analytical experience.
* Ability to lead a small project team to support Moderation business.
* Ability to pick up domain knowledge in new areas quickly.
* Familiar with the policy and moderation landscape.


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
  
  

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at https://shorturl.at/cdpT2
  
Job Information
  
The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $88920 - $152000 annually.
  
  

​
  
  

Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.
  
  

​
  
  

Our company benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support our employees to give their best in both work and life. We offer the following benefits to eligible employees:
  
  

​
  
  

We cover 100% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, approximately 75% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account(HSA) with a company match. As well as Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life and AD&D insurance plans. In addition to Flexible Spending Account(FSA) Options like Health Care, Limited Purpose and Dependent Care.
  
  

​
  
  

**Our time off and leave plans are:** 10 paid holidays per year plus 17 days of Paid Personal Time Off (PPTO) (prorated upon hire and increased by tenure) and 10 paid sick days per year as well as 12 weeks of paid Parental leave and 8 weeks of paid Supplemental Disability.
  
  

​
  
  

We also provide generous benefits like mental and emotional health benefits through our EAP and Lyra. A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements. The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Join Our Team: Do Meaningful Work and Improve People’s Lives
Our purpose, to improve customers’ lives by making healthcare work better, is far from ordinary. And so are our employees. Working at Premera means you have the opportunity to drive real change by transforming healthcare.  

To better serve our customers, we’re creating a culture that promotes employee growth, collaborative innovation, and inspired leadership. We are committed to creating an environment where employees can do their best work and where best-in-class talent comes, stays, and thrives! As a result of these efforts we are proud to share that Forbes ranked Premera among America’s 2023 Best Midsize Employers and America's 2023 Best Employers By State.
Learn how Premera supports our members, customers and the communities that we serve through our Healthsource blog: https://healthsource.premera.com.
As a Financial Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the activities of the Financial Planning & Analysis team. We are a strong team and looking to grow even stronger by adding a financial analyst to handle and improve some of our “easier” functions. But don’t worry, you won’t be stuck doing the same thing forever because there is much to learn and room to grow.
What you will do*:** Financial Data and Analysis You will be perfect for this job if you have strong technical skills, particularly in Excel, and have experience in, or would like to learn to work with, our three major software programs:
	+ Maintain, expand, and improve financial reporting in Tableau
	+ Understand and extract data from our ERP, Workday
	+ Work with Adaptive, our company-wide administrative cost budgeting tool

* Use your creativity to share your analysis with both financial and non-financial users. You should have a knack for creating reports that are “just right”: just the right amount of information, presented in a manner easy to understand by the intended audience
* Ad Hoc Reporting and Analysis There is a lot of opportunity here. We have more data in this place than there are stars in the universe and lots of curious minds that want to understand it to make better business decisions. We need someone resourceful, can learn from others, and can dive deep into the weeds but then pop back up to clearly communicate findings to the non-weed-eaters. And show excellence by anticipating the inevitable follow-up questions, rather than simply following requests by rote. If you can do all that you will be in good company!
* Written and Verbal Communication We don’t want your work to die in your cube. We need you to find ways to share the brilliance of your work. We can help, especially at first. But as you grow in the role, you will be most successful if you become adept at this yourself.
* Other duties as assigned No telling what they will be right now, but they will be fun!


What you will bring:* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, or a similar field of study, or four years’ work experience. (Required)
* One year of financial analysis, business analysis, accounting, or audit experience. (Required)
* Self-starter with a thirst for learning.
* Proficient and fast in Excel skills (Required)
* Experience in Tableau, Workday, and Adaptive, or similar programs (Preferred)


#LI-SS1
What we offer* Medical, vision and dental coverage
* Life and disability insurance
* Retirement programs (401K employer match and pension plan)
* Wellness incentives, onsite services, a discount program and more
* Tuition assistance for undergraduate and graduate degrees
* Generous Paid Time Off to reenergize
* Free parking


Equal employment opportunity/affirmative action:
Premera is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Premera seeks to attract and retain the most qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, gender or gender identity, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.
If you need an accommodation to apply online for positions at Premera, please contact Premera Human Resources via email at careers@premera.com or via phone at 425-918-4785.
Premera is hiring in the following states, with some limitations based on role or city: Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, California, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Maine, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Montana, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Mexico, North Carolina, Oklahoma, Oregon, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin*.*
The pay for this role will vary based on a range of factors including, but not limited to, a candidate’s geographic location, market conditions, and specific skills and experience.
National Salary Range:
$67,800.00 - $89,100.00
National Plus Salary Range:
$67,800.00 - $101,600.00* *National Plus salary range is used in higher cost of labor markets including Western Washington and Alaska**.*

title: Senior Business Operations Analyst
description:
The Senior Business Operations Analyst is responsible for driving insights in support of driving Siteimprove’s commercial strategy covering the entire customer lifecycle. The primary goal of this role is to leverage internal and external resources which enable our commercial teams to drive sales, increase retention rates, and improve internal operations.

This individual will partner with departments across the entire organization including, but not limited to Commercial Operations, Sales, Customer First, Marketing, Channel, Product, & Engineering to execute transformational projects and support operational cadences. In order to drive successful outcomes, it is critical for this role to collaborate cross-functionally and lead teams across Siteimprove to bring the customer strategy to life.

Given the strategic nature of the team, this role will also result in other Siteimprove departments looking to you for data-driven insights about our customers and their journey with Siteimprove which you will be willing and able to provide. You will help advise the organization in transformation. Doing so time and again will result in you being a trusted advisor for departments across Siteimprove.
### **What you will be doing**

* Utilize all available data and tools to optimize the sales cycle and go-to-market strategy across the Marketing, Sales, Channel, and Operations teams
* Utilize all available data and tools for identifying trends around customer health, retention, adoption, satisfaction, and expansion to proactively identify areas of opportunity alongside Customer First, Product, and Engineering teams
* Identify and serve intel and insights to customer-facing roles that will optimize their ability to drive value-based, meaningful interactions with our customers to provide ROI and value
* Develop tracking mechanisms and processes to monitor and analyze success metrics to track performance and further identify areas for optimization, especially across our commercial teams: Sales, Marketing, Customer First, and Channel
* Solve for the root cause of issues, while clearly articulating strategies for resolution
* Aid cross-functional teams in executing process, policy, and technology transformation while identifying dependencies and removing roadblocks
* Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Channel, and Product teams to make sure we develop a unified engagement model with customers that encompasses all of the benefits and developments that are driving customer value (e.g., new patents, capabilities, services, marketing campaigns, value drivers)
* Aid in the development of thought leadership, big thinking, and a continuous learning mindset into every interaction
* Keep up-to-date information, status, and documentation around the execution and implementation of strategic programs
* Actively participate in huddles, team meetings, and other company functions by sharing knowledge and providing feedback that will improve how Siteimprove works with our customers
* Attend meetings and other company functions necessary to perform duties
* Performs other related duties as assigned

### **What we will require of you**

* You embody our core values: You are people-centric. You are customer-focused. You embrace and drive change. You have a passion to succeed. You find value in diversity and inclusion.
* Minimum 2+ years of experience in Data Analytics, Commercial Operations, Strategy & Operations, Corporate Strategy, Management Consulting, or equivalent history and experience in driving transformational change
* Ability to query data from a central data repository (e.g., SQL Server) & tell stories in a meaningful way by leveraging data and facts via a visual medium (e.g., Power BI)

### **What we will love about you**

* Self-starter with a demonstrated record of acquiring knowledge above and beyond what is needed to complete assigned tasks
* Proven track record of analyzing large data sets to pick out key findings and insights
* Strong listening ability and persuasiveness to use appropriate interpersonal styles and communication methods
* Proven customer focus experience ensuring the customer perspective is a driving force behind business decisions and activities
* Excellent problem-solving and creative thinking skills
* Proven ability to be a business advisor by creating valuable business partnerships with cross-functional stakeholders
* Proven track record of delivering measurable results
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills working in a professional environment
* Strong collaboration and teambuilding skills
* Excellent, time management, organizational, and planning skills
* Ability to multi-task and adapt to a fast-paced environment
* Knowledge of and/or experience with common tools in B2B SaaS (e.g., Salesforce)
* Experience working in or with Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) companies
* 2+ years of management or technology consulting experience, a plus

### **In addition, we hope you will appreciate:**

* Rest and relaxation: Open Paid Time Off (OPTO) program for vacation, personal illness, mental health, or to care for a family member, 10 paid holidays, and two Give Back Days
* Comprehensive benefits: National medical plan, dental, vision, paid maternity leave, paid paternity leave, HSA, Flex, employer-sponsored short-term, long-term disability, discounts to volunteer plans to meet your family needs, and more!
* Prepare for the future: 401(k) with a company match to provide a better future in your retirement years.


Base pay will depend on the position, individual qualifications, market, and other operational business needs.**Siteimprove is an equal opportunity employer**  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or other legally protected status.  

Siteimprove is a global corporation that has developed data practices to ensure your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that personal information may be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in accordance with our Privacy Policy at https://siteimprove.com/en/privacy/.

title: Business Analyst II
description:
* 3+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
* 5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
* 3+ years of business or financial analysis experience
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent
* Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
* Experience with Excel
* Experience with SQL
* Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Over 2 million Sellers in 10 countries ship billions of products for sale on the Amazon Marketplace. To meet our sellers’ needs, we are constantly innovating and building on new ideas. Fulfillment by Amazon (FBA) Inbound analytics and data science team partners with product team to optimize inbound supply chain by influencing right tradeoffs among cost, speed and network capacity utilization.
  
  

FBA Product Analytics team is looking for an individual with excellent analysis and statistical skills, deep knowledge of BI solutions, and the ability to work with product development, and business teams. The successful candidate will have passion for data and analytics, be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
  

**An ideal candidate for this role:**  

* Will have relevant experience in data analytics working with large data sets and to extract and transform data using various tools and technologies
* Will transform data into actionable business information, and will make it readily accessible to stakeholders worldwide
* Will use data to support ideas, drive actionable outcomes, and provide unique ways to present data and information in an easy to consume format
* Will be passionate about finding root causes, trends, and patterns and how they impact business.
* Will draw inferences and conclusions, create dashboards and visualizations of processed data
* Will have excellent business and communication skills to be able to work with product owners to understand key business questions to build reports that enable product owners to answer those questions quickly and accurately


. Will be very comfortable juggling competing priorities and handling ambiguity
  
. Will thrive in an agile and fast-paced environment on highly visible projects and initiatives
  
  

A day in the life
  
As a Business Analyst, you will help develop an analytic solution to drive deep dives, provide insights into the health and state of the Operations and measure business impact. You will transform data into actionable business information, and will make it readily accessible to stakeholders worldwide. You will own the design, creation, and management of extremely large datasets. From Day 1, you will be challenged with a variety of tasks, ranging from creating datasets, reports, dashboards to metadata modeling, pipeline monitoring. You will interact with internal program and product owners, and technical teams to gather requirements, structure scalable and perform data solutions, and gain a deep understanding of key datasets. You will design, implement and drive adoption of new analytic technologies and solutions and promote industry standard best practices. You will be responsible to tune query performance against large and complex data sets. You will help translate analytic insights into concrete, actionable recommendations for business or product improvement.
  
  

About the team
  
  

**Our benefits include:**  

* Work on high-impact, high-visibility projects that drive the experience for millions of customers.
* The opportunity to use and learn state-of-the-art data management solutions.
* Excellent opportunities, and ample support, for career growth, development, and mentor-ship.
* Competitive compensation, including relocation support.


We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
  
  

Bellevue, WA, USA
  
  

* - Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business, economics, engineering , analytics, mathematics, statistics or a related technical or quantitative field
* - Experience in working with databases, ETL and SQL in a business environment
* - Demonstrated use of analytical packages and query languages such as SAS, R, Python and SQL
* - Experience in developing requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting, familiarity with data visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Quicksight
* - Experience communicating analytical outcomes through written communication to both business and technical teams


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
  
  

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $59,500/year in our lowest geographic market up to $143,100/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Business Analyst
description:

-------------------

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Our client, a national leader in the disaster restoration industry, is looking for a Business Development Manager to join their organization in the Denver CO market.

**We are looking for someone with an existing, transferrable book of business** **in commercial business and/or multi-family property managers.**

  
  
**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

• Manage all phases of the sales cycle for each opportunity/lead. 

• Proactively source, strategize, and develop new client relationships and referrals.

• Generate leads and sell new accounts for various company services.

• Establish a trusted and strategic advisor relationship and drive continued value of our products, technology and services.

• Maintain and develop customer success procedures and best practices.

• Support Divisions on development of Customer Success processes.

• Support Sales Division with pre-sales planning and strategies.

• Responsible for Market Research and to identify key target customers, share and contribute with sales organization.

• Work within the CRM to develop client organization and touch points.

• Ensure that all support practices are carried out in a professional and ethical manner to maintain the company’s reputation as a high-quality solutions provider.

• All calls, visits and communications must be entered into the CRM with relevant post, call notes and information given.

• Discuss Profit/Loss Assessments (PLA) and benefits of emergency event preparation.

• Contribute to marketing effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed; provide information and commentary pertinent to deliberations; recommend options and courses of action; implementing directives.

• Provide short- and long-term market forecasts and reports by directing market research collection, analysis, and interpretation of market data.

• Support and facilitate development and execution of marketing plans.

• Translate business development objectives and strategies to prepare brand portfolio objective, plans, strategies to facilitate the growth of business unit.

• Assist in strategic plans for client demonstrations, presentations, displays, etc.

• Work with regional offices to design and implement prospective and client relations.

• Develop and administer marketing database that includes prospect and client information, access to documents and reports, applications of mailing list, etc.

• Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; review professional publications; establish personal networks; participate in professional societies.

• Manage daily activities with marketing events. Track and present to the VP of Sales the ROI on each event.

• Develop and deliver insightful strategies and presentations to the decision makers and business department where appropriate.

• Travel Required to major disaster sites in various areas of the country.

• Travel Required to Client visits regularly, expected to maintain a scheduled plan of visits.

• Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

• Maintain and grow existing relationships to drive more business opportunities.

• Meet or exceed sales goals.

• Maintain customer relations by attending conventions, annual meetings, trade associations, and seminars.

• Sell Construction Opportunities, Manage Sales Process throughout Construction Projects as well.

• Identify and develop key partner strategies for specific market segments.

• Collaborate/coordinate project leads with business development partners.

• Maintain professional internal and external relationships that meet company core values.

• Drive Customer Success Outcomes.

• Perform other duties as assigned

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES**:

While this position does not have any direct reports, they need to be mentoring and coaching their team mates to drive further collaboration and revenue

  
  
**QUALIFICATIONS:**

• Understand Construction Processes a plus. 

• Computer skills including internet, e-mail, (MS Outlook) MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, and MS Word and has worked in a CRM tool previously.

• Comprehend client organizational structure to ensure high level of client retention to grow company revenues.

• Be high energy, self-motivated, self-starter.

• Demonstrate exceptional time management skills.

• 24/7 availability and reachability by team and clients required.

**EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:**

• Bachelor’s Degree in business, marketing or related field from a four-year college or university; or 

• Five (5) + years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience in service base sales, restoration, or construction 

Base Salary: $65,000-$75,000

title: FinOps Analyst/Business Analyst
description:
**Software Resources has an immediate job opportunity for a FinOps Analyst/Business Analyst with a major corporation, on-site in Seattle, WA.**   
  
**Duration**: 6 month(s)  
  
**Description**:  
This is for a FinOps/Business Analyst role  
The cloud first strategy has driven extreme growth across the cloud providers, platforms, and tools used across the enterprise to deliver experiences and as such, this position is focused on the following business areas:  
• Cloud Provider Billing and Allocation  
• Data Analysis and Reporting  
  
**Billing and Allocation:**  
• Support Data Engineering team during monthly invoice processing and validation across all billing sources (10+), inclusive of appropriate chargeback and credit allocation  
• Work closely with segments and third-party cloud providers on billing issue resolution  
• Consult with non-cloud product owners when billing issues arise  
• Drive new billing vendor intake and onboarding  
Reporting:  
• Support leadership reporting asks as necessary based on FinOps datasets in Databricks  
• Own cloud billing and optimization reporting including creating self service queries and reports segment strategic partners can leverage to run efficiently  
Cloud Enablement  
• Partner with Cloud Vendors and Segment Strategic Partners to support training activities  
• Consult on cloud cost estimates including managing self service cloud cost calculators  
• Act as a trusted advisor providing thought leadership on new cloud service provider optimization product launches  
• Provide cost optimization guidance to segments  
  
**Basic Qualifications:**  
• 5+ years experience in product engineering or data engineering  
• 5+ years cloud experience (AWS, Google, Azure)  
• 5+ years of experience in a cloud business operations role with an emphasis on forecast accuracy and cost optimization.  
• Deep knowledge of Excel (arrays formulas) and SQL (creating complex queries joining multiple datasets)  
• Both technically adept in multi-cloud strategies & technologies and highly skilled at building strong partnerships that deliver critical organizational outcomes.  
• Excellent written and verbal communications; proven ability to develop and deliver presentations geared for Senior and Executive Management  
• Experience with cloud application development platforms, tools and utilities  
• Experiencing managing multiple engineering projects across public and private cloud solutions  
• Ability to work with large data sets for analysis and interpretation of business results  
• Prioritizes work effectively, making tradeoffs as necessary  
• Date driven and manages to deliverables.  
• Ability to work cross-functionally with other functions, such as designers, product managers, data scientists, engineers, or SRE, to deliver products  
• Positive can-do partnership attitude while working with teams, cross-functional teams and cross-functional business units  
• Must be detail oriented, self-organized, and capable of simultaneously tracking multiple issues of varying complexity  
• Strong principles of financial analysis  
• Exercises good judgment when faced with risk, blockers, or tradeoffs  
• Leverage accurate documentation, best practices, and creative problem solving  
• Deep empathy for customer requirements - both the goods and the bads  
• Ability to dive deep and validate data  
  
**Preferred Qualifications:**  
Expert knowledge of third-party cloud providers (AWS, Google, and Azure)  
• Experience using Databrix  
  
**Required Education:**  
BS in CS/Data or Finance

title: Business Analyst
description:
We are seeking a **Business Analyst - IT Solutions** to join our team for a large-scale Information Technology project that requires the services of an expert-level Information Technology Business Analysis (BA) practitioner.  
  
**Job Responsibilities:**  
* Gather, analyze, and document business requirements and rules directly from stakeholders and domain experts.
* Organize and lead meetings with business leadership and teams to capture and assess business needs from stakeholders and Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), converting these insights into agreed-upon product scope and specific product requirements.
* Conduct sessions to gather, specify, and validate current and future business processes and rules.
* Develop IT Pre-Project Scoping Statements (PPSS) to aid in the resource planning efforts of TSD management.
* Implement relevant regulations, policies, and standards such as the Revised Code of Washington (RCWs), OCIO Policies, and ETPMO Standards & Practices in determining product scope with clients.
* In collaboration with the project manager and according to the project’s development or acquisition approach, elicit, analyze, and document detailed business processes and requirements.
* Utilize requirements management tools like Sparx Enterprise Architect or Jama to document and analyze business processes, creating both current and future state business workflows, IT capability reviews, business rules, and glossaries for IT project team use.
* Produce and maintain essential IT documentation such as system context diagrams, use case diagrams, system use cases, and domain models.
* Oversee and manage the product scope and requirements for designated IT projects, ensuring alignment with stakeholder needs and business goals.
* Classify and prioritize requirements in collaboration with business stakeholders.
* Establish and document baseline requirements for the business and secure business endorsement of product requirements.
* Coordinate with IT project teams to obtain approval of product requirements and oversee the fulfillment of these requirements.

**Basic Qualifications:**  
* A Business Analyst, with a focus on IT business requirements gathering, business process analysis, and data analysis within large-scale software application projects.
* Formal education equivalent to university-level training in business analysis.
* At least 3 years of expert knowledge and hands-on experience with the International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK) framework, including the creation and maintenance of its deliverables.
* A minimum of 8 years of comprehensive experience in process mapping, workflow modeling, conceptual and logical data modeling, business rules modeling, use case modeling, scope management, as well as requirements elicitation and management.
* Technical experience (minimum 8 years) supporting application development, database administration, or data modeling, including design, development, testing, and implementation of diverse IT systems.
* Proven ability to conduct requirements elicitation and interviews across a broad range of stakeholders, from front-line employees to executive-level staff.
* Familiarity with requirements management techniques, such as traceability matrices.
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including Visio.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
* Experience with requirements management software, such as SPARX Enterprise Architect or Jama, is preferred.

**Preferred Qualifications:**  
* A current International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) Certification or a current certification as a Project
* Management Institute - Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA).
* Experience in implementing Cloud-hosted business process migration in Software as a Service (SaaS) implementations utilizing Google, Amazon, or Microsoft cloud hosting technologies.
* Certification as a Lean Six Sigma Green Belt.
* Experience in the creation of business requirements for Request for Information (RFI) and Request for Proposal (RFP) solicitations.

title: Entry Level Territory Sales Manager
description:
About the Company  
Dynasty Dynamics is based in Seattle, Washington, and growing rapidly. Our company represents various clients across various industries, most notably the **nation’s largest e-commerce tech company**. Our tailored sales approach is what makes our services so highly sought-after. We believe every company can acquire customers more effectively through interpersonal relationship-building techniques and partner with brands to penetrate their current market further and expand to new ones.  
Job Description  
Dynasty Dynamics is offering a Management Trainee program for its Territory Sales Management position to focus on new business-to-business (B2B) account development in the Seattle region. Working at Dynasty Dynamics isn’t all about selling. It’s also about learning and getting professional exposure. We provide a thorough sales training program, which includes product knowledge, a week-long product boot camp, mentorship, sales process, weekly coaching, and business development strategies.  
Key Responsibilities* Generating revenue and meeting sales targets
* Developing and qualifying leads within respective territories to drive additional sales opportunities
* Close opportunities at assigned existing accounts and drive sales at new accounts
* Gathering and utilizing business intelligence on prospects to support sales calls, product presentations and driving new business
* Analyzing the prospects’ needs and interests, determining which products are appropriate, and referring to the correct sales partner to ensure client satisfaction
* Projecting a positive image in representing the Corporation to clients and the community to create a Sales opportunity
* Attend Zoom meetings every morning

Our Sales Representatives Enjoy* Uncapped commission potential
* Travel opportunities upon achieving sales quotas
* Gas allowance
* Monthly/Quarterly performance bonuses & incentives
* Performance-based promotion rather than seniority
* Paid and intensive training program
* Mentorship program
* Tablet (company iPad)
* Annual recognition events
* Team night every Thursday

Skills/Qualifications  
Required* Impeccable presentation, verbal and written communication skills
* A go getter mentality - the idea of being an active participant in a growing company must excite you

Preferred* Bachelor's Degree preferred
* New Business-to-Business (B2B) sales experience
* Hunter sales mentality - goal driven and self-motivated
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)

Additionally, Our Employee-partners Enjoy* Paid Time Off and Holidays
* Career Advancement Opportunities

* Have independent meetings with folks on the team based on what they need to do to meet their goals

- Study and summarize user access patterns to create generic querying guideline in accordance to internal policies.  
- Understand AWS Lake Formation architecture and how fine-grained access control impacts data consumers.  
- Work closely with program stakeholders to understand, track and iterate the business requirements and provide analyses.  
- Understand trends related to data access within the business teams and recommend strategies to stakeholders to help drive business growth/reduce risk.  
- Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations that will help shape the direction of the business.  
- Supporting cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of the access control compliance and requirement implementation.  
- Influencing across multiple levels of leadership and organizations through strong communication and analytical skills via Program Flashes and wiki updates.  
- Monitoring existent metrics, analyzing data and partnering with program partner teams to identify process and system improvement opportunities.  
- Research and implement cost reduction opportunities through the program roadmap initiatives

title: Business Analyst
description:
Brook Health is a digital health company. Brook provides people who are living with chronic conditions a highly personalized high-touch support via smartphone apps offering AI tools, data collection through connected devices, and real-time access to health coaches to make smart, daily decisions and build healthy habits to achieve their long-term health goals.  
  
Brook offers an innovative work experience with team members in multiple time zones, headquartered in Seattle, WA. We have a fast-paced, user-centric, high-expectation, constantly-improving-ourselves type of culture. Our goal is to change the approach to chronic condition management and improve health outcomes for users and health care providers. Learn more about who we are here. 

**Business Analyst** 

We are looking for a highly skilled and growth-oriented Business Analyst with strong problem-solving and analytical skills along with communication and interpersonal skills. In this role, you will be responsible for understanding the internal and external business and clinical requirements and challenges. You will drive opportunities and bridge the gap between stakeholders to ensure solutions align with requirements and deliver value. The ideal candidate will have a healthcare background and a metrics/data-driven analytical mindset of constantly measuring success and driving continuous improvement.  
  
***Compensation Band: $105,000 - $135,000. Pay is based on several factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.***

**Responsibilities:**

* Analyzing, developing, and executing internal and external reports and dashboards.
* Driving company and departmental OKRs, patient outcomes, and clinic-facing metrics to promote clinic activations, engagement, and growth.
* Identify opportunities and data-driven recommendations for improving patient outcomes.
* Work directly with our patient engagement, care team, product and finance to understand problems, and departmental requirements.
* Align on the dashboard vision.
* Analyze business requirements, processes, workflows, and data to interpret the needs of customers.
* Translate business requirements for reports and dashboards.
* Collaborate with the data team to test, design, and deploy solutions that are visually appealing and meet the business needs.
* Create and maintain accurate, up-to-date detailed documentation including business requirements, data, process flows, use cases, and user stories.
* Identify potential risks.
* Understand business and clinical implications of potential analysis.
* Participate in or lead testing, user acceptance testing, and validation of implemented solutions.
* Ensure delivered solutions meet the specified requirements and quality standards.

**Qualifications:**

* Excellent verbal/written communication
* Data presentation skills
* Ability to effectively communicate with both business, technical, and clinical teams.
* Critical thinking skills to assess metrics, trends and data to reach conclusions based on findings.
* Technical knowledge and competence in compiling and communicating the effect of changes.
* Knowledge of relevant tools such as Miro, JIRA, Notion, Sigma, MS Excel, SQL, Tableau, etc. Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP, CCBA).
* Coming from a healthcare and/or startup background is a huge plus.

description:
At Michael of Scottsdale, We are seeking an Digital marketing manager to promote our company's brand and services. In this role, you will be optimizing our marketing strategies, managing the marketing department's budget and staff, as well as preparing forecasts.

To ensure success, you will need extensive knowledge of marketing strategies and the ability to identify new business leads. An outstanding marketing manager will be someone whose expertise translates into increased brand awareness and profitability.

Marketing Manager Responsibilities:

* Evaluating and optimizing marketing and pricing strategies.
* Analyzing market trends and preparing forecasts.
* Generating new business leads.
* Increasing brand awareness and market share.
* Coordinating marketing strategies with the sales, financial, public relations, and production departments.
* Developing and managing the marketing department's budget.
* Overseeing branding, advertising, and promotional campaigns.
* Managing the marketing department's staff.
* Preparing and presenting quarterly and annual reports to senior management.
* Promoting our brand at trade shows and major industry-related events.
* Keeping informed of marketing strategies and trends.

Marketing Manager Requirements:

* Bachelor's degree in marketing, finance, business administration, or similar.
* A master's degree in a relevant field will be advantageous.
* At least two years' experience as a marketing manager.
* Proficiency in electronic marketing automation software such as HubSpot Marketing and Bitrix24.
* Extensive knowledge of marketing strategies, channels, and branding.
* Superb leadership, communication, and collaboration abilities.
* Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong time management and organizational abilities.

title: Microsoft Dynamics Business Analyst
description:
Caf2Code is proud to be a Microsoft Solution Partner who currently performing a confidential talent search for a company in Houston, TX. If you are match for the criteria below, please forward us your resume and salary requirements.  
  
Do you pride yourself on innovation and excellence? Are you passionate about collaborating with stakeholders, problem solving, and support end-users? If so, we are looking for a talented D365 Business Analyst that has experience with analyzing business processes, creating technical documentation, and working with cross functional teams.  
  
Prior experience should include, but not be limited to the following responsibilities.   
  
 Liaises and builds relationships with stakeholders to understand business issues.  
 Liaises and builds relationships with external consultants to help with business issues.  
 Assists with stakeholder capturing requirements in line with business needs, facilitates defining and delivering appropriate solutions to meet those requirements.  
 Ensures ongoing consistency of understanding business needs, objectives, priorities, and requirements.

title: Forensic Analyst and Business Valuation Preparer
company: Client of Reputable Staffing & Recruiting Firm
description:
**Brookwoods Group** is seeking a meticulous and experienced **Forensic Analyst and Business Valuation Preparer** to provide comprehensive support to our testifying financial experts in family law cases. This role involves assisting in separate property tracking, business valuation and characterization of executive compensation plans. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in finance, accounting or business valuation, with prior experience in family law financial expert work. You will work directly with a team of experts in a very collaborative work environment. The company is based in Houston TX, but the candidate can sit anywhere in the US.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Financial Modeling:** Develop and maintain complex financial models to support business valuation assessments, cash flow projections, and asset allocation analysis.
* **Expert Witness Support:** Assist in the preparation of expert witness reports and exhibits for courtroom presentations, ensuring accuracy and compliance with legal requirements.
* **Document Review:** Review and analyze financial documents, including tax returns, financial statements, and investment portfolios, to identify relevant information for case preparation.
* **Case Strategy Development:** Collaborate with the legal team to develop case strategies and provide financial expertise to support litigation efforts.
* **Client Education:** Educate clients on financial matters related to their cases, including the implications of financial documents and the valuation process.
* **Quality Assurance:** Conduct quality assurance checks on work products to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to company standards and industry regulations.

**MUST HAVE WITHOUT EXCEPTION:**

1. Detail-oriented individual with a strong background in finance.
2. Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and formulas for financial analysis and data manipulation.
3. Must have a bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or a related field.
4. Must have 5+ years of experience in accounting, business valuation, audit, or family law financial expert work.
5. Must have 5+ experience reviewing and analyzing financial documents, including tax returns, financial statement, and investment portfolios.

Preferred but not required:

* Business valuation designation, ASA, ABV, or CVA
* CPA
* 5 years working in family law litigation

title: Reimbursement Specialist - Collections
description:
**Reimbursement Specialist Needed!**

LHH has a client in Houston, TX that needs a Reimbursement Specialist on a contract opportunity!

**Job Summary:** 

The position requires advanced knowledge of various program billing requirements as well as federal billing rules, Medicare and Medicare, and/or IDTF Billing. 

The Reimbursement Specialist will actively participate in internal audits and quality improvement initiatives, maintains documentation of current workflows, and assists with special projects. 

The reimbursement specialists will perform complex patient account follow-up activities, actively participates in quality improvement initiatives to improve accounts receivable and assists with special projects. 

The reimbursement specialist is also responsible for answering questions regarding team functions, and the accurate and timely processing of appeals to various pertinent payers or programs. 

The reimbursement specialist will also serve as the technical expert for complex workflows, providing ongoing updates and training to existing staff for their specific area of expertise. 

The specialist may be responsible for handling charge review edits, claim edits and preparation, insurance follow-up, denial resolution, and necessary follow-up to ensure accurate payment.  
  
**Major Responsibilities:**

  
Maintaining a complete collection of accounts receivable for area of expertise. This includes following accounts through the revenue cycle, from charge review, claim edits, claim submission, and follow up with third party payers and patients to facilitate prompt resolution of outstanding account balances. 

**This includes:**  
Resolve claim edits via claim edit work queues and/or our external billing software.  
Review charges to ensure we are filing to correct guarantor (e.g., work comp, research, transplant, or personal/family)  
Analyze and reconcile denied payment transactions.  
Compile and file all information needed to appeal denials.  
Follow federal and state regulations to ensure compliance standards are met.  
Monitor timely filing requirements on claims and appeals.  
Follow-up with contracted payers to secure payments on outstanding balances.  
Evaluate third party payments to ensure accuracy relative to contract language (underpayment/overpayment)  
Prepare specialized invoices and information as needed for each payor.  
Verify patient coverage information and update registration as required.  
Accurately document all actions taken to reconcile outstanding balances.  
Communicate with Revenue Cycle teams, payors and others to resolve account problems; participate in meetings as needed to address any potential payor concerns.  
Evaluate the payment status of outstanding third-party claims and resolve any impediments to payment by providing information such as appropriate medical records, detailed itemization of charges, information regarding other insurance benefits, and explanation of charges.  
Review and validate adjustments to accounts in the insurance folder based on insurance reimbursement, coverage, contracts and services provided.  
Review charges to ensure we are filing to correct guarantor (e.g., work comp vs. personal/family)  
Complete work on special projects, queries and reports as assigned.  
Provide general assistance with team:  
Complete quality improvement and productivity activities  
Answer questions regarding team functions and assist with team direction.  
Assist in training staff as needed.  
  
**Customer Service Standards:**

  
Support co-workers and engage in positive interactions.  
Communicate professionally and timely with internal and external customers.  
Provide helpful assistance in anticipating and responding to the needs of our clients.  
Collaborate with customers in planning and decision making to result in optimal solutions.  
Ability to stay calm under pressure and deal effectively with difficult people.  
 **Qualifications:**

  
Education: High School Diploma or equivalent combination of education/work experience.  
Preferred: Associate degree in Business, Finance, Health Information Management, or related field.  
Work Experience: Minimum 5 years of experience in a healthcare revenue cycle or clinic operations role.  
Xifin experience.  
Three years of experience in a healthcare revenue cycle, specific to area of  
expertise (I.e. IDTF, Trans telephonic and Electronic Monitoring Service (e.g., 24-hour ambulatory EKG monitoring, pacemaker monitoring and cardiac event detection) or client billing.  
Sitting for extended periods of time will be required.  
Use of hands repetitively to type, handle and operate standard office equipment will be required.  
Employee will work under typical office conditions.  
All employees must pass a drug test and must have valid proof of eligibility to work in the USA.

  
  
**Required Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:**

  
Advanced analytic ability  
Ability to make good judgments in demanding situations.  
Ability to react to frequent changes in duties and volume of work.  
Effective communication skills  
Ability to listen empathetically.  
Ability to logically and accurately organize details.  
Ability to manage multiple tasks with ease and efficiency.  
Self-starter with a willingness to try new ideas.  
Ability to work independently and be result oriented.  
Positive, can-do attitude coupled with a sense of urgency.  
Effective interpersonal skills, including the ability to promote teamwork.  
Strong problem-solving skills  
Ability to ensure a high level of customer satisfaction including employees,  
patients, visitors, faculty, referring physicians and external stakeholders.  
Ability to use various computer applications including Xifin  
Excellent PC operating skills (keyboard, mouse) and use of MS Office  
Broad knowledge of health care business office practices and principles  
Basic math skills and knowledge of general accounting principles  
Knowledge of medical and insurance terminology, CPT, ICD coding  
structures, and billing forms (UB, 1500)  
Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information  
  
**Preferred Qualifications:**

  
5+ Years Prior Medical Collections Experience.  
Knowledge of claims processing and adjustments  
Knowledge of Medicare, Medicaid, and Commercial carriers  
Excellent communication and organizational skills  
Ability to calculate insurance benefits and write appeal letters (using templates)  
Ability to read and understand Explanation of Benefits.  
Knowledge of Out of Network (Non-participating provider) Collections  
Insurance verification  
Knowledge of Centricity  
Basic Benefit Coordination  
Knowledge of Medicaid or Medicare Claim Processing regulations

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Commerical Real Estate Analyst
description:
**Commercial Real Estate Analyst**

POSITION SUMMARY

 

The Commercial Real Estate Analyst is a key member to our commercial real estate team in the Raleigh area responsible for analyzing markets, financials, properties, leases, in order to assist the brokerage and management of clients’ portfolios. This professional represents The Overton Group. As such, they should maintain the highest level of standards and conduct that reflect The Overton Group values. This is a full-time, exempt position that reports to the Vice President/Advisor.

  


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

* Develop, maintain, and enhance cash flow/financial models, ensuring accuracy and relevance in decision-making processes. Provide insightful analysis and recommendations based on model outcomes.
* Generate marketing reports for clients.
* Originate new and renewal lease analyses for existing properties, meticulously assessing their impact on existing properties.
* Perform various portfolio- and property-level analyses, including nuanced hold/sell evaluations for current assets to optimize investment strategies. Provide strategic recommendations based on thorough financial analysis and market insights.
* Assist in all aspects of property level acquisitions and dispositions and related due diligence efforts.
* Conduct in-depth research within target investment markets, leveraging sophisticated supply/demand models and macro/micro economic forecasting to anticipate trends and opportunities.
* Synthesize complex data sets into actionable insights to inform investment decisions.
* Collaborate with brokers and clients to facilitate effective communication and alignment of investment objectives. Cultivate strong relationships with brokers, lenders, and other industry professionals to stay abreast of market trends and opportunities.

REQUIREMENTS, QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS

* Strong analytical mindset, excellent written and verbal communication skills, detail-oriented, ability to multitask
* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Real Estate, Economics, or related field
* Robust understanding of the commercial real estate market or exhibit a strong desire to grow and learn the real estate investment business.
* Fluent in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel, PowerPoint and Word; proficient with Adobe InDesign
* Propensity toward organization and attention to details
* Ability to work independently as well as function a part of a team
* Ability to take direction, receive feedback, and continue personal & professional growth

title: Tax Advantaged Accounts Analyst
description:
Description: The Tax-Advantaged Accounts Analyst will assist with executing the strategic direction of Individual Retirement Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, and Coverdell Education Savings Accounts. This individual will have extensive experience with the administration of retirement plans and in-depth knowledge of the rules and regulations of IRAs, HSAs, and Coverdell ESAs. The position will manage the day-to-day operations, reporting and administration of tax-advantaged accounts and provide direct and indirect member support as a subject matter expert. This position will also contribute to the overall success of the Wealth Management team and the broader Operations lines of business. 

  


**NORMAL DAY-TO-DAY WORK**

1. Oversee the day-to-day operations and administration of tax-advantaged accounts, ensuring compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, organizational policies, and industry best practices.
2. Develop and manage daily processes and procedures for the tax-advantaged accounts, including, but not limited to document review, account approval, account creation, contribution, and withdrawal reporting, required minimum distribution processing, and tax reporting for distribution withholdings and year-end interest statements.
3. Formulate recommendations for policies and procedures to ensure accurate recordkeeping for tax-advantaged accounts. Identify and implement process improvements to increase efficiency, quality and member satisfaction based on industry best practices.
4. Build and maintain strong relationships with members, providing exceptional customer service and support.
5. Support internal business units in developing the skills and knowledge to expertly support member tax-advantaged account needs at all levels of inquiry. Help establish the Credit Union's reputation as a thought leader in the tax-advantaged account space.
6. Assist with reviewing and approving all marketing material, including appropriate forms and procedures.
7. Develop expertise in all operational systems, applications, and ancillary tools necessary to support end-to-end processing of tax-advantaged accounts, including internal and external forms, systems, and procedures as well as reconciliation and settlement processing.
8. Assist with the development and preparation of timely and informative management reports to ensure expert oversight of all tax-advantaged accounts and other Wealth Management accounts, services, and portfolio activities.
9. Stay current with tax laws and regulations related to tax-advantaged accounts and business best practices through participation in industry events and continuing education for tax-advantaged accounts. Monitor legislative and regulatory changes that may affect retirement and savings products and make product and process recommendations as appropriate.
10. Support the broader Wealth Management Department and Operations lines of business by demonstrating flexibility in knowledge development and task assignment in accordance with the evolving needs of a fast-paced production driven operational department.

**JOB QUALIFICATIONS** 

**Here are a few skills you MUST have to be qualified for this position.** 

1. Minimum 4 – 6 years' experience in branch operations, member relations, or related field, with 1 – 3 years of direct experience with tax-advantaged accounts.
2. Experience with operations and product development while providing a high degree of innovation and vision.
3. Strong analytical skills with the ability to develop new products to stay competitive in the current marketplace.
4. Ability to function in a Consumer business office environment and utilize standard office equipment including, but not limited to: PC, copier, telephone, etc.
5. Ability to lift a minimum of 25 lbs. (file boxes, computer printer).
6. Travel required on occasion.

**Here are a few qualities we'd LIKE for you to have to make you more suited for this position.** 

1. BA/BS in Operations, Finance, Business Development, or related field.
2. Certified IRA Specialist (CIS) certification.

**OUR CULTURE**

Our organizations believe we can all do well by doing good. We value the contributions of diverse minds and prioritize the success and wellbeing of our employees. We also believe every person in our organization plays a role in supporting a healthy environment and helping to achieve our goal of prosperity for all. To this end, we recruit bright, energetic, and talented people to be members of our team. In return, we offer a dynamic workplace that presents opportunities for professional advancement and individual growth. We strive to always display integrity, self-awareness, courage, and respect for one another while continuing to seek opportunities to learn. We really believe that when our employees succeed, our community wins. 

  


If you have questions about this position description, please feel welcome to ask. You can reach our HR department at: 

Human Resources

3600 Wake Forest Rd, Raleigh, NC 27609 

**careers@civicfcu.org**

title: Financial Administrator
