title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
***Laser******Photonics, based in Orlando, Florida, is a leading brand in industrial-grade laser solutions, specializing in marking, engraving, cleaning, and cutting machines. We offer an extensive range of standard and specialized laser systems, employing advanced technologies.***

***The dynamic and forward-thinking environment attracts top talent, eager to be part of a team reshaping the future of laser-based technologies. Renowned for its pioneering solutions, this company is transforming industries with precision and innovation. This is where disruption meets excellence, forging a path toward new career possibilities. Interested in coming into a rapidly growing organization and making an immediate impact? Reach out to us today!***

**Summary:**

 

As a Financial Analyst at Laser Photonics Corp, you will play a critical role in shaping the company's financial strategy with a specific focus on business strategy for mergers and acquisitions, analyzing five-year business plans, and modeling fund-raising events.

This position requires expertise in SEC filings with futures exchange.

 

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Proficiency in financial modeling and analysis
* Experience in M&A transactions and due diligence processes
* Knowledge of SEC regulations and filings (S-1, S-3, etc.)
* Strong strategic planning abilities with a focus on business growth and expansion
* Excellent communication and presentation skills for collaborating with stakeholders at all levels
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and drive results. Conduct detailed analysis to support business strategy development for M&A activities.
* Examine and evaluate five-year business plans to identify growth opportunities and potential risks.
* Develop financial models to determine optimal fund-raising events and implement strategies accordingly.
* Expertise in preparing and filing SEC documents including S-1, S-3, ATM, Shelf, or direct listings.
* Execute resource reallocation from subsidiary entities to the parent company to achieve cost efficiencies.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to implement strategic financial decisions.

 

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or related field. Master's degree preferred.
* Proven experience in financial analysis, business strategy, M&A, and SEC filings.
* Advanced proficiency in financial modeling and forecasting.
* Strong understanding of fund-raising processes and strategies.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively across departments.

 

If you are a dynamic financial professional with a strategic mindset and a passion for driving business growth through effective financial planning and analysis, we encourage you to apply and join our team at Laser Photonics Corp.

 

**Location: Orlando, FL**

**Compensation:**

The compensation package will be competitive and includes comprehensive benefits and an equity component.

***Laser Photonics upholds a strong commitment to equal opportunity employment. We value diversity, ensuring that every applicant is evaluated for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, or any other protected status under relevant federal, state, or local laws.***

title: Financial Analyst
description:
We are looking for a Financial Analyst and data junkie to join our team. Ideal candidates are  
analytical, inquisitive, and enjoy diving into financial data to identify key performance drivers and  
fresh insights. We believe data is meaningless if it doesn’t tell a larger story. Candidates should be  
skilled in presenting financial results clearly with high-impact visualizations and other presentation  
tools. This is a client-facing role and candidates should be confident leading client discussions  
independently, delivering and interpreting financial results, and providing fundraising  
support. Candidates with early-stage startup experience in accounting, finance, or FP&A roles are  
preferred, as are candidates with client-service experience and SaaS industry experience.  
Graphite Financial is redefining the “finance department” for early-stage companies and VC-backed  
startups. We deliver high-caliber accounting/finance leadership and support to entrepreneurs and  
management teams building scalable, high-growth companies. Our clients are actively managing cash burn,  
measuring performance, reporting to investors, making capital allocation decisions, and preparing for  
fundraising. All of that takes expertise and time that founders don’t have and can’t afford to hire for.  
Graphite closes the gap with flexible, fixed-fee support packages that provide fractional leadership and  
operational support from CFOs, Controllers, FP&A Managers, and Accounting Managers.  
  
This is a fully remote position however we do have coworking space available in Central FL, NY and NJ. The expected annual salary range is $75,000-$100,000.   
  
Some of What You’ll Do:

* Build financial dashboards that use visualization to communicate results and tell a “story”
* Prepare and present comprehensive monthly financial reports to multiple clients, including all financial statements, trend reporting, budget vs. actual reporting, and key metrics
* Develop assumptions-driven financial models that empower clients to forecast company performance, assess headcount and resource needs, manage runway, and plan for fundraising
* Work closely with client teams to understand key performance drivers for their business
* Prepare detailed reporting on unit economics and margin analysis
* Prepare annual and quarterly budgets for multiple clients
* Collaborate with accounting teams to understand underlying data
* Perform ad-hoc analysis for clients on pricing strategy, margin sensitivity, cash burn scenarios, etc.
* Ensure all forward-looking models and analysis is accessible and built with investors in mind

Who you are:

* 7+ years’ experience in financial planning, analysis, and reporting
* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance with specific knowledge of GAAP/accrual principles
* Proficient with Business Intelligence platforms (i.e. Tableau, PowerBI, Grow, Looker, etc.)
* Expertise with cloud-based accounting and reporting systems
* Highly organized with the ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines and manage multiple clients
* Strong analytical and advanced Excel skills as well as excellent written and verbal communication
* Ability to work independently, as well as collaborate with a virtual team
* Exceptional analytical, reasoning, and problem-solving skills
* Aligned as a partner with the client team and known for a polished, professional presentation

Why you’ll love working at Graphite:

* Balance. We encourage you to take time to recharge outside of the office. You’ll have flexible PTO to explore new places, hobbies, or TV shows
* We’re not just an employer. We’re people. We offer insurance coverage (health, vision, and dental).
* We’ll invest in your career. Our company is growing quickly, and we’ll give you the opportunity to do the same. You’ll have access to many professional development opportunities so that you can keep up with the company’s evolving needs.
* We’re creating an environment where everyone can thrive. Our customers are global and diverse, so we’re building a team that is, too.
* We offer competitive compensation packages. We deeply value the talent our team brings to the table and believe that fair and equitable total compensation packages are part of our commitment to everyone who works here.
* We’re fun.
* All applicants must be authorized to work in the United States.

About Graphite:  
Graphite Financial is a growing boutique finance, accounting & strategy firm  
(www.graphitefinancial.com) built to help startup companies scale efficiently and  
sustainably. We were born in 2008 in NYC, supporting ff Venture Capital’s portfolio of early-stage  
companies. In 2016, Graphite Financial spun out and began working with the broader startup  
community. We are a team of certified public accountants, analysts, entrepreneurs and venture  
capitalists who are passionate about partnering with early-stage companies to help them succeed.  
Our roots give us a unique vantage point that extends well beyond vanilla finance and accounting  
matters. In other words, we’re more than just bookkeepers, though we’re great at that too.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Salary:   
Join our dynamic team of innovators, creators, and problem solvers! At Frontline Insurance, we're on a mission to Make Things Better! We believe in fostering a collaborative, inclusive, and growth-oriented work environment where every team member can thrive and make a meaningful impact.

  


At Frontline Insurance we're more than just a workplace – we're a community of talented individuals dedicated to Integrity, Patriotism, Family and Creativity. Join us in shaping the future of Insurance and let's achieve remarkable things together. Your next career adventure starts here!

 

**SUMMARY**

 

The Financial Analyst is responsible for supporting with the Company’s Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) activities, which encompass budgeting, forecasting, analysis, reporting and evaluation of the organization’s financial goals and results. The Financial Analyst’s primary objective is to assist with the analysis, evaluation, and reporting portions of the FP&A process.

 

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

 

* Collect explanations for departmental budget-to-actual variances and evaluate for impacts to the budgeted versus forecasted results for the year.
* Research and respond to departmental inquiries about budgeted or actual amounts, or remaining budget outlook for desired expenditures, etc.
* Evaluate & analyze budget-to-actual results on an ongoing basis, identifying, researching, and communicating any issues/trends noted.
* Prepare periodic forecasted results, based on actuals and updated forecast for remaining months, updated monthly.
* Assist with the maintenance and updates to the Company’s financial models & projections.
* Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual budget-to-actual reports to be sent to Executive Management and Department Heads.
* Assist with the documentation of internal controls related to the FP&A process.
* Assist with the administration & upkeep of the Budget & Financial Planning SharePoint site

* Enterprise and accounting information systems experience a plus
* Some insurance industry experience a plus

* Solid written and verbal communication skills.
* Attention to detail
* Ability to multi-task and manage time effectively on tasks with competing priority.
* Experience working in dynamic and team environment
* Fast learner with Interpersonal skills to develop relationship between the business and the system to enhance the appropriate flow of information.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION:**  
Financial Analyst is required to provide accurate and data based information on company’s profitability, solvency, stability and liquidity. You will research and analyze financial information to help Company make well informed decisions, write reports and monitor financial movements.  
  
**Responsibilities:*** Consolidate and analyze financial data (budgets, income statement forecasts etc) taking into account company’s goals and financial standing.
* Provide creative alternatives and recommendations to reduce costs and improve financial performance.
* Assemble and summarize data to structure sophisticated reports on financial status and risks.
* Develop financial models, conduct benchmarking and process analysis.
* Conduct business studies on past, future and comparative performance and develop forecast models.
* Identify trends, advise company and recommend actions to a senior financial analyst based on sound analysis.
* Track and determine financial status by analyzing actual results in comparison with forecasts.
* Reconcile transactions by comparing and correcting data.
* Gain and update job knowledge to remain informed about novelty in the field.
* Consult with management to guide and influence long term and strategic decision making within the broadest scope.
* Drive process improvement and policy development initiatives that impact the function.
* Other duties as assigned by supervisor.

  
**Requirements and skills:*** Proven working experience as a Finance Analyst.
* Proficient in spreadsheets, databases, MS Office and financial software applications.
* Hands on experience with statistical analysis and statistical packages.
* Outstanding presentation, reporting and communication skills.
* Proven knowledge of financial forecasting and diagnosis, corporate finance and information analysis.
* Well informed in current financial subjects, accounting, tax laws, money market and business environments.
* BS degree in Finance, Economics or related field.

We prioritize professional development and provide every opportunity for our team members to grow their skills and talents, and become even more effective.

title: Enterprise Risk Operations Analyst I
description:
Req ID: 74763
Location: Tulsa -TUL, Oklahoma City -OKC
Areas of Interest: Risk Management; Audit; Internal Audit; Risk Management, BSA/AML; Risk Management, Compliance
Pay Transparency Salary Range: Not Available
Application Deadline: 04/06/2024
BOK Financial, Headquartered in Tulsa, Oklahoma, BOK Financial Corporation (NASDAQ: BOKF) is a top U.S.-based financial services holding company with operations in Oklahoma, Texas, Arizona, Arkansas, Colorado, Kansas, Missouri, Tennessee and New Mexico. The company began more than 100 years ago in Tulsa and has successfully diversified into a variety of industries, businesses and geographies. .

Bonus Type
-----------


Discretionary
Summary
--------



What does it take to join us? We're glad you asked! We expect exceptional skills, discipline, a dedication to being your best, and a commitment to serving our communities and building relationships with teammates, clients and stakeholders. We're building on over a century of service in our industry.

Job Description
----------------



The Enterprise Risk Operations Analyst I identifies, reviews and analyzes enterprise-wide risk. The incumbent prepares and maintains risk management documentation and monitors and tracks operational risk issues employing a strong knowledge of practices and principles of risk management, in addition to a solid understanding of data analytics, visualization, and automation. Ensures continuous improvement in risk mitigation through identification of risk trends and development of key risk indicators.

Team Culture
-------------



Our camaraderie, shared decision-making, and mutual respect for one another are what make us, one big happy family. All team members have a stake in the game and are encouraged to share their ideas on creating efficiencies and impacting our bottom line. We're also focused on your growth and development. We want you to grow your capabilities by actively participating in opportunities to expand your knowledge, influence others, and develop your interpersonal skills.

How You'll Spend Your Time
---------------------------


* You'll be assigned various risk analysis projects in areas such as Internal Control Environment, Risk Profile, Risk Outlook, BOKF's Whistleblower and Standards of Conduct Programs.
* You'll employ data visualization tools to illustrate emerging trends to your team and BOKF leadership.
* You'll work with the entire enterprise risk team to develop and analyze key risk indicators.
* You'll ensure data quality and validation controls are maintained in support of accurate reporting.
* You'll develop and distribute policy management reports and dashboards as assigned by your manager.
Education & Experience Requirements
-----------------------------------



The required level of knowledge is typically acquired through completion of a Bachelor’s in Finance, Economics, Accounting, MIS or related field and 1+- years’ experience with data aggregation and analysis with tools such as R, SAS, Python, Excel/VBA, Matlab, or comparable software; data visualization and report building/automation. Knowledge of SharePoint administration and advanced functionality is preferred.
Personal Attributes
* Self-motivation, discipline, task focus, and a proven record of delivering high quality results within strict deadlines
* Well-developed oral and written communication skills to effectively represent self and BOKF, as well as ability to present complex information and issues in a clear and concise manner
* Conceptual thinking and analytical skills with the ability to analyze complex problems that include interrelationships and dependencies in order to identify common themes and solutions
* Ability to effectively plan time, method, manner and sequence of own work assignments
Working Conditions & Physical Requirements
------------------------------------------


Office - Occasional Travel
BOK Financial Corporation Group is a stable and financially strong organization that provides excellent training and development to support building the long term careers of employees. With passion, skill and partnership you can make an impact on the success of the bank, customers and your own career!  

  

Apply today and take the first step towards your next career opportunity!  

  

The companies in BOK Financial Corporation Group are equal opportunity employers. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for training, compensation, transfer, promotion and other aspects of employment for all qualified applicants and employees without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy status, sexual orientation, genetic information or veteran status.
Please contact recruiting\_coordinators@bokf.com with any questions.

description:
#WeAreONEOK – Fortune 500 company. 100+ years in business. Leading midstream service provider. Safety first. Sustainable operations. Environmentally responsible. Employee focused.

This position is hybrid.

Performs advanced level activities related to compiling, analyzing and preparing complex financial planning models and information.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities* Perform advanced level of compilation and preparation of plan and forecast information for various company departments, business segments and entities
* Analyze and/or compare actual performance to various forecasts

	+ Projections/forecasts

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
Zeeco fosters a robust work environment where employees, from engineering teams to support groups, benefit from a strong culture, trained leadership, and opportunities for growth. Zeeco collaborates with the biggest names in the industry, enabling individuals to broaden their skills alongside teams of subject matter experts.
### **Job Description:**

* Act as a liaison between Zeeco Global Headquarters and all Zeeco international entities from an accounting perspective. This will mostly be via e-mail, telephone and video conference but may involve overseas travel of one or two trips per year.
* Assist each international entity with the preparation of their annual budget and ensure completion within group deadlines.
* Preparation of departmental and actual vs. budget financial statements for international subsidiaries and ensure compliance with monthly group reporting deadlines.
* Review financial performance of each international subsidiary and obtain explanations for unusual variances.
* Translate monthly international subsidiary financial statements into USD for consolidation purposes.
* Review and assist international subsidiaries with monthly percentage of completion calculations and obtain explanations for unusual current month results on individual projects.
* Reconcile intercompany account balances with international subsidiaries and direct reconciliation process between international subsidiaries.
* Prepare consolidated schedules of international subsidiaries for the annual audit and liaise with outside auditors.
* Assist in selection of outside accounting and audit firms for international subsidiaries.
* Assist in cash disbursement approvals for international subsidiaries with no local internal accounting staff.
* Maintain working knowledge of all applicable US GAAP requirements.
* Assist in preparation and maintenance of standardized reporting package for international subsidiaries.
* Prepare templates for annual budget for all international subsidiaries and manage change control.
+ Participate and/or lead review of financial results with international entities.

### **Qualifications:**

* Excellent financial analysis experience and skill.
* Strong financial analytical skills for researching errors or variances.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills (position includes frequent communication with international personnel).
* Confidence to defend a position with logical reasoning and state position using clear, concise, and compelling reasons in an upbeat manner.
* Professional in all aspects including superior work product
* Ability to produce dependable quality work that is highly accurate.
* EXPERT spreadsheet skills are mandatory; these will have to be demonstrated by an existing spreadsheet created and operated by the candidate.
* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting required.
* Two or more years’ of experience required
* CPA or related certification a plus.


Working at Zeeco means being part of a people-centric culture and environment built on mutual respect, personal encouragement, professional integrity, and limitless opportunity. Join Zeeco and embark on a fulfilling journey where innovation, collaboration, and personal and professional growth converge.

title: Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) / Financial Analyst
description:
**FP&A - Financial Analyst**
============================


This is a great opportunity for an early career Financial Analyst who is looking for a new challenge in an established, well-respected industry leader. A publicly traded, Tulsa headquartered diversified natural resources company is looking to add a Financial Analyst to their FP&A Department. Reporting to the Director, Financial Planning and Analysis, they will work closely with finance, operations management, accounting, and senior management teams in the consolidation of annual operating plan, quarterly plan forecasts, and long-term strategic plan. They will work with finance and treasury in the compilation of debt compliance as well as periodic cash management as needed. They will also assist in compilation of budgets and financial statements for potential new acquisitions as needed. Outstanding benefits including company paid medical, 401(k) match and other generous benefits. This position is performed on site and requires that the selected candidate live in or near Tulsa, OK.


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**
------------------------------------------


### **The items listed below detail some of the assigned duties and responsibilities for this position. This is not meant to be an all-inclusive list and management reserves the right to change these duties at any time.**


* Collects and analyzes financial information for assigned accounts, products or product lines, or business units in order to track the organization's progress against financial goals.
* Reports current or expected financial performance and creates financial models to guide decision making.
* Analyzes cash flow, expenditures, revenue, depreciation, and investments to make recommendations for action and/or modifications regarding financial procedures, plans, and controls.
* Assists in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, or annual financial statements.
* Research, analyze and gather information to support various business activities, revenue and expense trends, market analysis, etc.
* Perform other ad hoc analysis as requested.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**
-------------------


* 3 - 5 years forecasting and analysis experience in either public accounting or corporate environment.
* Ability to interpret and apply financial planning and analysis methods and procedures.
* Experienced in preparing and analyzing consolidated financial statements
* Experienced in interpreting and applying generally accepted accounting principles.
* Experienced in use of software such as: Microsoft Excel, Word, Power Point, and Visual Basic
* Experienced working in a team environment.
* Ability to prioritize workload and deliverables
* Requires excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Must have excellent analytical thinking skills.

**EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION:**
--------------------------------


* Bachelor's degree in finance or accounting required

* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use a computer and a phone. The employee is regularly required to talk and hear, as well as use hands to finger, handle and feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk and occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.

title: Financial Analyst-Central Region
description:
As the Financial Analyst for the Region, you will support key stakeholders by performing a broad range of financial, analytical, and accounting support for multiple manufacturing locations in your region. You will develop, measure, and actively manage results, ensuring business and reporting needs are met. As the Financial Analyst for the Region, you will be responsible for daily/weekly/monthly accounting tasks related to the various manufacturing locations in your region as well as month-end closing activities. In addition, you will support the Regional Controller and plant leadership in understanding variances in their financial performance and any related data reconciliations.


***This position will be located in our Catoosa, Oklahoma office and will work Monday through Friday, standard office hours. A competitive salary and annual bonus are offered, including a full suite of benefits, 401k with company match, paid time off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, parental leave, sick time and more!***

* ***All candidates must be authorized to work in the United States.***

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Participate in monthly close activities by preparing recurring and non-recurring journal entries to ensure complete and accurate financial statements.
* Perform balance sheet account analysis and reconciliations.
* Analyze actual results in comparison with budget, prior year and/or forecast.
* Collaborate with Estimating, Cost Accounting and FP&A to help maximize profitability.
* Provide actionable manufacturing analysis, cost analysis and business partnering to create value.
* Assist in identifying, evaluating, and prioritizing opportunities to ensure the business is working on the right activities.
* Serve as an agent of change to help reduce costs and improve EBITDA.
* Participate in special projects related to ERP system conversions and finance process optimization initiatives.
* Assist Regional Controller with external audit requests.
* Travel to regional plants as needed, estimated between 10% - 20% annually.
* Additional duties as required.

**Requirements:**  

Education and Experience:


* Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, accounting, or other demonstrated experience
* Prior experience working in a high growth, multisite organization.


Job Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:


* Excellent analytical and conceptional thinking skills.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office, particularly in Excel.
* Demonstrates initiative, natural curiosity, and effective organizational and communication skills.
* Able to manage time efficiently, prioritize, multi-task, and adapt to change.
* Able to work cross-functionally and collaborate effectively with others.
* Able to maintain a high level of accuracy in the performance of all job duties.

title: Sr Project Financial Analyst
description:
The Senior Project Financial Analyst is a key member of the Finance and Project Team and works directly with the Project Managers to help support the project’s goals and objectives; maintain project budgets, analyze progress reported against budgets, and recommend and take action to improve progress. This individual will monitor and analyze the financial plan on assigned contracts to ensure that the Project Team and Management are informed as to status and issues which can positively or negatively impact the overall revenue and margin plans and will support the Finance Department with business planning and forecasting of results.  

  

Under the direction of the Project Managers, and in compliance with the processes and procedures established by the Project Management Procedures, prepares project analysis charts, job forecasts, labor forecasts and project completion reports. Requires the ability to execute / revise plans to attain well defined goals, and a high degree of concentration to monitor progress and put in place recovery plans when productivity falls below target. Must be capable of communicating information timely and accurately between departments, to the Project Managers, and to Senior Management.  

  

Work with the Project Team to ensure changes to the Work Scope are identified and documented if and as they occur throughout the Project’s execution. Requires advanced knowledge of Excel to create project specific worksheets for analysis of trends, problems, and forecasts.  

Essential Responsibilities:
* Provide Project financial reports and analysis including monthly Project Status Reports, Cost and Revenue Forecasts, Budget Variance Reporting, Ad-Hoc Analysis, Cashflow, etc.
* Work with the Project Team to ensure changes to Work Scope are identified and documented if and as they occur throughout the Project’s execution.
* Analyze and investigate Budget Variances and working with the Project Team identify the root cause, any lessons learned, and then recommend possible corrective actions.
* Prepare Month-end reports.
* Interface with Divisional Managers to review monthly business results and support the annual and quarterly forecast updates for Project, Resource and Overhead planning.
* Review current workflow and reports and help lead/drive process improvement and automation to completion.

Job Requirements / Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:
* Bachelor’s Degree (B.A. or B.S.), discipline in Finance/Accounting/Economics (Preferred).
* 4 – 6 years of relevant work experience, Current work experiences/Project based experience/Manufacturing or Engineering fields (Preferred).
* Master’s Degree or CPA certification (A Plus).
* Intermediate knowledge of financial and cost accounting including Project Costing, Inventory, Work in Progress and Percent Complete Revenue Recognition, etc.
* Capable of using ERP system and various other database formats and running ad-hoc queries/reports.
* Requires advanced knowledge of Excel to create project specific worksheets for analysis of trends, problems, and forecasts.

title: Financial Planning & Analysis - Senior Financial Analyst 127-2006
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:**  

The Senior Financial Analyst will embrace a strong emphasis on financial modeling and management reporting. As a key member of our finance team, they will be responsible for developing, analyzing, and presenting financial models and reports that drive strategic decision-making across the organization. In addition, the Senior Financial Analyst will be responsible for extracting insights from complex financial data, developing sophisticated financial models, and providing strategic recommendations to senior management. They will possess a deep understanding of financial analysis, advanced modeling techniques, and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey complex financial information to stakeholders at all levels.
  
  

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Financial Modeling: Develop and maintain comprehensive financial models that project the company's performance, including revenue forecasting, expense planning, and capital investment analysis. Collaborate with various departments to gather relevant data and assumptions for accurate modeling.
* Management Reporting: Prepare regular and ad-hoc financial reports for senior management, department heads, and stakeholders. These reports will include key financial metrics, variance analysis, and insights to support data-driven decision-making.
* Data Analysis and Manipulation: Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from diverse sources to generate meaningful financial insights. Employ data science techniques, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling to optimize financial strategies and enhance decision-making.
* Forecasting and Budgeting: Financial Planning and Forecasting: Collaborate with business units to develop accurate and insightful financial forecasts, highlighting risks, opportunities, and potential areas for improvement. Participate in the annual budgeting process and ensure alignment with strategic objectives. Utilize historical data, industry trends, and business drivers to ensure accurate financial projections.
* Financial Analysis: Conduct in-depth financial analysis to identify areas of improvement and opportunities for cost optimization. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze financial performance, identify risks, and recommend actionable solutions.
* Performance Analysis: Analyze financial and operational performance metrics to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement. Present findings to key stakeholders and contribute to the development of data-driven business strategies.
* Data Visualization: Present financial data and analysis in a clear, concise, and visually appealing manner. Utilize data visualization tools to enhance the understanding of financial trends and insights.
* Communication and Collaboration: Effectively communicate financial results, forecasts, and recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders. Collaborate with various teams to collect data, understand business drivers, and align financial analysis with strategic initiatives.
* Continuous Improvement: Proactively identify opportunities to enhance financial modeling processes, reporting tools, and overall efficiency within the finance department.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.
* Strong knowledge of financial principles, accounting practices, and financial statement analysis.
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create insightful reports and dashboards.
* Proficiency in financial modeling techniques in Excel. Experience with financial planning and analysis (FP&A) software is preferred.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
* Strong business acumen and the ability to translate data insights into actionable strategies.
* Effective communication and presentation skills to convey complex financial concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team and manage multiple priorities effectively.


**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field. MBA preferred.
* Proven experience (3+ years) as a Financial Analyst, with a focus on financial modeling and management reporting.


CommunityCare is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Growing An Economy With Opportunity For All

**Reports To:** Director of Economic Incentives

**Summary of Position**


The Financial Analyst will assist activities related to projects requesting incentives, supporting the proper management and oversight of project pipeline and process from initiation and underwriting, to approval, to ongoing oversight. The Financial Analyst is responsible for understanding the City of Tulsa's and the State of Oklahoma's incentive programs including but not limited to Tax Increment Financing, Downtown Development Redevelopment Fund, Affordable Housing Trust Fund, and others. They must also have knowledge and experience in financial projections, tax analysis, and loan underwriting.


The ideal candidate will understand both market-rate and "affordable" aspects of real estate development, development finance, for-profit and nonprofit finance, and general development aspects such as land acquisition, entitlement, funding sources, and financial structures.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

The Analyst is responsible for the management and financial analysis of Projects within the organization's pipeline. They are part of the deal team, engage with companies and developers, identify key drivers and project gaps and help structure solutions that ensure a project's success.


* Assist the Director of Incentives with evaluation and project application and approval process with clear communication amongst the deal team and client.
* Responsible for preparation of Loan Review Packet, including writeups, risk rating, spreads and term sheet.
* Work alongside Director and Senior Vice President, Finance & Real Estate to assist in development of incentive program guidelines, consult on potential modifications of current guidelines, etc.
* Responsible for the development and management of oversight and compliance of incentive programs and current contracts, including coordination with clients regarding contract and reporting requirements.
* Develop knowledge of local, state and federal loan programs to maximize coordination with the City of Tulsa and ODOC programs and better serve business borrowers.
* Live in, or able to relocate to Tulsa, OK within a reasonable timeframe.

**Desired Qualifications**

* A Bachelor's degree in a related field from an accredited institution is required, a Master's degree is preferred.
* Has worked in/ had exposure to real estate finance and housing development - both market-rate and affordable, development finance, for-profits and nonprofits - bringing a depth of experience in loan underwriting, loan structuring, grant programs, etc.
* Minimum of 3 year' experience in one or more of the following fields: credit analysis; real estate development; real estate finance; government incentive programs; project management, and finance.
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
* Experience with developing and managing systems and processes to manage and oversee workflow
* Ability to proactively anticipate obstacles and create solutions
* Must possess a strong work ethic, thrive in a fast-paced dynamic work environment, and do it all with a positive and proactive mindset
* Sense of humor required

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Real Estate Analyst
description:
The Real Estate Analysts will provide financial analysis to support property financing, acquisition, marketing, and leasing. They will advise our senior teams based on economic conditions, market trends, and financial situations. The Real Estate Analysts will research market trends and statistics to forecast immediate futures within the industry and determine the best use of cash according to a company's goals. They also perform due diligence and underwriting on new acquisitions. 

 **Real Estate Analyst Duties Include:**

* Analyze and evaluate development proformas and operating statements of properties being considered for development or investment to determine feasibility and valuation
* Maintain a primary focus on multifamily, mixed use - development or stabilized assets
* Assist in analysis of potential investments and preparation of detailed approval memos used to evaluate investment opportunities
* Perform due diligence research for the purchase and sale of properties
* Support program and contract management processes through the preparation and/or review of acquisition and program management documentation, briefings, white papers, reports, metrics.
* Manage and oversee lender/bank reporting, audit and compliance process on quarterly, annual or as needed basis
* Assist in writing investment memoranda or prospectus packages
* Assist in analysis of potential investments and preparation of detailed approval memos used to evaluate investment opportunities
* Work closely with other Investment team members, and external parties
* Assist in preparation of quarterly investor updates/reporting
* Perform market competitive analysis of metrics on existing competition
* Develop and analyze existing investment models with the ability to create new models
* Ability to travel occasionally

**Real Estate Analyst Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in business, economics, real estate or finance preferred Prior experience with business case development.
* One to three years of commercial real estate experience required. Multifamily experience is a requirement
* Candidate should be familiar with navigating and creating complex financial models for underwriting commercial real estate properties
* Must understand financial and accounting concepts and be able to apply concepts to financial models • Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects in a timely and thorough manner
* Requires advanced knowledge of Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Argus
* Familiarity with real estate finance as well as basic real estate operations, leasing and development concepts
* Is a critical thinker and problem solver.
* Strong time management and critical thinking skills.
* Experience with spreadsheets.
* Demonstrated negotiation and attention to detail.

title: Credit Analyst  – Job # 3258
description:
Credit Analyst – To $75K – Hybrid Remote (Tulsa, OK) – Job # 3258  
  
Who We Are**The Symicor Group is a boutique talent acquisition firm based in Lincolnshire, IL & San Antonio, TX. Our nationally unique value proposition centers around providing the very best available banking and accounting talent. In fact, most of our recruiters are former bankers or accountants themselves!****We know how to evaluate the very best banking and accounting talent available in the market. Whether you are a candidate seeking a new opportunity or a bank or company president trying to fill an essential position, The Symicor Group stands ready to deliver premium results for you.**  
The Position**Our bank client is seeking to fill a hybrid remote Credit Analyst role in the Tulsa, OK market. The successful candidate will be responsible for preparing the appropriate credit analysis and risk rating package for review.****The position includes a generous salary of up to $75K and excellent benefits package. (This is a hybrid remote position – must live in the Tulsa, OK area.)**  
**Credit Analyst responsibilities include:*** Analyzing and underwriting new business loan requests, renewals, and annual reviews for management review.
* Completing underwriting of simple credits as assigned/determined by supervisor.
* Collaborating with supervisor and Business Loan Officers to ensure all aspects of the underwriting process are completed and presented thoroughly so loans can be decisioned.
* Requesting necessary financial statements for the completion of annual reviews as assigned by supervisor.
* Assisting with contacting business clients, accountants, attorneys, or other necessary professionals to clarify questions related to the preparation of the credit analysis package as needed.
* Requesting and analyzing all necessary collateral documents and taking a proactive approach in resolving any issues.
* Performing loan audit review work as assigned.
* Completing annual reviews, assigned by supervisor, as per the requirements of the business loan policy and the dates established in the credit analysis package.
* Analyzing and studying the trends to determine the appropriate risk rating.
* Making recommendations on risk rating changes.
* Performing other duties as assigned.

  
Who Are You?**You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for an opportunity where you can pursue your interests and your passion. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but merely the starting point for your future.****You also bring the following skills and experience:*** Bachelor’s degree in business or related field.
* Five or more years of experience in a credit-based environment or financial institution.
* Course work or experience within accounting or financial analysis.
* Knowledge of business credit documentation and business collateral documents preferred.
* Ability to gain proficiency in software or systems used for credit analysis, and deposit and loan products.
* Must develop a thorough understanding of company policies and procedures as they relate to this position. Must comply with all company policies and procedures and all job-related state and federal laws and regulations.
* Must possess attention to detail, accuracy in work performed, and have the ability to multi-task while maintaining focus.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, problem-solving skills, organizational skills, and the ability to work independently as a valuable team member in a dynamic environment.
* Excellent PC skills required; must demonstrate the ability to mentor/coach other team members while completing own work at a high level.

  
**The next step is yours. Email us your current resume along with the position you are considering to:**  
**resumes@symicorgroup.com**

title: Technical Analyst - Employee Benefits
description:
Description:**WHO WE ARE**

Relation Insurance is a leading, innovative company with a strong commitment to excellence and a passion for delivering cutting-edge solutions to our clients. As a key player in the insurance market, we pride ourselves on our dynamic culture, collaborative environment, and continuous drive for success. With a rich history and a bright future ahead, we are looking for exceptional individuals to join our team and contribute to our ongoing growth and success.

  


**WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR**

The Technical Analyst will perform mathematical analyses, underwriting, marketing and renewal analyses that provides clients, teams and leadership with financial findings and conclusions. 

  


**A GLIMPSE INTO YOUR DAY**

* Design, develop and prepare accurate and timely reports and analysis, providing financial guidance and general direction for influencing clients’ decisions and the achievement of strategic goals.
* Request for Proposals (RFPs): Gather benefits information from a variety of sources (such as hard files, electronic files, the client and carriers), develop RFP template, coordinate responses from the carriers, inputs data and maintains all appropriate documentation. Prepare draft presentation to client and team leadership.
* Request, analyze and negotiate renewals for all line of coverage for Health & Welfare plans.
* Conduct plan/benefit change analysis including but not limited to self-insured feasibility, CDHP feasibility & funding analysis.
* Analyze and assist in making recommendations on client strategy and cost containment initiatives.
* Includes both detailed technical work, as well as client communication as reports and models are provided to clients.
* Assist in preparing the Rate Development Templates, RFP analysis and templates for all lines of business.
* Prepare and/or review monthly clients financial reports and plan performance monitors.
* This role will work closely with a variety of individuals including underwriting/analysts, sales, consulting, health management and leadership.
* Develop benchmarking reports by gathering health benefits data to compare a client’s plan information to other companies by industry or geography and provide results to client in appropriate format.
* Understand and demonstrate project management skills such to include: managing the quality and timeliness of client deliverables, participating in client calls and meetings as appropriate and assisting with the preparation and delivery of clear and concise client-friendly communications.
* Prepare ad-hoc reports.
* Other projects and duties as assigned.

Requirements:**WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE** 

* State Life, Accident & Health Insurance License is required and must be maintained.
* 3+ years of relevant and progressive experience or equivalent combination of education and job-related experience.
* Above average ability working with software and systems both as currently used by the Company and alternative industry standards.
* Proficient in Excel & PowerPoint.
* Based on area of expertise, demonstrated application of financial and business knowledge.
* Well-developed presentation skills to clients, within department and to project teams.
* Able to operate in a matrix environment.
* Health insurance experience preferred.
* BA/BS in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business or Statistics preferred.
* Use initiative to identify and overcome obstacles, manage through ambiguity, remain focused and highly productive.
* Work cross-functionally and at all levels as both a self-starter and in a team environment.
* Think critically, creatively, analytically, and with sound judgment to develop and provide comprehensive, in-depth financial analyses and ad hoc projects.
* Simultaneously manage multiple assignments while maintaining composure, good judgment, and commitment to deadlines.
* Think and work independently and work flexible hours as required, including out-of-town travel.
* Must have valid driver’s license, ability to travel to client sites and reliable transportation.

**WHY CHOOSE RELATION?**

* Competitive pay.
* A safe and healthy work environment provided by our robust benefit program including family health and wellness programs, 401K, employee assistance programs, paid time off, paid holidays and more.
* Career advancement and development opportunities.
* Paid training and continuing education to obtain/maintain your insurance license.

**Note:** The above is not all encompassing of the full position description. 

  


**Relation Insurance Inc.** provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

  


The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Relation, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is presented within this posting. 

  


You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: Insurance Agent
description:
Description Were looking for ambitious, entrepreneurial professionals who want to own their business and help clients prepare for lifes planned and unexpected moments with the right insurance products.  
COUNTRY Financial Insurance Agents have the opportunity and the autonomy to build a rewarding, financially stable career while enriching lives in the communities we serve.  
**The Career**Our Insurance Agents take a consultative approach to grow business with existing and prospective clients. As independent contractors, they are in business for themselves but not by themselves, and they:* **Diversify their income through our portfolio of property and casualty, life and health lines.**
* Have the flexibility to manage their schedules to balance their careers and personal interests.
* Educate clients and prospects about our products and services.
* Collaborate with COUNTRY Trust Bank Financial Advisors to inform clients of our financial products and services.
* Establish an office and build a staff.
**We Offer**COUNTRY Insurance Agents have**uncapped earning potential**without a required buy-in and:* Opportunities to earn performance-based global trips and financial rewards.
* Access to continued learning and marketing resources.
* Affiliation with our 95+ year brand heritage and family-focused culture that values authenticity, integrity, and inclusivity.
 Qualifications Successful COUNTRY Insurance Agents are from different paths, but they are all:

* Entrepreneurial, self-motivated, and goal driven.
* Strong communicators with excellent business acumen.
* Committed to building and maintaining solid connections between their efforts and their rewards.
* Focused on achieving professional success through securing clients trust.
* Passionate about making positive impacts in their communities.

**Required Qualifications**

* Property/Casualty State Insurance License\*
* Life/Health State Insurance License\*

**Preferred Experience**

* Series 6/63 licenses
* Accredited Asset Management Specialist (AAMS)
* Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA)
* Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
* Certified Financial Planner (CFP)
* Chartered Financial Consultant (ChFC)
* Bachelors Degree
* 2+ years of experience in the insurance and or financial services industry
* 5+ years of business ownership or managerial experience

\*These licenses are not required to apply; however, the candidates ability to obtain these licenses is essential when a contract decision is made. About Us COUNTRY Financial is the trade name for a collective of affiliated insurance and financial services companies. This means we have an extended family of support and a large backing.  
For nearly 100 years, COUNTRY Financial has been dedicated to helping others plan for their future while also protecting what matters most to them. What started long ago as a simple commitment on Midwest farmlands has expanded to become a FORTUNE 1000 insurance and financial services organization proudly serving 19 states.  
Our insurance agents, financial advisors, and employees remain dedicated to serving nearly one million households with our diverse range of personal and business insurance products as and financial services products. And our consistent AM Best A+ rating means we have the financial strength to keep the promises we make to our clients.  
  
COUNTRY Financial is the marketing name for the COUNTRY Financial family of affiliated companies (collectively, COUNTRY), which include COUNTRY Life Insurance Company, COUNTRY Mutual Insurance Company, and their respective subsidiaries, located in Bloomington, Illinois.  
Investment management, retirement, trust, and planning services provided by COUNTRY Trust Bank. The investment objectives, risks,charges, and expenses of an investment company should be carefully considered before investing.  
  
 This is a 1099 position. Commissions, bonuses, and incentives only. The position does not have a salary

title: Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) / Financial Analyst
description:
**FP&A - Financial Analyst**This is a great opportunity for an early career Financial Analyst who is looking for a new challenge in an established, well-respected industry leader. A publicly traded, Tulsa headquartered diversified natural resources company is looking to add a Financial Analyst to their FP&A Department. Reporting to the Director, Financial Planning and Analysis, they will work closely with finance, operations management, accounting, and senior management teams in the consolidation of annual operating plan, quarterly plan forecasts, and long-term strategic plan. They will work with finance and treasury in the compilation of debt compliance as well as periodic cash management as needed. They will also assist in compilation of budgets and financial statements for potential new acquisitions as needed. Outstanding benefits including company paid medical, 401(k) match and other generous benefits. This position is performed on site and requires that the selected candidate live in or near Tulsa, OK. 

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**  
The items listed below detail some of the assigned duties and responsibilities for this position. This is not meant to be an all-inclusive list and management reserves the right to change these duties at any time.* Collects and analyzes financial information for assigned accounts, products or product lines, or business units in order to track the organization's progress against financial goals.
* Reports current or expected financial performance and creates financial models to guide decision making.
* Analyzes cash flow, expenditures, revenue, depreciation, and investments to make recommendations for action and/or modifications regarding financial procedures, plans, and controls.
* Assists in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, or annual financial statements.
* Research, analyze and gather information to support various business activities, revenue and expense trends, market analysis, etc.
* Perform other ad hoc analysis as requested.

**QUALIFICATIONS:*** 3 - 5 years forecasting and analysis experience in either public accounting or corporate environment.
* Ability to interpret and apply financial planning and analysis methods and procedures.
* Experienced in preparing and analyzing consolidated financial statements
* Experienced in interpreting and applying generally accepted accounting principles.
* Experienced in use of software such as: Microsoft Excel, Word, Power Point, and Visual Basic
* Experienced working in a team environment.
* Ability to prioritize workload and deliverables
* Requires excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Must have excellent analytical thinking skills.

**EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION:*** Bachelor's degree in finance or accounting required

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:** The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use a computer and a phone. The employee is regularly required to talk and hear, as well as use hands to finger, handle and feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk and occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:** The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

* Normal office environment

title: Sales Analyst - Inside Sales - Altec NUECO
Operations Analyst- Regions Equipment Finance
description:
Thank you for your interest in a career at Regions. At Regions, we believe associates deserve more than just a job. We believe in offering performance-driven individuals a place where they can build a career --- a place to expect more opportunities. If you are focused on results, dedicated to quality, strength and integrity, and possess the drive to succeed, then we are your employer of choice.
  
  

Regions is dedicated to taking appropriate steps to safeguard and protect private and personally identifiable information you submit. The information that you submit will be collected and reviewed by associates, consultants, and vendors of Regions in order to evaluate your qualifications and experience for job opportunities and will not be used for marketing purposes, sold, or shared outside of Regions unless required by law. Such information will be stored in accordance with regulatory requirements and in conjunction with Regions’ Retention Schedule for a minimum of three years. You may review, modify, or update your information by visiting and logging into the careers section of the system.
  
  

**Job Description:**  

At Regions, the Equipment Finance Operations Analyst oversees the quality assurance monitoring process for all equipment leasing and financing transactions to ensure adherence with internal and regulatory requirements.
  
  

Primary Responsibilities
  
  

Oversees pre-closing quality assurance review of equipment leasing & finance loan documentation
  
  

Oversees post-closing quality assurance review of key data inputs to improve reporting accuracy
  
  

Increases level and quality of services through recommendations and development of new and improved procedures
  
  

Partners with management to improve error rate and drive operational efficiency
  
  

Ensures data integrity of documentation and adherence to internal and regulatory requirements
  
  

Creates and maintains databases and management reports; analyze and interpret data to identify anomalies, trends and opportunities for improvements
  
  

Defines user requirements and assists with user acceptance testing
  
  

May manage small projects requiring some coordination and/or contribute to task forces or project teams
  
  

This position is exempt from timekeeping requirements under the Fair Labor Standards Act and is not eligible for overtime pay.
  
  

Requirements
  
  

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related Business degree with 5 years of relevant experience or GED with 7 years of direct analyst experience.
  
  

Knowledge of InfoLease and Rapport system required
  
  

Knowledge and understanding of applicable standard practices and regulations
  
  

Strong organizational and analytical skills
  
  

**The Operations Analyst will also:**  

Oversee the OneView Client Services Paltform to include testing, training, and client resolution.
  
Oversee Lessee audit requests including quality assurance review of key data inputs to improve reporting accuracy.
  
  

Position Type Full time

title: Area Manager | Casual Theme Restaurant
description:
Job Title: Area Manager

Salary Range: $65,000- 75,000

Job Type: Full-time

  


Job Description:

We are seeking a talented and experienced Area Manager to join our team. As the Area Manager, you will be responsible for leading and directing our above store leaders towards operational excellence. This role requires a self-motivated individual with exceptional organizational skills, adaptability to change, and a creative mindset to overcome challenges while ensuring brand standards and financial success. 

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

* Engage with units and team leaders in a hands-on approach, supporting above store leadership.
* Hold all leadership accountable for upholding brand standards.
* Mentor all positions within the organization to foster engagement and success, ensuring availability for their development.
* Support, reinforce, and align decisions with the unique culture of our company.
* Understand, define, and execute the purpose, requirements, and desired results of all company programs. Lead the area in implementing these programs, including restaurant marketing, training/talent, and recruiting functions.
* Take full responsibility for the financial performance of the company, overseeing the financial analysis of individual restaurants and the district, and making recommendations for improvement. Manage all aspects of the restaurant EBITDA, including budget planning, management, and performance.
* Analyze business trends and financial data to assess and improve performance, both operationally and financially.

Qualifications:

* High School Diploma or GED required; College Degree preferred.
* Minimum of 2 years of multi-unit management experience with a proven record of success.
* Experience in an organization with clear career progression.
* Strong knowledge and skills in analyzing profit and loss statements and overall financial performance of the company.
* Proficiency in staffing with a track record of achieving results.
* Familiarity with labor laws.
* Preferred experience in local store marketing.
* Proficient in various technology systems, especially Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), Posi Touch (POS), Compeat, Restaurant 365, Hot Schedules, 7Shifts, and ability to adapt to new systems easily.

Additional Requirements:

* Must possess the ability to lead, motivate, and empower managers to achieve higher levels of performance.
* Ability to align the team with the company's culture by striking a balance between seriousness and fun.
* Capable of managing basic tasks and fiscal operations for a growing company.
* Proactive problem-solving skills in operational and personnel matters.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Ability to handle all public dealings.
* Willingness to recognize personal shortcomings and actively seek improvement.
* Proficient in setting goals, creating plans, and translating plans into action for individual restaurants and the entire district.
* Ability to measure performance objectively and subjectively, holding direct accountability to meet performance expectations.

**Benefits:**

* Profit sharing.
* Paid time off
* Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
* Long Term Incentive Plan
* Opportunities for Advancement
* Quality of life
* Equal Opportunity Employer

  


  


To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your relevant experience and qualifications. We appreciate all applications, but only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview.

  


***As part of our recruiting process, we may contact you regarding positions we feel are a good fit or engage with you via SMS text message. By clicking to submit your application, Superior Talent Source has your consent to communicate via SMS text message moving forward.***
