title: B2B Outside Sales Representative
description:
If you are confident in your abilities and would like to try something new we are looking for energetic people with 3+ year's business ownership or sales experience who would like an opportunity as an Outside Sales Rep with our company. This is a great opportunity to expand your career working with a leading business development firm.

**Responsibilities:**

* Preparing for appointments received from assistant the day prior--all travel is local and typically within a 20 mile radius of your home
* Directing 2-3 sales appointments daily with owners of small to medium sized businesses with the goal of marketing and securing Business Analysts a Survey Agreement
* Contacting Business Coordinator with feedback from appointments and sharing new business lead opportunities.
* Reviewing the day's successes and challenges with your Sales Manager, gaining sales support as appropriate-- all administrative support people have a vested interest in your success

**Requirements:**

* At least three years of business ownership experience and/or three years of face-to-face direct sales experience
* Bachelor's degree preferred but not necessary. We will consider the right experience over a degree
* Highly self-motivated and self-disciplined with ability to work effectively with little or no supervision
* Outgoing personality with expertise at developing relationships, particularly with business owners, presidents and CEO's
* Good communicator--excellent listening skills and ability to uncover the real "pain" a client might be experiencing
* Ability to begin work immediately

**\*Selected Territory Currently available in the Birmingham area**\*

**We Offer a Fantastic Benefits and Compensation Program**

* **This is a commission only position with residual income, and daily cash bonuses. $100K-$110K realistic first year earnings**
* Potential to earn high 6 figure commissions
* Comprehensive new hire and ongoing training and development
* Full benefits after 60 days of employment & 401k after 1 year
* Protected territory and pre-set appointments

**To schedule an interview  
Call 877-274-0147 Ext: 14007**

**Or forward resume**

Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Multi Craft Maintenance Technician
description:
**To troubleshoot systems and perform preventive and predictive maintenance on various equipment, while always keeping safety as a priority. Will also provide support for production and carry out the assignments and responsibilities given to them by the assembly department maintenance supervisors and team leaders.** 

**Responsible for supporting safety, quality, and productivity while adhering to KAMTEK’s plant standards and upholding the Magna Employee’s Charter.** 

**Also, maintain, troubleshoot, and provide continuous improvement suggestions resulting in minimal downtime of manufacturing equipment in the assembly area. Support installation and modification of equipment to ensure quality control requirements are met and process enhancements are realized.**

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITIONS:**

**1)** **Follow and enforce all plant safety rules and policies.** 

**2)** **Understand and promote Magna’s philosophies (Magna Operational Principles, Corporate Constitution and Employee’s Charter).**

**3)** **Follow and comply with all plant safety standards including LOTO**

**4)** **Troubleshooting, diagnosis and repair of various manufacturing equipment, including robots, PLC, controls, electrical, etc.** 

**5)** **Support continuous improvement and lean manufacturing processes**

**6)** **Effective communication with team members and other departments**

**7)** **Maintain integrity of safety devices including light curtains, safety gates, barriers, etc.**

**8)** **Assist in design and installation of new/improved manufacturing equipment, components, and processes**

**9)** **Make modifications to existing equipment as required**

**10)** **Assist in determining spare parts requirements**

**11)** **Maintain accurate documentation**

**12)** **Train operators and new team members on fixtures, control panels, etc.**

**13)** **Assist team members with running lines/presses**

**14)** **Monitor and maintain good housekeeping using 5S**

**15)** **Provide support for machine improvements**

**16)** **Ensure equipment meets NEC, OSHA, RIA, and Magna regulations**

**17)** **Perform PM inspections as required, complete with all repairs**

**18)** **Disassemble defective equipment as well as replaces defective parts, electrical, mechanical, pneumatic, etc.**

**19)** **May specialize in repairing specific manufacturing equipment, and equipment that is not specific to the manufacturing process.** 

**20)** **Use computerized or manual maintenance information systems to document the details of equipment related issues, repairs made, preventative and predictive maintenance measures taken, etc.**

**21)** **Use computerize or manual systems to facilitate root cause analysis for failures resulting in major downtime (as defined by management). Once the root cause has been identified, put measurements in place that will prevent reoccurrence within the affected business unit, as well as across the facility.** 

**22)** **Interface will all necessary production associates, production supervision, etc., to ensure issues are identified and resolved. In general, communicate with the production team.** 

**23)** **Minimize downtime by effective use of resources including response time, technical expertise, tools, spare parts and external contacts** 

**24)** **Promotes good housekeeping (5S)**

**25)** **Perform other duties as required.**

title: CPA Controller
description:
**Job Title:** CPA Controller

**Location:** Birmingham, Alabama

**Job Overview:**

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Controller to join our team. The Controller will play a critical role in overseeing the property accounting and accounts payables operations of our property management company, ensuring accurate and timely financial reporting, and compliance. This position requires a deep understanding of property accounting.

**Responsibilities:**

1. **Financial Reporting:** Prepare and analyze financial statements, income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements to ensure accuracy and compliance with GAAP.
2. **Cash Flow Management:** Monitor and manage cash flow to ensure adequate liquidity for ongoing operations and investment in new projects.
3. **Financial Analysis:** Provide financial analysis, variance analysis, and insights to senior management to support decision-making.
4. **Audit and Compliance:** Coordinate and manage external audits and ensure compliance with all relevant regulatory requirements and tax filings.
5. **Financial Strategy:** Contribute to the development and execution of the company's financial strategy, including investment analysis and funding strategies for new projects.
6. **Team Leadership:** Lead and mentor the accounting team, fostering a culture of accountability and continuous improvement.
7. **Risk Management:** Identify and mitigate financial risks and develop strategies to protect the company's assets.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field; CPA or MBA preferred.
* Minimum of 8 years of accounting experience in the real estate industry. Experience with Affordable and/or Multi-Family Housing would be optimal.
* Minimum of 5 years managing a team.
* Strong knowledge of property accounting, including property management, development, and funding.
* Proficiency in financial analysis, budgeting, and forecasting.
* Experience with property management software and financial software (e.g., Yardi, QuickBooks).
* Excellent leadership and team management skills.
* Strong communication and presentation abilities.
* Attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
* Knowledge of applicable laws, regulations, and compliance requirements in the real estate industry.

description:

 Job Description **Overview**  
  
Today, SCA Health has grown to 11,000 teammates who care for 1 million patients each year and support physician specialists holistically in many aspects of patient care. Together, our teammates create value in specialty care by aligning physicians, health plans and health systems around a common goal: delivering on the quadruple aim of high-quality outcomes and a better experience for patients and providers, all at a lower total cost of care.

As part of Optum, we participate in an integrated care delivery system that enables us to support our partners as they navigate a complex healthcare environment, Only SCA Health has a dynamic group of physician-driven, specialty care businesses that allows us to customize solutions, no matter the need or challenge:

* We connect patients to physicians in new and differentiated ways as part of Optum and with our new Specialty Management Solutions business.
* We have pioneered a physician-led, multi-site model of practice solutions that restores physician agency by aligning incentives to support growth and transition to value-based care.
* We lead the industry in value-based payment solutions through our Global 1 bundled payment convener, that provides easy predictable billing to patients.
* We help physicians address everything beyond surgical procedures, including anesthesia and ancillary service lines.

The new SCA Health represents who we are today and where we are going—and the growing career opportunities for YOU.

  
**Responsibilities**  
  
As a member of the Asset Management & Lease Accounting team, the Experienced Asset/Lease Accountant will be responsible for accurate and timely accounting and monitoring of company’s fixed assets as well as providing in-depth analytics related to fixed assets. In addition, the Experienced Accountant will be responsible for analysis of real estate & equipment leases for entry into the accounting subledger and various reconciliation and expense analysis journals related to leases. 

**Position Responsibilities:** 

* Perform various lease & asset management accounting functions within prescribed time schedules and guidelines
* Maintain subledger for fixed and intangible assets and leases, including additions, adjustments, & disposals
* Prepare and compile monthly Sub-Ledger support documentation for audit support
* Review and process capital expenditure requisitions requests
* Review lease agreements, assess appropriate accounting classification (capital vs. operating), and prepare appropriate supporting documentation
* Prepare and maintain assigned balance sheet account reconciliations, research outstanding issues and propose corrections
* Run & analyze monthly depreciation expense reports and explain material month-to-month changes in expense
* Perform month-end and year-end closing procedures for fixed and intangible Assets and leases, including various journal entries
* Assist in technical accounting and reporting research activities, such as capital vs. expense decisions
* Understand and apply relevant lease accounting guidance to agreements and transactions to ensure completeness and accuracy of center financial statements
* Assist in process improvements and automations to improve work efficiency
* Ad-hoc reporting and responses to inquiries based on requests from tax, external and internal auditors, financial operations, and various other SCA lanes
* Develop and maintain working relationships with fellow teammates and various stakeholders
* Prepare timely and accurate work product, including insightful financial statement analysis

  
**Qualifications**  
  
Total education, vocational training and experience: 

* BS in Accounting or Finance required
* 2+ year experience in corporate or public accounting
* Experience in lease accounting and/or asset management preferred but not required
* Strong quantitative, analytical, and statistical skills
* Strong interpersonal, teamwork, organizational, and time management skills
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to interact with all levels of management

Additionally, candidate should possess the ability to work in a changing, fast paced environment while displaying SCA’s values. Candidate must be able to work independently and efficiently, with acute attention to details and deadlines. Candidate should have a can-do, will-do attitude, with the ability to influence others towards positive results and actions. Candidate must demonstrate teamwork and partnership across multiple different lanes and have the ability to interact professionally with Company teammates.

 USD $58,000.00/Yr. USD $65,000.00/Yr.

title: Registered Nurse
description:
Come join the Top 12 Encompass Team in the Country!  
Excellent pay- $10,000 Sign on bonus for Night shift  
Day shift, Night Shift Full time positions and PRN positions available  
Excellent PRN rates as well  
Registered Nurse Career Ladder Opportunity  
Encompass Health: Where Nursing Meets Heart, Home and Healing  
The Registered Nurse provides direct patient care to inpatients. This position assesses patients and creates a plan of care that is individualized and is reflective of each patient's needs and goals. The Registered Nurse supervises activities of care, treatment and services of patient provided by LPN/LVNs, RNTs/CNAs, and other staff on assigned unit and shift. This position communicates information with the interdisciplinary team and reports patient concerns and changes in condition to supervisor and/or physician in a timely manner.   
Jobcode: 101644

License or Certification:  
- Current RN licensures appropriate to state regulations.   
- BLS certification (ACLS preferred).  
- CRRN certification preferred.  
Machines, Equipment Used:

- Microsoft Office software, to include Outlook, Word, and Excel.  
Physical Requirements:  
- Visual acuity, speech recognition, speech clarity.  
- Ability to lift, lower, push, pull, and retrieve objects weighing a minimum of 30 pounds including medical supplies and equipment and the transferring and repositioning of patients. Reasonable assistance may be requested when lifting, pushing, and/or pulling are undertaken which exceeds these minimum requirements.  
Skills and Abilities:  
- Oral communication, written communication, active listening. Must be able to speak and understand English.  
- Information ordering, deductive reasoning, social perceptiveness, time management, critical thinking.  
- Ability to coordinate, analyze, observe, make decisions, and meet deadlines in a detail-oriented manner.

Environmental Conditions:

title: Production Control Analyst
description:
Production Control Analyst

We have an opening for a Production Control Analyst with a stable and growing Alabama manufacturer located south of the Birmingham area.

*Salary Range is 65 to 95k and is based upon prior depth and breadth of work experience, education, and overall skill set. Strong benefit package is included.*

The Production Control Analyst plays a pivotal role in the Operations department by providing valuable data analytics to drive production efficiency and optimize resource utilization. This role requires a keen understanding of production processes, data analysis techniques, and the ability to translate insights into actionable recommendations.

Areas of responsibility will include:

• Data Analysis and Reporting

• Production Planning and Optimization

• Inventory Management

• Process Improvement Initiatives

• Cross-Functional Collaboration

Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent professional experience.
* 5+ years of dedicated experience in Production Control operations.
* Proficient understanding of production scheduling, data transmission standards, and job scripting.
* Proficient with automated scheduling tools and their administration.
* Stellar organizational, communication, and technical abilities.
* Proven capabilities in strategic planning and educational initiatives.
* Strong interpersonal skills, with the capacity to work cooperatively with business stakeholders.
* Proficient in problem analysis with a track record of effective resolution coordination.
* Deep understanding of data interconnectivity across varied business units.
* Sound knowledge of database systems and data storage structures.
* Proven ability to juggle multiple tasks with precision and attention to detail.

Please forward your resume if you are qualified and interested in the position, thank you!

title: Manager On Duty
description:
MANAGER ON DUTY -- Will need to work EVENING and WEEKEND SHIFTS!!

 

**OVERVIEW:**  
The Manager On Duty will be responsible for assisting in the oversight of gym operations to ensure the club is successful. The Manager on Duty will partner with Assistant General Managers in support of the General Manager to help lead and support a team dedicated to delivering an excellent experience and revenue growth simultaneously with an opportunity to contribute to every level of the gym's overall success, including shared oversight of all *CLUB4* operations in that assigned facility with focus on such things as providing a superior customer experience, establishing community partnerships to enhance business-to-business relationships within the community as well as to raise awareness and recognition of the organization in the community and drive membership sales.

 

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and or ability required.  
Reliable service as scheduled; significant organizational skills; an ability to lead others.

1. Assist in recruiting, hiring, training and developing a high performing staff consisting of front desk and trainers.

2. Sales duties to include making phone calls to prospective members that have been to the club or have shown interest in joining via online communications. Strong sales background helpful. Assist in maintaining a welcoming atmosphere for all members, prospective members and guests and ensuring staff follows superior customer service guidelines.

3. Assist with Staff Management and provide backup support to Club Manager as needed.

4. Assist in scheduling and supervising staff, including acting as ‘back-up’ for any absent employee

5. Assist in resolving or escalating employee issues or concerns.

6. Involved in all front desk related activities including:

· Answer phones in a friendly manner and assist callers with a variety of questions.

· Check members into the system.

· New member sign-up.

· Take prospective members on tours.

· Facilitate all member requests, issues and questions.

7. Assist in overseeing cleanliness and maintenance of facility.

8. Assist in ordering of supplies using specific budget based on club requirements.

9. Assist in tracking statistics and reports (weekly, monthly, and annually).

10. Other duties as assigned by the General or Regional Manager or Managing Partner

 

**ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:**  
The position reports directly to the General Manager and/or the Assistant General Manager in the GM’s absence, in charge of CLUB operations under the direction of an assigned Regional Manager.

 

**REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  
  
1) Knowledge, skills & abilities:**

· Hard working, goal oriented, enthusiastic, and energetic.

* Solid work ethic with strong decision-making skills
* Self-starter who takes initiative with minimal direction and supervision
* Basic computer, math, and communication skills required
* Superior customer service skills, preferably in the fitness industry
* Solid supervisory, diplomacy and listening skills
* Both detail and results-oriented with high degree of professionalism and organizational skills
* Strong communication, problem-solving, time management and analytical skills
* Strong time management skills, ability to effectively manage multiple priorities in a rapidly changing environment
* Demonstrated ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively within teams
* Possess a working knowledge of all purchasing/sales web-based programming and fitness software utilized by C4F as it relates to sales of services to members
* Must be computer proficient and well versed in Microsoft Office Suite.
* Strong track record of successfully executing on tasks and duties assigned by General Manager

title: Territory Sales Manager
description:
**SUMMARY--A Primarily Remote Position, seeking Candidates in multiple markets.**

Regional Vice President of Sales--Territory Sales Manager--Cogent Analytics

**WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:** **Charismatic, Confident, Intelligent, Motivated sales professionals with a passion for helping clients.** 

**SUMMARY--****This is an uncapped full commission opportunity after an initial 14-week period that includes a weekly guarantee.** Additionally, we offer a benefits package including 70% paid medical (for the employee), employer paid dental and vision. 401K participation is available after one year of employment. 50-75% travel role. Travel expense coverage and a rental car are provided.

**WHAT WE BELIEVE IN:** **We put the interest of our clients first. Their success is our success. Our culture is based on a code of honor, courage, wisdom, faith, perseverance, and loyalty.** **We are committed** **to** providing the necessary tools, support, continuing education, and professional development for our team members to actively pursue perfection.

**WHAT WE DO:** **We are a business management consulting firm that helps small to medium-sized businesses by providing impactful solutions that are tailored to their business needs. We offer our expertise in holistic business analysis and help to improve performance through organizational structuring, operational efficiencies, and profit engineering.**

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:** 

· Consistent and intentional communication with the highly capable outbound phone call sales team that will help fill your calendar with appointments. This team includes a “calendar lead” that helps minimize windshield time and maximize calendar efficiency.

· Current and past client relationship management.

· Professional pipeline management through CRM.

· Communication of activity results with management to identify high value opportunities.

· Punctuality with all appointments.

· Identify challenges and opportunities in the client organization. Create tangible and quantifiable wants or desires in the client’s business.

· Emotionally connect with clients and influence client behavior to effectuate change.

· Challenge the status quo that exists within client organizations and be professionally assertive to secure new client engagements.

· Embrace the sales structure provided to efficiently obtain new clients.

· Participate in departmental training sessions.

· Follow all internal department and company procedures.

**OTHER REQUIREMENTS**

· Meaningful sales experience with a proven track record of delivering results.

· Ability to communicate in English, both written and verbal.

· Ability to travel onsite to clients.

· Ability to operate remotely in a home office, with the appropriate technological equipment and capabilities.

· Valid state issued driver’s license and current auto insurance.

· Advanced computer skills with Microsoft Suite, and the ability to learn a CRM system.

· Prior business ownership. (not required, but encouraged)

· MBA or other Business Degree. (not required, but encouraged)

We value the service and commitment made by our veterans and welcome them to join our company.

It does not prescribe or restrict the work that may be assigned.*

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**About C.R. England, Inc.**

 

Founded in 1920, C.R. England, Inc. is headquartered in Salt Lake City, UT and is one of North America’s premier transportation companies. C.R. England is an industry leader in Dedicated, Over-The-Road, cross-border Mexico, and Intermodal services.

 

C.R. England has also been regularly recognized for management excellence. This year, C.R. England was recognized by *Newsweek* as one of ‘America’s Greatest Workplaces for Women’, one of only three truckload carriers to receive this recognition, and ‘America’s Greatest Workplaces for Diversity’ one of only seven truckload carriers to be so recognized. Additionally, C.R. England was honored with a ‘2020 Glassdoor Top Places to Work’ award, the ‘Achievers 50 Most Engaged Workplaces™ Award’ and by Deloitte Private and *The Wall Street Journal* as a ‘2021 US Best Managed Company’.

Committed to giving back the community, learn more about C.R. England Inc.’s goal of providing one million meals to children annually through partnerships with local food banks by visiting www.oneagainstchildhoodhunger.com.

The key responsibilities of the Finance Analyst are to provide analytical, forecasting, reporting, and project support to senior management. The ideal candidate for this role will have a strong knowledge of excel and financial modeling, enjoys problem solving and can articulate complex issues and concepts to business leadership.

**Position: Financial Analyst**

**Location: SLC, UT Corporate Office** 

**Compensation Range: $60000- $80000 (Annual Salary)**

**Shift: Monday-Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM MST**  
 

The key responsibilities of the Finance Analyst are to provide analytical, forecasting, reporting, and project support. The ideal candidate for this role will have a strong knowledge of excel and financial modeling, enjoy problem solving and can understand complex issues and concepts.

**Roles and Responsibilities**

* Maintain financial models to assist in budget planning and weekly forecasts.
* Perform monthly, quarterly, annual reporting and variance analysis.
* Provide adhoc project support.
* Assist in month end close process.
* Help identify financial opportunities and risk.
* Organize data into actionable insight.
* Work with various operations leaders to establish goals and align priorities across teams.
* Display and encourage teamwork and willingness to be a problem solver, provide excellent service to business partners.

**Education and Experience**

* Strong working knowledge of Excel and financial modeling.
* Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, or related field.
* 1-3+ years of relevant experience in corporate finance, financial planning & analysis, investment banking, or other related fields.
* Excellent analytical, decision making, and problem-solving skills.
* Attention to accuracy and detail required.
* Ability to work well in a hybrid environment (both in-office and from home)
* Microsoft-SQL skills a plus.

title: Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.

**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**

Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

**Requirements:**

* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

**Benefits:**  


* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/year**

Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: Military Service - Air Force Reserve, Operations Research Analyst
Laboratory Technician
description:
The purpose of the Laboratory (Lab) Technician role is to safely perform daily activities that support the chemical evaluation of incoming raw materials, intermediate process samples, and finished biodiesel and biodiesel by-products. The Lab Technician is responsible for laboratory-based tasks, which include sampling, testing, measuring, and recording and analyzing results. The Lab Technician is also responsible for general lab duties including, but not limited to preparing reagents, handling hazardous waste, instrument calibration, and statistical analysis of instrument performance. The Lab Technician is expected to know area and plant performance goals and metrics (such as safety, quality, production, etc.) and develop an understanding of how to positively impact these goals. Additionally, the Lab Technician may provide input on area priorities that support the achievement of production goals.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Investigate, analyze, problem solve and communicate lab information to Operations and Maintenance.
* Maintain logbook and computer documentation that support lab results and keep lab test data information and electronic files in accordance with BQ9000 requirements.
* Perform Lab Technician tasks as required by business conditions.
* Perform hourly sampling and testing of in-process samples and communicate any trending or out of spec results to Operations.
* Perform final product testing using ASTM methodologies.
* Ensure proper calibration of lab analytical instruments.
* Responsible for the proper storage of retained samples and the filing of all Certificates of Analysis.
* Participate in the execution of quality program and test plans for the laboratory.
* Perform SQC testing on analytical instruments to ensure accurate performance.
* Take necessary steps to reconcile differences in procedure and practice and update procedures whenever necessary and submit for revision.
* Follow strict Lab safety procedures and perform daily safety checks.
* Train other employees in lab tasks, skills, and other activities when directed.
* Perform other lab tasks and activities directed by the Lab Manager, Engineering & Environmental, Safety & Occupational Health, and Production Managers.
* Perform necessary housekeeping to maintain excellent building and area standards.
* Attend BQ9000 Management Review Team.
* Ensure compliance with regulatory, company policies and procedures including safety.
* May serve on an Employee Safety (Involvement) Committee.

**Qualifications**

* High School Diploma or GED required.
* Bachelor's of Science Degree in Chemistry/Biology, preferred.
* At least one [1] year work experience an in analytical laboratory.
* Knowledge of chemical plant manufacturing safe operations and procedures.
* Ability to effectively communicate with peers, supervision, and management.

 **Additional Information**

This is a full-time day, evening, or night, twelve [12] hour position that reports to the Lab Manager. This role may be required to overtime hours outside regular shift schedule to support non-routine work and plant turnarounds The Memphis biodiesel manufacturing plant operates on a seven [7] day, twenty-four [24] hour schedule.

title: BOOKKEEPER & PAYROLL CLERK
description:
The position of bookkeeping and clerk consists of performing any combination of routine calculating, posting, and verifying duties to obtain primary financial data for use in maintaining financial records.

**Bookkeeper Duties:**

**1.** Check figures, postings, and documents for correct entry, accuracy, and proper codes;

**2.** Classify, record, and summarize numerical and financial data to compile and keep financial records, using journals and ledgers or computers;

**3.** Code documents according to company procedures;

**4.** Compile statistical, financial, accounting and tables pertaining to such matters as cash receipts, expenditures, accounts payable and receivable, and profits and losses;

**5.** Comply with federal, state, and company policies, procedures, and regulations;

**6.** Debit, credit, and total accounts on computer spreadsheets and databases using specialized accounting software;

**7.** Operate 10-key calculators, typewriters, and copy machines to perform calculations and produce documents;

**8.** Operate computers programmed with accounting software to record, store, and analyze information;

**9.** Reconcile and identify all or any discrepancies found in records.

**Payroll Duties:**

 **1.** **Processing Payroll:** This is the core responsibility of a payroll clerk. They calculate employee salaries, wages, bonuses, commissions, and deductions.

**2.** **Timekeeping Management:** Managing timekeeping systems to ensure accurate recording of employee work hours, including overtime and time off.

**3.** **Data Entry:** Entering payroll data into the company's payroll system accurately and efficiently. This includes new hires, terminations, changes in salary, and other relevant information.

**4.** **Tax Compliance:** Ensuring compliance with federal, state, and local tax regulations. This includes calculating and withholding income taxes, Social Security, Medicare, and other applicable taxes.

**5.** **Payroll Reconciliation:** Reconciling payroll accounts and resolving any discrepancies or errors.

**6.** **Generating Reports:** Generating payroll reports for management, accounting, and auditing purposes. These reports may include payroll summaries, tax reports, and employee earnings statements.

**7.** **Addressing Client Inquiries:** Responding to client inquiries regarding payroll matters, including paycheck deductions, tax withholdings, and other payroll-related issues.

**8.** **Maintaining Records:** Maintaining accurate and up-to-date payroll records, including employee information, tax forms, and payroll reports.

**9.** **Confidentiality:** Maintaining confidentiality of payroll information and ensuring that sensitive employee data is handled securely and in accordance with company policies and regulations.

**Competencies:**

 **1.** **Financial Reporting**: Ability to prepare accurate and timely financial statements following relevant accounting standards (e.g., GAAP, IFRS).

**2.** **Bookkeeping:** Proficiency in maintaining financial records, including recording transactions, reconciling accounts, and managing general ledgers.

**3.** **Tax Compliance:** Knowledge of tax laws and regulations to ensure compliance with tax obligations and optimize tax strategies for the organization.

**4.** **Financial Software Proficiency:** Experience with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAGE, NexGen, etc.) and proficiency in using spreadsheets for financial analysis and reporting.

**5.** **Communication Skills:** Ability to communicate financial information effectively to co-workers, clients, and 3rd parties (banks, government agencies, etc.), both orally and in writing.

**6.** **Attention to Detail:** Strong attention to detail to ensure accuracy in financial records and reports.

**7.** **Time Management:** Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

**8.** **Ethical Standards:** Adherence to ethical principles and integrity in handling financial information and transactions.

**9.** **Dependability:** Job requires being reliable, responsible, and punctual in fulfilling obligations.

**Qualifications and Requirements:**

**1.** A minimum of 2 years of College;

**2.** A minimum of 2 years of Bookkeeping & Payroll Experience;

**3.** Experienced in QuickBooks (Desktop & Online)

**4.** Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)

title: Project Manager Residential Properties
company: Crest Core Realty and Property Management
description:
CrestCore Realty and Property Management and CityLight Commercial Services are both in the 6am CoreCollective family of companies that offer comprehensive leasing and property management services, ensuring our clients’ real estate investments are effectively managed and maximized for optimal returns.

We are seeking an entry-level Project Manager for CrestCore Realty and Property Management that will specialize in property management construction rehabs to join our team. The ideal candidate will have an initiative-taking mindset similar to a builder, coupled with strong business acumen. With a history of achieving results, the successful candidate will play a pivotal role in our organization.

RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES

People Management

* 
Facilitate weekly team meetings with direct reports to discuss project progress, address challenges, and foster collaboration.

* 
Conduct regular one-on-one meetings with direct reports to provide personalized feedback, support professional development, and address individual concerns.

* 
Maintain accessibility to the team through intercompany chat, phone, or email on a daily basis, ensuring timely responses and support.

* 
Offer training and coaching as necessary to team members, empowering them to enhance their skills and excel in their roles.

* 
Supervise the daily tasks and responsibilities of the team, providing guidance and direction to ensure efficient and effective execution of project objectives.

* 
Adhere to policy standards by promptly acknowledging emails, promoting effective communication and responsiveness within the team.


 

Project Management

* 
Oversee department profitability, ensuring alignment with profit margin objectives by analyzing Profit & Loss reports and guiding team members on enhancing job profitability.

* 
Ensure accurate billing of clients to maintain financial transparency and client satisfaction.

* 
Conduct thorough quality checks on vendor work to certify homes as ready for occupancy by new tenants, maintaining high standards of property readiness.

* 
Evaluate property rehabilitation needs and effectively communicate recommendations to property owners and vendors, facilitating efficient project planning and execution.

* 
Manage personal schedule to meet project deadlines across multiple assignments while accommodating additional requests from the team.

* 
Coordinate with supervisors, direct reports, and cross-departmental team members to streamline service delivery and ensure seamless project execution.

* 
Offer timely solutions to vendors, clients, and tenants to address project challenges and uphold client satisfaction.

* 
Attend regular meetings with team members and supervisors to foster alignment and ensure project progress.

* 
Set quarterly goals and provide progress reports to track performance against objectives, fostering accountability and continuous improvement.

* 
Assist in identifying and resolving process and procedure gaps to enhance operational efficiency and customer service excellence.

* 
Fulfill other duties as required to support departmental and organizational objectives.


 

QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS

* 
Excellent communication skills, adept at fostering effective internal and external dialogue.

* 
Capable of managing multiple projects concurrently, prioritizing tasks effectively to meet project objectives.

* 
Solution-oriented approach to problem-solving, adept at identifying and implementing effective resolutions.

* 
Displays a strong sense of ownership, taking full responsibility for all tasks and requests.

* 
Familiarity with budgeting


 

6am CoreCollective is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: General Ledger Accountant
description:
We have an **immediate staffing need** for a temp-to-perm role in our accounting department. We are seeking a ***GL Accountant*** in Germantown, TN! We are seeking Accountant level candidates with a bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Management/Administration and at least 2 years of General Ledger Accountant level experience.

Job Description:

* Applies knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) to the preparation of journal entries for posting to the general ledger, financial statements, reconciliations, and variance analysis during monthly closeout for each property within assigned portfolio.
* Reviews financial statements for accuracy and prepares all necessary accruals, amortizations, and reclassifications to complete the final monthly close package to ensure compliance with GAAP standards.
* Analyzes balance sheet accounts to ensure accuracy; prepares balance sheet reconciliations with detailed explanations of account balances.
* Analyzes monthly utility expenses for completeness by making all necessary accruals/adjustments and by providing detailed variance explanations.
* Reconciles current month cash receipts; prepares cash reconciliations for each property balancing current month cash balances with supporting bank documents.
* Participates in peer review process of work products for quality assurance, including close packages, to ensure completion, accuracy, and timely release to internal and external customers.
* Reviews and responds to requests from Operations regarding various property accounting issues and implements corrective actions to resolve.
* Participates in general ledger project teams with internal peers and/or external resources.
* Assists with completing SOX testing as required by the Internal Audit Department.
* Performs other related duties as assigned to meet the needs of the business

**Skills and qualifications:**

* Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Management/Administration, or similar required.
* Minimum 2 years of General Ledger Accountant level experience required.
* Proficiency in general ledger, financial statements, cash reconciliations, accruals, prepaid amortizations, and excel experience required.

**Preferred Experience:**

* Background in property accounting or real estate accounting experience is a plus.

title: DT&A Business Analyst, Cotton Platform
description:
Company Description  
  
Louis Dreyfus Company is a leading merchant and processor of agricultural goods. Our activities span the entire value chain from farm to fork, across a broad range of business lines, we leverage our global reach and extensive asset network to serve our customers and consumers around the world. Structured as a matrix organization of six geographical regions and ten platforms, Louis Dreyfus Company is active in over 100 countries and employs approximately 17,000 people globally.

Job Description  
  
**RESPONSIBILITIES**

• Analysis of As Is and To Be: Support and contribute to the documentation of as is and to be processes and describe the changes required to migrate to the to be capability to record accurately the change required.  
 • Business Requirements Identification: Collect business requirements using a variety of methods such as interviews document analysis workshops and workflow analysis to express the requirements in terms of target user roles and goals.  
 • Requirements Management: Identify elicit and document project/process requirements using appropriate modeling technique if required. Analyze requirements and validate with original users eliminating confusion. Define the testing scripts and verification criteria to ensure requirements are met. Maintain documentation and traceability throughout project.  
 • Documentation and Back up: Draft and maintain basic technical and/or user documentation to a high standard and create backup files to ensure instant recovery if problems occur.  
 • Application Software Development: Contribute to development of existing and new applications by analyzing and identifying areas for modification and improvement. Contribute to development of new applications to meet customer requirements.  
 • Quality Testing: Carry out a specified range of complex tests; interpret test data to verify that specifications are met and/or to identify remedial actions required to ensure conformance.  
 • Personal Capability Building: Develop own capabilities by participating in assessment and development planning activities as well as formal and informal training and coaching. Develop and maintain an understanding of relevant technology external regulation and industry best practices through ongoing education attending conferences and reading specialist media.  
 • Data Collection and Analysis: Collate and analyze data using pre-set tools methods and formats. Involves working independently.  
 • Horizon Scanning: Explore and develop a basic understanding of external developments or emerging issues.

**BEHAVIOUR COMPETENCIES**

• Manages Complexity: Makes sense of complex high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems. For example looks at complex issues from multiple angles; explores issues to uncover underlying issues and root causes; sees the main consequences and implications of different options.  
 • Optimizes Work Processes: Knows the most effective and efficient processes to get things done with a focus on continuous improvement. For example uses metrics and benchmarks to monitor accuracy and quality. Takes steps to make methods productive and efficient. Promptly and effectively addresses process breakdowns.  
 • Ensures Accountability: Holds self and others accountable to meet commitments. For example accepts responsibility for own work both successes and failures. Handles fair share and does not make excuses for problems. Usually meets commitments to others.  
 • Plans and Aligns: Plans and prioritizes work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals. For example outlines clear plans that put actions in a logical sequence; conveys some time frames. Aligns own work with relevant workgroups. Takes some steps to reduce bottlenecks and speed up the work.  
 • Action Oriented: Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency high energy and enthusiasm. For example takes timely action on important or difficult issues. Identifies and pursues new opportunities that benefit the organization.  
 • Cultivates Innovation: Creates new and better ways for the organization to be successful. For example demonstrates openness to new ideas and ways of looking at things; suggests new and useful ideas or solutions. Learns innovative methods tools and technology and applies them to work tasks.

**SKILLS**

• Assessment  
 • Data Collection and Analysis  
 • Action Planning  
 • Application Development  
 • Computer Skills  
 • Perform Gap Analysis  
 • Planning and Organizing  
 • Analyze Current State/AS-IS State  
 • Architecture  
 • Business Data Modeling  
 • Business Requirements Analysis  
 • Compliance Management  
 • Customer and Market Analysis  
 • Data Control  
 • Database Administration  
 • Define Future State/TO-BE State  
 • Document and Model User Requirements  
 • Policy and procedures  
 • Project Change Management  
 • Project Quality Management  
 • Project Scope Management  
 • Project Testing  
 • Requirements Elicitation and Facilitation  
 • Requirements Traceability and Management  
 • Validate Requirements  
 • Verify Requirements

Qualifications  
  
**Education/Professional** Certifications/Licenses

* 1 year minimum as a Business Analyst, 2 years preferred
* Degree in a Finance-related discipline preferred

  
  
Additional Information  
  
**Experience**

* 1 to 2 years of experience working as Business Analyst in a Finance-related area
* Good knowledge of key financial processes and best practice
* Commodities trading, inventory or logistics experience an advantage
* Understanding of Project Management methodology and best practices
* Good Microsoft Visio and Excel skills
* Business Analysis Certification a strong advantage

**Knowledge/Skills/Abilities** *(including any physical demands)*

* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively at all levels
* Ability to work in fast-paced, reactive, and challenging trading environments
* Ability to manage own time and workload
* Ability to own a task and deliver to required timelines
* Ability to anticipate issues and suggest resolutions

**Decision Making/Accountability**

Analyzes back-office business systems and integration processes; devises/conducts gap analysis surveys and documents operational specifications requirements; reviews systems and makes recommendations for customization based on knowledge of relevant business processes; recommends procedural changes to operational personnel and management as deemed necessary.

**What We Offer**

We provide a dynamic and stimulating international environment, which will stretch and develop your abilities and channel your skills and expertise with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.

- Comprehensive benefits program including medical, dental and vision care coverage, flexible spending account plans, employee assistance program, life insurance and disability coverage  
 - 401k with Company Match  
 - Family Friendly Benefits including childbirth and parental leave, fertility and family building benefits  
 - Paid Time Off (PTO) and Paid Holidays  
 - Hybrid work available (not applicable to all roles)

**Diversity & Inclusion**  
  
 LDC is driven by a set of shared values and high ethical standards, with diversity and inclusion being part of our DNA. LDC is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion.  
  
 LDC encourages diversity, supports local communities and environmental initiatives. We encourage people of all backgrounds to apply.

**Equal employment opportunity (EEO)**

Louis Dreyfus Company provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

**Sustainability**  
  
 Sustainable value is at the heart of our purpose as a company.  
  
 We are passionate about creating fair and sustainable value, both for our business and for other value chain stakeholders: our people, our business partners, the communities we touch and the environment around us

title: Consultant - Business Operations / Management
description:
**Business Operations Consultant/Project Director**

*Design, build, implement, train and evaluate customized solutions and advice that assist organizations in improving productivity and increasing revenues, and that positively impact overall performance. Solution implementation will encompass business development, organizational engineering, process management and financial systems. The Project Director is responsible for the client relationship from the origination of the opportunity to the evaluation of the effectiveness of the completed body of work. Responsibilities include client financial improvement, client relationship management and project management.* 

**Position Description**

**This position provides an outstanding opportunity to work with clients, to help them improve their operational and financial efficiencies and success. This position requires 100% travel.** 

**JOB PURPOSE** 

*Design, build, implement, train and evaluate customized solutions and advice that assist organizations in improving productivity and increasing revenues, and that positively impact overall performance. Solution implementation will encompass business development, organizational engineering, process management and financial systems.*

**QUALIFICATIONS** 

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**COMPENSATION EXPECTATIONS:**

**135 - 145K+**

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

1. Deliver quantifiable and sustainable value for clients that are reflected through the income statement, balance sheet, cash flow, as well as quality of life. This is achieved through the successful development, implementation, training and evaluation of solutions to client challenges.
2. Oversee the identification and communication of work to be completed on behalf of the client. Responsible for clear and concise communication with assigned Assistant Director or Sr. Project Director.

**OTHER REQUIREMENTS**

1. ***Ability to travel onsite with clients (100% travel requirement).***
2. Authorized to work in the United States.
3. Minimum of four years of consulting experience with a proven track record of delivering value for clients.
4. Administrative duties completed in a timely and accurate manner.
5. Ability to communicate in English, both written and verbal.
6. Valid state issued driver’s license and current auto insurance.
7. Advanced computer skills (Microsoft Suite, financial software, dashboards, CRM’s and PM software)
8. Proven fiduciary responsibility, successfully managing a budget of 10M+, preferred.
9. Prior business ownership, preferred.

**COMPETENCIES REQUIRED**

* **Problem Solving** – Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; develops alternative solutions; uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.
* **Change Management** – Communicates changes effectively and builds broad consensus; monitors transition and evaluates results.
* **Leadership** – Exhibits confidence in self and others; inspires and motivates others to perform well; accepts feedback from others
* **Judgement** – Displays willingness to make decisions; supports and explains reasoning for decisions. Gains trust of peers and leadership through sound decision making.
* **Results Driven** – Serious about committing and getting to results. Exemplifies this ability through sound decision-making, backed by logic, understanding contingency planning, with an attitude toward appropriate prioritization and effort.
* **People Orientated** – Possess a high EQ and readily able to connect and build relationships with clients, their staff and Cogent team members.
* **Conflict Management –** Empathetic and able to see all perspectives; graciously communicates differing points of view to build understanding; finds agreeable, forward-looking, and policy-aligned solutions to resolve conflicts others would see as irreconcilable.

**CULTURAL EXPECTATIONS**

Given the unique nature of the company and our strong focus on integrity and values, these cultural components of how we operate will be expected:

1. Cogent Analytics strives to always put our clients first, choosing to do what is in their best interest even if that choice may not be the easy or popular path.
2. Cogent Analytics maintains the highest professional standards and pledges to operate with integrity and honesty in all that we endeavor to do.
3. We believe in a collaborative environment between the administrative staff, Leadership (AD and MD) and Project Directors.
4. We understand and embrace the “Obligation to Challenge”, realizing that the status quo can be improved upon based on our unique and diverse capabilities and insights.
5. We embrace diversity realizing the benefit of working together and sharing individual exceptional insights to the group. Through these insights discovered in the pursuit of solving problems we will improve results both for our clients and ourselves.

We value the service and commitment made by our veterans and welcome them to join our company.

*This job description is intended to describe the general nature, complexity, and level of work to be performed by team member assigned to this position and is not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and/or skills required. It does not prescribe or restrict the work that may be assigned.* 

*We are an equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to our team and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: AP Specialist
description:
As an Accounts Payable Specialist, your primary responsibility is to manage accounts by processing all invoices received for payment and for undertaking the payment of all creditors in an accurate, efficient and timely manner. Must be able to maintain the confidential nature of the position.

**Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities**

 

* Reconciles processed work by verifying entries and comparing system reports to balances.
* Maintains subsidiary accounts by verifying, allocating, and posting transactions.
* Verifies vendor accounts by reconciling monthly statements and related transactions
* Prepares financial reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing account information and trends.
* Complies with federal, state, and local legal requirements: enforcing adherence to requirements; filing reports; and advising management on needed actions.
* Charges expenses to accounts and cost centers by analyzing invoice/expense reports recording entries.
* Audit and process credit card bills.
* Pays vendors by monitoring available discounts, verifying federal ID numbers, scheduling and preparing checks, resolving contract, invoice or payment discrepancies and documentation. Ensures credit is received for outstanding memos.
* Address and respond to vendor inquires.
* Reviews, investigates and corrects errors and inconsistencies in financial entries, documents and reports.
* Takes ownership of assigned projects to ensure superior customer service and reduce company delinquencies.
* Meets individual and unit performance goals for A/P Clerk as defined by management.
* Perform other duties as assigned by management.

**Requirements**

 

* High School Diploma; associate degree in accounting preferred.
* Two to four years of related and appropriate experience with attention to detail.
* Must be highly skilled at problem solving and dealing with complex situations.
* Well-developed business software skills required, preferable Excel and Word, and experience in Peachtree/Sage and Advantage Software.
* Prior QuickBooks experience a plus.
* Strong organizational skills
* Proficient in Microsoft Office

**Soft Skills**

 

* Must be detail-oriented, resourceful, and possess excellent time-management skills with ability to multi-task on numerous projects in a fast-paced environment
* Must be able to handle sensitive and confidential situations and have the ability to interface with people at varying levels of seniority both internally and externally
* Proven interpersonal skills that build effective relationships with team members in a manner that fosters an environment of integrity and trust
* Ability to communicate clearly through verbal, written, and face-to-face methods
* Ability to work well independently and in a team environment

title: Business Analyst
description:
**About Us:**  
 Perfict Global is a leading IT consulting services provider focused on providing innovative and successful business workforce solutions to Fortune 500 companies. Our trained and experienced professionals constantly strive to bring together the best technologies available to manage client's complex business and technology, participate in implementation activities and collaborate in new ways to meet client needs.  
  
 We provide excellent benefits such as Medical, Dental, Vision ++ a fun company to work!!!  
  
 **Job description:** We are looking for a Business Analyst with at least 6+ years of IT experience.

 **Top**   **Desired Experience:**  
 " Ability to determine which features people will use the most and help the team implement those features.  
 " Ability to gather and document user requirements and write test cases to meet those requirements.  
 " Combination of technical and social skills.  
 " Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking.  
 " Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing.  
 " Experience in generating process documentation and procedures and presenting to stakeholders  
 " Previous experience in Business / Systems Analysis  
 " Ability to work independently and as part of a group.

 This team is responsible for Client Dataworks overarching tooling strategy and initiatives tracking tech spend mgmt. They look at Dataworks third party software for employees to use internally whether that's slack, MS Teams, individual dev environments, tools that finance/AR use to do their jobs, etc. and understand how they use the software, should they keep or retire, or use a new one. They also provide strategy for third party software purchases.  
 They have about 150 diff tools and have already dwindled that down to 76. Their leadership is asking to get an overall breakdown on spend for the 76 remaining tools.  
  
 Client Data Works is looking for a Business Analyst will work closely with stakeholders to identify business needs, problems, and opportunities, and then develop solutions that help the organization achieve its goals. The business analyst will be responsible for gathering and analyzing data, documenting business processes, building use cases, developing requirement, and identifying areas for improvement. The business analyst will work with cross-functional teams to develop and implement solutions, analyzing the potential impact of the recommendations and will be responsible for ensuring that solutions meet the needs of the business and add value.

 **Job Duties/ Responsibilities:**  
 " Work with stakeholders to identify business needs, problems, and opportunities.  
 " Gather and analyze data to identify trends and patterns while documenting business process and identify areas for improvement.  
 " Develop and implement timely solutions to meet business needs and requirements. Timely communication to stakeholders on progress and develop solution requirements. Develop roll-out plans.  
 " Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of solutions and make recommendations for enhancements.  
 " Provide training and support to end-users to ensure that they are able to use solutions.  
 " Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices to ensure that solutions are innovative and fit for purpose.

title: Associate Financial Advisor
description:
**Associate Financial Advisor  
Location**: Memphis, TN  
**Compensation**: $90,000 - $100,000  
**Status**: Full-time  
  
The best and brightest in the financial advisory industry always have choices in the wealth management arena. Working with us is an investment in your future that will reap rewards for years to come.  
  
We are a close, tightly knit team that works collaboratively to bring our values to life each day: hard work, humility, optimism, responsiveness, and doing whatever needs to be done to make things right. Our office is committed to delivering high-quality, high-touch experiences to our clients so that, no matter whom they work with, clients know that they are receiving our utmost attention. Being their advocate is the highest honor for us!  
  
We are excited to have an opportunity to welcome a **Associate Financial Advisor** to our team! If you love solving problems, we would love to hear from you. We enjoy sharing what we have learned over the years while embracing the unique points of view that new teammates bring to the table. The attributes that we look for in teammates include:

 

* Insistent attention to detail and follow-through
* Strong team player
* Self-management
* Commitment to exceeding client expectations
* Careful listening skills
* Client first mentality
* High ethical standards
* Consistently providing high quality work
* Ability to work autonomously within an area of responsibility, as well as collaboratively to contribute to the overall client experience
* Flexibility and openness to work on varied assignments with people across the firm
* Ability to learn quickly and improve upon established processes
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, quickly connecting with others to build relationships within the firm and across our client base
* Ability to convey complex planning issues to clients in easy-to-understand language
* Drive with a desire to be a long-term contributing member of the team
* Growth-oriented: holding a long view of the opportunities presented by the firm and the industry overall

  
**Get in touch today** so that we can get to know you! You will work with some of the most successful business owners, families, and individuals around. You will provide life-changing support to clients who look to us as advocates for their hopes and dreams. Utilizing best-in-class resources and technology, you will roll up your sleeves and work in collaboration with a senior advisor to tackle complex financial, estate, and tax planning situations and deliver an experience to clients that is second to none.  
  
Interested in more details? As a **Associate Financial Advisor**, you can expect to:

 

 

* 
+ Work alongside a lead advisor to learn about our clients, processes, and value proposition
+ Prepare for and attend client meetings by running reports, creating financial plans (both initial and updated), utilizing Holistiplan and reviewing prior notes
+ Provide service to a subset of the lead advisor’s client base after introductions are made; service additional clients may be identified in the future
+ Demonstrate the ability to communicate with clients in terms that they understand, minimizing use of jargon or technical terminology
+ Participate and listen carefully in client and planning meetings and translate the discussions into a strategy for data collection and analysis to help drive financial planning efforts; calculate projections; Take notes in meetings, complete follow up, and correspond with clients
+ Interview clients about their attitudes, financial constraints, and goals; identify and clarify client needs; review statements provided by clients
+ Continuously stay in relationship with clients and understand their unique circumstances, connections, talents, interests, etc.
+ Field calls and prepare for review meetings (reviewing notes, updating plans, determining contributors/detractors to portfolio performance, etc.) for all lead advisor’s clients.
+ Meet with clients to review paperwork; ensure all required forms are completed accurately and answer client requests in an appropriate time frame
+ Support teammates in the financial planning process
+ Create personal financial statements
- Conduct monthly/quarterly/ad hoc client reporting

+ Generate reports, such as position statements, for meetings with clients
+ Organize data
+ Conduct research as requested
+ Complete accurate financial plans in Right Capital and MoneyGuidePro; utilize Holistiplan as needed for tax planning needs
+ Perform complex analysis of planning strategies, risks, and opportunities in the areas of retirement planning, tax planning, estate planning, cash flow planning, asset allocation, asset protection, etc.
+ Develop client deliverables and reports in a timely, accurate, and informative manner

* Respond to client service needs throughout the year
* Research new products and services that will enhance client relationships or fulfill clients’ short- and long-term financial needs; conduct research
+ Stay current on trends in the financial planning area; read trade journals, books, and other publications. A premium subscription to www.kitces.com will be provided.
+ Recommend new or updated tools and resources to keep the firm on the cutting edge (e.g. regarding customer relationship management, trading models, etc.)
+ Draft letters as needed
+ Assist with workflow needs in the office:
- Maintain updated client contact records using CRM software
- Follow up on outstanding transactions with our custodian Commonwealth/NFS (e.g., transfers)
- Maintain up-to-date and organized client files, making sure documents are in the correct folder on the shared hard drive and also uploaded and shared with clients in the client portal.

  
Qualifications for this role include:

 

* Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline
* CFP®, designations a bonus; pursuit of the CFP designation is a job requirement
* Minimum of one year of experience as a financial planner in the financial services industry; experience working with Fidelity processes and forms a plus
* Series 65 required
* Strong understanding of financial planning concepts and terminology
+ Knowledge of mutual fund, stock, bond, insurance, and annuity products
+ Exposure to estate planning issues, tax loss harvesting and asset positioning

* Excellent people skills, including:
+ Active listening
+ Effective communication
+ Professional, knowledgeable demeanor

* Ability to establish rapport with clients and coworkers
* Attention to detail
* Lifelong learner/deep desire to grow and learn
* Genuine interest in helping people
* Self-confidence; able to act decisively and humility to accept feedback.
* Ability to:
+ Proofread and quality check own work in accordance with firm criteria
+ Proactively relate internal concerns to lead advisor
+ Identify and solve problems in a timely, efficient, and effective manner
+ Use resources available to answer questions and resolve problems (e.g., COMMunity Link, operations manual, office procedures, etc.)
+ Use multiple technology platforms (e.g., CRM system and Right Capital, etc.) Proficiency with computer software, including the Microsoft Office Suite (Excel and Word), Right Capital, Holistiplan and CRM
+ Prioritize workload and meet deadlines
+ Work independently
+ Keep lead advisor updated on all client information via Trello or email

* Demonstrated job stability and career progression

  
Successful candidates will be supported in their career progression. For example, an Associate Financial Advisor who wants to become a Lead Financial Advisor will be provided with training and mentoring to help them move into a lead position. They will have opportunities to Senior Financial Advisor/Partner as they master increasing levels of responsibility in the organization. Your commitment to our firm will be reciprocated by our investment in you and your future!  
  
**We welcome a diverse pool of applicants from various backgrounds and urge you to apply to learn more about what we offer and see if it might be an attractive fit for both of us and you. We look forward to meeting you!  
  
#ZR**
