title: Financial Planning & Analysis Manager
description:
**Financial Planning & Analysis Manager**

**Department:** Accounting

**Location:** 1500 Expo Parkway

**Reports to:** Chief Financial Officer

**Status:** Full-Time

**FLSA:** Exempt  
 

 

**Organization Information**

WellSpace Health believes that everyone deserves to be seen, no matter who you are, where you come from, where you work or what place you call home. We see you and are here for you. To that end, we’ve committed ourselves to finding solutions for our community’s health and wellbeing to achieve regional health through high quality comprehensive care.

 

Our focus has always been to offer a full range of quality medical care, dental care, mental health and behavioral health services, and enabling services to underserved people. We do this by placing ourselves within the communities we serve and employing outstanding healthcare professionals who are devoted to our mission.

 

We are a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) and are accredited by the Joint Commission for Ambulatory Care and Behavioral Health. We’re also certified by the Joint Commission as a Primary Care Medical Home and a Behavioral Health Home.

 

**Position Summary**

The Financial Planning & Analysis Manager will play a crucial role in providing financial insights and analysis to support WellSpace Health’s strategic decisions. This position will be responsible for overseeing budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and business strategic analysis, along with developing dashboards for management and ensuring the accuracy and effectiveness of financial models.

 

**Required Qualifications** 

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in financial planning and analysis, with at least 2 years in a management role.
* Strong understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).
* Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills with a deep understanding of financial modeling, budgeting, and forecasting.
* Proficient in financial planning software such as Workday Adaptive Insights is preferred.
* Intermediate to advance skills in Microsft Office software applications (Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint).
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to present complex financial information in a clear and concise manner.
* Strong leadership skills with experience managing a team.
* Ability to work under pressure, meet tight deadlines, and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
* High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results-orientation.
* Commitment to HIPAA and ability to abide by standards of professional ethics and maintain confidentiality.
* Adherence to infection control procedures, including but not limited to, standard precautions of temperature monitoring, hand washing, symptom self-monitoring, masking and social distancing.
* Assist and support the Center/Department/Program to meet standards of High Reliability.

 

**Essential Responsibilities** 

* Develop and execute the company's financial planning process, including annual budgets, forecasts, and long-range strategic plans.
* Analyze current and past financial data and performance to make recommendations on profit enhancement.
* Conduct variance analysis between actuals, forecasts, and budget, explaining the causes of differentials.
* Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual management reporting that provides insights into the company’s financial performance.
* Collaborate with various department heads to create financial models for decision support and track the financial viability of strategic initiatives.
* Enhance financial and operational decision-making by developing dashboards and providing key financial indicators and performance metrics for management and board reporting.
* Lead the financial modeling and analysis to support the development of long-term strategic initiatives and business plans.
* Ensure financial models are accurate and updated to reflect the latest assumptions and financial information.
* Participate in the capital budgeting process, assessing investment opportunities and their financial impacts.
* Manage and mentor a team of financial analysts, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and professional development.
* Stay abreast of industry trends and regulatory changes that may affect the financial landscape.
* Develop robust models on trends, key business drivers, and financial results to prioritize & plan investment decisions in collaboration with senior management.
* Implement processes to enhance cost tracking, including greater visibility into spend and streamlined reporting.
* Oversee and administer financial analytical software tools for budgeting, forecasting, and analysis.
* Support the CFO or his/her designee in the analysis, interpretation, and monitoring of financial requirements for finance, analysis for labor negotiations, participating in ad hoc projects as needed.
* Establish policies, procedures, and direction for the continuous improvement of financial operations, including increased use of technology.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.

 

**Benefits**

Successful candidate will receive regionally competitive salary, above average health benefits at reduced costs, company paid life insurance & long-term disability insurance, additional voluntary retirement plan with company match and no vesting schedule requirement.

* Paid bereavement and jury duty leave
* 11 paid holidays per year
* Paid time off
* Paid sick leave
* Flexible Spending Program
* Company paid malpractice insurance for all providers
* Professional development hours offered annually

 

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**

The work environment is characteristic of a medical clinic environment. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; use hands to handle, or feel. The employee is also required to stand; walk; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The employee must also possess hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the phone. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.

 

The employee may be in contact with individuals and families in crisis who may be ill, using substances and/or not attentive to personal health and safety for themselves or their homes. The employee may experience a number of unpleasant sensory demands associated with the client’s use of alcohol and drugs, and the lack of personal care. The employee may also be exposed to bodily fluids (blood, urine) and hazardous chemicals.

 

WellSpace Health is committed to the principals of equal employment. We are committed to complying with all federal, state, and local laws providing equal employment opportunities, and all other employment laws and regulations. It is the intent of WellSpace Health to maintain a work environment free of harassment, discrimination, or retaliation because of age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and/or related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state or local laws. WellSpace Health is dedicated to the fulfillment of this policy in regard to all aspects of employment, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, placement transfer, training, promotion, rates of pay, and other compensation, termination, and all other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment.

 

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

WellSpace Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Compensation Analyst -Hybrid
description:
We're looking for an **HR Compensation Analyst** in the Sacramento area, that will be responsible for establishing bench salary marks by utilizing established data resources, ensuring competitive pay structures, and evaluating current positions.   
  
**Details:**   
• Pay: $38 hourly  
• Hybrid Schedule (2 remote, 2 onsite)  
• Monday-Friday 8am-5pm  
• 6 month Contract role with the possibility of hire  
• 3-5 years’ experience of dedicated compensation experience is a MUST!  
  
 

**GENERAL DESCRIPTION:**   
The Compensation Analyst will assist in administering the Company’s compensation and performance management programs and provide analytical support and technical expertise to the Human Resources department. Supports analysis of compensation programs and practices and recommends solutions to ensure programs are competitively and consistently administered in compliance with all applicable regulations.  
  
**TASKS, DUTIES, FUNCTIONS:** 

* Administer compensation programs for the Company including the development and management of base salary ranges and incentive programs for the Company’s various business lines.
* Maintains competitive structures and conducts on-going analysis to ensure overall competitiveness and consistent approach to pay decisions for all levels across the organization.
* Participate in various annual compensation surveys to stay abreast of market trends and ensure compliance with regulations.
* Works with managers and HR team members to create or update job descriptions as needed.
* Conduct job evaluations and participate in FLSA job evaluation reviews to determine exemption status and recommend grade assignments.
* Support the Company’s annual performance and compensation review process.
* Partner with leadership and vendor to administer the Company’s annual employee engagement survey. Schedule employee communications, track progress and create participation and rating reports for management.
* Prepare analysis related to salary/bonus budgets, pay equity, etc.
* As needed, provide analytical support in the form of ad hoc reports, dashboards, and trended graphs for all areas of Human Resources to assist in understanding trends and root causes.
* Identify and participate in continuous operational improvement initiatives.
* Partner with leadership and provide Human Resources subject matter expertise and analytical support to all divisions.
* Maintain a thorough understanding of state and federal laws and regulations related to credit union compliance including bank secrecy and anti-money laundering laws appropriate to the position.
* Supports other projects as assigned.

  
**PHYSICAL SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND EXERTION UTILIZED IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THESE TASKS:** 

* Effective oral and written communication skills required to manipulate and analyze data into meaningful actionable items.
* Must possess sufficient manual dexterity to skillfully operate an on-line computer terminal and other standard office equipment, such as financial calculators, personal computer, facsimile machine, and telephone.

  
**ORGANIZATIONAL CONTACTS & RELATIONSHIPS:**

* INTERNAL: All levels of staff and management.
* EXTERNAL: Vendors, HR professionals in other financial services organizations.

  
**QUALIFICATIONS:**   
  
**EDUCATION:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, General Business, Communications, or related field preferred.

**EXPERIENCE:**

* Minimum three years’ experience in Human Resources.
* Knowledge of compensation theories and practices.
* Experience in the analysis and reporting of statistical data within a Human Capital Management system or similar relational database preferred.

**KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:**

* Ability to analyze complex problems, evaluate alternatives and make sound, appropriate recommendations.
* Ability to exercise sound independent judgment and initiative within established guidelines.
* Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Familiarity with relational databases and data tables (MS Access, SQL derived HCM databases).

  
**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:**   
• Prolonged sitting throughout the workday with occasional mobility required.   
• Corrected vision within the normal range.   
• Hearing within normal range. A device to enhance hearing will be provided if needed.   
• Occasional movements throughout the department daily to interact with staff, accomplish tasks, etc.   
  
**LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS:**   
None. Human Resources Professional Certification or Certified CompensationProfessional (CCP) desirable.

 

***To find out more, apply and schedule an interview with a recruiter today!***

 

*Wollborg Michelson Recruiting does require all applicants to be able to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated from COVID prior to their start date, unless otherwise prohibited by law. Wollborg Michelson Recruiting is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination of any kind. We ensure job offers are made based of one’s employment experience, skills, and qualifications, regardless of race, gender, ethnic origin, or any other classification protected by law. All applicants must furnish proper identification to prove their legal right to work in the US upon a job offer. We participate in E-Verify to confirm one’s right to work in the US. Wollborg Michelson Recruiting does not provide sponsorship for an employment-based visa status.*

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
Are you skilled at synthesizing complex financial data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in environments that require strategic thinking and meticulous attention to detail? Are you passionate about leveraging financial analysis to drive strategic decision-making? If you're nodding along, then we're excited to introduce a brand-new opportunity at our firm for a **Senior Financial Analyst**. This pivotal role will involve developing and maintaining comprehensive data libraries that span all facets of our business, providing the foundation for deep analytical assessments to guide strategic choices.  
  
Your primary responsibilities will include offering analytical support for various financial operations and contributing significantly to our planning, budgeting, and forecasting endeavors. You'll be instrumental in monitoring our financial performance and key metrics, conducting thorough financial reviews, and playing a vital role in our strategic planning efforts. We're looking for someone with a robust financial background, seasoned in budgeting and financial analysis, who is proactive and capable of autonomously discovering and delving into areas ripe for detailed exploration, beyond merely executing assigned tasks.  
  
This position isn't about traditional accounting; it's about adopting a forward-thinking stance on financial strategy and planning. It's a chance to step into a newly created role, where you'll have the freedom and responsibility to shape and evolve your position to maximize its impact on our firm. Join us and be a key player in our journey toward strategic growth and excellence.  
  
We offer a robust bonus plan and flexible hours including work-from-home and alternating Fridays off; health, dental, and vision benefits; competitive paid time off, and 401(k) with employer match.   
  
**As the Senior Financial Analyst, you will...**  
 * Conduct and coordinate financial processes including tracking, reporting, and analysis to drive the company’s financial performance.
* Perform routine financial reviews to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement.
* Identify data-mining opportunities across the business, develop approaches to gather and organize pertinent information, and analyze to yield strategic recommendations.
* Participate in the budgeting process, providing detailed analysis to support budget proposals and monitoring adherence to approved budgets.
* Assist sales and marketing efforts by producing targeted data to enhance project pursuit efforts and proposal submissions.
* Engage in due diligence activities for mergers and acquisitions, including financial modeling and valuation.
* Support the CFO in succession planning efforts, ensuring financial leadership continuity and strategic alignment.
* Lead planning and analysis projects, utilizing advanced financial modeling to forecast future performance and advising on potential financial scenarios.
* Create and analyze various monthly, quarterly, and annual reports and ensure underlying financial information has been categorized appropriately.
* Develop forward-looking insights and recommendations to assist in strategic decision-making and long-term financial planning.
* Display time management skills, ensuring tasks are completed accurately and on schedule, and take initiative to seek out guidance or additional tasks, as needed.
* Demonstrate strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to collaborate effectively with various individuals.
* Perform special projects, as assigned.

  
**Senior Financial Analyst Qualifications – The Must-Haves (Required)** * Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, economics, or a related field, or equivalent.
* A minimum of 7 years of experience in financial planning and analysis, or a similar role.

  
**Senior Financial Analyst Qualifications – The Like-to-Haves (Not Required)**  
 * A/E/C Industry experience.
* Familiarity with Deltek Vision.

  
Salary range: $106,800-$132,200. Compensation DOE and location.   
  
*Studies have shown that underrepresented individuals like women; LGBTQIA+; and BIPOC, among others, are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every single one of the qualifications in a job description or posting. Because we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive organization, we understand the best candidate may come from a non-traditional background in our field of work. We strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the qualifications described above. Diversity makes us better.*Powered by JazzHR

description:

**Job Title: Data Analyst  
Location: Windsor Locks, CT**  
  
**Job Description:**  
This position is for an experienced Data Analyst role to join a growing aerospace team with L&T Technology Services (LTTS). As an important part of the Supply Chain team here at LTTS, you will actively be providing critical value to our customers by helping to ensure customer expectations are met.  
The E-Procurement Data Analyst leverages analytics expertise to translate complex spend data into actionable insights to drive procurement savings and process improvements. Strong data visualization, presentation, and collaboration skills enable impactful reporting and influence with executives and cross-functional leaders.  
  
**Core Responsibilities Includes:**  
 Partner with Procurement leaders to identify savings and improvement opportunities  
  
 Create dashboards, reports to communicate insights  
  
 Collect, structure and analyze large internal data sets related to sourcing/purchasing  
  
 Establish and track KPIs aligned to business decisions and initiatives  
  
 Employ data modeling, statistical analysis, and querying methods to find patterns  
  
 Present findings, recommendations, and next steps to executive audiences  
  
 Collaborate cross-functionally to implement analytical solutions  
  
 Continually seek to challenge status quo with critical thinking  
  
**Basic Qualifications:**  
 Bachelors degree in Supply Chain, Analytics, Finance or related field  
  
 2+ years experience as a data analyst supporting purchasing/sourcing  
  
 Expert level data visualization, dashboarding and reporting skills  
  
 Advanced Excel analytics and statistical modeling capabilities  
  
 Structured critical thinking and quantitative skills  
  
 Comfortable working with large, complex data sets  
  
 Strong written and verbal communication abilities  
  
 ERP experience is a must, SAP preferred  
  
 Tableau experience is a must.  
  
 1+ years of experience with Microsoft Office 365  
  
 Must be a US Citizen/Person  
  
**Preferred Qualifications:**  
 Lean Six Sigma or equivalent process excellence training  
  
 3-5 years turning data into compelling insights in manufacturing industry  
  
 Aerospace industry experience a plus  
  
 An ability to work independently without day-to-say supervision  
  
 An alignment with LTTS company values, including: Being Purposeful, Ethics & Integrity, Caring, A Culture of Learning, and Results with Accountability.

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Internal Wholesaler / Marketing Associate (Base + VC Oppty) (MN or CT)
description:
**Department:** Sales

**Position Title:** Internal Wholesaler

**Reports to:** National Sales Manager

**Essential Job Function:**

As an Internal Wholesaler, you will be responsible for acquiring new advisors, maintaining relationships with existing advisors and moving advisors to the next level of production using our market-leading tools and a consultative sales process. We will help you gain the skills needed to succeed as well as provide a consistent flow of new recruiting opportunities to help you build your production.

**Primary Responsibilities:** 

· Recruit agents/advisors and support a book of agents/advisors

· Provide product support, including comparative analysis, quotes and illustrations

· Promote our market-leading marketing programs to your agents/advisors

· Coordinate with our service department to provide L&A, new business and support to your agents/advisors

· Promote product ideas to your agents/advisors

**Qualifications:** 

· 1-3 years of experience in sales or other relevant job experience

· Basic understanding of financial markets and retirement trends

· Ability to use social media to increase sales effectiveness

· Ability to pass the insurance and/or securities examinations

· College degree preferred

**Core Competencies:**

· Strong communication skills

· Strong telephonic skills

· Self-starter that thrives on high activity in a high-energy environment

· Personal Effectiveness / Credibility

· Demonstrates professionalism and business acumen

· Willing to accept constructive feedback in order to grow professionally

**Compensation:** 

· Competitive base salary plus Bonus

title: Segment Financial Analyst - Controllership
description:
Our client is a world-class producer of aero engine and industrial gas turbine components and is publicly traded. They hold the top global position in their area of aerospace manufacturing and have a rich history of growth and evolution over the last 75 years. The company culture is fantastic, offering great exposure and growth opportunities. In 2022, Forbes named them one of the World's Best Employers, and they were ranked as a "Top Employer for Diversity".

  


This role is open due to a promotion to Controller!

  


**Why work for our client?**

  


* Publicly traded company in a growing trajectory.
* Named by Forbes as one of the worlds top employers
* Full insurance on day 1
* Generous 401k match
* Great company culture and team environment.
* Great training!

  


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Derive business insights from financial and operational analysis and synthesize them into high-impact, targeted recommendations and presentations to support decision-making.
* Review monthly actual, forecast, and plan performance; understand deviations from both forecast and plan to provide insights to senior management.
* Collaborate with cross-functional peers to prepare monthly and quarterly reporting packages for senior management, including schedules, performance tables, and bridge analyses.
* Assist sub-segment Controller with month-end closing activities, including coordination of closing entries and account reconciliations.
* Critically evaluate the segment's capital portfolio and individual project proposals
* Track execution of cost savings projects and coordinate reporting.
* Lead process improvement projects to achieve world-class performance across segment operations
* Support financial forecast preparation and development process utilizing Hyperion.
* Consolidate weekly close data and provide a month-to-date view of financial results and monthly projections to segment leadership, allowing for countermeasures to be deployed.
* Analysis of plant spending and monitoring spend management systems.
* Financial analysis and process development for special projects, as required.
* Completion of internal audit requirements for internal controls, as required.
* Assistance with Peer Review activity across segments, as required.

  


**Basic Qualifications:**

* Three (3) or more years of combined experience in finance/accounting and manufacturing
* Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution
* Employees must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.
* This position is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) which requires U.S. person status. ITAR defines U.S. person as an U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee.

  


**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Cost accounting experience is highly desired
* Previous internal audit experience preferred
* Working knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles
* MBA, CMA, and/or CPA highly desired
* Ability to communicate clearly & concisely in both written and oral form
* Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills
* Experience with querying databases
* Excellent analytical skills

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Our Mission**

**“Preparing Our Community to Meet Life’s challenges.”**

**We help everyone who comes to our door with resources for both immediate needs and long-term goals.** 

**Our network of programs, services, and experiences strengthen individuals, families, and communities and provides opportunities for growth and economic stability****.** 

 

**Come join our team!**

When you become an employee at the Community Renewal Team (CRT), you will join a host of others with an average tenure of nine years of service. Some of our employees have celebrated more than twenty + years of service. You’ll participate in fun activities, themed- employee appreciation events, organization sponsored golf tournaments, etc. We celebrate the accomplishments of employees using our Wall of Excellence highlighting employees of the month. Opportunities to grow within the organization are plentiful. Most of our employees started in entry level positions and have been promoted throughout their career. 

**BENEFITS**

401K with a matching employer contribution, medical, dental, vision, HSA Spending 

Accounts, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability (STD)/Long- Term Disability (LTD), 

and an Employee Assistance Program. Eligible employees are also able to participate in 

agency sponsored educational opportunities. Eligible employees receive ten paid vacation days, six sick

paid days annually, and two personal days paid annually. 

**JOB DETAILS**

**POSITION TITLE:** Financial Analyst 

**DEPARTMENT:** Finance

**FLSA STATUS:** Non**-**Exempt

 

**GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES**

 

The Financial Analyst is responsible for financial monitoring and analysis to the approved budget, monthly revenue recognition entries, applicable reporting to the funding source, and assistance in the preparation of annual budgets for assigned programs and grants. 

 

 

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILIITIES**

The list of essential functions, as outlined herein, is intended to be representative of the tasks performed within this classification. It is not necessarily descriptive of any one position in the class. The omission of an essential function does not preclude management from assigning duties not listed herein if such functions are a logical assignment to the position.

  


* Responsible for providing financial projections, budget variance explanations, and forecasting to Program Managers on a monthly basis.
* Verify all budgeted expenses (salary, fringe, occupancy and direct expense line items) on a monthly basis against the actual expenses and summarize results in monthly scheduled meetings with Program Managers to ensure grants are on track, data is accurately reported and make recommendations to Program Managers for budget line adjustments.
* Ensure proper billing is reported in connection with the monthly financial closing and work with the Accounting Manager and Controller to ensure collection of assigned funds occurs.
* Maintain financial program files for assigned programs.
* Complete all required financial reports to funder based on scheduled due dates as listed in the executed grant contracts.
* Conduct budget analysis in preparation of completing budget revisions. Review and prepare budget modifications and request revisions to efficiently use all funds before the program fiscal year/contract period ends.
* Assist with Funder’s monitoring visits.
* Assist with annual audit and closing of funds.
* Assist with monthly, quarterly, and annual closing processes.
* Prepare journal entries and reconcile general ledger and subsidiary accounts.

  


**ADDITIONAL JOB FUNCTIONS**

* Perform all other duties as assigned.

  


**MINIMUM TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE**

Education: Associate degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or Business Administration required. Bachelor degree preferred. 

Experience: A minimum of two (2) years of related experience. Knowledge of Generally accepted accounting practices and principles, Fund or governmental accounting practices and principles. 

Demonstrated Skills: Ability to use financial software and MS Office skills with advanced skills in MS Excel and MS Word. Must have excellent oral and written communication skills, customer service and organizational skills. Must exercise confidentiality and educated judgment to perform projections. Demonstrated ability to multitask and be proactive.

 

 

**ADA COMPLIANCE**

**Physical Ability:** Tasks involve the ability to exert very moderate physical effort in light work, typically involving some combination of stooping, kneeling, crouching and crawling, and which may involve some lifting, carrying, pushing and/or pulling of objects and materials of moderate weight (12-20 pounds).

**Sensory Requirements:** Some tasks require visual perception and discrimination. Some tasks require oral communications ability.

**Environmental Factors:** Tasks are regularly performed without exposure to adverse environmental conditions, such as dirt, dust, pollen, odors, wetness, humidity, rain, fumes, temperature and noise extremes, machinery, vibrations, electric currents, traffic hazards, animals/wildlife, toxic/poisonous agents, violence, disease, or pathogenic substances.

title: Financial Planner - Paraplanner
company: Hartford Financial Management Inc./HFM Wealth Management
description:
We are seeking a dedicated Financial Planner/Paraplanner to join our team in providing comprehensive financial planning services to our clients. In this role, you will play a crucial part in helping clients navigate life's financial decisions, providing them with clarity, confidence, and a sense of control over their financial future.

**\*\*Key Responsibilities\*\***

* Act as an in-house expert on fundamental financial planning concepts, techniques, and applications.
* Embrace our philosophy that financial planning is the cornerstone of effective investment portfolio management.
* Engage directly and indirectly with clients and collaborate with other professionals to meet clients' needs.
* Participate in the collection and analysis of client data, including financial resources, risk management, lifestyle considerations, budgeting, tax planning, and other holistic aspects of financial planning.
* Educate clients on financial planning processes, explain strategies, and deliver clear and concise reports on their financial planning activities.

**\*\*Minimum Qualifications & Performance Readiness\*\***

* A four-year college degree in a relevant field of study.
* At least 1 year of relevant industry experience.
* Progress toward obtaining a Certified Financial Planner (CFP) designation is highly desirable.
* Proficiency in financial planning software (e.g., MoneyGuidePro/eMoney) and MS365 Suite (Outlook, Excel, Access, Word, File Explorer, PowerPoint, Publisher).
* Competence in Adobe Acrobat, web meeting applications, CRM systems, and familiarity with data exports and reporting from portfolio accounting software (e.g., Tamarac, SS&C/Advent Axys).
* Understanding of basic concepts, laws, and regulations in estate planning, taxation, and portfolio management. CPA or estate specialist level expertise is not required.
* Knowledge of the characteristics of all publicly traded securities.

**\*\*Remote Work Policy\*\***

Our current policy allows for limited remote work with prior approval. Please note that this policy is subject to change.

**\*\*Join Our Team\*\***  
If you are passionate about financial planning and eager to help clients build a secure financial future, we would love to hear from you. Take the next step in your career with a firm that values the role of financial planning in wealth management.

title: CCAT- Business Analyst
description:
The Connecticut Center for Advanced Technology, Inc. (CCAT) is a non-stock, tax-exempt 501(c)3 corporation incorporated in May 2004. CCAT is an applied technology demonstration and training center that validates, demonstrates, and assists with the adoption of leading-edge technologies into global industrial companies and the advanced manufacturing supply chain, while providing vital workforce training and upskilling necessary for companies to fully-utilize the technology advancement. CCAT partners with State and Federal governmental funding agencies such as the DOD, DOE, NASA, SBA and USDOC on technology development and training utilizing government programs and commercial contracts to address military and civilian industrial manufacturing needs, promote clean-tech planning and policy initiatives and enhance workforce skills for technology competitiveness. The current technology focus of the Advanced Technology Centers is on multi-material additive manufacturing technologies, composites, advanced design, automation, metrology, industrial automation, and Industry 4.0 technologies.

  
**Position Title**: Business Process Analyst 

  
**Job Description**: The Business Process Analyst collects and studies operational and performance data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement. Researches, analyzes, and recommends changes to an organization's business processes to improve operational efficiencies, quality, service, and profitability. Creates flowcharts, process maps, and diagrams. Develops process documentation and project plans. In addition, supports cross-functional activities and working sessions during projects' design and implementation phases. Designs and prepares documentation, training materials, and communications supporting new processes. May deliver training to impacted business units. Gaining exposure to some of the complex tasks within the job function. Reports to COO.

  
**Essential Functions and Responsibilities:** 

* Develop and maintain document management program for filing, protection, and retrieval of records, and assure compliance with program. design, evaluate, recommend, and approve document revisions.
* Assist in creation of internal audit system.
* Prepare and train colleagues to utilize new forms, reports, procedures according to organizational policy.
* Lead process mapping and continuous improvement efforts to develop or improve company processes.
* Confer with personnel concerned to ensure successful functioning of newly implemented systems or procedures.
* Analyze data gathered and develop solutions or alternative methods of proceeding.
* Interview personnel and conduct on-site observation to ascertain unit functions, work performed, and methods, equipment, and personnel involved.
* Prepare reports.
* Chair change control meetings for asset inventory and documentation changes.
* Collaborate with all members of the business teams (leadership, operations, marketing, finance, legal, engineering) to develop process documents.
* Works on projects/matters of limited complexity in a support role.
* Other tasks as assigned.
* Career growth opportunities include access and exposure to technical experts and executive leadership with a growth path to project or program management.
* The position requires the candidate to be on-site at multiple facilities in East Hartford, Connecticut.

**Experience and Skills**:

* Bachelor or Associate Degree and 3-4 years of prior relevant experience/certifications in a technical field.
* Manufacturing, Supply Chain, or Operations related education/experience.
* Process orientation and ability to develop and follow standard work.
* Proven ability to write procedural documents.
* Ability and desire to work in a collaborative, non-profit environment.
* The ability to learn, understand and interpret business processes.
* Ability to act in partnership with the organization and be recognized as a valued contributor to business and program results.

**Physical Demands & Work Environment:** The role involves occasional movement within the office, computer operation, and frequent communication. The position may require visits to manufacturing businesses and adherence to safety protocols in lab and external facilities.

**Reports to**: Chief Operating Officer

**Manage Others**: None

**Job Type**: Exempt

**Employee Type**: Full Time

**Travel:** Limited

**Compensation**: Based on qualifications

**Relocation**: No

  
CCAT is an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

  
Please direct resumes to careers@ccat.us

title: Financial Analyst
description:
The Financial Analyst will work within the FP&A group and play a key role in providing cost and margin planning, modeling, and analytical support to business partners throughout the organization. The hired candidate may work in our Danvers, MA office, be hybrid or work remotely residing in the Eastern time zone.  
**What you'll be doing:**

* Create and maintain monthly Revenue and Operating Expense Financial Package; conduct monthly meetings with business partners
+ Track key metrics for revenue and cost across certain business units, functional areas, products, projects, categories, and department; items include: detailed product revenue, cost and margin performance analysis, headcount statistics, discretionary/capital spending and savings and opportunities/risk and exposure
+ Research actual variances versus benchmarks; work with business partners to develop comprehensive explanations of variances and support remediation, as needed
+ Be a thought partner to the organization’s planning processes to support build-out of reporting - partner with business to improve visibility of performance for use and interpretation of results

* Continuously look at opportunities to optimize analytics models and reporting processes to provide more timely and relevant financial insights for organization
* Assist in coordinating company’s planning process including the administration and maintenance of budget and forecast software and compilation of reporting to Executive team and Board of Directors

**What you'll need:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Equivalent discipline required
* 3+ years’ experience as a financial analyst
* Proficiency in financial forecasting, modeling, and reporting
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, along with superior attention to detail
* Must function at expert level in MS Excel; Proficiency in Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint
* Ability to extract data from financial systems and into environments such as Power BI and other analytical tools
* Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills
* Exceptional organization skills; must be able to prioritize multiple tasks and work independently
* Oracle and Salesforce experience a plus

**Success Competencies:**

* Nimble learner – readily learns and adopts new technologies; is resourceful and curious
* Highly organized and comfortable managing multiple projects simultaneously, demonstrating excellent time management skills with attention to details
* Considers all relevant factors and uses appropriate decision-making criteria and principles
* Works cooperatively with others across the organization to align and achieve shared objectives.
* Demonstrates self-awareness; possesses a strong work ethic; manages own workload autonomously.

  


**Compensation range:** 65k to 78k USD   
The actual salary offer to the successful candidate will be based on job-related education, training, licensure, certifications, related experience and other related factors.

title: Financial Analyst, Hartford, CT
description:
**Want to hear something crazy? Cars only spend 5% of their time driving. Where do they spend the other 95%? PARKED!**

**LAZ Parking is one of the largest and fastest-growing parking companies in the country. LAZ operates hundreds of thousands of parking spaces across the country. When it comes to parking, we’re the experts!**

**We are also a PEOPLE FIRST company. We often say, “parking is our industry, but people are our passion.” Our mission is to “create opportunities for our employees and value for our clients.” If you’re looking to join a growing company led by passionate people committed to being the best – contact us today!**

**The Spirit of the Position:**

The **Financial Analyst –Government / University Services** provides financial analysis for two complex national portfolios, recording data, identifying trends and generating insights for the assigned locations. This position reports directly to the Financial Director – Airport & Government / University Services.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Participate in the production of monthly client reports, statements, invoices, rent calculations, and rent payments to ensure accuracy and contract compliance.
* Prepare and submit required reports for clients to Financial Director for review.
* Report on client payment distribution to ensure accuracy and compliance.
* Perform revenue reconciliations and follow up as needed on unreconciled variances.
* Supply financial reports or analyses to onsite Government / University Services teams and clients as needed.
* Provide detailed month-end variance analysis, identification of cost deviations, and EAC preparation and updates.
* Support multiple contract types: Management Agreements, Leases, Fixed Fee, Time and Materials (Labor-Hour), and other hybrid models.
* Work with internal and external audits to help resolve or adjudicate any adverse audit findings.
* Review and audit daily logs, timecards, KPIs, LDs, and contract compliance.
* Consolidate data from Business Intelligence system and produce monthly reports, charts, and graphs
* Maintain a contract matrix to ensure contractual compliance
* Continually review performance bonds, KPIs, MBE/DBE requirements, licenses, etc. to confirm each contract is complying with contractual agreement and deliverables.
* Stay current on industry trends, regulatory changes, and best practices to ensure the organization remains competitive and compliant.
* Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and budget data entry forms that are accurate, concise and easy to digest.

**Experience and Requirements:** 

* Bachelor's in Accounting, Finance, or related fields or equivalent work experience.
* Master’s degree preferred but not required.
* Five or more years of experience in financial management.
* Experience in government finances or contracts preferred.

**Skills:** 

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* High attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.
* Proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues.
* Ability and willingness to “roll up” your sleeves to help teammates so everyone can be successful.
* Someone who enjoys working in a fun, collaborative environment where all ideas are respected and equally considered.
* One who embodies the LAZ values: trust, respect, honesty and integrity, and commitment to people.
* Someone who can be trusted to work with confidential information with discretion.
* Eager to learn and quickly understand new processes and applications.
* A self-starter that can troubleshoot issues on their own and find solutions.
* Proficiency in developing, maintaining, and strengthening policies and procedures.
* Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills; must be able to work well with all levels of employees.
* Ability to work independently and multi-task.
* Ability to stay organized, multi-task, and adhere to critical deadlines in a fast-paced and growing environment.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office skills required, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, and Outlook.
* Internally Certified Pricing Analyst versed in GAAP, FAR, and IFRS standards and best practices.
* Ability to mitigate and lead others to overcome challenges (Never Ever Give Up Attitude).
* Ability to interpret policies, procedures, and standard business practices.

**Physical Demands:** 

* Ability to lift, push and pull at least 10 pounds.
* Some travel required but not considered frequent (less than 20%).

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with qualified disabilities to perform the essential duties/functions. 

**FLSA Status:** Exempt

LAZ Parking is an equal opportunity employer. In all our employment practices, including hiring, we are firmly committed to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, genetics, Vietnam era, special disabled, recently separated and other protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. No question in our application process is used for the process of limiting or excluding any applicant's consideration for employment on such grounds.

This Employer participates in E-Verify.

title: Multichannel Business Analytics And Strategic Insights | Onsite - San Bruno, CA | WECJP00028230
Business Systems Analyst
description:
\*\*Hybrid, remote mostly (onsite a rarety-less than 10 intermittent or consecutive days)

\*\*PMM Supply Chain experience (Configuration, Design, testing, creating requirements document, working with business, develop project plan, production support) Integration with PeopleSoft ERP and Epic.

**SUMMARY -**  
The Business Systems Analyst provides essential functional support and expertise for Research Administration Systems (RAS), Accounts Receivables (AR) and related integrations or connected business processes in partnership with operational units (including Accounting, Research and Academic Departments) and technical units within UCSF IT. The Business Systems Analyst provides a critical bridge between the end-users and technical development resources. This position requires (requirements, analysis, data, documentation) that . Problem solving and application of design principles and data structure, in combination with facilitate the creation of solutions which improve and extend business applications. Includes in merging the business requirements with software functionalities, and ability to isolate key design dependancies and decision points, combined with exceptional documentation and communication (written and oral) are paramount to this position. As a functional system analyst, incumbent is expected to understand and validate all system functions routinely and repetitively in order to confirm system performance and results, as well as ensure integrity during upgrades.

Responsibilities include: daily end user support and triage of system problems using incident management procedures and ticketing systems, extensive data analysis and system integrity reviews, gathering and documenting operational requirements from end users and key business stakeholders, organization and translation of requirements into functional specifications that can be coordinated with development resources, executing above activities within established Software Development Life Cycle procedures that cover system design/documentation, knowledge management, fixes, enhancements, and upgrades, as well as performing related activities for new implementations and functionality.

Support and expertise covers a wide-array of applications/services involving a core of PeopleSoft modules for Grants, Contracts, Projects, Billing, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, and General Ledger, as well as related applications/integrations that support research and functionalities applied to other areas as well (e.g. Student AR and Sundry Billing). Incumbent is responsible for creating training materials for system support and change management, and will collaborate on and often lead cross-functional teams to solve business or systems issues.

The Business Systems Analyst works with the entire Enterprise Applications Team to ensure successful implementation of software maintenance, new implementations, and support of all financial and administrative systems under the direction of the Research Admin System Manager, leveraging advanced knowledge and working with stakeholders in a predominantly independent fashion. The supported modules and business processes are subject to change due to organizational needs, and responsibilities may be realigned when the need arises.

* PeopleSoft: 2 years (Required)

description:

title: Senior Business Systems Analyst – Custom Applications (JO#6094)
description:
**JOB TITLE: Senior Business Systems Analyst – Custom Applications**

**LOCATION: San Francisco or Sacramento**

**JOB OPENING #: 6094** 

**OVERVIEW** 

The Judicial Council of California supports California’s court system, the largest in the nation, serving a population of more than 39.5 million people— about 12 percent of the total U.S. population. Our mission includes a commitment to providing fair and equal access to justice for all Californians.

The Sr. Business Systems Analyst supports the JCC Information Technology (IT) Office teams responsible for the development and implementation of enterprise systems that support many programs and units throughout the JCC. These programs include the Oracle Financials program, the Uniform Civil Fees program, the Court Appointed Counsel programs, the Temporary Assigned Judges program, and other agency-wide programs such as the PowerBI program. This role acts as a liaison between business and technical users supporting the system initiatives for the various programs; provides production support to team members and business users for new systems and enhancements; and serves as an operations consultant to business and technical users to analyze and recommend efficient business processes. The Sr. Business Analyst works closely with the customer team, judicial partners, vendors and the application development and analysis teams to identify needs, solve immediate problems and create a higher quality product. The Senior Business Systems Analyst is distinguished from the Business Systems Analyst in that the Senior Business Analyst regularly serves as a project manager for large, complex business systems projects, and provides guidance and direction for work assigned to project teams members. Senior Business Systems Analysts are responsible for enterprise-wide system implementations, deployments, and upgrade projects.

The incumbent is responsible for creating application business and technical requirements documents and project plans; developing technical specifications, reviewing, and updating specifications and test scripts for new technology deployments; coordinating activities with other IT units, business partners, judicial partners, court staff, and vendor partners; and maintenance and operations support. The role is responsible for the review and analysis of technology requests for new features and services and for identifying issues related to the development and maintenance of information technology systems that support business functions at the JCC and the courts. The Sr. Business Systems Analyst ensures that the Enterprise Systems SharePoint sites have current content; users have appropriate access as needed and all users are proficient and effectively using the SharePoint sites.

The Judicial Council strives for work life balance and includes substantial vacation and holiday time. In addition, we offer an excellent benefits package including pension, medical, dental and vision coverage, flexible spending, up to $130 per month reimbursement for qualifying commuting costs, and retirement savings plans. In San Francisco, the office is only a 7-minute walk from the Civic Center BART station in downtown San Francisco. In Sacramento, the office is located minutes from downtown, just north of Discovery Park.

The successful candidate will be expected to work in the Judicial Council’s San Francisco or Sacramento office; Hybrid work options for employees who live in areas surrounding these locations may be considered.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

· Lead large complex projects that support many programs and units throughout the JCC. These programs include the Oracle Financials program, the Uniform Civil Fees program, the Court Appointed Counsel programs, the Temporary Assigned Judges program, and other agency-wide programs such as the PowerBI program.

· Perform system analysis services for new and enhanced applications services, identify process improvements, develop process workflows and document business and technical requirements.

· Provide on-going functional and user support for Enterprise Systems applications including Oracle Financials, UCFS, SCACS, DCACS and JIS, record and track reported issues, address business user questions, investigate issues and propose and design solutions, and act as a liaison between business and technical users through problem resolution.

· Provide guidance and leadership for application testing and quality assurance to ensure that developed solutions meet the specified requirements.

· Provide complete and accurate project, technical and user documentation to ensure project success and compliance with industry best practices.

· Provide clear and accurate communications regarding assigned work.

· Establish and maintain excellent customer relationships and manage expectations.

Other Duties and Responsibilities:

· Collaborate with business users in the selection, acquisition, and deployment of new technologies. In doing so, engage the product vendor to develop specifications, test functionality and project deployment plans for implementation.

· Provide input to the annual budgeting and mid-year budget review process.

· Provide input to program planning activities and roadmap updates.

· Participate in the procurement processes for the annual renewal of support and maintenance agreements.

· Prepare Work Order Requests (WORF) and contract request for project resources as needed.

· Suggest areas for improvement in internal processes along with possible solutions.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS** 

Education and Experience

Bachelor’s degree, and five (5) years of experience providing technical and business process support, analysis, or project management for systems/applications.

Possession of a bachelor’s degree in a directly related field such as computer science, management information systems, etc., may be substituted for one of the years of required experience. An additional four years of professional experience as noted above may substitute for the bachelor’s degree. Or, additional directly related experience and/or education may be substituted on a year-for-year basis.

OR

One year as a Business Systems Analyst with the Judicial Council of California or one year of experience performing the duties of a class comparable in the level of responsibility to that of a Business Systems Analyst in a California Superior Court or California state-level government entity.

**Desirable Qualifications**

· 5+ years experience in business and/or systems analysis.

· 5+ years of lead experience in project management, development and deployment.

· 5+ years experience supporting infrastructure projects.

· Excellent customer service, communication skills, and presentation skills

· Excellent written skills

· Excellent MS Word, Excel, Project and Visio skills

· Experience in industry-standard project management methods, tools, techniques and processes

· Experience in judicial branch operations

**Other Information** 

Please note: If you are selected for hire, verification of employment eligibility or authorization to work in the United States will be required.

**HOW TO APPLY**

To ensure consideration of your application for the earliest round of interviews, **please apply by 5:00 P.M. on Saturday, March 30, 2024.** This position requires the submission of our official application, a resume and a response to the supplemental questions.

To complete the online application, please go to https://www.courts.ca.gov/careers.htm and search for **JO# 6094.**

The Judicial Council provides reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities who request such accommodation. Reasonable accommodation needs should be requested through Human Resources at (415) 865-4260. Telecommunications Device for the Deaf (415) 865-4272.

**PAYMENT & BENEFITS** 

$7,485 - $11,228 per month

Some highlights of our benefits package include:

· Health/Dental/Vision benefits program

· 14 paid holidays per calendar year

· Choice of Annual Leave or Sick/Vacation Leave

· 1 personal holiday per year

· Up to $130 per month reimbursement for qualifying commuting costs

· CalPERS Retirement Plan

· 401(k) and 457 deferred compensation plans

· Employee Assistance Program

· Basic Life and AD&D Insurance

· FlexElect Program

· Pretax Parking

· Long Term Disability Program (employee paid/optional)

· Group Legal Plan (employee paid/optional)

**The Judicial Council of California Is an Equal Opportunity Employer**.

title: Media Sales Consultant
description:
Valpak Sales Representative - Sell for a Brand that Sells Itself!

(Remote Outside Sales Opportunity in San Francisco, CA)

Are you looking for a new sales position with a well-established brand? Do you want to invest in yourself, your career, and future? Then look no further. Valpak is seeking qualified sales professionals to join our team.

The ideal candidate has a positive attitude, is self-assured and thrives in a fast-paced environment with the ability to multitask and manage multiple priorities. Must possess excellent communication skills to maintain relationships with existing customers while also seeking out new prospects through lead generation, referrals, and networking. You will need at least 2+ years of experience in cultivating sales and building relationships, preferably in the media/print industry but not required.

As an Outside Sales Representative, you will belong to a territory that will consist of small and mid-sized businesses (Prospecting B2B with companies under 1,000 employees). The Valpak Iconic Blue Envelope is designed to increase sales for our clients. We know how to plan personalized marketing campaigns using data and analytics to reach the customers our clients want. We combine the Blue Envelope with postcards and digital product lines to provide a full marketing campaign to obtain maximum results for our customers. This is why our sales team is so successful.

Below are the highlights of what we have to offer….

* Competitive earning expectations include base plus uncapped commissions. Approximately $60,000 - $70,000 in your first year. After your first year, your earning potential will continue to grow as your book of business grows.
* Paid training to learn our processes and selling tools (computer skills is a must)
* High Tech Data and Analytics at your fingertips to build effective campaigns
* Proven process to put it all together in front of the customer.
* Participate in contests where you can win trips and prizes.
* Benefits Including:
+ Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits start on the first day of the month after hire date when you sign up.
+ Automatic 401k participation after 30 days of employment
+ Generous Paid Time Off Policy
+ Paid Holidays
+ Additional voluntary benefits like Pet Insurance and Life Insurance
+ Programs like DEI, Health & Wellness, Employee Assistance Program

* Casual, positive work environment that promotes from within

 

Your consultative sales approach will ensure a greater close rate and that makes your earnings potential limitless. If this sounds like a fit for you, apply today! We want to hear from you.

 

Salary: 40K plus unlimited commissions

title: Data Scientist – Advanced Analytics & Modeling
description:
FocusKPI is looking for a **Data Scientist – Advanced Analytics & Modeling** to work for our client, one of the largest retailers/e-commerce companies in the U.S.A.   
  
The client is building a robust in-house advertising business that’s key to its growth strategy. They partner closely with brands on strategies and solutions that harness client’s unparalleled omni-channel influence. They deliver relevant retail ads and experiences that connect their customers with the brands and products they love. They use online and in-store data, encompassing 95% of American households, to measure campaign-correlated sales on their site and in their stores.  
 

**Work Location:** Remote in the U.S.

**Duration:** 6 months contract with potential for extension and conversion, depending on budget and performance

**Pay range:** $60/hr to $73/hr

  
**Responsibilities:**

* Build and enhance media mix models to connect the impact of marketing tactics and business short-term and long-term outcomes
* Run optimization and simulation scenarios to help provide the marketing investment and allocation recommendations to stakeholders
* Perform hands-on modeling and complex analyses using SQL & Python
* Explain complex modeling approaches in simple terms and develop compelling narratives that connect modeling results with business problems
* Partner with cross-functional teams to streamline data science solutions

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* **Master's degree** in statistics, data science, operations research, economics, mathematics, or related field
* 4+ years of experience in **media mix modeling, predictive modeling, advanced measurement, applicable marketing analytics**
* Proficient coding skills (**Python/SQL**), experience and knowledge with database structures and Microsoft Excel
* Experience with **predictive modeling algorithms**
* Strong **project management** skills
* Able to communicate technical material to a range of audiences that provides insight into marketing performance.
* Passion for working in a fast-paced **agile** environment
* A collaborative mindset, innovative with a sense of curiosity

  
**Preferred Qualifications:**

* **PhD degree** in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Operations Research, or related field
* Experienced in building multiple **market mix and multi-touch attribution models**
* Experience with **Tableau** or similar **data visualization tools**.
* Experience with advertising, measurement, and/or digital marketing analytics
* Experience with advertising technology platforms eCommerce, Ad servers, DSPs, DMPs, etc.

 

Thank you!

FocusKPI Hiring Team

Founded in 2010, FocusKPI, Inc. (FocusKPI) is a data science and technology firm specializing in predictive analytics practice and methodologies. FocusKPI is a U.S. company headquartered in Silicon Valley, California with an East Coast office in Boston, Massachusetts.

**NOTICE:** Please be aware of fraudulent emails regarding job postings, job offers and fake checks. FocusKPI's recruiting team will strictly reach out via @focuskpi.com email domain. If you have received fraudulent emails now or in the past, please report it to https://reportfraud.ftc.gov/ .  
The domain @focuskpijobs.com is fraudulent and not related to FocusKPI. Please do not not reply or communicate to anyone with @focuskpijobs.com.

title: District Manager
description:
**District Manager - Northwest - Must be based in San Francisco, CA.**

**\*This role covers the Northwest region in AZ, CA, CO, NV, OR and WA\***

Iconic. Approachable. Connected. These are some of the ideas that guide our every day at Janie and Jack. We set ourselves apart with outstanding quality and great care for every detail, from our clothing to our customer service to the people we work with. Are you ready to be a part of the Janie and Jack story?

**About the job:**

As a District Manager, you lead a portfolio of stores and coach a team of General Managers to deliver an optimal customer and employee experience, operational excellence, merchandising execution, maximum productivity and profitable sales and earnings growth. You are accountable to drive consistent, high performance across all initiatives, and for ensuring consistency between your stores as measured by the P&L and other reports.

**Organizational Leadership:**

* You are part of the Upper Field and lead your own team of General Managers.
* Responsible for all aspects of performance for your portfolio of stores.
* Drive profitable sales through effective business analysis; identifying financial opportunities in your portfolio of stores and action plan to deliver desired results.
* Build a high performing team and strong talent pipeline.
* Collaborate with peers and cross functional partners in Human Resources, Loss Prevention, Operations, Visual Merchandising and other HQ partners to make the best business decisions.
* Model and inspire your team to embody your brand’s mission and the Janie and Jack culture: Be fast. Be fearless. Be better. Be bold.

**What you'll do:**

* Attract, hire, develop and retain the best team to meet both short and long-term business goals.
* Monitor performance and consistently follow- up to ensure results are delivered.
* Develop individual and team performance & capabilities via clear expectations, intentional conversations, meaningful recognition and accountability.
* Foster and maintain an inclusive and collaborative work environment.
* Identify themes in product performance across your portfolio and create a district merchandising plan to excel performance utilizing data points, strategy and seasonality.
* Lead effective store visits focused on driving behaviors which enable the team to consistently deliver results in all areas of the business.
* Identify and use multiple ways to achieve goals when confronted with obstacles, plan for contingencies.
* Identify and solve problems with sustainable solutions.
* Maintain a keen awareness of the external market and competition.
* Ensure stores are operating in compliance with all Janie and Jack policies and procedures.

**What you'll bring:**

* Demonstrated ability to drive results; execute based upon direction and manage multiple, competing priorities.
* Demonstrated ability to build merchandising capability and coach to sustain merchant strength in stores.
* Demonstrated ability to build diverse, high performing teams with an inclusive environment.
* Demonstrated ability to deliver an exceptional customer experience via all channels.
* Demonstrated ability to continually embrace challenges, take risks, learn fast and enable change.
* Demonstrated ability to achieve beyond what is expected and take actions or use improvements or learnings to exceed existing goals.
* College degree preferred.
* 3+ year’s multi-unit, high volume, complex business leadership preferred.
* Flexible to workdays, nights, weekends and holidays to meet the needs of the business.
* Ability to travel overnight and/or between stores as required.
* Ability to lift and carry 30lbs.

**Why You’ll Love Working with Us**:

* The Product—so good, you’ll be using your employee discount more than you probably should.
* The People—ask anyone that works here…we have incredible people on our team.
* The Experience—you’ll enjoy a rewarding career at a respected children’s brand.

**Let’s Talk Perks!**

* Employee discount at Janie and Jack.
* Paid holidays and flexible time off.
* Generous Health Savings Account (HSA) employer contributions for individuals and families.
* Flexible Spending Accounts and commuter benefits.
* Life insurance.
* Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching.
* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance\*
* Employee Assistance Program with resources like financial and legal assistance, childcare and elderly care, emotional work/life counseling, health, and wellness resources, travel assistance.

*Actual starting pay for this role is determined by a wide array of factors including but not limited to qualifications, experience, relevant skills, education, and geographic location. Employees are offered a variety of benefits to empower them with the resources and flexibility they need to enjoy success on the job and to live a healthy life. Full-time employees are eligible for medical insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, health and dependent care FSA, life/ad&d insurance, short term and long term disability, commuter benefits, pet benefits, tuition reimbursement, paid time off and 401(k) including matching. All employees are eligible for employee discounts and EAP Resources. All regular, full-time Brand Support Center employees are eligible for the annual discretionary bonus plan.*

*Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.*

  


  
**Compensation details:** 105000-125000 Yearly Salary

title: Marketplace Analytics Lead
description:
We offer a hybrid work environment. Most US-based positions can alsobeperformed remotely (any exceptions will be noted in the Minimum Qualifications below.)

**Our Mission:**

To actively connect people to their next great opportunity. 

**Who We Are:**

ZipRecruiter is a leading online employment marketplace. Powered by AI-driven smart matching technology, the company actively connects millions of all-sized businesses and job seekers through innovative mobile, web, and email services, as well as through partnerships with the best job boards on the web. ZipRecruiter has the #1 rated job search app on iOS & Android.

**About the Job:**

ZipRecruiter is a multi-sided marketplace connecting job seekers and employers. In the role of the Technical Lead, you'll be at the heart of our business, monitoring the health of our marketplace, providing business teams with actionable insights, investigating issues, making recommendations, and collaborating with our product, engineering, and operational teams to enact improvements that have meaningful impact on our business. You will be collaborating with cross functional teams to help us anticipate changes meant to impact our ecosystem and you will have direct impact in the marketplace by driving action from insights and influencing product roadmaps. 

**Key Focuses:**

* Develop frameworks, processes, dashboards, and utilize tools to help us more quickly and effectively monitor, identify and communicate trends, and debug data or product issues in our business
* Become a subject matter expert on the technical aspects of our marketplace, including learning how our product, data, and systems work
* Prioritize and quickly respond to incoming requests, including helping to formulate business questions
* Create actionable insights from data
* Create business cases to influence product roadmaps

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* 4+ years of professional experience in decision science, business analytics, data science, software engineering, or related field
* BA/BS in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, related technical field or equivalent professional experience
* Advanced SQL knowledge
* Experience working with marketplaces and/or bidding systems

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Advanced degree in Data Science, Analytics, or other quantitative disciplines
* Expert in Python, Spark, and/or Databricks
* Strong knowledge in statistics and probabilistic modeling

**As part of our team you'll enjoy:**

* Competitive salary
* Exceptional benefits package
* Flexible Vacation & Paid Time Off
* Employer-matched 401(k) plan

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $155,000-$190,000. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location, and the range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location, role-related knowledge and skills, depth of experience, relevant education or training, and additional role-related considerations.

Depending on the position offered, equity, bonuses, commission, or other forms of compensation may also be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and other benefits.

ZipRecruiter is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or genetics.

**Privacy Notice:** For information about ZipRecruiter's collection and processing of job applicant personal data for this job, please see our Privacy Notice at: https://www.ziprecruiter.com/careers/job-applicant-privacy-notice
