title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Principal Financial Analyst
description:
Principal Finance Analyst  
The Principal Finance Analyst distills technical analysis of the current financial climate and trends in financial performance into reports and recommendations for how the business operates. By gathering, analyzing, preparing and summarizing recommendations based on financial analysis, he/she will be critical in advisement of business moves such as acquisitions, operational forecasting and other financial plans. Growth is contingent on finding new avenues to stretch; being well-informed on the financial environment allows us to measure the risk and move forward.   
  
Rewarding Impact. Fulfilling Careers.   
  
Making an impact isn't something reserved for people in corner offices. It comes from people in every corner of the office. People with ambition, optimism and courage. We provide growth and opportunity and give employees flexibility in how they get the job done. You might not expect that from a big company, but we're smart enough to know how to hire the best and when to step aside and let them lead. Our goal is that you never stop learning and you never cease to amaze--especially yourself. If this fits your career goal, we can't wait to welcome you on board.   
  
Responsibilities  
 * Develops, interprets and implements financial concepts for financial planning and control.
* Performs technical analysis to determine present and future financial performance.
* Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for financial plans, acquisition activity, trended future requirements and operating forecasts.
* Performs economic research and studies in the areas of rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements, investment opportunities, investment performance and impact of governmental requirements.
* Having wide-range experience, he/she uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.
* Ability to draw on past experience and current data to influence business partners and provide insightful analytics.
* Ability to challenge conclusions and impact business outcomes.
* Extensive knowledge of planning and forecasting with ability to work independently to identify initiatives and recommend actions to business and finance overall.
* Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
* Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.
* Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise.
* Ability to produce strategic analysis to proactively identify issues and provide potential actions.
* High level of expertise in planning & forecasting and levers impacting profitability.
* Ability to influence outcomes and business partner decisions (viewed as trusted business advisor) with extensive subject matter expertise.
* Works in larger cross-functional teams with ability to influence senior leaders in Finance and Business.
* Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and may coordinate activities of other personnel.

Qualifications  
 * Advanced degree in finance and relevant experience in planning & forecasting/budgeting required.
* Requires a minimum of 6 years of experience and a Master's degree or a PhD with 3 years of experience, or equivalent experience.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Financial Analyst for Family Office**

***This full-time, onsite role is located in the Cincinnati/Northern**-Kentucky area.* 

The Family Office Analyst will be an integral part of the Family Office Team, providing diversified support to the Director, Family Office and Investments as well as Family Members.This dynamic position involves overseeing accounting and finance deliverables, preparing detailed financial statements, and producing investment performance reports. 

As a self-starter, the Family Office Analyst will contribute to the growth of the family office, actively participating in initiatives and gaining hands-on experience. This position offers a unique opportunity for the right candidate to thrive in a supportive and collaborative environment, with ample room for professional growth and advancement within the organization. 

In this role, the ideal candidate will be dynamic and versatile. They will have strong finance accounting background and the ability to navigate complex financial issues to find creative solutions. 

 **Duties and Responsibilities**

**Investment Management:**

* Assist in monitoring investment activities, evaluate performance, and propose adjustments while maintaining accurate books and records.
* Generate detailed investment reports and conduct research on existing and potential investments.
* Stay updated on market trends, presenting findings to the team and gaining exposure to a wide range of asset classes and investment types.

**Financial Reporting:**

* Prepare comprehensive financial reports and analyses for the Director, providing insights into the family’s financial position and investment performance.
* Maintain schedules and reports needed for tax reporting.
* Monitor and evaluate financial trends, highlight potential areas for optimization.

**Accounting & Accounts Payable/Receivable Oversight**

* Oversee day-to-day accounting operations, ensuring accuracy.
* Manage accounts payable/receivable, and reconcile financial discrepancies related to investment and personal activities.
* Prepare capital calls and distributions, monitor cash balances within the various entities maintained.

**Budgeting and Forecasting:** 

* Contribute to the development and maintenance of family and entity budgets.
* Provide input on financial forecasts and variances.

**Collaboration:**

* Work collaboratively with team members to support overall family office objectives.Liaise with external partners, financial institutions, and relevant stakeholders.
* Liaise with external partners financial institutions and relevant stakeholders.

**Learning and Development:**

* Proactively engage in continuous learning to develop expertise in accounting, finance, and investment analysis.
* Take initiative in acquiring new skills and knowledge relevant to the role.

 **All other responsibilities and special projects as assigned.**

Qualifications & Requirements * Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field.
* Proven experience in accounting, finance, and investment analysis.
* Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrates ability to assume ownership, work independently and achieve results.
* Experience with or willingness to learn investment strategies and reporting.
* Experience using PowerBI or similar Business Intelligence tools preferred.
* Highest standard of integrity, discretion, confidentiality, and professionalism

Competitive compensation package based on the candidate’s experience, they will receive a best-in-class benefit package, and opportunities for continuing professional development.

***Must live in and be eligible to work in the USA. Reserve Squad is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*** 

**To learn** more about Reserve Squad, visit our website at www.reservesquad.com.

description:
**Position Type :**

Full time**Type Of Hire :**

Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)**Education Desired :**

Bachelor of Accounting**Travel Percentage :**

0%**Job Description**


Are you ready to unleash your full potential? We’re looking for people who are passionate about payments to chart Worldpay’s path to being the largest and most-loved payments company in the world.


Every day, our teams innovate across the world of finance. We collaborate to work smarter, while making a difference. We believe in diversity and inclusivity, giving a voice to everyone on the team. And we celebrate our success together. If you want to make an impact in fintech, we’d like to know!  

  

**About the role:**  

As a Financial Analyst, you’ll have your finger on the financial pulse of the entire organization. Working with a diverse team, you’ll be responsible develop, interpret, and implement financial concepts for financial planning and control.  

  

**What you will be doing:**  

* Perform technical analysis to determine present and future financial performance.
* Gather, analyze, prepare and summarize recommendations for financial plans, acquisition activity, trended future requirements and operating forecasts.
* Meet with organizational unit/department managers to discuss and establish timelines and methodologies for completing budgets.
* Research and compile data to forecast and prepare annual and monthly budget projections for a division or similar group of organizations.
* Track revenue and expenses on a monthly basis, comparing actual to forecasted figures and make necessary adjustments.
* Perform economic research and studies in areas of rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements, investment opportunities, investment performance and impact of governmental requirements.
* Prepare reports for management summarizing results of research, analyses and evaluation of any discrepancies.

  

**What you will need:**  

* Bachelor’s degree is required, Finance or Accounting highly preferred
* Good understanding of generally accepted accounting principles as well as company accounting policies, procedures and standards
* Ability to analyze and solve problems using learned techniques and tools
* Analytical and statistical examination skills
* Demonstrated ability to plan and accomplish work to ensure critical deadlines are met

  

**Added bonus if you have:**  

  

**What we offer you:**  

A career at Worldpay is more than just a job. It’s the change to shape the future of fintech. At Worldpay, we offer you:  

* A voice in the future of fintech
* Always-on learning and development
* Collaborative work environment
* Opportunities to give back
* Competitive salary and benefits

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Join Our Team at VTrips**

**Exciting Career Opportunity!**

Are you skilled in financial analysis and passionate about driving business success through insightful financial forecasting and reporting? VTrips, a leading name in the vacation rental industry, invites you to bring your expertise to our team as a Financial Analyst in the dynamic and growing field of vacation property management.

As a vital part of our finance team, you will play a key role in shaping our financial strategy, providing critical support to our Director of Finance. Your efforts in preparing financial statements, budgets, forecasts, and models will not only ensure our financial health but also guide our strategic decisions. This is an incredible opportunity to grow your career with a company that values innovation, efficiency, and a commitment to excellence.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct annual financial forecasting and quarterly re-forecasts, presenting your insights to upper management and lenders to inform strategic decision-making.
* Collaborate closely with managers across departments to align financial planning with operational needs, ensuring efficient resource allocation and financial stability.
* Prepare detailed month-end financial reports for commercial lenders and private equity partners, contributing to transparent and accountable financial management.
* Develop financial and operational models and reports, driving optimization and process improvements across the organization.
* Assist in the preparation of quarterly board meeting decks, providing clear and concise financial summaries to inform board members and guide discussions.
* Engage in due diligence for acquisition targets and support accounting teams post-close, ensuring smooth financial integration and reporting.
* Tackle Ad-Hoc projects, leveraging your problem-solving skills to support the operations team and management with timely and effective solutions.
* Embrace additional responsibilities as required, demonstrating flexibility and a commitment to the company's success.

**Other Duties:** Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**Apply now and become a vital part of the VTrips family, where your career is more than just a job - it's an adventure!**

**Qualifications and Experience:**

* A Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, economics, or a related field.
* 1-2 years of relevant experience in finance, accounting, or analysis.
* Proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint, with the ability to manage complex financial models and presentations.
* A quick learner and self-motivated professional with excellent time management skills.
* Outstanding communication skills, capable of engaging effectively with all levels of the organization.
* Strong interpersonal skills, fostering collaboration and communication across departments.
* Previous experience in the hospitality industry is an advantage, though not mandatory.

**Work Authorization/Security Clearance:** Must be eligible to work in the United States and pass a background screening.

**AAP/EEO Statement:** The Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and fully subscribes to, as well as practices, the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity. title: Financial/Budget Analyst
description:
Alivia Care, a leading non-profit healthcare organization specializing in hospice and palliative care, is hiring a Finance/Budget Analyst to join our growing team. Offering a competitive salary and benefits, generous PTO, and retirement options, Alivia Care provides a supportive work environment to grow your professional career.

**Position Details**

* **Compensation:** Base Salary $90-100K, full benefits package including 23 days PTO annual
* **Location:**  In-office position, Monday-Friday 8:00am-5:00pm; no work from home at this time
* **Typical Week:**  Creating, interpreting, reviewing, and forecasting departmental budget financial data providing business intelligence to CFO and senior leaders. Analyzing new company business lines forecasting financials.
* **Ideal Candidate:** Lives in Jacksonville area, significant experience in budgeting, administering budgeting forecasts, translating financials and helping create reports to guide numerous departmental budgeting. Former banking industry experience. Great Plains accounting software and/or MYSO experience.

**Job Responsibilities**  
The Financial Analyst prepares and reports budgetary and other financial data identifying key drivers regarding financial variances within organization budgets. S/he will provide analysis and analytics for month over month and annual financials, primarily related to department budgeting and forecasting.

* Takes primary ownership of the company's budgeting process, gathering, developing and interpreting business intelligence making recommendations to CFO
* Provides financial planning and analysis of various budgets across companies and departments.
* Helps standardize financial reporting across departments, consolidating reporting at the business unit level.
* Administers budget process, working with department leaders to analyze variances
* Uses advanced excel abilities to present charts and data to decision makers regarding budget goals
* Creates relationships and collaborates with numerous department heads, providing analysis for forward-looking financial and business-related projects.
* Interprets results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to data mining independently.
* Conduct ad hoc analyses on various company subsidiaries and affiliates.
* Compiles information and prepares reports for compliance with regulatory reporting requirements.
* Analyze reports to identify operational performance opportunities throughout all subsidiaries and affiliates.
* Assist in design, development, implementation, and maintenance of business solutions and recommendations to improve performance.
* Assist in development and presentation of operational results to senior management.
* Maintain and publish standard reports for executives and operational leadership.
* Maintain databases and develop weekly / monthly metrics reports.
* Contribute towards the achievement of company’s strategic and operational objectives.

**Education/Experience**  
Any combination of education and experience that would provide required skills and knowledge for successful performance would be qualifying. Typical qualifications would be equivalent to:

* Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or related field from an accredited university/college.
* Two (2) years experience in financial analysis, business analysis or related field; minimum
* Extensive Excel experience

**Desired Knowledge & Skills:**

* Strong ability to design integrative reports using advanced Excel functions and/or other data query driven tools.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and with minimum supervision.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work setting:

* In-person

Application Question(s):

* Do you have extensive budgeting experience?

Ability to Relocate:

* Jacksonville, FL 32257: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Financial Planning & Business Growth Strategy Analyst (Onsite)
Finance Analyst III
description:
**Why Mayo Clinic**

  

Mayo Clinic is top-ranked in more specialties than any other care provider according to U.S. News & World Report. As we work together to put the needs of the patient first, we are also dedicated to our employees, investing in competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit plans – to take care of you and your family, now and in the future. And with continuing education and advancement opportunities at every turn, you can build a long, successful career with Mayo Clinic. You’ll thrive in an environment that supports innovation, is committed to ending racism and supporting diversity, equity and inclusion, and provides the resources you need to succeed.  

  

**Responsibilities**  


This is the third in a series of four finance analyst roles in a multi-site, multi-specialty academic medical center. Assures the integrity of financial and statistical data, via preparation or review of general ledger entries, reports, schedules, worksheets, reconciliations or other analysis. Provides leadership in a team environment supporting division and departmental activities. Actively communicates and presents information to various audiences. Uses reporting tools to develop unique management financial information with significant institutional impact. Is recognized and relied upon as a subject matter expert of a finance, accounting or compliance technical area. Develops, implements, and maintains programs and tools for financial reporting. Interprets and implements accounting rules, fiscal compliance, policies and regulations. Proactively identifies opportunities and recommends options for increasing financial margins, while preserving Mayo standards and minimizing the financial and legal risks to Mayo. Develops variable-sensitive business models and/or compliance or fiscal management tools. Provides advanced analytical, financial, accounting, and compliance support to department and institutional leadership. Mentors, coaches, and trains staff. Actively participates in decision-making. Leads and facilitates multi-disciplinary workgroups or projects.


* **This position is primarily remote work. Individual will be required to provide onsite support at least once per week and must live within driving distance to the Mayo Clinic Jacksonville campus.**


**\*\*This vacancy is not eligible for sponsorship / we will not sponsor or transfer visas for this position.**


*During the selection process, you may participate in an OnDemand (pre-recorded) interview that you can complete at your convenience. During the OnDemand interview, a question will appear on your screen, and you will have time to consider each question before responding. You will have the opportunity to re-record your answer to each question - Mayo Clinic will only see the final recording. The complete interview will be reviewed by a Mayo Clinic staff member and you will be notified of next steps.*

 **Qualifications**  

* Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in Accounting or Finance.
* If degree is in Accounting or Finance, minimum of six years applicable experience in accounting or finance is required. Other business related bachelor's degrees require a minimum of nine years of applicable accounting or finance experience. A master degree in accounting or finance, a MBA, MHA, CPA (active or inactive), CMA or CIA can be substituted for one year experience.
* Professional designation such as CPA (active or inactive) or CMA is preferred.

**Additional Qualifications:**


Has an advanced understanding of accounting and finance practices. Has advanced knowledge of Microsoft applications including Word, Excel and Outlook. Advanced investigational skills, shows attention to detail, accuracy and ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks. Solid customer-service skills; anticipates, understands and addresses customer needs in a timely manner. Advanced knowledge of large accounting and/or grant management systems. Ability to work in a team environment and develop constructive working relationships with others. Demonstrable communication and presentation skills. Ability to work independently and lead projects and activities. Possess initiative, analytical skills, and an ability to operate with a high level of productivity.


This position will accept applications until 03/31/2024. This deadline may be extended if the necessary candidate pool is not met by this date.

 **Exemption Status**  

  

Exempt  

  

**Compensation Detail**  

  

$84,510.40 - $118,393.60 / year. Education, experience and tenure may be considered along with internal equity when job offers are extended.  

  

**Benefits Eligible**  

  

Yes  

  

**Schedule**  

  

Full Time  

  

**Hours/Pay Period**  

  

80  

  

**Schedule Details**  

  

Monday - Friday with typical hours of 8:00 am - 5:00 pm with some overtime expected.  

  

**Weekend Schedule**  

  

N/A  

  

**International Assignment**  

  

No  

  

**Site Description**  

Just as our reputation has spread beyond our Minnesota roots, so have our locations. Today, our employees are located at our three major campuses in Phoenix/Scottsdale, Arizona, Jacksonville, Florida, Rochester, Minnesota, and at Mayo Clinic Health System campuses throughout Midwestern communities, and at our international locations. Each Mayo Clinic location is a special place where our employees thrive in both their work and personal lives. Learn more about what each unique Mayo Clinic campus has to offer, and where your best fit is.  

  

**Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer**
  

As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer Mayo Clinic is committed to creating an inclusive environment that values the diversity of its employees and does not discriminate against any employee or candidate. Women, minorities, veterans, people from the LGBTQ communities and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply to join our teams. Reasonable accommodations to access job openings or to apply for a job are available.  

  

  

**Recruiter**  

  

Oneida Her

 This position is responsible for the post check activities for a large-scale client remediation. Position requires data validation, branch office communications, project status updates to management regarding former client payments.

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

description:

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Description:Exciting Career Opportunity at VTrips

  


Are you skilled in financial analysis and passionate about driving business success through insightful financial forecasting and reporting? VTrips, a leading name in the vacation rental industry, invites you to bring your expertise to our team as a Financial Analyst in the dynamic and growing field of vacation property management.

  


As a vital part of our finance team, you will play a key role in shaping our financial strategy, providing critical support to our Director of Finance. Your efforts in preparing financial statements, budgets, forecasts, and models will not only ensure our financial health but also guide our strategic decisions. This is an incredible opportunity to grow your career with a company that values innovation, efficiency, and a commitment to excellence.

  


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct annual financial forecasting and quarterly re-forecasts, presenting your insights to upper management and lenders to inform strategic decision-making.
* Collaborate closely with managers across departments to align financial planning with operational needs, ensuring efficient resource allocation and financial stability.
* Prepare detailed month-end financial reports for commercial lenders and private equity partners, contributing to transparent and accountable financial management.
* Develop financial and operational models and reports, driving optimization and process improvements across the organization.
* Assist in the preparation of quarterly board meeting decks, providing clear and concise financial summaries to inform board members and guide discussions.
* Engage in due diligence for acquisition targets and support accounting teams post-close, ensuring smooth financial integration and reporting.
* Tackle Ad-Hoc projects, leveraging your problem-solving skills to support the operations team and management with timely and effective solutions.
* Embrace additional responsibilities as required, demonstrating flexibility and a commitment to the company's success.

  


**Other Duties:** Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

  


**Apply now and become a vital part of the VTrips family, where your career is more than just a job - it's an adventure!**

Requirements:**Qualifications and Experience:**

* A Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, economics, or a related field.
* 1-2 years of relevant experience in finance, accounting, or analysis.
* Proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint, with the ability to manage complex financial models and presentations.
* A quick learner and self-motivated professional with excellent time management skills.
* Outstanding communication skills, capable of engaging effectively with all levels of the organization.
* Strong interpersonal skills, fostering collaboration and communication across departments.
* Previous experience in the hospitality industry is an advantage, though not mandatory.

**Work Authorization/Security** Clearance: Must be eligible to work in the United States and pass a background screening.

  


**AAP/EEO Statement:** The Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and fully subscribes to, as well as practices, the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law in the recruitment, selection, placement, training, compensation, and promotion of our employees.

title: Financial Controller - Construction
description:
**Company Description**

CYE Enterprises, Inc. is a woman-owned small business and a third-generation federal contractor specializing in roofing, concrete, energy, and renovation projects for federal agencies. Our team strives to consistently exceed our clients' expectations, and we value our employees as our greatest asset. Our corporate office is located in Jacksonville, FL. We service federal agencies and commercial customers throughout the country.

**Role Description**

CYE Enterprises, Inc., a prominent construction company in Jacksonville, FL, is seeking a full-time, on-site Controller with expertise in construction accounting. As a key member of our management team, the Controller will play a pivotal role in overseeing all financial functions, including accounting, budgeting, and financial analysis, with a focus on our construction projects. This role encompasses managing financial reporting, operations, cash flow, and forecasting for optimal project financial performance. Additionally, the Controller will manage the performance of direct reports.

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

**Qualifications**

* Ideal candidates will have a Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or related field or equivalent relevant work experience
* **5+ years experience in a Controller and/or Finance Director role**

Must have experience in construction accounting

Must be proficient in Excel and Microsoft Office Suite.

**Preference is given to candidates with Sage 100 Contractor experience**

* Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact effectively with company executives, vendors, and employees at all levels of the organization.
* Problem Solving/Troubleshooting skills
* Thoroughness and attentiveness to details
* Ability to prioritize and multitask
* Proactive and deadline-oriented
* Negotiation skills

**Duties and responsibilities**

* Lead, manage and support Accounting/HR Team
* Work closely with Owners and Department Managers
* Manage all aspects and accounting of the general ledger, cash flow
* Strong understanding of construction accounting (WIP, over/under billing, job costing, etc.)
* Safeguard assets and assure accurate and timely recording of all transactions by implementing disciplines of internal audits, controls and checks across all departments
* Manage the accuracy and productivity of day-to-day activities of cash disbursements, invoicing/billing, payroll, fixed asset records, general & entity accounting, job cost accounting, etc.
* Prepare financial statements
* Provide financial analysis tools to evaluate special projects, programs, capital expenditures, job costing, etc. when necessary
* Prepare / monitor company Cash flows & Budgets
* Report financial results / recommendations to Owners
* Interface with outside audit firms(s), outside CPA and banks
* Coordinate the provision of information to external auditors for annual audits
* Managing the development, documentation, and maintenance of accounting policies, procedures, and internal controls; ensuring compliance with GAAP.
* Reconcile Payroll, State and Federal Payroll Taxes with returns filed by payroll service.
* Research corporate registration and tax requirements by state and locality for new contract opportunities – to include corporate taxes, sales & use taxes, payroll taxes, etc.
* Responsible for filing & remitting monthly Sales & Use Taxes
* Comply with local, state, and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings, annual registrations.
* Provide bankers, brokers, etc. financial information for renewing bonding and various insurance policies, i.e. property, general liability, worker’s compensation and health insurance.

**Direct and indirect reports**

* Staff Accountant / Accounts Payable / Accounts Receivable
* HR & Payroll Administrator
* Contract Manager / Accounts Receivable

Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.

CYE Enterprises, Inc. will not be engaging with agencies to fill this position. We kindly request that recruiters do not forward resumes to CYE Enterprises, Inc. regarding this role.

title: Domo Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.

**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**

Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

**Requirements:**

* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

**Benefits:**  


* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/ year**

*Everlight Solar is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all types and are excited to work with talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds. Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: Financial Analyst
description:
The Financial Analyst will work within the FP&A group and play a key role in providing cost and margin planning, modeling, and analytical support to business partners throughout the organization. The hired candidate may work in our Danvers, MA office, be hybrid or work remotely residing in the Eastern time zone.  
**What you'll be doing:**

* Create and maintain monthly Revenue and Operating Expense Financial Package; conduct monthly meetings with business partners
+ Track key metrics for revenue and cost across certain business units, functional areas, products, projects, categories, and department; items include: detailed product revenue, cost and margin performance analysis, headcount statistics, discretionary/capital spending and savings and opportunities/risk and exposure
+ Research actual variances versus benchmarks; work with business partners to develop comprehensive explanations of variances and support remediation, as needed
+ Be a thought partner to the organization’s planning processes to support build-out of reporting - partner with business to improve visibility of performance for use and interpretation of results

* Continuously look at opportunities to optimize analytics models and reporting processes to provide more timely and relevant financial insights for organization
* Assist in coordinating company’s planning process including the administration and maintenance of budget and forecast software and compilation of reporting to Executive team and Board of Directors

**What you'll need:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Equivalent discipline required
* 3+ years’ experience as a financial analyst
* Proficiency in financial forecasting, modeling, and reporting
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, along with superior attention to detail
* Must function at expert level in MS Excel; Proficiency in Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint
* Ability to extract data from financial systems and into environments such as Power BI and other analytical tools
* Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills
* Exceptional organization skills; must be able to prioritize multiple tasks and work independently
* Oracle and Salesforce experience a plus

**Success Competencies:**

* Nimble learner – readily learns and adopts new technologies; is resourceful and curious
* Highly organized and comfortable managing multiple projects simultaneously, demonstrating excellent time management skills with attention to details
* Considers all relevant factors and uses appropriate decision-making criteria and principles
* Works cooperatively with others across the organization to align and achieve shared objectives.
* Demonstrates self-awareness; possesses a strong work ethic; manages own workload autonomously.

  


**Compensation range:** 65k to 78k USD   
The actual salary offer to the successful candidate will be based on job-related education, training, licensure, certifications, related experience and other related factors.

title: Media Sales Consultant
description:
Valpak Sales Representative - Sell for a Brand that Sells Itself!

(Remote Outside Sales Opportunity in Philadelphia, PA)

Are you looking for a new sales position with a well-established brand? Do you want to invest in yourself, your career, and future? Then look no further. Valpak is seeking qualified sales professionals to join our team.

The ideal candidate has a positive attitude, is self-assured and thrives in a fast-paced environment with the ability to multitask and manage multiple priorities. Must possess excellent communication skills to maintain relationships with existing customers while also seeking out new prospects through lead generation, referrals, and networking. You will need at least 2+ years of experience in cultivating sales and building relationships, preferably in the media/print industry but not required.

As an Outside Sales Representative, you will belong to a territory that will consist of small and mid-sized businesses (Prospecting B2B with companies under 1,000 employees). The Valpak Iconic Blue Envelope is designed to increase sales for our clients. We know how to plan personalized marketing campaigns using data and analytics to reach the customers our clients want. We combine the Blue Envelope with postcards and digital product lines to provide a full marketing campaign to obtain maximum results for our customers. This is why our sales team is so successful.

Below are the highlights of what we have to offer….

* Competitive earning expectations include base plus uncapped commissions. Approximately $60,000 - $70,000 in your first year. After your first year, your earning potential will continue to grow as your book of business grows.
* Paid training to learn our processes and selling tools (computer skills is a must)
* High Tech Data and Analytics at your fingertips to build effective campaigns
* Proven process to put it all together in front of the customer.
* Participate in contests where you can win trips and prizes.
* Benefits Including:
+ Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits start on the first day of the month after hire date when you sign up.
+ Automatic 401k participation after 30 days of employment
+ Generous Paid Time Off Policy
+ Paid Holidays
+ Additional voluntary benefits like Pet Insurance and Life Insurance
+ Programs like DEI, Health & Wellness, Employee Assistance Program

* Casual, positive work environment that promotes from within

 

Your consultative sales approach will ensure a greater close rate and that makes your earnings potential limitless. If this sounds like a fit for you, apply today! We want to hear from you.

 

Salary: 40K plus unlimited commissions

title: Technical Business Analyst (Clinical Oncology Studies)
description:
**Working** under the direction of the Clinical Director, **the Business Analyst** will have a key role and be responsible for aligning our information technology systems with business operations by analyzing and developing innovative integrated software solutions, including Real World Data/ AI for oncology clinical trials and clinical trial management systems. **BA will work with staff and be looked upon to discuss workings in "plain English"**  Duties include providing internal IT support and managing web-based services and internal customer support for the Coalition and its affiliated entities

**This is a hybrid position requiring 1-2 days/week working from our Center City Philadelphia office.**

**JOB REQUIREMENTS**

**Skills/Abilities**

The Business Analyst’s role requires the following:

* Exemplary interpersonal, communication and education skills toward facilitating the use of new software systems
* This role necessitates self-direction, motivation, organization, strict attention to detail and problem solving and decision making abilities
* Knowledge of a CTMS\CTMF
* Knowledge of clinical database study build is a plus
* Advanced knowledge of programming languages like SQL, MS Access and system integration solutions

**Experience**

* A minimum of five (5) years of experience working in the field of computer systems programming; operations; systems, data base or network enterprise system support (hardware or software level); or information technology management consulting.
* Experience working in a CRO or Pharmaceutical Clinical Trial environment.
* Extensive experience in technical business analysis in a related industry.
* Able to facilitate internal end-user proficiency.
* Able to design and maintain efficient customer portal support and feedback channels.
* Advanced knowledge of data security and encryption.
* Able to keep up with IT advancements.
* Knowledge of relevant licensing and industry compliance regulations

**Education**

* A Bachelor’s Degree with a major in computer science, electronics or management information systems and or relevant professional experience is required.
* An accreditation in management consultancy preferred

**Responsibilities:**

* Performs system analyses on software programs, applications, and web services and makes recommendations for necessary changes or upgrades.
* Acts as the liaison with collaborators and vendors, internal departments and clinical sites to ensure system viability and user familiarity and proficiency.
* Works with staff to develop and deliver all appropriate and necessary reports.
* Works with key departments to ensure and maintain relevant efficiencies within the system.
* Assists management with identifying areas of improvement and enhancements and obtains approval for system development projects.
* Efficiently integrates new systems, programs, and applications with business operations and services.
* Analyzes and improves the performance of web-based customer portals and support services.
* Monitors product licenses and ensures compliance with IT industry regulations.
* Ensures that computer hardware remains compatible with system enhancements and updates.
* Participates in on-going continuing education courses or seminars.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Summary The User Acceptance Analyst will serve as a liaison between the users/stakeholders and IT implementation teams on cross-functional projects in adherence to the User Acceptance Framework. The User Acceptance Framework defines an enhanced relationship between IT and the user community through engagement early and often, additional transparency from IT and users, and high levels of collaboration throughout the SDLC. The Analyst will be responsible for developing Acceptance Test Plans, ensuring completion of User Acceptance Checklists, Updating Execution Plans, and delivering information through weekly statuses. The Analyst will own the reporting of User Acceptance metrics and analysis of KPIs. The Analyst will also work with Quality and Release Management leadership to maintain processes and practices necessary to retain accurate information; and improve upon them if necessary. Job Responsibilities* Coordinate varying User Acceptance preparations and activities for dedicated Early Business Testing (EBT) and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) periods including, but not limited to, data needs, access needs, environment needs, business scenario documentation, etc.
* Create User Acceptance test plans in collaboration with the business managers/stakeholders, business users, business analysts, IT teams, and project managers.
* Monitor User Acceptance Testing [execution] efforts and work with users to record and mitigate any issues/delays.
* Manage relationships with both internal and external teams/customers/stakeholders.
* Provide critical feedback and action-oriented recommendations that provide value for User Acceptance processes across the enterprise.
* Collaborate with end users from various levels and departments on User Acceptance planning efforts, such as test case creation, trainings, and readiness reviews for projects and major planned releases.
* Participate in functional demonstrations of system changes alongside development team and business analysts (system and project).
* Ensure that all entrance and exit criteria to begin User Acceptance Testing have been met and track via the User Acceptance Checklist.
* Provide weekly User Acceptance statuses on test execution and bugs to all stakeholders.
* Obtain formal/written User Acceptance (approval) from stakeholders

 Degree/licenses/Professional Certifications* Bachelor Degree (preferably in MIS, IT, or Business)
* Business analysis or quality assurance certifications preferred
* Certified Scrum Master or Agile [methodology] designation a plus
* ITIL certification(s) a plus

 Experience* 5+years' experience in business and/or data analysis including end-to-end testing required

 Compentencies, Knowledge, & abilities* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present to all levels of management
* Exceptional interpersonal relationship building skills: able to work with a variety of people and groups at multiple levels in a constructive and collaborative manner; including working across Group Companies
* Outstanding strategic insight to understand and consider relevant organizational / departmental impacts of decisions and departmental growth strategy.
* Subject matter expertise-level working experience in problem solving and analytical skills
* Strong time management skills to achieve objectives and meet deadlines.
* Strong customer service orientation (responsive, consultative, collaborative and accurate).
* Extensive understanding of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
* Knowledge of Property & Casualty Insurance terminologies and processes is preferred
* Hands on/ working experience with Microsoft Azure DevOps preferred

title: Business Analyst
description:
Advantexe, an EdTech company, is an award-winning world leader in the design, development, and delivery of cloud-based simulation-centric learning solutions for businesses around the world. The Business Analyst position at Advantexe is responsible for helping to create, deploy, and maintain Advantexe’s award-winning business simulations. The Business Analyst is a critical member of the simulation development team and has two primary functions: 1. Working with Subject Matter Experts (SME), solution architects, and simulation modelers to conduct research on the base conditions and industry trends that would drive, affect, and improve the outcomes of the simulations when being developed, and 2. Helping to deploy the simulations in virtual, in-person, and blended workshops. The key responsibilities of the position will include:

* **Simulation Industry Research - Identify and verify simulation base conditions and assumptions including:**
1. Industry size
2. Company-specific financial terms
3. Product life cycle analyses
4. Competitive environment
5. Standard industry Gross margins
6. Industry trends
7. Potential company initiatives, wobblers, and scenarios
8. Helping develop model effects from scenarios
9. Participation in customizing calls to learn more about the client
10. Development of the overall simulation story

* **Simulation Wireframes, Development, and Content**
1. Work with development teams to wireframe the entire simulation including all user interface interactions
2. Work with development teams to manage project flow and identify simulations variables
3. Develop simulation content that explains decision sets and helps guide users during the simulation experience
4. Create all supporting simulation material including user manuals and teaching guides

* **Simulation Testing – play through all parts of a simulation to ensure the simulation works flawlessly including:**
1. Simulation model assumptions
2. Assuring variables react in the correct manner and drive the proper outcome of metrics and financial statements

* **Simulation Delivery**
1. Travel to company sites and use virtual delivery tools like Zoom and Microsoft Teams to help facilitate and deliver simulations to client user audiences
2. Provide insight for debriefings for facilitators

**Skills Required**

* Business background and base level understanding of economics and financial management is a must
* A strong understanding of Microsoft Excel is a must
* Exceptional writing, presentation, and communication skills
* Must be a self-motivated team player

title: Administrative Assistant (Mid-Atlantic Office)
description:
Our Mid-Atlantic Regional office is looking for a dynamic **Administrative Assistant** with the personality, professionalism and skills to be the positive first impression of the organization for clients, subcontractors and internal stakeholders.

**About** **PJ Dick**:

* Premier regional general contractor and commercial construction manager;
* Consistently ranked in the **Top 100 Builders** nationally by *Engineering News Record;*
* Family-owned, Family of Companies whose core values are Safety, Quality, Integrity, Family, and Community;
* Voted a **"Best Places to Work"** multiple times.

**What the Role Involves:**

* You will provide administrative support (clerical/secretarial) services and engage with multiple disciplines (e.g. Marketing/Business Development, Estimating, Accounting and Construction Operations).
* You will answer, screen, and forward any incoming phone calls.
* You will organize, process and follow up on a variety of documents for construction projects, working on multiple tasks and shifting priorities while managing deadlines.
* You will act as liaison with other departments, external contacts, clients, etc. to arrange meetings, clarify and resolve problems, coordinate work, maintain working relationship and public relations, etc.
* You will prepare special reports, studies, statistical analysis, brochures, etc.
* You will collect and review certified payroll from subcontractors for federal projects.

**Who We Are Looking For:**

* Critical, creative thinkers with inquiring minds;
* Someone with drive, determination, and a high level of self-discipline;
* Someone who loves a fast-paced and dynamic work environment that focuses on problem solving, collaboration with a wide variety of team members, and structured work product;
* A confident team player who develops trust across stakeholders, is a clear communicator and facilitator, and demonstrates a high degree of critical thinking skills.

 **We offer an outstanding compensation package with excellent benefits, professional development and education reimbursement, annual bonus and profit sharing, and a positive team-oriented environment.**

**SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:**

* 4 year business or technical degree plus
* Minimum 2 years administrative experience or equivalent combinations training and related experience.
* Working knowledge of general office procedures plus ability to organize and coordinate group work efforts required.
* Proficient research, supervisory and communicative skills essential.

We are an Equal Opportunity and VEVRAA Federal Contracting Employer: We encourage Covered Veterans, Minorities, Females, and Disabled Individuals to apply.

title: Consultant - Business Operations / Management
description:
**Business Operations Consultant/Project Director**

*Design, build, implement, train and evaluate customized solutions and advice that assist organizations in improving productivity and increasing revenues, and that positively impact overall performance. Solution implementation will encompass business development, organizational engineering, process management and financial systems. The Project Director is responsible for the client relationship from the origination of the opportunity to the evaluation of the effectiveness of the completed body of work. Responsibilities include client financial improvement, client relationship management and project management.* 

**Position Description**

**This position provides an outstanding opportunity to work with clients, to help them improve their operational and financial efficiencies and success. This position requires 100% travel.** 

**JOB PURPOSE** 

*Design, build, implement, train and evaluate customized solutions and advice that assist organizations in improving productivity and increasing revenues, and that positively impact overall performance. Solution implementation will encompass business development, organizational engineering, process management and financial systems.*

**QUALIFICATIONS** 

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**COMPENSATION EXPECTATIONS:**

**135 - 145K+**

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

1. Deliver quantifiable and sustainable value for clients that are reflected through the income statement, balance sheet, cash flow, as well as quality of life. This is achieved through the successful development, implementation, training and evaluation of solutions to client challenges.
2. Oversee the identification and communication of work to be completed on behalf of the client. Responsible for clear and concise communication with assigned Assistant Director or Sr. Project Director.

**OTHER REQUIREMENTS**

1. ***Ability to travel onsite with clients (100% travel requirement).***
2. Authorized to work in the United States.
3. Minimum of four years of consulting experience with a proven track record of delivering value for clients.
4. Administrative duties completed in a timely and accurate manner.
5. Ability to communicate in English, both written and verbal.
6. Valid state issued driver’s license and current auto insurance.
7. Advanced computer skills (Microsoft Suite, financial software, dashboards, CRM’s and PM software)
8. Proven fiduciary responsibility, successfully managing a budget of 10M+, preferred.
9. Prior business ownership, preferred.

**COMPETENCIES REQUIRED**

* **Problem Solving** – Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; develops alternative solutions; uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.
* **Change Management** – Communicates changes effectively and builds broad consensus; monitors transition and evaluates results.
* **Leadership** – Exhibits confidence in self and others; inspires and motivates others to perform well; accepts feedback from others
* **Judgement** – Displays willingness to make decisions; supports and explains reasoning for decisions. Gains trust of peers and leadership through sound decision making.
* **Results Driven** – Serious about committing and getting to results. Exemplifies this ability through sound decision-making, backed by logic, understanding contingency planning, with an attitude toward appropriate prioritization and effort.
* **People Orientated** – Possess a high EQ and readily able to connect and build relationships with clients, their staff and Cogent team members.
* **Conflict Management –** Empathetic and able to see all perspectives; graciously communicates differing points of view to build understanding; finds agreeable, forward-looking, and policy-aligned solutions to resolve conflicts others would see as irreconcilable.

**CULTURAL EXPECTATIONS**

Given the unique nature of the company and our strong focus on integrity and values, these cultural components of how we operate will be expected:

1. Cogent Analytics strives to always put our clients first, choosing to do what is in their best interest even if that choice may not be the easy or popular path.
2. Cogent Analytics maintains the highest professional standards and pledges to operate with integrity and honesty in all that we endeavor to do.
3. We believe in a collaborative environment between the administrative staff, Leadership (AD and MD) and Project Directors.
4. We understand and embrace the “Obligation to Challenge”, realizing that the status quo can be improved upon based on our unique and diverse capabilities and insights.
5. We embrace diversity realizing the benefit of working together and sharing individual exceptional insights to the group. Through these insights discovered in the pursuit of solving problems we will improve results both for our clients and ourselves.

We value the service and commitment made by our veterans and welcome them to join our company.

*This job description is intended to describe the general nature, complexity, and level of work to be performed by team member assigned to this position and is not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and/or skills required. It does not prescribe or restrict the work that may be assigned.* 

*We are an equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to our team and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: MDM Business Analyst
description:
https://www.linkedin.com/company/ai-talentflow  
linkedin.com/in/chapmanandre

**AI TalentFlow: MDM Business Analyst - Supply Chain****Fuel Your Career Growth by Building Next-Gen MDM Solutions**

About AI TalentFlow:

AI TalentFlow specializes in accelerating startup growth, scaling enterprise solutions, and nurturing the career growth of the individuals who power those organizations. We connect top talent in AI, Data, Analytics, Product, and Agile with innovative companies seeking to push boundaries and achieve remarkable success.

About the Role:

Are you a seasoned MDM Business Analyst with a passion for supply chain data and a desire to contribute to the development of cutting-edge solutions? If so, lets talk!

In this exciting role, you will play a critical role in leading the technical planning and implementation of MDM projects, leveraging your expertise in cloud platforms and Agile methodologies. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders across the organization to gather requirements, analyze data, and translate business needs into actionable technical specifications for developers.

This is an excellent opportunity for a highly motivated and results-oriented individual who thrives in fast-paced environments and enjoys working at the forefront of technology advancements.

Responsibilities:

* 
Lead the technical planning and requirements gathering phases of MDM projects, including estimation, development, testing, and management.

* 
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and document MDM requirements, including data elements, business rules, and use cases.

* 
Conduct comprehensive data mapping exercises to identify data sources, elements, and relationships relevant to the MDM implementation.

* 
Analyze and document existing data structures and data flows to assess compatibility with the Informatica P360 MDM solution.

* 
Translate business requirements into technical specifications and user stories for developers, with a particular focus on data mappings and transformations.

* 
Work directly and collaboratively with Business SMEs, MDM Solution Architects, Administrators, and developers.

* 
Serve as a Business Analyst lead and mentor, providing technical support and guidance to the team.

* 
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with team members of various experience levels.


Qualifications:

* 
8+ years' experience in MDM Business Analysis.

* 
5+ years' experience on the Informatica MDM platform (version 10.x required).

* 
Minimum of one implementation experience performed in a lead business analyst role.

* 
Proven ability to identify and implement best practices in MDM solutions.

* 
Extensive knowledge and experience with Supply Chain Data.

* 
Development experience on a cloud platform (preferably Azure) is a plus.

* 
Client-facing or consulting experience is highly preferred.

* 
Strong problem-solving skills and a demonstrated ability to create innovative solutions.

* 
Flexible, adaptable attitude with the ability to manage multiple responsibilities and adjust to diverse environments.

* 
Passion for continuous learning and professional development.

* 
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively present complex technical concepts to a diverse audience.

* 
Bachelor's degree in MIS, Computer Science, Math, Engineering, or a comparable field.

* 
Solid foundation in Computer Science with strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software design principles.

* 
Experience developing software using agile methodologies.

* 
Proficient in authoring, editing, and presenting technical documents.

title: Healthcare Business Analyst
description:
Seeking a Healthcare Analyst to join our team. We are a small company located in Paoli, PA. We have people working at the office and working remotely in multiple states. Our clients we work with are primarily Medicare and Medicaid plans and TPA's. We help our clients manage their member and provider communications. We have a platform our clients use to track the communications i.e. letters, statements, EOB's, EOP's, ID cards, Welcome kits to name some of what we handle for our clients.   
 Job Description:-  
   
 • Good understanding of Medicare, Medicaid and other government healthcare programs. Experience with Eligibility, Enrollment preferred. Minimum 1-2 years of experience.  
 • Ability to analyze issues / errors reported by customer and perform first level of analysis before handing over to technical teams.  
 • Act as the single point of contact for clients, manage stake holders and customer expectations, and facilitate resolution of issues.  
 • Basic understanding of Databases, with hands on experience in writing queries and analyze data files, if required to aid analysis and support activities (mandatory)  
 • Proactively manage Client needs by understanding business requirements, criticality of issues, ensuring timely updates and maintain customer satisfaction.   
 • Proficiency with MS Excel and other MS Office tools.  
 • Hands on experience in creating functional and technical documentation.  
   
 This BA will be less involved in SDLC activities (which a typical IT Project BAs does in other software projects) and more in working extensively with clients - managing customer expectations, conflict resolution, build rapport with end users and work with them through tickets proactively, provide a first level trouble shooting and ensure customer satisfaction. Compensation – depends on experience. If possible, I would like to find a Jr analyst with some experience.  $60k to start, but some room for negotiation.We don’t currently have health insurance, but we offer some additional compensation to help offset the cost of health coverage, vacation and 401k plan.

title: Business Analyst, Health Information & Analytics
description:
Are you a **Business Analyst** who is passionate about people? Are you looking for a job where you’ll enjoy excellent benefits and the chance to make a difference in your community? Then join the I Am Boundless, Inc. team!


We are a fast-growing nonprofit organization committed to building a world that realizes the boundless potential of all people. For more than forty years, we’ve provided people with intellectual and developmental disabilities and behavioral health challenges the support and services to thrive. Our person-centered approach to care celebrates people for who they are and empowers them to become active participants in the communities where they live, work, and play.


Will you join us? Apply today!


**Boundless Benefits**  

Working for Boundless has many perks. We treat our team like family and offer advantages that allow you to focus, thrive, and grow. Why Boundless?


* Excellent benefits including no-cost dental, vision, and life insurance
* A Boundless sponsored $150 deposited into your flexible spending plan
* 232 hours of paid time off
* Student loan forgiveness through the Federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program
* Scholarships geared towards professional development and continued education


**Schedule:** Full-Time (Located in Worthington, OH)


* Monday - Friday: 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.
	+ Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.

**What You Will be Doing**  

We want people to join our team who share our values of love, excellence, respect, empowerment, and well-being. The ideal candidate will function as an administrative, technical, and operational liaison and resource. The BA supports the Health Information and Analytics (HIA) team projects and daily tasks by engaging with key stakeholders and cross-functional teams to align and prioritize projects according to business needs. The BA will lead strategic initiatives for process optimization, leveraging advanced data analytics for decision-making, and tracking the effectiveness of improvement programs. The role involves performing detailed analysis of business processes, documenting and communicating findings, and managing a variety of projects from inception to completion.


**Minimum Qualifications, Experience & Education:**

* High School Diploma or the equivalent and a minimum experience of at least 2 years in business analysis and project management, preferably in a healthcare setting; or
* Bachelor's degree in business administration, Healthcare Administration, Health Informatics, or related field.
* Knowledge and experience with various software systems including Microsoft Office Products including high proficiency in Excel, Word, and SharePoint.
* Some knowledge of data analytic software including, but not limited to, Power BI and Sisense or similar analytics tool.


**Preferred Qualifications, Experience & Education:**

* Master’s degree in business administration, Healthcare Administration, Health Informatics, or related field.
* One to two years’ experience in the field of developmental disabilities.


All candidates who have received an offer of employment will be required to undergo a pre-employment background check, drug screen, and health screen as applicable for the role.


We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

* Configure and implement new systems and/or enhance existing systems
* Research technical solution options. Identify problems and opportunities.
* Scope projects. Define and schedule project plans. Lead projects through completion
* Will work individually as well as part of a team to accomplish objectives. Will "roll up your sleeves" as necessary to dig in and figure out solutions and get things done.
* Define test scenarios and use cases, and thoroughly test technical deliverables.
* Manage change and provide post go-live support.
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex system issues

Candidates are required to be able to work well under pressure, enjoy partnering with end users, have excellent verbal and written communication skills, be self-directed and require minimal time to get up and going. Individuals should be excellent communicators. This position requires candidates to work onsite daily. Benefits include paid holidays and vacation, medical, dental and vision, life and disability and 401K. 

**Requirements:** 

* Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related discipline, or equivalent experience combined with formal training.
* 3+ years of relevant implementation project management / project planning experience around enterprise applications with multiple business stakeholders and business processes within a manufacturing and/or distribution environment (e.g. ERP, WMS, TMS, Maintenance Management etc.)
* Proven ability to execute business systems project tasks (write requirements for customizations, perform vendor management, define test scenarios and test customizations, define and execute user training)
* Experience implementing applications in an environment with 400+ users and a suite of integrated complex business systems.
* Strong business process and technical acumen; able to translate business challenges into scalable technology-based solutions
* Proven ability to analyze information, detect patterns and relationships, and solve problems on a complex level.
* The ability to create use cases and test plans.
* Will have exposure to waterfall, agile and hybrids of both project management methodologies, and be able to define the best approach for each given application.
* Must be able to work as a part of a team, and individually to accomplish the goals
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills providing the ability to collaborate with a variety of stakeholders including business leaders and cross-functional teams

**Reasons to work for this organization:**  
1. Privately held   
2. Profitable company   
3. Experiencing growth  
4. Recession proof business  
5. High profile position, at a company that can provide quick business decision making processes, there is minimal red tape
