**Categories:** Unit 9 - CSUEU - Technical Support Services, Probationary, Full Time, Information Systems & Technology, Telecommute eligible (work onsite as scheduled and/or as requested and telecommute as scheduled)
  
  

Position Summary
  
  

Under the direct supervision of the Associate Vice President – Enrollment, in conjunction with the Senior Director of Enrollment Management, Registrar, and Enrollment Management Business Analyst, the Business Systems Analyst will support a comprehensive enrollment management operation and aid in the technical analysis, troubleshooting, and operational support of PeopleSoft Campus Solutions (student) system in use by students, staff, and student employees at San Diego State University. The analyst will also assist in supporting integrations between the Student Information System and other enterprise systems, including the uAchieve degree audit system, Slate CRM and the OnBase imaging/workflow system.
  
  

**Responsibilities and duties include but are not limited to:**  

Assist in the design, planning, and implementation of enhancements to complex projects and support continuous process improvements.
  
  

Aid in providing consultation and facilitating the analysis and definition of system operations, business rules, and user requirements, and
  
  

Work cross-functionally to solve problems, improve interfaces, and implement changes.
  
  

Assist with the coordination and monitoring of operational processes, query optimization, troubleshooting, and maintenance of PeopleSoft Campus Solutions SIS configuration.
  
  

This is a full-time (1.0 time-base), benefits eligible, permanent/probationary position. This position is designated exempt under FLSA and is not eligible for overtime compensation. Standard SDSU work hours are Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., but may vary based on operational needs.
  
  

This position is eligible for partial telecommuting with onsite work in San Diego.
  
  

Department Summary
  
  

Enrollment Services comprises Undergraduate and Graduate Admissions, Evaluations, Office of the Registrar, Prospective Student Services, and Enrollment Communications. Enrollment Services implements SDSU enrollment management policies and provides services to students from their initial point of interest in SDSU to their graduation
  
  

Education and Experience
  
  

To enter this classification, a basic foundation of knowledge and skills in applications programming and systems analysis and related programming support functions is a prerequisite. This foundation would normally be obtained through a bachelor’s degree, preferably in computer science or business, or equivalent training and applied experience. Foundation knowledge and skills for the Analyst/Programmer, depending on the position assignment, may include working knowledge of a specific industry standard applications programming language and knowledge
  
  

Key Qualifications
  
  

Experience in the business analysis of process improvement and application development in higher education or other regulated industries.
  
  

Working knowledge of PeopleSoft Campus Solutions.
  
  

Experience writing queries.
  
  

Strong technical skills, including proficiency in SQL.
  
  

Goal-oriented with strong initiative, imagination and organizational qualities.
  
  

Ability to work under tight deadlines and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
  
  

Compensation and Benefits
  
  

Starting salary upon appointment is not expected to exceed $5,834 per month.
  
  

Salary placement is determined by the education, experience, and qualifications the candidate brings to the position, internal equity, and the hiring department’s fiscal resources.
  
  

San Diego State University offers a rich benefits package that constitutes a major portion of total compensation.
  
  

**CSU Classification Salary Range:** $3,899 - $7,506 per month.
  
  

Diversity and Community at SDSU
  
  

At SDSU, our diversity gives us power and benefits every single member of our community.
  
  

Through our commitment to equity and inclusion, we encourage all members of our community to purposefully learn from one another through open and respectful dialogue and responsible engagement. For more information, click here .
  
  

Principles of Community
  
  

At San Diego State University, we are a community of diverse individuals who have and represent many perspectives, beliefs, and identities. This diversity lends our community strength, and we commit to creating and sustaining an inclusive and intellectually vibrant environment that benefits all members of our university.
  
  

SDSU’s Principles of Community is an aspirational statement that is intended to evolve over time. The statement reflects the ideals we are encouraged to uphold in our interactions with one another.
  
  

Supplemental Information
  
  

Initial review of the required application materials, including cover letters and resumes, will begin on April 2, 2024. To receive full consideration, apply by April 1, 2024. The position will remain open until filled.
  
  

The person holding this position is considered a ‘mandated reporter’ under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.
  
  

San Diego State University is not a sponsoring agency for staff or management positions (e.g., H-1B visa). Applicants must currently be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. Offers of employment are contingent upon the presentation of documents that demonstrate a person's identity and authorization to work in the United States, which are consistent with the provisions of the Immigration Reform and Control Act.
  
  

A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily and is required for employment. SDSU will make a conditional offer of employment, which may be rescinded if the background check reveals disqualifying information, and/or it is discovered that the candidate knowingly withheld or falsified information. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the continued employment of a current SDSU employee who was conditionally offered the position.
  
  

SDSU is a smoke-free campus. For more information, please click here .
  
  

SDSU is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers all qualified candidates for employment and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, age, disability, genetic information, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, medical condition, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, covered military and veteran status, or any other protected characteristic or status. Reasonable accommodations will be provided for qualified applicants with disabilities who request an accommodation by contacting Taylor Jaress at tjaress@sdsu.edu .

title: Staff Commercial Operations Analyst (Hybrid)
description:
About Dexcom


Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2022 revenues of $2.9B, a growth of 18% over 2021. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 8,000 people worldwide.


**Meet the team:**

Staff Commercial Operations Analyst, Commercial Analytics will drive the analytics effort for Dexcom’s Trade team and the commercial leadership team. This position will include (but is not limited to) responsibility for the development and management of Trade analytics and ad-hoc analytics at both the national and sub-national levels. Success in this position will require a problem-solving orientation, data analysis expertise, and the ability to collaborate within a cross-functional team.


**Where you come in:**

* Act as a business partner to the Commercial trade team in key activities, such as performance analysis, and assessment of initiatives
* Provide support to the Dexcom’s Trade and Channel team to bring business actionable insights and drive efficiencies.
* Develop, maintain, and oversee performance reporting against key performance indicators, working with functional leads to understand strategic initiatives and identify ways to measure performance.
* Effectively explain modeling assumptions to key stakeholders including senior leadership via oral and written communication. Partner cross-functionally with Finance, Sales, Sales Operations, Forecasting, and other relevant stakeholders to communicate analysis and context clearly and effectively throughout the organization as needed
* Manage and execute ad hoc analysis projects
* Prepare, distribute, and present various reports to stakeholders throughout the organization, including senior management, ensuring accuracy and timeliness
* Ensure all data and reporting are managed in a compliant manner, and adhere to the highest level of quality

**What makes you successful:**

* Strong analytical skills combined with a client service mindset with the capability to define and execute data-driven approaches to solving business questions
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills: ability to communicate effectively with key commercial stakeholders as well as cross-functionally
* Understanding of how senior management thinks and makes decisions; demonstrated ability to think strategically to drive key business decisions
* The high degree of intellectual curiosity
* Experience developing and maintaining Excel-based models and conducting related quantitative analysis in the pharmaceutical/MedTech healthcare space
* Experience with data visualization and data processing tools such as Tableau and SQL

**What you’ll get:**

* A front row seat to life changing CGM technology. Learn about our brave #dexcomwarriors community .
* A full and comprehensive benefits program.
* Growth opportunities on a global scale.
* Access to career development through in-house learning programs and/or qualified tuition reimbursement.
* An exciting and innovative, industry-leading organization committed to our employees, customers, and the communities we serve.

**Travel Required:**

* 15-25%

**Experience and Education Requirements:**

* Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 8-12 years of related experience.
* At this level a graduate degree may be desirable with 4 years of related experience

Please note: The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job, nor are they intended to be an all-inclusive list of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Management may, at its discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The duties and responsibilities in this job description may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.


An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Dexcom’s AAP may be viewed upon request by contacting Talent Acquisition at talentacquisition@dexcom.com.


If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Dexcom Talent Acquisition at talentacquisition@dexcom.com.


View the OFCCP's Pay Transparency Non Discrimination Provision at this link .


Meritain, an Aetna Company, creates and publishes the Machine-Readable Files on behalf of Dexcom. To link to the Machine-Readable Files, please click on the URL provided: https://health1.meritain.com/app/public/#/one/insurerCode=MERITAIN\_I&brandCode=MERITAINOVER/machine-readable-transparency-in-coverage?reportingEntityType=TPA\_19874&lock=true


To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Dexcom. Only authorized staffing and recruiting agencies may use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes on specific requisitions. Dexcom does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to the Talent Acquisition team, Dexcom employees or any other company location. Dexcom is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

title: Military Service - Air Force Reserve, Operations Research Analyst
Senior Data Informatics Analyst
description:
**Company Description**  

At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.


With more than 7,700+ customers, we serve approximately 85% of the Fortune 500®, and we're proud to be one of FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For® and World's Most Admired Companies™.


Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.


Unsure if you meet all the qualifications of a job description but are deeply excited about the role? We still encourage you to apply! At ServiceNow, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all voices are heard, valued, and respected. We welcome all candidates, including individuals from non-traditional, varied backgrounds, that might not come from a typical path connected to this role. We believe skills and experience are transferrable, and the desire to dream big makes for great candidates.

 **Job Description**  

We’re not yesterday’s IT department, we're Digital Technology. The world around us keeps changing and so do we. We’re redefining what it means to be IT with a mindset centered on transformation, experience, AI-driven automation, innovation, and growth. We’re all about delivering delightful, secure customer and employee experiences that accelerate ServiceNow’s journey to become the defining enterprise software company of the 21st century. And we love co-creating, using, and highlighting our own products to do it.


Ultimately, we strive to make the world work better for our employees and customers—when you work in ServiceNow Digital Technology, you work for them.


As ServiceNow continues its unprecedented growth, the company seeks to further establish its data and advanced analytics foundation and capabilities. We are building a mathematical enterprise for ServiceNow, leveraging all the data signals across the enterprise to guide business decisions. The Senior Insights Analyst will be a part of our Product, Platform & Success Analytics team, and help drive a data driven approach to shaping our digital customer success experience. This role will be responsible for quantifying feature, app and product value using user behavior, product event and workflow/process data.


This role needs an understanding of product/web analytics, business analysis, KPI development, data engineering and visualization, and will be reporting to the Head of Customer Success Analytics.


We are looking for a talented individual with a strategic viewpoint who can grow and adapt along with our fast-paced business. The ideal candidate is relentlessly curious, has high analytical capability and is passionate about enabling data and experimentation driven product optimization. This individual is energized by creating actionable insights and recommendations for business leaders and is highly collaborative with both business and technical audiences at all levels of the organization.

**What you get to do in this role:**

* Understand product & feature roadmaps, define KPIs and product success measures, and work with engineering & product teams to develop product instrumentation and telemetry needs
* Drive analysis and conduct in-depth studies on product & business performance. Take ownership and proactively identify trends and anomalies using a range of statistical methods, both univariate and multivariate, to establish correlations and causality.
* Utilize your expertise in quantitative analysis and data visualization to go beyond the numbers. Transform raw data and model output into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.
* Collaborate closely with key business leaders, providing them with analysis and recommendations to support strategic decision-making. Help them understand the significance and implications of taking action or not.
* Enhance digital product experience by identifying and executing initiatives that improve efficiency, overcome obstacles, and introduce enhanced processes and approaches to the business. This includes leveraging tools and technologies to optimize workflows, user navigation and experience
* Foster cross-functional relationships and leverage available resources to tackle complex interdisciplinary problems on behalf of the business. Proactively identify areas that require deeper analysis and initiate further study.

 **Qualifications** **To be successful in this role you have:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in an analytical field (e.g., Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Business or a related field). Master’s Degree is a plus.
* 5-8 years of prior experience in business, analytics, data science and/or research or equivalent
* Proven track record of using data to drive business decisions including the ability to structure problems for analysis, analyze the data, and provide actionable recommendations through effective and compelling storytelling
* Experience with data & experimentation led product optimization, establishing program and product KPIs, blending quantitative and qualitative data to help build a product narrative and a strong understanding of business processes/ workflows
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills and ability to engage effectively at all levels of the organization, to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Self-starter with a high degree of motivation to go above and beyond the task at hand. Demonstrated passion for connecting the dots, digging deeper to uncover stories and trends in data, with a keen eye for detail.
* Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively and effectively across different functions
* Experience with Python, R or equivalent.
* Strong SQL skills with the ability to perform effective querying involving multiple tables and subqueries.
* Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills
* Experience with Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics or any similar web analytics tool from an implementation and from a power user perspective, a must
* Experience with Tableau, Power BI (or similar analytical packages) a plus

title: SALES SUPPORT ANALYST II
description:
At Shell Energy Solutions, we believe there’s a better way to power your business and home.


Aligned with Shell’s ambition to be a significant global power business and to become net zero by 2050, our cleaner, affordable and simple solutions help companies manage their energy spend and plan their sustainability roadmap - a fresh approach for environmentally conscious businesses that are looking to boost their sustainability credentials. We also have set out to deliver the very best experience to our customers across all our channels.


Shell Energy Solutions mission is delivering cleaner energy solutions for a brighter tomorrow by guiding customers toward a better energy future, enabling customer choice and by providing market-leading energy solutions.


Going above and beyond for our customers is what we’re all about and we have set out to deliver the very best experience to our customers across all our channels. But bigger challenges lie ahead, and we need to keep moving forward. Are you ready to help us get there?

**WHERE YOU FIT IN**


Generally, facilitates and supports direct and/or indirect sales activities. Performs essential pre-deal tasks to support and manage the initial deal request for the sales team.


Reporting into the Sr. Manager of Sales Support and Account Management, the role requires self-motivated, dedicated, and responsible individual with the ability to perform well under pressure.

**JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Primary role will be supporting the Originators in the California market by assisting in the day-to-day management and support of prospective and existing power end use customers.
* Price customer hedges for power commodities, in addition to environmental products via frequent communication with the Trade desks.
* Ensure detailed and accurate capture of customer transactions in systems of record along with retail TCs and back office.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with back office and IOUs in CAISO.
* Request usage data, load profiles and work with back office to ensure all accounts are enrolled timely for additional load/customers.
* Maintain strong commercial mindset and proactive customer care to maximize margins, retention rates and customer satisfaction.
* Engage with stakeholders across the life-of-a-deal on both Shell Energy Solutions and Shell Energy North America including SMEs in Trading, Origination, KYC, Credit, Finance, Contracts, IT, Scheduling, Risk, Back Office and Settlements.
* Partner with C&I Origination to build and maintain productive relationship with customer base.
* Strong collaboration with Trading, staying abreast of market pricing conditions and drivers of market changes.
* Effective communication with accounting functions to resolve any invoicing concerns.
* Other duties may include supporting other markets as needed.

**ESSENTIAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCE**


Successful job applicants will be able to perform these functions. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Bachelor’s Degree and/or 3+ years of relevant experience in the Energy industry.
* Experience with proven results in the Retail Energy sector.
* Good communication skills, written and oral, for example ensuring sales agents are kept informed of any delays in turning around pricing requests, or outlining the rationale behind a decision not to approve credit for a customer.
* Analytical mindset, demonstrate ability to problem solve and create practical solutions to overcome problems and mitigate risks.
* Comfortable working in a target-driven and fast-changing environment, and able to respond to changing business needs
* Excellent attention to detail
* Proficient use of Microsoft Office programs including Word, Outlook and strong Excel skills
* Excellent analytical, organization and time management skills, with the ability to maintain a strict level of attention to detail
* Ability to work well within a team environment and demonstrate a vested interest in team goals and objectives
* Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to establish and maintain positive and effective working relationships
* Self-motivated with the desire to consistently improve performance and gain further knowledge
* Ability to meet deadlines, learn quickly and demonstrate effective problem solving and follow-up skills

**LOCATION & WORK SCHEDULE**

* Required to be in-person in San Diego, CA through a hybrid workplace environment.

**BENEFITS OF WORKING WITH SHELL ENERGY**

* Competitive Compensation
* Health Care - Medical/Dental/Vision/Prescription Drug Coverage
* 401(k) with Company Matching Contributions
* Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
* Health Savings Accounts (HSA)
* Disability Programs (STD & LTD)
* Employee Basic Term Life Insurance
* Generous Vacation & Company Holidays
* Flexible hybrid working schedule
* Training and coaching
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Paid Parental Leave
* And much more!

**SHELL ENERGY VALUES**


Shell is a company with shared values. Honesty, integrity, and respect aren't simply a strapline: they are part of everything we do. What's more, Shell is an equal opportunities company, and we place the highest possible value on the diversity of our people and our inclusive approach. Join us and you’ll belong to a world where you are proud of your achievements and propel your career with global opportunities. We care deeply about fostering a truly diverse workplace.

* Job descriptions are not intended as, nor should be construed to be, exhaustive lists of all responsibilities, skills, efforts, or working conditions associated with a job. They are intended to be accurate reflections of those principal job duties and responsibilities essential for making fair pay decisions about the job.

title: Logistics Analyst Retail Operations
description:
**Logistics Analyst Retail Operations**

To work with COMNAVAIRPAC at NAS North Island.

Must hold Secret Security Clearance

-The candidate will provide Training to Navy shipboard on FSM, ROM and retail operations.

- The candidate will Evaluate shipboard services operations and facilities, conduct equipment assessments and recommend improvements to enhance productivity and quality of life.

- Provide oversight and recommendations for Supply Department equipment modernization and replacement requirements for ship store, ship laundry, self-service laundry, barbershop, and bulk storerooms.

- Conduct on-board visits to validate and report progress on supply related maintenance, repair, replacement and modernization jobs.

- Provide input and recommendations on laundry equipment.

- Review and recommend manpower/personnel and training requirements.

- The candidate will prepare reports and submit results, with recommendations for improvements, for all inspections and assessments conducted.

-Participate and provide technical analysis regarding future technology initiatives related to shipboard services operations.

-Candidate will provide qualitative and quantitative techniques for analyzing and measuring shipboard supply services effectiveness. Perform independent analysis of shipboard services operations, cost-wise readiness, and initiatives that have or will affect supported activities.

-Identify systemic barriers and problems affecting shipboard services operations. Analyze barriers and problems, and provide recommendations to eliminate or mitigate obstacles and improve overall effectiveness and shipboard quality of life.

-Support the Government with analytical and investigative techniques to achieve improved shipboard services operations at reduced costs.

-Attend meetings to collect information; review, validate and provide analysis of processes and data; prepare draft reports, briefs and presentations; and conduct product demonstrations of shipboard services equipment or procedures.

-Develop, analyze, conduct operational audits, and prepare follow-up reports evaluating effectiveness of systems implementations.

-Conduct training for new and existing supply services systems and programs to aircraft carrier

-Candidate will conduct studies, review findings, make recommendations for improved operating procedures and policies concerning current and future shipboard services operations and program initiatives.

-Support the Government in research and development of Force Supply policies, procedures and guidance.

-Collect, review, monitor, and analyze data received from supported activities. Develop a performance metrics tracking report, to compile data received, and ascertain health of services readiness operations on aircraft carriers.

- Candidate must be knowledge in PowerPoint, Word and Excel.

-Must be willing to travel.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $82,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Developing a metrics tracking report, on aircraft carriers.: 5 years (Required)
* Retail Operations: 5 years (Required)
* Training to Navy personnel on Retail operations& procedures.: 5 years (Required)

Security clearance:

* Secret (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Staff Business Systems Analyst
description:
**Overview**
------------


This is a BI applications super-user/report developer role within the Controllership, Assurance, and Operations (CAO) organization supporting business reporting needs of the finance team. This role will also represent finance process owners on finance data initiatives, BI application changes and will ensure implementation and maintenance of controls over reporting changes. As an individual contributor, this person will engage with data, technology and finance organizations on data and reporting changes, have a risk-based assessment of process impact and provide assurance over the changes to finance leaders and process owners.


This position is expected to have solid experience writing reports using a multitude of BI applications or freehand SQL with a demonstrated understanding of reporting and data leveraged by the finance teams. This position shall also have an ability to translate E2E business process requirements into system requirements, review of solution design and validation through testing. The position will require strong cross-functional skills with a POV that operates at a consistent quality and standard considering existing system architecture and design decisions, existing and future processes, and inherent risks. In addition, this position will be required to provide change management, training, and support to the finance team.


This individual must demonstrate good business sense, project management skills, communication skills, use data to drive decisions, be an independent thinker, team player and a trusted thought partner. Ability to communicate clearly, work effectively with diverse groups, skill with quantitative/qualitative analytical methodologies and tools, ability to quickly research, understand and document new processes and requirements are foundational needs for success in this role.

**What you'll bring**
---------------------

* Bachelor’s degree, with 6-8 years related information systems experience and 3-5 years in business intelligence
* Solid background in business intelligence, data warehousing, and information management.
* Strong team player with energy, enthusiasm and detail orientation to produce high quality deliverables in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to present complex ideas in clear concise fashion to technical and non-technical audiences.
* Extensive experience in working with cross-functional business teams with ability to negotiate and influence project outcomes is required for this role.
* Functional background in Finance is required.
* Solid hands-on experience with Oracle SQL and QlikSense is required.


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


Ability to influence people and indirectly manage a team of people to ensure the effective execution of complex initiatives. Ability to navigate complexity well and demonstrated experience managing across functions to accomplish large scale goals. Must be comfortable working in cross-functional teams and willing to voice their opinion. Must be savvy to understand both business needs and the technologies to implement them. Have experience identifying systemic and process risks and how to mitigate those discoveries.

**How you will lead**
---------------------

* Partner with various report developers and data/technical teams, representing requirements of finance process owners, during implementation of strategic business intelligence and analytics initiatives.
* Provide point of view on solution leveraging E2E systems and data domain knowledge and understanding of finance processes and controls. Provide transparency on significant design decisions and process changes to finance leaders and teams with PoV on risk, resource, and financial impacts. Validate solution for finance process implications while providing PoV on design, gaps, and deferrals with inputs on prioritization and manual workarounds.
* Align testing approach and scenarios with a PoV on risk. Validate solution through testing evidence review & execution, as needed. Lead UAT coordination with process owners.
* Have a risk-based review of technical releases, identify system issues with a PoV on finance process impact/ risk and manage prioritization of defects for resolution.
* Provide leadership to finance teams to effectively leverage information by optimizing use of data and streamlining of business processes.
* Work with Business Intelligence leaders across the organization to contribute and influence BI strategy.
* Work with a cross functional BI community to develop standards for governance and use of information consistently across the organization.
* Effectively manage the change that results from the introduction of new technology and processes while educating finance process owners. Goal is ‘no surprises’ for our stakeholders (Finance leaders and process owners)
* Follow industry BI trends to ensure that solutions are best in class and meet industry standards.
* Ensure controls over reporting and data are implemented and maintained. SOX report validations are project-managed for timely completion.

title: EDI Programmer Analyst
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY**


The EDI Programmer Analyst will work with a team of developers and analysts to plan, design, implement, and test EDI systems in support of the Community Health Group’s (CHG) core Medi-Cal and Medicare insurance programs. The position will facilitate the exchange of data with CHG’s regulators, vendors, and provider network by implementing back-end processes to import and export data. All applications will be implemented within the Microsoft stack, particularly C# and Microsoft Sql Server. The EDI Programmer Analyst will work side by side with other EDI team members and will be expected to participate in business analysis or quality assurance activities, as well as production tasks to support CHG’s day-to-day operations. This position will proactively seek opportunities that will enhance CHG’s revenue and reduce CHG’s expenses while maintaining compliance with CHG’s regulatory agencies.

  

**COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATIONS:**


This position works closely with all departments necessary to ensure that all processes, programs, and services are accomplished in a timely and efficient manner in accordance with CHG policies and procedures and in compliance with applicable state and federal regulations including CMS and/or Medicare Part D, DHCS, and Council for Affordable Quality Healthcare Committee on Operating Rules for Information Exchange (CAQH CORE).

  


**RESPONSIBILITIES**


 **Develop and Maintain EDI processes to import, transform, and export data to support business objectives.**


* Develop scheduled tasks, power shell scripts, C# applications and SSIS packages to automate data imports.
* Build database repositories to store incoming data.
* Configure and debug BizTalk orchestrations to transform data and store it within our core repositories.
* Configure other EDI components for healthcare related transactions including: QNXT, TIBCO, MoveIT, and SFTP servers.


**Analyze business processes and functions, and interpret regulatory requirements to guide the development of new EDI interfaces with CHG's trading partners and core business systems.**


* Gather, analyze, and document requirements from business users, regulators, and healthcare partners.
* Research and evaluate file specifications, including ANSI x12 EDI transactions, HL7 specifications, National Council for Prescription Drug Programs (NCPDP) specifications, and custom specifications created by vendors and state\federal regulators.
* Serve as a subject matter expert in new EDI data regulations and quality measurements.
* Attend and participate in encounter data, program data, and provider data workgroups and webinars.
* Audit data supplied by providers and trading partners for accuracy.
* Test new system integrations to ensure compliance with documented requirements.


**Provide support for provider inquiries and issues related to EDI enrollment, claims processing, payment inquiries, and clearinghouse activities, with duties including but not limited to:**


* Resolve issues related to production EDI transactions related to claims, payments, enrollment, provider data, real time transactions, clearinghouse activities and other proprietary EDI formats.
* Monitor EDI exchanges and transaction processes to ensure they run efficiently and correctly.
* Work with external providers and regulators to research and reconcile EDI transactional inquiries, errors, and discrepancies.
* Identify errors and escalate complex issues to higher levels for assistance and review.
* Monitor the submission of encounter data from subcontractors to ensure completeness, accuracy, reasonability, and timeliness before submission to state and federal agencies.


**Maintain desktop procedures, companion guides, and other supporting documentation for all critical EDI processes.**


* Develop and maintain documentation of EDI requirements and specifications.
* Support cost-benefit analysis, impact analysis, and assessments for strategic operational projects and policy and operational changes.
* Maintain documents for operational procedures according to HIPAA standards and regulatory guidelines.

  




Qualifications
**Education:**


* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Information Systems.

  




**Experience/Skills:**


* Minimum of 3 years experience working in software development or business analysis.
* Good communication skills, and experience working with teams.
* Experience developing web and Windows based services in C#.
* SQL Server, including T-SQL stored procedures, and Integration Services (SSIS).
* Familiarity with XML and JSON document formats.
* Working knowledge of the software development lifecycle.
* Working knowledge of research, analysis, and reporting methods.
* Familiarity with testing procedures, including unit testing and regression testing, as well as test plan development and documentation of test results.
* Adherence to security requirements and confidentiality as required by the company and HIPAA.
* Ability to demonstrate flexibility and creativity, identify improvements to existing practices, and effectively adapt to change


***Expertise in the following areas is not required but preferred:***


* CAQH CORE Operating Rules
* QNXT Core Administrative Payer System
* Knowledge of the following specifications or transaction sets:
	+ X12 EDI HIPAA transaction sets: 820, 834, 274, 270/271, 276/277, 277CA, 835, 837 P/I, 999
	+ HL7 FHIR
	+ DHCS pharmacy encounter data NCPDP File
* Medical billing and health care data interfaces
* Medi-Cal and Medicare programs

  




**Physical Requirements:**


* May be required to work evenings and/or weekends.

  




\*\*Must have current authorization to work in the USA\*\*

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
General Atomics (GA), and its affiliated companies, is one of the world’s leading resources for high-technology systems development ranging from the nuclear fuel cycle to remotely piloted aircraft, airborne sensors, and advanced electric, electronic, wireless and laser technologies.  

  

We have an exciting opportunity for a Business Systems Analyst to join our GA Division located in San Diego (Rancho Bernardo), CA.
  

  

With general direction and limited review, this position acts as a liaison between one of more business units and information systems technical staff to ensure that information technology design, data, reports, systems, and processes meet the needs of the end users.  

  

The Business Systems Analyst should demonstrate extensive knowledge in Computer Maintenance Management Systems with experience in SAP Plant Maintenance and Business Intelligence solution design. With general direction and limited review, this candidate represents the Facilities Maintenance organization to manage the system of record and all related activities.
  

As the business activity advocate, coordinates and provides leadership for all information technology developments including but not limited to: developing product, service and report specifications to ensure end user requirements are fulfilled; and, evaluating new and/or modifying/upgrading existing business processing hardware and software systems.  

  

**DUTIES AND RESPONSBILITIES:*** System Administration:
	+ Manage and maintain Computer Maintenance Management System (CMMS) including system maintenance, performance, and reporting.
	+ Research, plan, evaluate, and coordinate requirement for new projects and upgrades to existing business processing hardware and software systems.
	+ Collaborate with ITS and business partners to execute on system deliverables and enhancements while establishing prioritization of requirements.
	+ Communicate status and updates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders related to system interruption, sustainment and change management activities.
	+ Generate and maintain related process documentation.
	+ Act as a CMMS system expert to utilize process and system knowledge to support audits.
* BI Solution Design: Develop, implement, and maintain advanced Business Intelligence solutions that enable real-time monitoring and predictive analysis of existing maintenance processes.
* Performance Measures: Analyze data to drive operational improvements. Identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop performance measurement systems to track and enhance the efficiency of our maintenance processes. Collaborate with teams to improve workflows and streamline operations.
* Continuous Improvement: Lead the charge in championing a culture of continuous improvement by providing recommendations for process changes and identify opportunities for automation to strive for system efficiencies.
* Training: Facilitate training and maintain training resources for technicians, system users and leaders.
* Responsible for observing all laws, regulations and other applicable obligations wherever and whenever business is conducted on behalf of the Company. Expected to work in a safe manner in accordance with established operating procedures and practices.
* Other duties as assigned or required.


We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.  

  

43292  

**Job Qualifications:*** Typically requires a bachelor's degree and six or more years technical experience working with computerized systems such as financial, accounting, purchasing, payroll, human resources, manufacturing, or other business related systems. May substitute equivalent experience in lieu of education.
* Must be experienced in leading and coordinating interactions between business system end-users and technical staff and have a complete operational and system understanding of administrative functions such as: general ledger, accounts receivable, accounts payable, purchasing, inventory control, fixed assets, payroll, human resources, etc.
* Must have experience in developing and coordinating the development of reports from business systems and evaluating new or upgraded relevant software and hardware.
* Must be customer focused, able to look at long-term trends and emerging requirements, and understand government cost accounting. Able to work extended hours as required.

  

**Salary:**$73,700 - $128,780**Travel Percentage Required** 0 - 25**Relocation Assistance Provided** Not Provided **US Citizenship Required?** No**Clearance Required?** No **Clearance Level**null **Workstyle**Hybrid

title: Business Analyst - Remote (WFH)
description:
**Position Summary:** Cognitive is seeking a Business Analyst to work closely with development teams, and stakeholders to ensure that the product meets the needs of our client. Identify client’s technical needs, plan enterprise architecture and strategize ideas to improve decision-making, while working in an agile environment. 

**Duties:**

* ﻿Works closely with the client and technical team to provide guidance and analysis experience, while incorporating the client’s baseline requirements and processes into scalable design specifications that satisfies business requirements and needs
* Provides solutions to a variety of technical problems of moderate scope and complexity where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors
* Develops, implements, and promotes policies and standard operating procedures
* Improves the flow of information through the organization by using modeling, testing and data models
* Provides input to project plans to achieve performance-based objectives, enhancing implementation, technical integration and interoperability products and services
* Adheres to the Agile software development methodology:
+ Work with the development team to document the processes involved in the software development life cycle
+ Works with the development team to ensure that the product backlog is well-groomed and contains user stories ready for development.
+ Works with the client and the Cognitive development team to build user stories ensuring the team has full understanding of requirements and business process
+ Develops and designs user stories, wire frames, and process maps using tools such as Lucidchart and Visio

* Works with all levels to provide input to reports and other deliverables, to execute multiple assignments, & meet agreed deadlines, and adjust to changing client demands
* Provides integral support in mission requirements determination, conceptualization, design, development, testing, verification and validation, documentation, and implementation of technical integration efforts and interoperability products & services

**Required Skills:**

* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills (oral and written)
* Self-starter with a positive attitude and very good interpersonal skills
* Experience with Jira Scrum boards or Kanban (2-4 years)
* Experience with and thorough understanding of Agile methodology and SDLC
* Experience with Excel, SharePoint, Lucidchart (or Visio)
* Experience with data collection and the design and creation of wireframes (2-4 years)
* Experience with and ability to define and document software requirements
* Ability to work / collaborate with a team
* Strong work ethic, ability to self-manage workload & deliverables under tight deadlines

**Required Education, Experience, and Clearance:**

* ﻿﻿Bachelor’s Degree + 5 years or more experience, - OR – 13 years of relevant experience
* Ability to obtain a Position of Public Trust – Medium Background Investigation (MBI)
* US Citizenship required

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Job Description:  
  
 Pay Range $50hr - $53hr  
  
 Responsibilities:** * Requirement Gathering and Analysis: Work closely with stakeholders, including business users and technical teams, to gather and document detailed requirements.
* Understanding the needs of various stakeholders and translating those needs into clear and comprehensive specifications.

 Process Mapping and Documentation: * Analyze and document existing business processes, workflows, and systems to identify areas for improvement.
* Create process maps, flowcharts, and other visual aids to help stakeholders understand the current state and proposed changes.

 Contribute to Solution Design: * Based on the gathered requirements, collaborate with technical teams to design solutions that align with business objectives.

 Documentation: * Create detailed requirement documents, functional specifications, use cases, EPICs, User stories, and other documentation to guide development and implementation teams.

 Collaboration: * Collaborate with subject matter experts, project, consulting, and technical teams, and various levels of management to execute quick resolution to issues and risks and identify interdependencies across the projects.

 Communication: * Act as intermediaries between business and technical teams, effectively communicating complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and vice versa, facilitate discussions, workshops, and meetings to ensure all parties are on the same page.

 Testing and Validation: * Involve in testing newly developed features/products to ensure they meet the specified requirements.
* Work with testing teams to define test scenarios, conduct user acceptance testing (UAT).

 Continuous Improvement: * Participate in post-implementation reviews to assess the success of new feature/product release and identify opportunities for further optimization and improvement.

 Data Analysis: * Analyzing data and providing insights to support decision-making and strategic planning.

 Working Experience: * Proven experience as an IT Business Analyst with a focus on infrastructure projects.
* Strong knowledge of IT infrastructure components, including servers, networks, and storage, compute.
* Experience with ServiceNow platform architecture and functionality.
* A fundamental understanding and experience using ITSM, ITIL, ITOM, CMDB principles. ITIL v3 Certification preferred.
* At least two years experience formulating technical requirements based on customers needs.
* Understanding of Software Development Life Cycle.
* Ability to create and manage short and long-range schedules for software releases.
* Effective written and oral communication skills.
* Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
* Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of products.
* Promoter of Agile methodologies.

title: Business Analyst I
description:
Business Analyst plays a critical role in delivering these services, performing and leading assignments and projects as described below. The successful candidate is adept at analyzing data and understanding business requirements for applications. The successful candidate is able to use productivity tools and work in a proactive manner to deliver on simultaneous assignments.

The role will interact extensively with Operations, IT, Client Services and clients to ensure accurate and timely completion of tasks. Professional, clear and precise verbal and written communication skills are required to ensure information is accurately exchanged with both technical and non-technical counterparts.

The work is dynamic and requires a high degree of adaptability, while maintaining high attention to detail. A can-do attitude and drive to deliver results on schedule are essential for success in this position. 

**RESPONSIBILITES/ACCOUNTABILITIES:*** 
Responsible for developing and maintaining in-depth requirements based upon knowledge of the client’s business processes, data, and applications.

* 
Responsible for the timely entry, escalation, and general management of client requests and issues.

Skills/Knowledge/Abilities –

* 
 Excellent verbal and communication skills.

* 
Must be self-motivated, goal oriented, and able to learn independently.

* 
Must possess initiative, advanced decision-making skills, and problem solving abilities.

* 
Programming experience is preferred and experience scripting in SQL is highly preferred.

* 
Ability to simplify complex topics for broad audiences.

* 
Ability to manage one’s time across multiple assignment simultaneously. 

* 
Ability to focus and perform at a high level in an open and dynamic team environment.

Ability to break down complex business processes to; identify requirements, create test scenarios, create training documentation, and explain the business need to Development.

Ability to work within a Scrum team and Agile environment.

Takes initiative to learn complex business processes without being instructed to do so.

Eager and adept at learning and applying new IT applications under self-direction.

title: Operations Center Analyst
description:
\*\*\*JOB WILL NOT BEGION UNTIL JANUARY 2024\*\*\*

No Guard Card Needed. Security experience a plus but not required. This role will be monitoring information for multiple sites for the client and making calls and notifications based on this information.

Previous Customer Service Centers, Customer Service, Call Center, Monitoring Center or other related experience is preferred.

Looking for great people that have great written and verbal communication skills. For BOTH Part Time and Full Time

If you are a service minded person - Send us a resume. Great pay, great benefits and flexible schedules!

The operators will be monitoring building systems to include analytics from cameras, access control systems, water leak detection, possible weather events and other activity around the property or events that are called into the room. The function of the operators will be to respond to the incident, document the response and make appropriate notifications based on the type of incident.

The Global Security Operations Center (GSOC) Operator, under guidance of GSOC Supervisor, is responsible for assisting company personnel in all concerns that pertain to safety and security for the primary location located in San Diego, California and other sites on the West Coast. The individual will work in a GSOC environment, monitoring several screens. The Operator will use a variety of tools that range from access control and alarm monitoring systems to various business intelligence sources, open-source media, Internet, and in-house tools. The Operator is required to detect, analyze, and alert others of any incidents which may impact the client’s people, products, property, or brand image. These may range from extreme weather conditions, political instability, crime, terror, to technical failures. Responsibilities:

• Provide customer service to our clients by carrying out safety and security procedures, site-specific policies and when appropriate, emergency response activities

• Respond to incidents and critical situations in a calm, problem solving manner

• Investigate alarms and respond by sending security patrol, or alerting Fire services or Police as needed

• Assist company employees in all concerns that pertain to safety and security

• Be at least 18 years of age for unarmed roles; 21+ years of age for armed roles

• Possess a high school diploma or equivalent, or 5 years of verifiable experience

• Minimum of two (2) years of military, law enforcement, government, or security experience

• As a condition of employment, applicants will be subject to a background investigation in accordance with all federal, state, and local laws. Ollivier Corp will consider qualified applications with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable laws.

• Health insurance and 401k plans for full-time positions

• Schedules that fit with your personal life goals

• Ongoing paid training programs and career growth opportunities

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
description:
Dynamis ABA International provides ABA treatment in the homes and communities of families affected by Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and behavioral concerns. We use only evidence-based practices based on the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA). Dynamis ABA contributes to the ABA field through training, research, and professional partnerships.

 

Our mission is to create “Strength and Ability for Life” by developing intervention programs and partnering with families, schools, communities, and business systems to foster essential life skills for individuals with Autism and challenging behaviors.

 

Dynamis ABA is looking to hire a Board-Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) in the San Diego area. The ideal candidate is someone that is approachable and accessible, has attentive listening skills, displays emotional maturity, compassion, and is a life-long learner.

 

Responsibilities

* 
Provide 1:1 ABA therapy in homes, schools, community, or business-based environments

* 
Conduct Functional Behavior Assessments (FBAs)

* 
Create treatment plans based on ABA principles that may include, but is not limited to, working on communication, behavior, feeding, ADLs, and social skills

* 
Design data collection systems to track and evaluate the client’s progress associated with the treatment plan objectives

* 
Supervise Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs) during implementation of the ABA treatment plans

* 
Update treatment plans as needed

* 
Train the client’s family on how to implement the treatment plan

* 
Coordinate schedules between the RBT and the client/family

* 
Ensure the environment is always safe and positive

* 
Participate in team meetings and conduct trainings


 

Qualifications

* 
Master’s degree in ABA, Psychology, Education, Human Development, or a related field

* 
1 to 2 years BCBA experience in homes, schools, community, or business-based environments

* 
Experience with children that have development disabilities and/or behavior problems

* 
Previous RBT supervision experience, preferred

* 
Treatment Plan Implementation Training experience

* 
BLS/CPR Certified

* 
BACB BCBA Certified


 

Skills

* 
Excellent communication skills

* 
Must have a passion for working with children with disabilities

* 
Must have reliable transportation

title: Salesforce Business Systems Analyst
description:
The Position:  
  
Team Purpose: To serve our coworkers and clients by providing software solutions that are both high quality and timely, which enhance their ability to provide exceptional patient care.  
  
The position will work closely with stakeholders from across the company and other members of the Salesforce Team. The Salesforce Business Systems Analyst is responsible for leading and participating in design, implementation, and support of Salesforce and integrated applications. This role will rely heavily on effective communication, creative problem solving, thorough documentation in a regulated environment, and timely delivery.  
  
Responsibilities:

* Lead and perform analyses of business workflows and IT related processes. Determine logic for new developments and improve existing systems. Create flow diagrams, define requirements for software acquisition and/or application development, and ensure that business needs are met
* Lead and work closely with business stakeholders to develop business requirements, user stories, functional specifications, acceptance criteria, and release notes with a primary focus on Salesforce system development
* Create detailed test cases and documentation for software releases
* Test systems to ensure successful implementation of business requirements.
* Document functionality and create user training material as related to software releases
* Maintain system processes and workflow documentation
* Determine logic for and monitor integration of all systems in relation to Salesforce, and the wider company software ecosystem
* Identify, promote, and implement tools and software which meet company needs and improve processes. Manage installation and deployment of 3rd party applications via AppExchange
* Accountable for monitoring and identifying issues with software workflows and managing successful resolution of issues, including Tier 1 support
* Accountable for monitoring and maintaining system integrity, including Salesforce Health Check
* Prepare large amounts of data to upload to or download from Salesforce using tools such as DataLoader
* Accountable for review of seasonal Salesforce releases, identify necessary changes to internal systems, and mediate areas of impact
* Deliver resource activity status and detailed time tracking to management by communicating project issues and project gaps
* Maintain permissions and sharing integrity through systematic auditing
* Provide declarative development of the Salesforce platform and raise code-based issues to developers
* Provides demos of new development
* Mentor and train others in Salesforce Administration

**Who You Are:**

* A bachelor’s degree (preferably with an emphasis in Business Administration or Information Systems), or equivalent experience
* 4 years of direct experience working in Salesforce administration and business systems analysis
* Exceptional ability to accurately define business requirements for stakeholders
* Certification in Salesforce Administration highly preferred
* Takes full ownership of assigned tasks and regularly drives successful outcomes
* Ability to work with a high degree of autonomy and flexibility
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Experience with Salesforce systems such as, Sales, Marketing, and Community Cloud highly preferred
* Experience with QA and developing complex test cases a plus
* Experience with email campaign tools considered a plus

**What We Can Offer You**  
  
The anticipated base salary range for candidates who will work in San Diego is $85,600 to $117,000. The final salary offered to a successful candidate will be dependent on several factors that may include but are not limited to the type and length of experience within the job, type and length of experience within the industry, education, etc. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.  
  
Veracyte is a multi-state employer, and this salary range may not reflect positions that work in other states.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Maya Hotels | 8632 Wilkinson Blvd, Charlotte, NC 28214**Job Overview**:


The Business Analyst will be responsible for preparing monthly financials and financial reporting, as well as assisting with data entry and mapping of new financial analysis software. The primary focus of this role will be to analyze financial data, identify trends, and generate accurate and timely reports to support financial decision-making.


The Business Analyst will work closely with cross-functional teams, including finance, accounting, and IT, to ensure data integrity, system accuracy, and compliance with financial reporting standards.

 **Responsibilities:*** Monthly Financials: Prepare monthly financial statements, including profit and loss statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements, by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing financial data from various sources. Ensure accuracy and completeness of financial data, and reconcile discrepancies as needed.
* Financial Reporting: Generate financial reports and dashboards to provide insights on key financial metrics and performance indicators. Analyze financial data to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, and present findings to management for decision-making purposes.
* Data Entry: Enter financial data into financial systems and software, ensuring accuracy and timeliness. Perform data validation and verification to maintain data integrity and consistency.
* Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation to streamline financial reporting and data entry processes. Develop and implement best practices to enhance the efficiency, accuracy, and effectiveness of financial reporting and analysis.

**Qualifications:*** Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or related field.
* Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret financial data and identify trends and patterns.
* Knowledge of financial reporting standards, regulations, and internal controls.
* Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in financial reporting, data analysis, and data entry.
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel required.


This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to perform any other job-related duties assigned by their supervisor.

title: Director, SC Business Systems and Support Engineering
description:
**What You Will Do**


Director, SC Business Systems and Support Engineering leads the Systems and Engineering teams (SC Business Systems Principal Analyst/Lead Analyst/Sr Analysts) that lead/manage all project efforts for new technology selection and deployment for Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) and Warehouse Labor Management Products (WLM), maintenance and enhancement of the existing WMS and WLM products, and/or new facilities product set up related to Lowe’s WMS Distribution Products for all DC nodes: RDCs, FDCs, BDCs, XDTs, CHFs, PFCs, FCs, and DFC, My Supply Chain Red Vest on the Business side, and Engineering standards projects partnering with a large cross functional team that consist of Operations, SC Process Engineering, IT solutions and Product Management, PMO leadership, as well as 3rd party software vendors’ leadership and consultants.


 Director, SC Business Systems and Support Engineering leads and drives the vision, strategy, and roadmap of SC Distribution Warehouse Management System and Labor Management Products on the Business side. He/she directs multiple complex cross functional product design and implementation initiatives across many cross functional stakeholders at any given time on the Business side while partnering closely with Business and IT leadership.


Director, SC Business Systems and Support Engineering is also accountable for Labor management system data accuracy, auditing, and Engineering standards and job code simplifications in the Distribution Network: RDCs, FDCs, BDCs, XDTs, CHFs, PFCs, FCs, and DFC.


In addition, this individual serves as the thought leader in the WMS and WLM space and also owns pursuing professional growth and providing developmental opportunities for the SC Business Systems Principal Analyst/Lead Analyst/Sr Analysts in his/her team by soliciting and acting on performance feedback; building collaborative, cross-functional relationships; hiring, training, and developing talent for growth opportunities and for ensuring skill and knowledge gaps are closed; delegating tasks and decisions; fostering open dialogue amongst team members; working closely with employees to set goals and provide open feedback and coaching to drive performance improvement and development opportunities.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

* Advanced skills in Communicating Effectively - The ability to effectively develop and communicate one's perspectives and ideas. This includes the ability to convey a compelling message, engage the audience, and adapt the message, delivery, and point-of-view based on the audience's real-time or anticipated reactions.
* Advanced skills in Solving Complex Problems - The ability to anticipate and plan for tough and complex problems. This includes obtaining relevant information through people and data, analyzing issues from multiple perspectives, recognizing relevant information in seemingly disparate data sources, and anticipating future states when making decisions.
* Advanced skills in Effective planning - The ability to spend his/her time and the time of others on the most mission-critical work activities. This includes communicating priorities to others, removing roadblocks that threaten to derail progress, and making timely and difficult decisions about serious tradeoffs with incomplete information. The ability to use organizational skills for purposes of planning and decision-making. This includes developing and communicating objectives, timelines, assignments, and goals.
* Advanced skills in Managing Ambiguity - The ability to thrive in crises, remain energized through tough challenges, make difficult decisions and take action, and challenge the status quo. The ability to proactively pursue opportunities that will help meet the bottom line. This also includes seizing an opportunity when it presents itself, taking informed risks and actions to succeed, and motivating and rewarding employees to ensure critical metrics are met.
* Advanced skills in Building and managing relationships - The ability to manage a variety of relationships from both inside and outside the organization. This includes building and nurturing a diverse network, finding a balance between meeting one's own interest and the interest of other groups, and having a good understanding of group dynamics. This also includes embracing diversity in terms of backgrounds and opinions and creating an environment of trust and respect for differences.
* Thought leadership & Innovation - This includes the ability to produce breakthrough ideas, being a visionary, managing innovation, seeing multiple futures, having broad interests and knowledge, and gaining support to translate new ideas into solutions. This also includes the ability to plan and implement unconventional ideas and speculate about alternative futures without all the data.
* Advanced skills in understanding business and demonstrating acute business acumen and subject matter expertise and thought leadership across multiple areas of Distribution.
* Advanced skills in dealing with trouble and getting things done through others.
* Organized and have a proven aptitude in handling multiple large-scale projects simultaneously.
* Experience in adapting and integrating new technology, automation, systems in a complex supply chain environment.
* Expertise in driving new ideas, technology, and systems in a complex and dynamic supply chain setting.
* Resourceful and results-driven leader in a highly dynamic environment.
* Ability to work seamlessly with cross-functional teams and excellent verbal and written communication skills to all levels of the organization as well as platform skills for training delivery and group presentations and ability to communicate and influence at an upper executive level when required.
* Advanced skills in managing a diverse team of individuals.
* Expert in managing, growing, and influencing high-visibility key relationships with core customers, stakeholders, and leadership at all levels of the organization.
* Manages and serves a professional team of SC Business Systems Principal Analyst/Lead Analyst/Sr Analysts who own providing and prioritizing business requirements, product/system configurations, user acceptance testing, change management, project management, and minimum realization of integrated business and/or enterprise application solutions for the entire Distribution Network (Core Distribution- RDC, FDC, CHF, E-commerce- DFC and FCs, Market delivery- BDC, XDT, and PFCs) for WMS and WLM implementation, enhancement, and maintenance initiatives; and who own Engineered standards roadmap and execution.
* Pursues professional growth and provides developmental opportunities for the SC Business Systems Principal/Lead/Sr Analysts by soliciting and acting on performance feedback; building collaborative, cross-functional relationships; hiring, training, and developing talent for growth opportunities and for ensuring skill and knowledge gaps are closed; delegating tasks and decisions; fostering open dialogue amongst team members; working closely with the team members to set goals and provide open feedback and coaching to drive performance improvement and development opportunities.
* Assigns SC Business Systems Principal Analyst/Lead Analyst/Sr Analysts to Enterprise initiatives based on team member skills and development needs, and program/project requirements by facilitating and managing partnerships between Supply Chain and IT leaders and Program/Project Managers.
* Provides work leadership and training to lower professional and technical staff to ensure policies, practices, and procedures are understood and followed by Systems team members, including recruiting and training programs for new Systems team members.
* Confers with IT Solutions, IT Product, Operations, and Process engineering leaders and teams, customers, vendors or others to discuss existing and potential product enhancement/implementation projects or technology and opportunities for WMS and WLM improvements.
* Partners with Supply Chain and IT Leaders to provide WMS and WLM Distribution Product (System) and Business process expertise and align the technology strategies to meet the financial and Business goals of the enterprise
* Oversees/leads the design and installation as well as maintenance and enhancements of multiple complex WMS and WLM products across all distribution and fulfillment centers, including RDCs, FDCs, CHFs, PFCs, DFCs, FCs, BDCs, My Supply Chain Red Vest, and XDTs. Directs his/her team to analyze and develop effective solutions to key operational problems leading product enhancements or new product implementations.
* Develops and maintains Distribution Technology and product road map for WMS and WLM partnering with Business and IT Stakeholders on the Business side.
* Leads and drives large, highly complex product launches on the Business side by working with relevant stakeholders (Operations, Program/Project Management, IT) reviewing and resolving issues and mitigating risks in partnership with other program/project stakeholders and team members.
* Communicates the WMS and WLM product roadmap to Business stakeholders and keeps everyone informed of changes. Ensures existing distribution products are enhanced and maintained based on Business needs and priorities.
* Builds and leverages solid and cross functional working relationships with Supply Chain Business leadership and WMS and WLM Product stakeholders, IT leadership, and Learning and Development to facilitate successful product implementation and change management.
* Evaluates new technology and vendors and owns/manages/leads technology supplier relationships on the Business side for WMS and WLM.
* Owns and accountable to execute Engineering standards roadmap for the RDCs.

**What you Need to Succeed**

*Minimum Qualifications*

* Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Information Systems, or Related Field
* 8 years' progressive Engineering/IT/Operations/Project Management/ UAT experience in a multi-unit environment
* 5 years’ experience in implementing/ enhancing/maintaining the Distribution WMS or WLM products
* 5 years’ of Super User Knowledge of Tier 1 Supply Chain distribution products (Manhattan/BY / or another Tier 1 WMS)
* 5 years’ experience working on a project(s) involving the implementation of software development life cycles (SDLC) and Agile methodology
* 5 years’ experience leading and sponsoring technical or project teams, with or without direct reports
* 3 years’ experience managing resources directly.
* 3 years’ experience working closely with senior leadership (VP and above)
* 3 years’ experience working directly with the third-party IT vendors and/or software solution providers
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills to all levels of the organization as well as platform skills for training delivery and group presentations. Ability to communicate and influence at an upper executive level when required, Executive presence.
* The ability to operate in harmonious partnership with IT operations and support groups.
* Process orientation – understands the linkages among strategy, process, and IT.
* Solid organization and planning skills, and analytical and conflict resolution skills.
* Self-starter with a proven ability to handle multiple programs/ projects.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite applications, including Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

*Preferred Qualifications*

* Master's Degree in Engineering, Information Systems, or Related Field or equivalent combination of education and work experience
* 5 years’ experience in a Retail Industry
* 2 years’ experience managing operational and/or project financial budgets
* Experience documenting/designing business processes, performing business analysis, and requirements definition
* Knowledge of other supply chain systems including TMS and logistics forecasting and planning systems
* Formal training in change management methodology (e.g., Conner)

*Lowe’s is an equal opportunity employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law.*


Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit https://talent.lowes.com/us/en/benefits.
