title: Bilingual (Spanish / English) Business Analyst - Operations
description:
**Bilingual (Spanish / English) Business Analyst - Operations**

USC Consulting Group is a forward moving consulting firm with a reputation of excellence since 1968 that partners with clients to provide greater value and competitiveness within their businesses. We provide multiple skills and business techniques such as: systems solutions, data analysis, process improvement, quality function deployment, continuous flow manufacturing and integrated supply chain management.

A Business Analyst with our firm will work as a team member and be assigned to feasibility studies at one of our prospect or client locations. Through practical technique applications, the Business Analyst will benefit from the extensive experience of the USC team members. You will learn the needed skill sets and business analysis techniques required to be successful in our business. You will be responsible for building relationships and coordinating activities with both our USC feasibility study team, as well as with our prospects and clients. The position’s responsibilities are within the scope of analysis management, which focuses on understanding and mapping out process workflows across a variety of industries, in order to identify specific areas of improvement opportunity. Methods applied could be work task analyses, organizational structure review, span of control analyses, performance data mining and review of the effectiveness of the management operating systems, processes, and work disciplines. We work closely with our prospects and clients in a partnership to achieve measurable results in process flow, productivity improvement as well as performance management.

FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES:

**This is a bilingual role within our analytical and business development department. Must be fluent with reading and writing in Spanish.**

The ideal Business Analyst candidate has previous experience working for a consulting firm, functioning in an Analyst / Operations Management role. The Business Analyst can see “muda” or waste when touring a facility or reviewing performance data and translate these into meaningful business opportunities, that drive tangible and measurable value for the prospect or client. The ideal candidate has previous experience as an Analyst with an implementation management consulting firm focusing on operational excellence. This individual can demonstrate:

• Experience across multiple industries and verticals, including experience working internationally.

• Possesses 5-10 years of experience in this specific role.

• Practical experience analyzing multiple work streams, the ability to identify all types of waste, associated non-value added activities and their root cause(s).

• Practical experience converting identified waste into business opportunities and tangible, measurables financial benefits.

• "Street credibility" (i.e., understanding how the technical and tactical elements of large ticket “process improvement initiatives are sold”).

• Experience working in diverse industry segments, selling comprehensive MOS solutions into related environments, i.e.: product development, supply chain, and/or manufacturing, food processing, capital intensive and/or commodity-based operations.

• Strong understanding of front-end SI&OP, planning and scheduling methodologies, related supply chain, product development, and various production, manufacturing operations, asset management and logistics.

• Being adept verbally and with writing skills at clearly articulating issues, selling into new accounts, and possesses a demonstrated ability to develop, qualify, and close large, sometimes politically complex business opportunities, while handling objections seamlessly.

• The ability and willingness to learn, listen, understand, and continually improve his/her skills, without being told to do so.

• Being a team player, able to work effectively with others in structuring, selling and on occasion, supporting delivery of value-added services to top tier clients.

• Travel is dependent on study needs and client requests, but you can live anywhere in the continental U.S or Canada.

TECHNOLOGY EXPERIENCE:

* Advanced computer skills; including MS Office Suite, MS Project, Power BI, Tableau, Web conferencing, and CRM.
* Possessing a working knowledge of Current Business Technology Tools including SPC data analysis, and Power BI. Candidate is well versed in Business Techniques such as APM (Asset Performance Management), Lean Six-Sigma, Spend / Sourcing.

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:

* Possess a thorough understanding of all aspects of the Analysis process and Analysis tools utilized.
* Exceptional observation, analytical, numerical reasoning, business acumen and leadership skills
* Prior consulting experience preferred.
* Understanding of how technical and tactical elements of large ticket “process improvement initiatives” are sold.
* Excellent communication skills in Business English and Spanish (read, write, speak)
* Ability to balance delivery of results, problem solving, and client management.
* Superior time management skills and the ability to keep the analysis and preparations on schedule to meet critical deadlines.
* Strong ability to review, analyze and present large amounts of data within short time frames.
* Professional in appearance and conduct.
EDUCATION AND WORK EXPERIENCE:  


* An undergraduate business-related degree (advanced degree is a plus).
* Experienced in working diverse industry segments selling comprehensive MOS solutions into related product development, supply chain, and/or manufacturing operations.
* Ability to travel up to 75%.
* Ability to work on international assignments.
* Have a valid driver’s license, and a Canadian or US Passport.

BENEFITS:

The company provides excellent benefits and covers most of the cost for employees. Employees contribute a small percentage to medical and vision plans, but the company fully covers the cost of a telemedicine plan, dental, life insurance, AD&D, STD, and LTD.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, and use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is constantly required to talk or hear clearly on the phone and in person. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, or crouch.

The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Must be able to spend extended periods of time on aircraft in-flight and travel long distances.

  


We are a Drug-Free Workplace

This job description is not intended to be all inclusive. Employees may perform other related duties as instructed to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Salary:   
**This is a 100% remote position, and candidates must be located in the eastern or central time zone.**

**Target salary $55,000 - $70,000**

  


About Us!

  


**Ascension Recovery Services (Ascension RS)** is considered an industry leader in developing and managing comprehensive, fully integrated behavioral health systems, treating SUD and co-occurring mental illness across the full continuum of care. Our mission is to provide culturally competent, comprehensive and fully integrated, behavioral health care to communities and populations that are underserved and/or where people in need are not accessing care. Our experience in the development of treatment facilities encompasses the entire continuum of care, including detoxification and residential treatment facilities, outpatient programming, sober living homes/recovery residences, peer support services, and job training / workforce reintegration.

  


**The **Financial Analyst will be a key part of the team supporting the Consulting division of Ascension RS. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, professional who is proficient in excel, and an efficient multi-tasker who takes initiative!****

  


**Accountabilities**

* Create budgets for startup expenditures for new substance use disorder treatment programs to include Residential Treatment (RT), Partial Hospitalization (PHP), and Intensive Outpatient Programming (IOP)
* Forecast financial outcomes of the new center to include Balance Sheet, Income Statement, Statement of Cash Flows
* Establish budgeted operating costs for new centers.
* Perform Monthly Budget vs Actual Variance Analysis
* Provide Revenue Cycle Management Assistance
* Complete Other Ad Hoc Analysis
* Deliver Daily Census and Monthly Key Performance Indicator Reporting
* Provide insight to accounts receivable and chargebacks of the new facility (i.e. collection, billing, etc.)
* Develop the estimated revenue stream, through reimbursement rates, from a variety of payers (commercial insurance, Medicaid, self-pay, etc.)
* Establish an annual budget for these various behavioral health / addiction treatment programs, to include RT, PHP, and IOP
* **Core Values** - Promote and adhere to the workplace values of kindness, teamwork, empathy, integrity, excellence and mission

  


**Education and Experience**

* Bachelor’s and/or master’s degree in finance, accounting, or business (health administration
* Direct experience with insurance reimbursement rates (commercial insurance and Medicaid preferred)
* High comfort level with financial reporting on a granular basis to a variety of internal and external constituents
* Revenue cycle experience preferred.
* Direct experience with developing and managing an annual budget.
* Minimum of two years of experience in accounting and/or financial management required; healthcare experience strongly preferred.

title: Financial Analyst, FP&A - Tampa, FL

**Summary**

The **Financial Analyst, FP&A** is expected to support month end close reporting, budgeting and forecast reporting, and additional ad hoc work. This position is heavily involved in report building and review, as well as consolidation of data from business units and other sources. In addition, this individual will assist with building presentations for company leadership.

  


 We offer a competitive salary with a range of $65,000-$85,000 based on experience and skill set.   
 A variety of benefits are also available, including medical, dental, life insurance, short-term and long-term disability, as well as Signode's 401(k) program.

* Help prepare presentations for the Board of Directors and Senior Management

To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: FIAR/ RMIC Financial Analyst
description:
**SEPS -** FIAR/RMIC Analyst- Financial Management

  
Pueo is known for bringing the best talent and unique tools to every opportunity. Pueo's Parliament (aka workforce) is composed of professionals who are seeking the opportunity to work in a small business with a flat organization that thrives on career development and independence. In support of mission and professional growth, our Parliament has supported the development of multiple patents, proprietary tools, and applications as well as trademarked processes.

Our flat organization emphasizes career development across multiple career environments (at the members own pace) and ensures those who contribute broadly are properly rewarded. Pueo has four career environments where every member of the parliament can participate. Each environment has opportunities available for all levels. Opportunities are framed by an employee's desires and capabilities, and we ensure challenges, growth, and unique experiences are available for employees at all levels.

Our Career Environments (Program, Functional, Service, and Leadership) provide numerous opportunities for employees to invest in their personal growth and those things that offer fulfillment. We invest in helping our members create and execute their career development plans. Our Pods (small teams of 5 or less) are comprised of personnel with similar skillsets to ensure mentorship, understanding, and peer support.

**Role:** Pueo has an opportunity for an experienced Secret cleared FIAR/RMIC Analyst- Financial Management to join our team in Tampa. FL. The FIAR/RMIC Analyst is responsible for ensuring FIAR compliance and financial reporting in direct support for SOCOM. 

**Responsibilities:**

* Development and implementation of corrective action plans (CAPs), prepare and deliver audit sample packages, development of process control narratives (PCNs), develop and conduct audit training,
* Audit remediation requirements for DoD,
* Evaluating program deficiencies and preparing briefings for GO/FO/SES level DoD leadership to address solutions,
* Justifying policy change, systems acquisition, or budget justification,
* Government Finance and Execution including use of systems such as: Procurement integrated Enterprise Environment (PIEE), EDA, DEAMS, FM Suites, Defense Travel System (DTS), CRIS, DAI, ADVANA, G-Invoicing, researching/coordinating financial and contractual information,
* Development and implementation of Corrective Action Plans (CAPS), prepare and deliver audit sample packages, development of Process Control Narratives.

**Qualifications:**

* An active Secret clearance,
* 2+ years' experience in preparing financial and material management reports IAW FIAR compliance or other FIAR-related activities that clearly demonstrate expertise in FIAR requirements,
* Master's Degree in one of the following disciplines: Accounting or Finance, Business Management or Business Administration, OR Licensed CPA with a B.S. Degree in Accounting or Finance, OR 10 years' experience in Financial Management, with a B.S. Degree in one of the following disciplines: Accounting or Finance, Business Management or Business Administration Transcripts.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience with DoD or other federal agency in Financial Management Financial Management experience includes activities such as monitoring budget execution, preparing financial documentation and reports, preparing trial balances, reconciling accounts, and other accounting functions, budget formulation, completing financial transactions in accounting and financial management systems, auditing, or similar tasks.

  
Pueo is an equal employment opportunity employer and affirmative action employer. All interested individuals will receive consideration and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or protected veteran status. Pueo takes affirmative action in support of its policy to advance diversity and inclusion of individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

title: Pricing Operations Analyst
description:
Responsibilities:

1. Assist with research, analysis, and implementation of various client billing requirements including but not limited to, billing rate arrangements, phase/task coding, and timekeeper approval.

2. Process requests from various departments in the billing system to update client and matter settings.

3. Monitor and update various client discount arrangements; including setting tracking alerts.

4. Entry and upkeep of client arrangements in firm deal database.

5. Assist with year end and ad hoc updates to client and timekeeper changes in billing rate arrangements.

 

Essential Functions of Job:

1. Collaborate with Pricing Operations Manager and intake team on maintenance initiatives including but not limited to: rate updates, phase/task code updates, matter tagging, client deal information updates.

2. Work with the relevant stakeholders to ensure that client financial arrangements are properly articulated, updated, and documented in Firm’s pricing database.

3. Manage the data-mining process for new and existing matters. This includes gathering and maintaining information on fee arrangements, matter types, cost drivers, task coding, among other items.

4. Monitor compliance with Firm budgeting and pricing policies, as well as the financial aspects of client guidelines and terms; provide guidance to attorneys and support staff as needed.

5. Collaborate with Billing, eBilling, and Practice Specialists to ensure most current client financial arrangements are communicated and properly administered.

6. Collaborate with lawyers, practice management colleagues, and the marketing department to respond to RFPs, pitches, and other pricing proposals.

7. Work with partners to enter budgets and other fee arrangement data into online matter management tool, then monitor and provide regular status reports to partners and management. This will be done in conjunction with the Budget Control Analyst.

8. Prepare recurring and ad hoc reports related to all aspects of practice management.

9. Complete special projects as assigned.

title: Sr. IT Business Financial Analyst
description:
Company Description  
  
At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible.

At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we’ve been doing just that. Our technology helped people put a man on the moon.

We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest growth organizations in the world. From energizing the most competitive gaming platforms, to enabling systems to make cities safer and cars smarter and more connected, to powering the data centers behind many of the world’s biggest companies and public cloud, Western Digital is fueling a brighter, smarter future.

Binge-watch any shows, use social media or shop online lately? You’ll find Western Digital supporting the storage infrastructure behind many of these platforms. And, that flash memory card that captures and preserves your most precious moments? That’s us, too.

We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, storage devices and platforms for business and consumers alike. Our data-centric solutions are comprised of the Western Digital®, G-Technology™, SanDisk® and WD® brands.

Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. It’s You & Western Digital. Together, we’re the next BIG thing in data.

Job Description  
  
The Senior IT Business Analyst will report directly to the Sr. Director of IT Planning and Financial Management within Western Digital’s Office of the CIO. The ideal candidate will have a strong financial analysis background with an attention to detail and be able to operate in a dynamic environment. 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 

* Collaborate as a trusted advisor to OCIO management and IT leadership.
* Build and maintain the annual budget plan to forecast, partnering with Finance business partner to align with targets.
* Identify and develop IT variance to plan and project reporting by IT function and sub-function. This will include data identification, consolidation, and validation to support consistent and accurate monthly/quarterly/annual reporting.
* Coordinate the monthly close activities within IT and in partnership with Finance, including expense and capital management, accruals, forecast to actuals variance reconciliation.
* Assess current state and implement improvements for OCIO tools and processes for Annual Plan to facilitate project level intake, review, and approval for simple transition into the formal Annual Plan for the upcoming fiscal year.
* Build and maintain centralized data repository which allows OCIO and IT leadership to quickly understand the consolidated, yet detailed IT spend for the prior rolling 3-5 fiscal years. This includes tracking, reporting and metrics for transformational spend, detailed asset and software licensing/maintenance schedules, spend by business area.
* Support analytics on total cost of ownership of initiatives, return on investment, net present value, lease vs buy, and other relevant analytics in support of IT initiatives and investment areas.
* Support other aspects of financial forecasting, intake and processing of funding requests and purchase requisitions as needed.
* Manage the IT headcount plan and engage with IT leadership to prioritize and achieve hiring objectives.
* Make clear, logical decisions based on facts, taking into consideration the big picture, long and short term effects, and exercising sound judgment when handling complaints, confidential and sensitive topics.
* Provide support and training to IT colleagues regarding the IT financial planning and management process.

It is essential that this person have the ability to build strong business relationships, understand IT financial processes, and display strong teamwork skills. This individual must be self-motivated and have prior similar experience in both International and US-based IT purchasing and contract management services capital and understand IT deliverables and contracts.

Qualifications  
  
REQUIRED

* BS in Finance, Computer/Management Information Services or equivalent experience in a relevant field
* 10+ years of experience working in organizations with complex accounting and financial reporting
* Combination of conceptual and analytical capabilities

SKILLS

* Strong written, presentation and verbal communication skills
* Master level capabilities with Excel, e.g. pivots
* Experience with Oracle Financials, Smartview, Power BI and SmartSheet strongly desired
* Advanced skills with data analytics tools such as PowerPivot, PowerQuery, Excel VBA and/or equivalent tools preferred

  
  
Additional Information  
  
Western Digital is committed to providing equal opportunities to all applicants and employees and will not discriminate based on their race, color, ancestry, religion (including religious dress and grooming standards), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), gender (including a person’s gender identity, gender expression, and gender-related appearance and behavior, whether or not stereotypically associated with the person’s assigned sex at birth), age, national origin, sexual orientation, medical condition, marital status (including domestic partnership status), physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, protected medical and family care leave, Civil Air Patrol status, military and veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. We also prohibit harassment of any individual on any of the characteristics listed above. Our non-discrimination policy applies to all aspects of employment. We comply with the laws and regulations set forth in the Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law poster.

Western Digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution.

Western Digital is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at jobs.accommodations@wdc.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

title: Financial Planning and Reporting Analyst
description:
Salary: $85k to 95k Annually DOE  
  


**Position:** Financial Planning and Reporting Analyst

**Location:** Administration, Milpitas, CA (**Hybrid in-person/remote)**

**Employment Type:** Regular Full Time, Exempt

**Compensation: $**85,000 to 95,000/Annually

 

**Program Summary:**

Immediately hiring a **Financial Planning and Reporting Analyst** to join our finance team. Reporting directly to the Controller, the analyst will be responsible for managing the annual financial planning process, interim budgeting activities, and monthly reporting.   


  


**Responsibilities:** 

Financial Reporting

* Generate accurate and timely monthly financial statements.
* Analyze financial data to identify key trends and variances.

Budget Management

* Generate department level budget vs actual reports.
* Collaborate with program managers to monitor financial performance, investigate variances, and provide insights to short term decision making.

Planning

* Work with key stakeholders across the organization to develop annual financial plans.
* Manage and update the models used in this process.

Grant and Fund Management

* Work closely with the development team to provide financial analysis and modeling for grant proposals.
* Track and report on the financial status of grants, ensuring compliance with funding requirements.
* Assist in the preparation of financial reports for grantors and donors.

Compliance

* Ensure compliance with relevant accounting standards, regulatory requirements, and organizational policies.
* Support the annual audit process by providing necessary documentation and explanations.

Process Improvement

* Identify and implement ongoing process improvements.

 

**Minimum Qualifications:**

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field (Master’s degree preferred).

Two years’ experience as a financial analyst, preferably in the non-profit sector.

 

**Skills, Abilities, and Knowledge:**

Strong analytic and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal.

Detail oriented with a high level of accuracy.

Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint). 

Comfortable with financial transaction processing systems - knowledge of Blackbaud Financial Edge and Concur a plus.

Knowledge of non-profit accounting principles.

 

**Other:**

* Able to perform sedentary work;
* Ability to use keyboard and read computer screens for extended periods;

 

**About HomeFirst:**

Established in 1980, with 40+ years of experience, we are the premier Silicon Valley provider of homelessness services. We believe that everyone has the potential to get housed and stay housed. We relentlessly focus on eliminating barriers to housing and creating stability for everyone we serve.

 

HomeFirst serves more than 6,000 adults, veterans, families, and young adults each year at multiple locations from Gilroy to Menlo Park – all of Santa Clara County as well as southern San Mateo County. 

Services include:

* Homelessness prevention
* Emergency and cold-weather shelters
* Comprehensive Veterans’ Services
* Rapid Rehousing programs
* Bridge Housing Communities
* Emergency Interim Housing
* Affordable permanent housing
* Permanent Supportive housing
* Street-based outreach

 

Benefits of joining the HomeFirst team:

  


* Professional growth opportunities within the organization
* 100% medical coverage for employees with an opportunity to add dependents at a shared cost
* 401k match up to 5%
* 12 observed Holidays
* Generous PTO, accrual begin with 120 hours annually and increase with tenure
* 4 hours of Community Engagement provided annually
* Access to our Emergency Assistance Program (EAP) services
* Pet Insurance options available

  


 HomeFirst is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law. Additionally, HomeFirst participates in the E-Verify program, as required by law.

  


HomeFirst is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.

title: Financial Planner
description:
Take your career to the next level at Prudential Advisors! Change your life by helping others change theirs!

 

We have an immediate opening for a highly motivated analytical individual to join us in our firm. In general, the entrepreneurial individual who successfully qualifies and is selected for this career opportunity will work within a team of Financial Advisors whose goal is to successfully help their clients achieve financial goals.

 

The FINANCIAL PLANNER is a key member of our team. After achieving the licenses and registrations necessary to become a FINANCIAL PLANNER your typical day may include:

· Developing relationships with clients (both existing and prospective)

· Gathering client information and using that information to build robust financial plans

· Helping clients prepare for their retirement

· Preparing and reviewing investment portfolio recommendations

Because of our comprehensive training and development program, no prior knowledge of the financial services industry is required, but prior exposure to the industry and the career is a plus.

YOU:

· Are a self-starter.

· Have an entrepreneurial mindset.

· Are a customer service champion.

· Are an engaging and compelling communicator and negotiator.

· Are a problem solver.

· Are a Life-long student seeking continued education and professional development.

· Are a critical thinker.

· Have prior sales experience and/or enjoy networking and seeking new clients.

· Have a college degree or equivalent work/life experience with a minimum of a high school diploma or GED equivalent.

WE:

· Provide a framework to help you attain all licensing and education needed to progress through the career.

· Support your learning through joint work and a team environment.

· Provide competitive compensation and benefits that are unique in our industry.

· Provide a roadmap for your success with our experienced team of leaders.

 

Prudential Advisors is a brand name of The Prudential Insurance Company of America and its subsidiaries.

 

Prudential is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO IS THE LAW. The Prudential Insurance Company of America, Newark, NJ, and its affiliates.

Prudential is an Employer that participates in E-Verify.

title: Project Financial Analyst
description:
At Antora, we're on a mission to stop climate change. And we can't do that unless we tackle the 30% of global emissions that come from industry.

Antora is unlocking zero-emissions industrial energy, cheaper than fossil fuels. Antora's thermal batteries store energy from renewables as heat for days on end, delivering that stored energy as heat and power at the scale and temperatures that large industrial operations demand. We're on a path to eliminate gigatons of emissions while strengthening domestic manufacturing, curbing industrial air pollution, and enhancing America's clean energy leadership.

We are growing our company with people who put team and mission first, value connection through laughter and joy, and build with humility and openness. We are committed to continue building a diverse, passionate, and creative team dedicated to a future where every industrial facility, everywhere on earth, is powered by abundant, low-cost, zero-emissions energy.

**Position Summary**

Financial Analyst owning project financial models for our renewable heat and power projects. Work within a small project development team to win projects, profitably deploy capital, and re-invent industrial energy.

**This is an onsite position based in our San Jose, California facility. It is possible for an exception to be made to accommodate a remote candidate (though in most cases this will come with the expectation that the candidate will eventually be onsite in San Jose).**

**Roles & Responsibilities**

* Ownership of financial models for clean energy projects $10M-$100M+ scale, beginning at proposal phase and iterating through operation.
* Work with wider business development team to develop project proposals
* Project diligence, risk identification, quantification, and mitigation strategy
* Build template models and tools to standardize and accelerate modeling process
* Work with analytics team to incorporate results from operational simulations into financial models

**Key Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in relevant field
* 2-3 years of experience building financial models likely in a renewable energy project development company or in a top-tier consulting firm, private equity firm, investment bank, or relevant graduate education
* Ability to effectively communicate financial models to wider team and to summarize data visually
* Extreme attention to detail and organization
* Strong quantitative sense and able to creatively estimate and operate in situations where data is unavailable
* Self-starter capable of working within a distributed team without direct supervision
* Experience in crafting presentations for external audience
* Expertise with both Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint

**Additional Qualifications Desired**

* Background in energy markets or energy projects
* Familiarity with energy project finance structures and relevant accounting and tax treatments (e.g. partnership flip, sale leaseback)
* Knowledge of relevant state and federal policies and regulations
* Exposure to Python or other programming languages

Work Location: Onsite - San Jose, CA 

Salary Range: $88,000 USD - $105,000 USD

Salary Basis: Annual

This job posting contains the salary range that Antora Energy believes it would be willing to pay for the posted job. The actual salary offered will be determined within the posted range based on a candidate's experience, credentials, and expertise as they pertain to the requirements of the position.

In addition to a competitive base salary, Antora Energy's Total Rewards program includes a premium health benefits package with life and disability insurance, a 401K plan, a flexible spending account, industry leading paid time off policy, providing a flexible and inclusive holiday observance, as well as paid volunteer time off.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
company: San Jose State University Research Foundation
description:
**OUR STATEMENT**  
The San José State University Research Foundation (SJSURF) is committed to building a work environment where everyone can show up as their own self and have an opportunity to contribute, develop, and advance in their career. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) are core values of the organization. We strive to attract, retain, and develop employees who reflect the community and society where we work and live. The Research Foundation aims to develop a culture where everyone feels welcome, shares their views, and where differences in backgrounds and perspectives are seen as adding value.

**GENERAL NATURE OF POSITION**  
The SJSU Research Foundation partners with the SJSU Division of Research and Innovation to assist faculty in the pursuit of external funding for sponsored research, IP portfolio management, and other discretionary activities. This role will report to the director of finance & accounting and as such will be involved in a variety of projects across the organization conceive to help improve efficiencies, effectiveness and long-term sustainable growth. Some of these initiatives will be managed by the sr. financial analyst in an ongoing manner. Others will be one-time special projects. All of them will involve collaboration with the leaders of the Research Foundation. Most of them will be financial in nature and as a result there will be close working relationship with the financial and accounting department. Additionally, the role will work with the OSP department, the central coordination point for all grants and contracts that works closely with Principal Investigators (PIs) in the submission of proposal and management of awards, as well as the Research Foundation HR and IT departments.

As a member of the finance & accounting department, the sr. financial analyst will function as the foundation’s primary budget manager and assist department managers as they develop budgets, interpret results, make ongoing adjustments and report results based on these indicators. In addition, the incumbent will be instrumental in the assembly of the monthly financial review and reporting process. The analyst will also support the ERP implementation. The analyst will also make recommendations for performance metrics, monitor departmental and group results and prepare reports for management and the Board of Directors under guidance of the director of finance & accounting. In addition, the incumbent will be expected to interface with University staff related to the financial relationship as an official auxiliary and the transfers/support payments between the two entities.  
   
**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

1. Manage the foundation’s annual budgeting process to include input and ensure understanding of all departments and the management team.
2. Develop monthly monitoring and reporting tools to track departmental and RF performance against budget.
3. Compare actual to budgeted results at the end of each reporting period. Analyze and report on significant variances and causes of those variances. Update the budget model as requested to account for significant changes.
4. Maintain and update the budgeting policies and standard operating procedures.
5. Draft and prepare data and reports for all Board of Directors meetings.
6. Initiate, analyze and submit for review the F&A distribution model on an annual basis.
7. Review and maintain data relating to F&A (indirect cost) calculation and approval process
8. Review and maintain data relating to fringe benefit calculation and annual approval process.
9. Actively support self-support programs like the Timpany Center, I-House, and MLML.
10. Initiate regular transfers to/from University departments.
11. Manage the RF Dashboard of key performance indicators to provide real-time update of operating results.
12. Actively assist the Finance Department in implementation of Workday ERP Software.
13. Actively assist in providing month end close and audit support to the Finance team and communicating accounting and reporting issues to regulatory agencies by reviewing, analyzing, and preparing supporting documents and other related materials.
14. Prepare various periodic standard and ad hoc reports for funding partners or regulatory agencies.
15. Other duties and tasks as assigned.

**INTERPERSONAL CONTACTS**

1. Reports to the director of finance and accounting.
2. Interacts with internal office staff (Office of Sponsored Programs, Human Resources, and IT) on a daily basis.
3. Also interacts, as appropriate, with SJSU faculty and staff, as well as with outside local, state, and federal agencies. Also interacts with auditors, as appropriate.

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES**  
No formal supervisory responsibilities, though will project lead and advise. 

**QUALIFICATIONS  
Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or related field.
* Five (5) years of experience as finance analyst of a complex organization.

  
**Preferred Qualifications**

* Demonstrated understanding of fund accounting and financial statements for not-for-profit organizations.
* Knowledge of Foundation financial software preferably Central Square and/or Workday.
* ERP implementation experience.
* Knowledge of California State University financial policies and guidelines.
* Directly relevant professional, personal and lived experience that translates into successful completion of the listed essential duties and responsibilities including: financial analysis, financial accounting, budget building, project management and contractual negotiations.
* Experience in promoting a culturally competent and diverse work environment.

**Knowledge, Skills, Abilities required**

* Attention to detail and accuracy.
* Ability to develop a schedule and plan ahead to meet known deadlines throughout the year.
* Ability to work with multiple financial systems and translate data and reports between them.
* Working knowledge of GASB & GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles).
* Excellent communication and writing skills are essential.
* Excellent interpersonal skills to develop and maintain cooperative and productive working relationships with Foundation colleagues, faculty, and representatives of various organizations and agencies.
* Ability to prioritize tasks, to work independently, to maintain confidentiality, and to take initiative to improve upon current operations.
* Excellent judgment, independent creative problem-solving skills, and attention to details.

**Physical Requirement**

* Must be able to operate a PC including mouse and keyboard.
* Must be able to operate general office equipment.
* Must be able to sit and stand for extended periods of time.
* Visual acuity associated with concentrated computer use.

**Complexity of Duties**

* Works on a variety of problems of complex scope, where analysis of data or solutions requires an evaluation of intangible, variance factors.
* Exercises independent judgment in developing methods and evaluating criteria for achieved results.
* Must be able to act on critical issues in an independent manner.
* Erroneous decisions or recommendations, or failure to get results would cause additional costs and personnel, and serious delays in overall schedule.

**PLEASE NOTE:** This position is considered a “sensitive” position by SJSURF and CSU policy. Consequently, the successful candidate must undergo and successfully complete the Live Scan (fingerprinting) background check as a condition of their employment. This background check must be completed before the actual start of employment.

**NOTE:** This position description intends to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. It is not intended to include all duties and responsibilities. The order in which duties and responsibilities are listed is not significant.  
   
**BENEFITS**  
The SJSURF provides an excellent benefits package to benefited employees. The comprehensive benefits package includes:

1. Four company health insurance plans to choose from (employee contributions differ according to plan and level of coverage).
2. Employer-paid dental and vision for both employee and eligible dependents.
3. Life, AD&D, LTD with supplemental coverage opportunities.
4. 14 paid federal & state holidays.
5. Retirement Plan: 403 (b) employee contribution plan component and a 403 (b) employer contribution component, which vests immediately.
6. Vacation-hour accruals and separate sick-hour accumulations.
7. Hybrid work schedule.
8. Employee discounts.
9. Paid training and professional-development conferences.

  
Please visit the Benefits & Compensation page on the SJSURF website for more detailed information.  
   
**APPLICATION PROCEDURE**  
To apply for this position, an applicant must submit a formal application for employment. Select “Apply Now” to complete the SJSURF online employment application.  
   
**REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION**  
The SJSURF is committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for individuals with physical or mental disabilities in the employment, recruitment, examination, interviewing, and hiring processes. If you are a job seeker with a physical or mental disability, and you require a reasonable accommodation to search, apply, or interview for a job opening or otherwise need a reasonable accommodation during the application and hiring process, please contact us at foundation-jobs@sjsu.edu. In the email message, please indicate your full name, phone number and the type of assistance required. You must not reveal the underlying medical reason for your needed reasonable accommodation or otherwise disclose confidential medical information.

title: FP&A Analyst II - Commercial
description:
**About Visby**

Visby Medical is an ambitious, well-funded late-stage biotech startup. Driven by a belief that infectious disease diagnosis should be quick, accurate, and accessible to all, Visby has developed the world's first single-use PCR platform that disrupts the traditional model and redefines the way infectious disease is tested and treated.

**About The Role**

We are currently recruiting a FP&A Analyst II to join our FP&A team, specializing in supporting our commercial organization. In this role, you will collaborate closely with the sales and marketing departments, taking charge of sales budgets, including commissions, and delivering insightful reporting. This unique position offers exposure to a traditional Finance function in a fast-paced startup environment, while also delving into commercial aspects such as reporting on distribution, marketing, and revenue activities. If you are a detail-oriented financial analyst with an interest in supporting commercial strategies, apply now!

**How You'll Make An Impact**

* Collaborate closely with sales and marketing teams to manage budgets, including quarterly bottoms-up forecasts in our planning system
* Conduct monthly analysis of actuals vs. budget/forecast variances
* Calculate and report quarterly commissions
* Dashboarding and reporting from a variety of systems including: Netsuite, Cube (Finance planning software), and Salesforce
* Prepare regular reports on revenue activities, including consolidating distributor reporting
* Actively participate in strategic discussions, offering financial expertise to support organizational goals

**On Your First Day We'd Like You to Have:**

* Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Sales or a related field
* Expert knowledge in Microsoft Office Excel
* Minimum of 2 years of finance experience, preferably in the medical device, pharma, or life science industry
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Experience with ERP Systems (e.g., Netsuite) and finance forecasting software
* Proficiency in sales analytics tools and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce) or a willingness to take courses
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; a bonus if you have worked with senior commercial leadership
* Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy

**Salary Range:**

* $83,054 - $120,000 (Minimum to maximum salary range for candidates based in San Jose, CA)
* Compensation for the role is based on geographical location. Should the level or location of the role change during the hiring process, the applicable base pay range may be updated accordingly.
* Compensation also depends on a number of factors including a candidate's qualifications, skills, competencies and experience and may fall outside of the range shown.

**More about our benefits**

Visby offers highly competitive health insurance through Cigna or Kaiser, including a company-funded HSA option. We also offer a 401k match, flexible paid time off, 11 company holidays, and many other contemporary benefits and perks.

**Additional information**

We believe that the unique contributions of all Visbees is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, pregnancy or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, or military or veteran status.

Full COVID Vaccination Required - Reasonable accommodations for medical or religious reasons considered.

title: Business Reporting Analyst - Remote
description:
Pager is a virtual care collaboration platform that provides access to whole-person healthcare in a trusted, convenient, connected care experience, like having a “doctor in the family.” Pager helps people make better healthcare decisions by enabling better access and reducing costs, making care simple and easy to understand throughout the entire care journey. Through a combination of hi-tech AI automation and hi-touch concierge services, Pager offers an integrated, full-service experience including triage, telemedicine, e-prescriptions, appointment scheduling, after-care follow-up, care advocacy and customer service. Pager’s omni-channel communications platform connects the fragmented healthcare ecosystem by aggregating a care team of nurses, doctors, pharmacists, coordinators, advocates and more in one place. Pager partners with leading payers, providers and employers representing more than 23 million people across the United States and Latin America.
  
  

The Reporting Analyst will report to the Reporting & Business Intelligence Manager and partner with cross-functional teams to address organizational data and reporting needs. This analyst will also work closely with the Sr. Director of the Professional Services Team. This role is a key part of the Operations team, which supports both external and internal stakeholders in transforming data, creating data models, visualizing data, and developing assets that provide meaningful value and insights to the business.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

* Act as a data and reporting resource across departments, by supporting data visualization (i.e. reports and dashboards) and analysis for internal stakeholders such as Finance, Customer Success, Sales, Product, and Senior Leadership teams to improve visibility into performance, trends, and business goals.
* Build reporting assets (dashboards, queries, etc.) from scratch with a bias toward creating clean, accurate, user-focused visualizations.
* Support timely and quality delivery of contractual client deliverables, such as client-facing monthly metrics presentations and SLA reports.
* Identify actionable insights, suggest recommendations, and influence the direction of the business by communicating results to cross-functional groups.
* Align programmatic needs and data infrastructure, by serving as an advocate and feedback loop for departments to improve data integrity, tracking, and maintenance.
* Collaborate with colleagues to improve data processes and codify data processes for managing and executing data requests to increase efficiency.
* Develop a solid understanding of our platform, product, and customers to ensure that reporting/data.


Requirements
  
  

* Minimum 2+ years experience in managing data, creating dashboards, and building reports for all levels of operations, including clients and senior leadership.
* Bachelor’s degree in information systems, computer science, or related field; In lieu of degree requirement, the candidate must have a minimum 6 years of experience with supporting business intelligence, managing datasets, creating dashboards, and building effective reporting for all levels of operations including senior leadership.
* Proficient in working with large data sets, across diverse formats and sources; data mining tools (must have: SQL (Metabase) and DAX (PowerBI) etc.).
* Proficient in working with data visualization tools such as Metabase, PowerBI, and SSRS.
* Excel and PPT proficiency required to create client facing presentation/analysis.
* Knowledge of ETL processes and data modeling.
* Experienced in working with and manipulating large datasets and writing and maintaining reports derived from that data.
* Experienced in creating actionable reports for our customers and internal teams, while balancing for future use cases and building a scalable reporting infrastructure.
* Experienced in building reporting solutions from scratch, data visualization, and a bias towards creating clean, accurate, user-focused visualizations.
* Ensures systems are implemented to support initiatives and goals to improve the quality of patient care, maximize patient safety, and enhance operational efficiencies to support digital health outcomes and enhancement.
* Demonstrates familiarity and understanding of all clinical information systems, including interfaces, and demonstrates expertise in applications within scope of assigned work.
* Strong ability to analyze data and troubleshoot complex technical problems.
* Past experience determining metrics to track the health of initiatives and the business overall.


**Preferred Qualifications:**  

* B2B SaaS Experience in the healthcare industry is a plus.


Must Have Behavioral Traits
  
  

* Comfortable with ambiguity and rapidly changing circumstances.
* Ability to self-organize tasks and balance competing priorities.
* When required, ability to take direction and be coached to directly support business needs.
* Communicates effectively with engineers and with non-technical stakeholders, and how to eliminate confusion and ambiguity.
* Challenges the status quo and push for best practices & sustainable, scalable data systems & processes in a fast-paced start-up environment
* Self-motivator who is able address problems in a highly dynamic and fast-paced environment.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to interact, communicate, partner effectively with technical and non-technical teams.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
* Excellent attention to detail, quality, and strong strategic mindset.


Offers are contingent upon the successful completion of a background check. This may include but is not limited to substance testing, education, employment, references, state and federal licensure and certifications, criminal history, Office of the Inspector General (OIG) and General Services Administration (GSA) exclusions checks.
  
  

**For Colorado, Nevada, and New York-based employment:** In accordance with the Pay Transparency laws the pay range for this position is $55,000 to $69,000. The compensation package may include stock options, plus a range of medical, dental, vision, financial, generous PTO, stipends for professional development, and wellness benefits. Final compensation for this role will be determined by various factors such as a candidate's relevant work experience, skills, certifications, and geographic location. The range listed only applies to Colorado, Nevada, and New York.
  
  

At Pager, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Position Summary
  
The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for supporting revenue growth and overall business performance through coordination of the sales funnel, delivering business insights and strategic analysis, and the continuous improvement of our sales, account management and contracting processes.
  
  

This position reports directly to the Manager of Business Intelligence & Reporting, whom you’ll work very closely with. You will interact cross-functionally regularly as you ensure that all operational elements & data integrity within the billing, sales, sales operations and reconciliation management processes are running efficiently. As such, your ability to build strong relationships and influence without authority in addition to your analytical and operational skillset will be critical to success in this role.
  
  

**Office Location:** New York, NY
  
**Schedule:** Hybrid, ~3-2 days in-office per week
  
**Salary Range:** $70,000 - $90,000 per year
  
  

**Responsibilities include:****Execution of Strategy:**  

* Deliver analysis and insights pertaining to marketing and sales activity, market/competitive intelligence, and profitability.
* Project manage programs and initiatives related to the Metergy’s US Services strategy, such as market segmentation, client engagement, and margin & vendor analysis.


**Performance Reporting:**  

* Analysis of KPI reports including sales/product conversions, growth, product health and YoY trends, leading to OKR development.
* Identify and make suggestions on potential actions/activities related to improve outcomes and help teams to prioritize opportunities based on knowledge of Metergy products and services.
* Working in a variety of reporting systems and databases for the creation of recurring reports and dashboards


**Billing & Sales Operations:**  

* Ability to Navigate SalesForce CRM, build reporting, ensure consistency and compliance across the sales organization.
* Support Marketing to develop, execute and track region or sector-based marketing plans where applicable
* Take a data-driven approach to further refine where teams can focus to develop their strategies for pursuing medium-to long-term opportunities.
* Knowledge of SQL syntax and experience debugging queries for accurate results


**What you’ll bring to this role:**  

* Data driven analytical skills, knowledge and/or extensive experience related to financial analysis.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to addressing challenges.
* Proven track record of working cross functionally and successfully delivering complex projects.
* Introduce innovative solutions and strategies to enhance project outcomes while managing internal stakeholders, facilitating communication and driving collaboration across teams.
* Quality-driven and diligent; attention to detail and accountability to see projects through.
* Ability to prioritize and adapt to changing demands and deadlines, are essential.
* Excellent skills in Salesforce, PowerPoint, Excel, MS Suite, JIRA, R/Python (plus).
* Creativity, relationship building skills and dedication are all highly desirable.
* Experience supporting sales and/or operations is an asset.


Metergy’s recruitment process includes accommodation for applicants with disabilities. All accommodations will consider the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability and are available upon request.

title: ECommerce Business Analyst
description:
We are high volume ecommerce company, with offices in NY and NJ, that sells a wide assortment of products across many online platforms (Amazon, eBay, Walmart.com, Macys.com, etc.). We specialize in photography, electronics, audio, and houseware products, but sell many other categories as well.

We are looking for an ecommerce/third-party platform Business Analyst to join our small but passionate team of ecommerce specialists in our Brooklyn, NY office.

You will work with the Ecommerce team and create reports to analyze trends and sales data. This is a key role to support our business and maximize our sales.

Job Description:

* Responsible for creating and issuing dashboards and analysis in Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI that range from weekly to monthly to bi-annually

title: Business Systems Analyst-Hybrid Schedule
company: Columbia University in the City of New York
description:
Columbia University is one of the world's most important centers of research and at the same time a distinctive and distinguished learning environment for undergraduates and graduate students in many scholarly and professional fields. The University recognizes the importance of its location in New York City and seeks to link its research and teaching to the vast resources of a great metropolis. It seeks to attract a diverse and international faculty and student body, to support research and teaching on global issues, and to create academic relationships with many countries and regions. It expects all areas of the university to advance knowledge and learning at the highest level and to convey the products of its efforts to the world. Columbia is one of the top academic and research institutions in the world, conducting path breaking research in medicine, science, the arts, and the humanities. It includes three undergraduate schools, thirteen graduate and professional schools, a world-renowned medical center, four affiliated colleges and seminaries, twenty-five libraries, and more than one hundred research centers and institutes. The creation of the Columbia Climate School is the first new school in 25 years at the University. Columbia can claim 86 Nobel Laureates as well as over 380 new inventions each year. Columbia is rated in the top 10 of private employers in NYC, and minorities make up 45% of faculty and staff. We are committed to attracting and retaining the best and brightest in the workforce to support our mission of excellence in higher education and research.

**POSITION DESCRIPTION:**

Reporting to the Associate Director, Operational Initiatives, Sponsored Project Finance (“SPF”), the Business Systems Analyst will support and maintain Columbia’s proprietary web-based data warehouse and application and other IT applications via coding, report writing and administrative assistance critical to the daily operations of SPF, with the objective of ensuring compliance with University policies, industry standards and sponsor terms and conditions. This position plays a key role as a technical resource and functional liaison between the Sponsored Project Finance team, University departments, the Finance Information Systems team, Application Service Provider and CUIT supporting the University’s sponsored programs through configuration and development of the proprietary application.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Works closely with Sponsored Project Finance, Application Service Provider and Information Technology to coordinate development activities, and respond to business needs by identifying system requirements and support opportunities for process improvement and system enhancements
* Acts as a technical resource to develop and write (i.e., code) business intelligence reports, dashboards, database tables, metrics and analysis tools that support the billing, reporting and collection of sponsored project funding
* Help document current business processes, and help clarify roles and responsibilities – recommend ongoing process improvements and have a sense of business process end to end ownership. Works with department leadership to develop processing procedures and system modifications to meet their specifications
* Works to translate functional needs into technical specifications and engages with the Application Service Provider, Information Technology and vendors in the construction of the work units
* Actively contributes to ongoing process improvement by assisting in the development and communication of policies, procedures and user support tools
* Coordinates with and supports department leadership, business partners and users to troubleshoot issues and responds to system errors and failures, recreating issues in a test environment
* Escalates incidents/issues to the next level of functional or technical system support as needed
* Interfaces with users to verify issue resolution, validate incidents and communicate progress to customers in a timely manner
* Serves as an administrator in leading technical troubleshooting/resolutions with current interfacing financial systems and the user-community
* Participates in the routine application of patches and fixes
* Performs systems and report testing and validation, and collaborates with department and technical support to resolve related issues and errors
* Uses project management skills to identify, evaluate and recommend updates to the current business processes, application and reporting tools
* Drafts specifications, informational materials and configuration documentation for technical support and user training
* Performs other related duties and special projects as assigned
* Help automate business process when possible and troubleshoot production issues
* Develop, document and help conduct end to end test scenarios and test procedures needed for product sign off after system, DB and operating system upgrades, system enhancements, Disaster recovery testing, and other system related changes.

**Required Skills/Abilities:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field required
* Four to six years related experience required
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills with a proven ability to collaborate with a team
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Extensive knowledge of financial applications and associated reporting tools
* Strong working knowledge of ERP systems integration
* Strong working knowledge of SAP Business Objects Web Intelligence or similar reporting and analysis tool (e.g., Cognos, Power BI, OBIEE and Tableau)
* Fluency in SQL and other similar languages with ability to become an advanced user in multiple languages rapidly, including C# and .NET
* Proficient with the technical development of reports, dashboards, databases and analysis tools
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software
* Proficient with or able to quickly learn systems and software used by the organization
* Demonstrated ability to work in a high pressure, fast-paced environment required.
* Must be able to problem-solve and troubleshoot, in addition to having the ability to work independently in a dynamic team environment.
* In addition, the successful candidate must be able to work well with all levels of employees, be flexible in nature, have sound judgment with an open and collaborative style that encourages teamwork and cooperation beyond the immediate team to the broader organization.
* Must have a passion for excellent customer service and commitment to exceptional quality.

**Education and Experience:**

* Experience in related technical, functional and information systems preferred
* Non-profit and/or research accounting knowledge a plus
* Experience in higher education strongly preferred
* Experience with process improvement preferred

To be considered an applicant, all interested parties apply through the Columbia University online employment application system. Paste the following quick link into your browser to access this position posting:

http://opportunities.columbia.edu/cw/en-us/job/541311?lApplicationSubSourceID=

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Job Title**


Business Analyst**Job Description Summary**


Support, maintain and enhance our JDE payroll application and Workday and the integrations related to them.**Job Description**


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES

* Collaborate with Operations, IT and functional areas to resolve open issues by developing problem statements, corrective action plans, presenting to others for peer review and approvals, then delivering to the plan.
* Research capabilities of the current JD Edwards system and recommend system configurations to meet the business requirements.
* Ability to define, configure and test PDBA, AAI, Tax, Benefit Plan and Union Group Contract setups to achieve an outcome consistent with defined requirements.
* Understand the database schema and extracting data for audit purposes to aid in identifying the root cause and corrective action.
* Support the complete development lifecycle including requirements gathering, documentation, design, development, integration testing and deployment.
* Understand the end-to-end process flow including interfaces to/from third party vendors as well as our CW integrated internal systems.
* Overseeing the timely completion of implementation assignments and keeping management informed of project progress and potential problems, particularly as to needed changes in schedule, resources, and detail designs.
* Participate in functional and customer facing meetings, anticipating needs before they arise and present solutions to management.
* Workday responsibilities - day to day tier 2 support for PR/HR operational processes. Understand and implement best practices and make recommendations to leadership for solutions and improvements.
* This position will also be responsible for evaluating customer needs to create systems and reporting solutions that support overall business strategies. This includes but is not limited to, documenting system and data requirements, business processes, standard operating procedures, and training guides.
* Maintain dovetail and ServiceNow cases KHUB, PeopleZone and other central document repositories.
* Further, the role will help to develop and deliver Hubble/Insight reporting requests while analyzing output for accuracy as well as perform predetermined audits and correct data as required.

**#INDCWS**

REQUIREMENTS

* 2+ years working with JD Edwards EnterpriseOne 9.0 (or higher) Workforce Management (WFM). WorkDay systems with emphasis on HR, Payroll, Benefits modules and related custom interfaces is also preferred.
* 2+ years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst or similar roles with strengths in gathering requirements, configuration, and testing.
* Experience working with companies that have more than 8,000 employees, in a back-office support function with a union workforce.
* Excellent data skills with an understanding of relational databases concepts, and desktop database management tools such as Microsoft Access and Excel.
* Strong understanding of data workflows and root-cause analysis

title: Accounts Payable Analyst
description:
**Accounts Payable Analyst**

**What to Expect** 

 The A/P Analyst is responsible for processing all invoices received for payment and for undertaking the payment of all creditors in an accurate, efficient, and timely manner. The A/P Analyst will be asked to perform accounting and clerical tasks for the maintenance and processing of accounts payable transactions. This position reports directly to the Controller. We're looking for someone who likes to work in a fast-paced atmosphere and who can contribute to the success of the accounting and finance team.

 

**Culture**  

At Sharestates, our success is employee powered. Our trademark of a great company culture includes comfortable workspaces, professional/personal development, an authentically transparent and accessible leadership team, and genuine workplace friendships that strengthen teams. We support success by encouraging our employees to think like entrepreneurs. We champion diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging, and we are always seeking new ways to amaze our clients. Success is celebrated, and integrity is at the core of who we are at Sharestates. 

 

**Making an Impact**  

You will contribute to the overall success of the organization by providing accounts payable and clerical support to the accounting team. Our companies move millions of dollars through our investment platform daily, and you will be a part of the growing Accounting & Finance Team. You’ll be given the tools, resources, and support you need to achieve your personal and professional objectives. Other responsibilities may include: 

 

* Open and distribute mail for the Accounting department.
* Verify approval on all invoices and check or wire requests.
* Accurately code invoices.
* Prepare and process checks.
* Update and maintain vendor database.
* Audit and verify expense reports.
* Reconcile corporate credit card statements.
* Ability to process and follow up on rush items.
* Make deposits as needed.
* Track loan servicing advances in both the accounting and loan systems
* 1099 preparation
* Special projects as assigned.

 **Who You Are**  

* You have a desire to work/partner with the team and anticipate needs.
* You’re adaptable and don’t get rattled when direction and goals change.
* You possess the ability to interact with all levels of management optimally.
* You’re able to maintain a high level of confidentiality.
* You demonstrate an exceptional ability to communicate, interact, and work effectively and cooperatively with a diverse team.
* You have a strong understanding of accountability by owning your actions and choices.
* You’re open to new ideas, are willing to challenge yourself, and realize that we all bring different strengths to the table.
* You can naturally forge long-lasting and positive relationships with existing borrowers, investors, and vendors.
* You have the ability and judgment to seek clarification or assistance when needed.

 

*If this describes you, you might be the Accounts Payable Associate we’re looking for!* 

 

**Qualifications**  

**Nice-to-Haves**  

* An associate degree in accounting, finance, or business management is preferred.
* 2+ years prior experience in accounts payable
* Ability to work both independently and as a member of a growing team.
* Demonstrated ability to pay high attention to detail is required.
* Must be computer literate and able to use Microsoft applications and proficient in Microsoft Excel
* Previous experience with NetSuite is preferred.
* Familiarity with real estate management is a plus
* Strong oral and written communication skills

 **Benefits** 

* Eighteen days PTO—use them however you want!
* Eight sick days
* 12 holidays
* Competitive health plan, including dental and vision plan.
* 401K with up to 4% company match
* Learning and development opportunities
* A knowledgeable, high-achieving, experienced team

  


 **Salary: $25-$26-Per hour**

**Status: Full-time Non-Exempt.**

**Monday -Friday in the Office**

ZipRecruiter is a leading online employment marketplace. Powered by AI-driven intelligent matching technology, the company actively connects job seekers with millions of businesses of all sizes through innovative mobile app, web, and email services, as well as partnerships with the best job sites on the web. ZipRecruiter has the #1 rated job search app on iOS & Android. 

**Summary**:

As a BI Engineer II, you will redefine data consumption at ZipRecruiter. You will work cross functionally with Decision Science, Product, and Engineering teams to change the way we use data across the company internally and externally. You will work with top notch technologies like Spark, Kubernetes, and Databricks that process billions of records every day. 

**Key focuses:**

* Responsible for Implementing new technologies and data infrastructures.
* Taking business questions and designing the required data sets
* Collaborating with Engineering on data modeling and design best practices
* Implementing the data warehouse, including analysis, modeling, and developing the solution
* Work cross functionally with analytics to implement new data technologies

**Minimum Requirements:**

* 2+ years of experience working as a BI Developer or a similar role
* Advanced proficiency in SQL skills & data modeling
* Excellent understanding of data warehouse architecture and methodology
* Experience working with CI/CD and Git
* Experience with databases such as Redshift, PostgreSQL, etc.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience with Big Data environments such as Data Lake and Delta Lake
* Proficiency with Spark (Pyspark or Scala)

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $117,500 - $155,000. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location, and the range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location, role-related knowledge and skills, depth of experience, relevant education or training, and additional role-related considerations.

Depending on the position offered, equity, bonuses, commission, or other forms of compensation may also be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and other benefits.

  
  


ZipRecruiter is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or genetics.

**Privacy Notice:** For information about ZipRecruiter's collection and processing of job applicant personal data for this job, please see our Privacy Notice at: https://www.ziprecruiter.com/careers/job-applicant-privacy-notice

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
**Key Responsibilities includes but are not limited to:**

• Gather/analyze/document business requirements leading to the development of a business solution.

• Analyze and verify requirements (potentially including those of other business analysis team members) for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.

• Assist in the definition, development, and documentation of software's business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal users and departments.

• Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.

• Create systems models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to the In-House and 3rd party programmers

• Thoroughly test the UI, business logic, performance, and all aspects of software

• Document and appropriately report defects and potential risk

• Build user training materials and prepare communications

• Host and run meetings with stakeholders and project team for them to review the scope, plan, scripts, solution demo, etc.

• Provide post-implementation support

 

**Qualifications:**

• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related field or equivalent work experience required

• 4+ years of experience in a similar position

• Ability to handle ambiguity and evolving priorities without losing focus

• Strong analytical skills and attention to detail

• Demonstrated ability and ambition to learn and utilize emerging technologies while working in the core team environment

• Team player with excellent interpersonal, collaboration, and motivational skills

• Strong verbal and written communication skills

• Travel is required

**Benefits**

Competitive benefits package, which includes medical/dental/vision plan, paid vacation/holidays and 401k plan.

***Wind Turbine and Energy Cables is an equal opportunity employer. We recognize the power and importance of a diverse employee population and strongly encourage applicants with various experiences and backgrounds***
